comment.text: I tried this cart for the first time today and I ordered the falafel platter.  It was delicious.  The falafel balls (and there were lots of them) are crispy and fresh.  The platter comes with yellow rice, salad, peppers, fried eggplant, a spoonfull of hummus and tahina and hot sauce along with the falafel balls and a pita bread.  For $6 you get this and a drink.  My only complaint was that the rice was dry -- but I will try to replace it with something else, like more salad or grape leaves.

The buffet is a welcome destination for the indecisive and the hangry, and on a deeper level Yip's earns praise by being an old-timey survivor as the city gets Sweetgreened and Duane Readed.

I enjoyed the Cajun fish, sweet and spicy chicken, ribs and spinach. The main entrance does two-item combos, for the buffet you'll need the back stairs like a speakeasy.

Great value and good food for a quick lunch in the Financial District.

Had not been to a Yip's in many years (they used to have other locations) so stopped by on a Friday afternoon when they were reasonably busy.  

Chose the sesame chicken and barbecue chicken over lo mein - very satisfying meal.

Planning to come back regularly

OMG delicious! While they may not have the same offerings I am used to in LA (no Orange Chicken?!?!) everything we ordered that they offer was great.

Portion sizes were huge, price was right.

Love this hole in the wall that we visited while in Battery Park.

Not too long of a walk and the staff service was super friendly.

Highly recommend!

Came back today. They had a special for a few types of chicken for 8.75.

General tso's is Panda Express level. The curry chicken is pretty good but it's bone-in, so be careful.

Lo mein still on point.

Inexpensive and quick service. Staff is courteous and attentive to your order. Best cheap eats in the financial district. They have mostly American Chinese food along with several authentic Chinese dishes and soups. They have several tables if you want to eat in or take to go. They also provide you with a bag so you don't have to worry about how to carry it back to your office or an any public areas to eat. The hot oil is amazing (upon request). Downstairs is a buffet with a large variety of food that you can choose and pay by the weight (not your weight, the weight of the food). :)  Overall, this is a must try! You will not be disappointed if you are seeking good Chinese comfort food.

I swung by for lunch today for the first time. After seeing them bring out steaming hot trays of Sesame Chicken and General Tso's Chicken from the kitchen, i decided to get their two sides special. I ordered their vegetable lo mein with string beans and General Tso's Chicken, and the order came out to $9.75.

The food was solid. The meat was well-cooked and well-seasoned. The string beans had a nice flavor and crunch to them. I really enjoyed the lo mein, which was a nice surprise; in most dishes, the rice/noodles play background to the meat and vegetables but the lo mein tasted really good.

Will definitely be back to try their other selections!

Tried two item lunch special, which they served in a single dish right on top of each other. Mixing beef gravy with a sweet sauce ruined the flavor. Plus the meat was tough and chewy and even the fortune cookie was stale. Worst Chinese food experience I have had in a long time and won't be going back here.
It is great flavored food and is always consistent. Affordable prices and friendly staff.

This place is awesome and everything here is DELICIOUS.

So, I have spent all kinds of money here, I've been to the buffet side of the restaurant, where you can get everything you want and then pay based on the pounds and the time.

They offer this special prices after 1:45 and even more special after 2:45.

I've been here at 1:00, where price is 7.89 per pound and have been here around 1:54, where the price is 6.99 per pound, and those $0.90 cents can really make a big difference.

According to my coworkers, this place gets really busy around 2:45 pm.

The food is DELICIOUS, well cooked. They have a huge amount of options, from chicken to a lot of seafood, beef, pork, SUSHIIIIIIII, sautéed options, different types of salad. You can't go wrong at Yips.

So far, this is the restaurant i've been to the most while i've been in Wall Street. It's really good. Great food and greater prices.

I love buffets! As usual, I filled my container even though I knew I'd only eat half of it. I got a Hella lot of shrimp dishes. Most of it was pretty good.

The kimchi was too fermented for me. Most of the chicken dishes were good too. The noodles were good & I loved the seaweed salad. I also loved the fish. It was so soft. I wish I'd gotten more fish & seaweed salad instead of chicken & so much shrimp.

Chicken and broccoli has absolutely NO SEASONING just cooked chicken in the water - had the nerve to tell me not on LuNCH special so I paid an extra two bucks for unseasoned food. not a dab or salt garlic spice nothing BLAND. Disgusting has no choice but the throw! WILL NOTVRETURN

Awesome chinese guy server! He was nice  
Love the energy of the place food is good too!!!
Sweet and sour chicken was delish not the bbq pork it's too hard for me :( too hungry didn't get a chance to take a pic of the actual food.
But can't beat the food for the price.

I will first prime this review and say this is not authentic Chinese food in the slightest, this is Americanized Chinese food. Alright, as long as you're fine with that, we're in business.

Located in the heart of the Financial District, Yip's offers made to order food upstairs and food court buffet style food downstairs. I work in the area and usually have a late lunch. I noticed that Yip's had a half off buffet discount after 2:45pm ($4.99/lb) and I was on board to try it out.

I arrived at about 3:00pm on a Thursday and there was still a good amount of food being offered -- 3 kinda of noodles, 4 kinda of rice, a lot of meat entrees, a fair amount of vegetable dishes, and a whole row of cold salad bar offerings.  I tried one of their chow mein offerings (yellow, thick egg noodles), what looked to be house fried rice with shrimp, some orange chicken and barbecue pork. Be advised that credit cards requires minimum of $8 so be prepared to buy a drink and candy if you're coming in during the special.

IT TASTED JUST LIKE AN AMERICAN CHINESE FOOD RESTAURANT BACK IN MY HOMETOWN!!!! I have tried so many Americanized Chinese food places out in NYC and there is just this blandness I can't get over. Yip's is where it's at! Everything was super flavorful and and delicious.

I don't often eat out since I like bringing my lunch to work but I will definitely come back for a late lunch or even take away dinner when I get off work.

Yip's is firmly in the middle of the road when it comes to Americanized Chinese. Everything I've gotten here is full of MSG and tastes average, with the exception of their veggie lo mein. It's terrible. So bad. Comically, I keep getting it and having my soul crushed. It's always soggy.

There's a buffet-by-the-pound downstairs, and then a counter upstairs with seating and you can order a la carte. They now take credit cards, and I think there's a reasonable $8 minimum on that.

Staff are friendly and somehow remember me when I lunch here.

2.5 stars.

I go here for lunch sometimes and the food is pretty good. The people working here are polite enough and the seating areas are pretty decent. I like the view out the windows on the top seating areas.

However, I had food here a week ago and broke out in a rash. I had no idea what was going on and went to the doctor who got me a test for allergies because something was in my food. It came back positive for mouse urine protein which makes sense. I give this place 4 stars because I do really like everything else. But you guys should really check for mice.

I really really like Yips and I haven't been for a while. I was especially excited when I was in the area (I used to work there) and immediately thought to get my favorite. Unfortunately there is a maggot/worm in my food. Yips you have to do better and check your sanitary conditions. This is not the type of protein I was looking for. I won't be back.

We ate lunch here today and it was quite fine.  The buffet had a very good selection, everything was very clean (including the restroom), the price per pound ($6.89) was much less than the typical buffet costs (and it decreases significantly in mid-afternoon), the food was very tasty, and all of the employees were friendly.  There are two seating areas (on the second and third floors), although we got the last free table at about 1:15 p.m.  The one negative was the loud music, but that wouldn't dissuade me from returning.

This place has an "A" rating from the Health Dept.

Recently found out about their thursday's special, where you can get a good portion of curry chicken with brocolli and rice for $5.50.

Excellent choice and good quality of food for such an affordable price. This is definitely my Thursday lunch special going forward.
Two stars because it was good... but now I will no longer get food here. Found something in the dumpling and threw my lunch out.

This is a great chinese food place that offers nice size portions.  I love to get the chicken with broccoli.  They have plenty of seating both upstairs and downstairs.

If you go in the basement you have buffet style and you can fill up a tray with whatever you desire.

The employees are always friendly and polite.

It's fast and is basically a non-chain Panda Express. It is fast. They are options. The food tastes okay like any fried, breaded, fatty food will do. You get two items over rice for about $7, so it's one of the least expensive lunches around. The texture of the chicken makes me wonder whether it's real meat--it's hard to explain, but several of the pieces essentially gave me now chewing resistance. I also tried the paradise shrimp and it was okay. They have a credit card minimum of $8, which is just over the cost of a standard lunch meal. They have a small discount for late lunch or early lunch. It's actually a fairly comfortable and quit dining area in the main floor, and there's more seating on another floor. It's cheaper than nearby china chalet and actually not too much lower in quality.

*Review for buffet downstairs*

Quick, Cheap and Delicious!!

I have eaten here a few times already and I am quite impressed by the variety and quality of the food offered in their buffet section.  My favorite is the ginger chicken (or was it the garlic...), yum!  They also have a lot of vegetables to choose from, like bok choy and green beans.  There's also a salad bar island, but it looks way to healthy.

For $5.39/LB, you get quite a bit of food and a free can of pop!  Although the line may be long during the lunch rush, you don't have to wait long with their speedy service.  You can also bring your food to eat upstairs, which is nicely (perhaps even overly) air conditioned during the summer.

CASH ONLY

After more then 10 years in Brooklyn they moved me back to the Financial District location. I have been avoiding YIP'S like an old problematic girlfriend from the past. I have good memories but I felt I have moved on; but I kept passing this place and my friend kept asking to go here for lunch.

"Come on Rich, the place is still good and cheap. (That is what I'm afraid of!). It will be like the good old days (Ugh!)."
"OK, just once; I hope no Yelp friends see me going into this place; let's go upstairs."

Surprisingly this place really didn't change much, they redecorated and painted to make it less dingy on the stairway and the cafeteria style dining room is nice now. The food-by-the-pound is still down in the basement and they still have a special with soda & soup. Cheap eats!
But I felt I was better then that (ha!), so I went upstairs to the individual (pre-cooked) rice dishes.
Their selection is small compared to HO YIP but it was fresh, tasty and it was under $5 an order. I actually enjoy the meal.
So old girl friends and old lunch places are not that scary to sit with.
Just don't leave them your cell#.
Ate here throughout high school. 10 years later and i still die for the garlic chicken. This place might be skeevy to some but you can't go wrong with the food.

Plain and simple, greasy, but somewhat delicioussssss Chinese food! I've been here a few times now to get take out and simply put, this is some of the greassiest"bootleg" Chinese food I have ever eaten! It's comparable to Ho Yips located in the financial district on Liberty Street, with a few differences. I consider Ho Yips the best "bootleg"/ "Americanized Chinese food restaurant I've ever been to.

The first huge difference is the amount of starch, sauce and grease in Yips' platters. I've ordered both the Chicken with Chinese Mushroom and Chicken with Black Bean Sauce from the front and both contained a large amount of sauce that I did not see from Ho Yips. Ho Yips daily specials were saucy, but it was mostly contained within the ingredients of the special. Yips' daily specials had sauce seeping into the white rice and making it down to the bottom of the container. All of the rice that was in my platter was drowned in sauce. Honestly I prefer it like that, but I know some people don't like their rice moistened.

A few smaller differences were that their containers were not plastic, but tin foil instead. Small gripe in that I prefer the plastic tupperwares just so that nothing spills. Finally, Yips' is actually still holding at $5 for a majority of their daily specials with white rice ($5.25 with pork fried rice), while Ho Yips has raised their prices a bit every few months to now $5.60 for most of their daily specials. Like Ho Yips, Yips' serves Chinatown style dishes, such as roast pork rices.

The restaurant is not as attractive as Ho Yips either, although Ho Yips is not going to win any décor awards, but Yips is slightly "dingier". One more comment I will make is that if you would like to get food by weight, then you have to go downstairs instead as the upstairs and downstairs are separated. Since I don't work too far from here, this will ultimately be my choice of Chinese food in the area and it's not a bad substitute!

Came here once and will never come again. Gross low quality chinese food that is worse than what they serve in the food court at the mall. My general tso's chicken was awful. The only good thing about the meal was the broccoli which was only good compared to how bad the chicken and rice was. I wouldn't eat here again if it was free.
Place has been open since the 70s. The food is dirt cheap. The roast pork is fine. It's cheap American Chinese food. Cashier was nice

Based solely on their $4.99/lb hot/cold bar happy hour (which gets a little cray, especially during school season...), A-OK.  The food was fresher than I've found other such happy hours to be during their happy hour time.  Good selection.  Fast check out.  Can't speak of their seating area, as I took mine to go.  But will keep them bookmarked for future om nom noms.

Great value for the location, comparable to Panda Express, either we were starving or everything we ordered was delicious. There's additional seating if you climb a few floors.

Quality assurance could be better, some of the ride was left undercooked, an easy fix.

What can I say about Yips. I go here every day for lunch, 8 years, every day excluding weekends. Not one day where I haven't liked the food or gotten sick. Literally one of the best restaurants in New York City. I wish I can share photos but the good times are unsharable. NO CAP.

Having very few under $20 lunch options is a rare find down here in the Financial District of NYC.  I found Yip's today and was pleasantly surprised.  for $5.19, I filled up a small container with dumplings, two kinds of chicken, shrimp and green beans and it was pretty good.  Sure some of the chicken may have been a tad overcooked but I get that at other Chinese restaurants in the area and paid a lot more for it.  Yip's is a great value with decent food.  Will definitely be back.  Since their buffet price goes down after 3PM, I think I will be stopping in on my way home from work every now and again as well.
This is excellent Chinese food. So cheap compared to open market. The roasted pork is excellent!

A taste of Hong Kong in Fi-Di with self-serve and counter options. Food seems fresh and finding a seat is like entering a maze with seats full of local construction workers at the top floor. Price drops after lunch hour rush, which is interesting.

Great place for a quick low priced meal.  Scoop of fried rice some pork lo mein and a Diet Coke. Don't forget almond cookie and fortune Cooke. Play numbers from fortune. Maybe you win lottery. Not the cleanest and don't expect a great conversation from servers.

I work in the area, and Yip's is my go-to!  Their lunch buffet is unbeatable -- if you go from 2:45pm-3:30pm, it's $4.99/lb which is exceptional, given that the average buffet at any given time in this area averages about $10/lb.  The food is also very tasty!
For those who aren't necessarily fond of buffet-style eats, they also have a full service dine-in and takeout service on the second floor.  I haven't encountered any other establishment in the area that provides good quality Chinese with a great variety, friendly staff and pricing like Yip's!

Come here if you want to eat a lot of meat for cheap.

Even though the per pound rate is lower than most ($6 vs $10), it comes out to about the same price for me for two reasons: rice and watermelon.

If you eat rice, like most Chinese people do, then the rice will be very expensive. If you don't eat rice, then your meal will be relatively cheap.

There's a large selection of meats and veggies.

Remember that: too much food very quickly =  food coma.

Sometimes quantity is better than quality, and in those moments, Yip's does not disappoint. Decent American-Chinese food at $6.89/lb (price decreases to $3.99/lb between 2:45 and 3:30PM). Generally the options consist of various deep fried meats, but they have some healthier options, as well as salads, vegetables, and fruits.

The bbq chicken was pretty good, as are the string beans and fruits.

I love this place, my father put me on to it. I go in and get the chicken que over lo mein with "brown sauce" I think it's the same sauce they use in chicken and broccoli either ways it's great. I shared a plate with my kids who don't even like lo mein and they enjoyed themselves. The only thing that made me sad was I noticed just how many other options they had that I ignored while I worked in the area. Be brave and venture out of your comfort zone find something delicious.
Many varieties and pretty good price. The flavor is good as well, but the consistency is off sometimes like the beef stew can be really tender or chewy like rubber.
Very good fast Chinese food.  A stable of Wall Street.  There are massive people here everyday.  Come at 11:00AM or after 2:00PM.  Just put it in your cubical, you know it keeps.

It's a small buffet place that's very affordable especially around this financial area if you'd like a quick fix and they have seating areas upstairs.

Love their fried tofus.

It's a Chinese fast food place so don't expect authentic cuisine. However it's great value lunch spot in FiDi. There two levels - basement for the buffet and upper level for set meals or noodles. The buffet tends to be most Americanized, greasy salty and deep fried as you might expect. Upstairs has better Chinese options. The set meals are 1 or 2 items with rice (white brown or fired rice for the same price). The most expensive item determines how much you pay. To understand their ration system, I have gotten shrimp+another meat on one occasion and shrimp+veg on another occasion. I paid the same price, but I counted two more shrimps with the veg, which I think is fair. The most authentic and also what I order the most in the winter is the soup noodles. Excellent portions and the egg noodle has great texture. If you show up before 12 o'clock it's an unbeatable $6.25.
Yip's is the best thing to have during a blizzard. Inexpensive, good food and friendly staff. Will be back again.

I'm a big fan of Ho Yips, but with a change in jobs, I'm closer to this Yip's location. I came to the first floor with the prepared over rice dishes and got a kung pao chicken. It was good, but not notable. I was actually hoping for more peppers or celery, but you can't complain when I got a lot of good white meat chicken. The rice to meat ratio is good and the meal is cheap and filling. I might have to try to basement buffet next time, but I'm not really rushing to go back. The value is great at least and the place is open in spite of the Sandy rebuilding.

Seating is ample, but the place could use a facelift. Definitely a greasy spoon kind of place.

eat or skip?

SKIP!

ordered:
*chow mein, kung pao chicken and pepper steak for 6.50. huge portion. flavor wise not tasty at all.

I definitely had better tasting chinese fast food. wouldn't really recommend it personally. that's probably because i'm a foodie and my taste buds are different from other folks. but to be honest when i came in here i was probably the only asian person in the building besides the staff.

tips:
*indoor seating
*there's also upstair seating.
*can get packed during lunch time.
*there's two lines.
*doesn't give a receipt so if you want one you have to ask.
*accepts cash and credit
*staff speaks fair english.

Good chroma fast take out Chinese.
This is is really 2 restaurants. A downstairs which is a buffer where you by by weight and the upstairs which has a la carte dishes.

The place is popular and can seem crowded but the line moves fast. The food is good if you are in the mood for takeout.

My eight year reign of working in Battery Park is over. So I figure I should give a favorite spot a review.  By far, I ate here the most frequently, I'd say about once or twice a month on average, which, shockingly, puts me somewhere around 100 visits.  I'm not proud of it, but stating it for purposes of this review.

There's two levels, which I'm sure you've read about.  One buffet by weight section and one that, I've never seen before, has already cooked options where they slap it together in seconds for you.  Their bread and butter is the lunch rush and they know it, get as many customers served as possible in that small window.  Works great for everyone.

I remember the first time I tried this place, I ordered over the phone, thinking it was like any other Chinese take out place.  Call ahead and pick it up right?  I go to pick it up and I was completely confused.  So I told them what I ordered and they made it right there.  That was a new experience for me.  It certainly works for everyone that way: faster service and higher turnover, no call-aheads or missing orders.  Go and get it, quickly.

I do the buffet more often, probably 4:1.  So I'll do that first.  The buffet is bountiful before 1pm.  Then they stop adding stuff and only add the bare necessities until the 1:45pm price drop, obviously to get rid of the stock.  Makes sense.  Price has gone up over time, but not by much, but the worst thing they did was get rid of the free drink if you hit a certain amount of weight!  Real bummer, but I'm not going to take a star away for that.  That's a business move, I get it.  

My favorite buffet configuration, and I'll add a pic sometime, has some lo mein, some rice.  Scurry over to the Garlic Chicken (used to be in the front but now allllll the way in the back).  Now, the Garlic Chicken in the buffet is dark meat, but upstairs it's white meat.  So I take a little of the dark but what I really get a hold of is the salty garlic crunchies on the bottom and top the rice and lo mein with it.  Banging.  The string beans are perfectly cooked every single time, get them.  The other half of the container is a wild card, reserved for when they have the sporadic items, like: chicken and zucchini in black bean sauce or the chicken with peanuts.  

Overall, I love it.  It's great for what it is.

I'm doing review based on the fact that this is a Chinese take out spot for lunch.  I'm not going to compare it to Chinese restaurants, I feel there's a difference.  You don't take your date here, but you definitely go with a co-worker during lunch.  I don't know what to tell you if it's a lunch date?  Maybe?

If you do upstairs, stay away from the tall string bean, he's all rice and lo mein, and not a lot of what you really wanted.  The two guys that have been there as long as I been going there are the two you want. One has glasses and usually mans the left side of the counter, he will do it right with proper amounts of what you order.  The other OG rarely does food and seems to be managing a little more.

Everything I ate here was good, I love and miss this place immensely.  It's funny that when I go visit, of all the places to eat in NYC, that I'll pick this Chinese lunch spot. Lol.
My go to Chinese spot in FiDi. Tasty food and good prices. Food is always fresh. The employees are also very nice and give you good portions. Very clean place.

I give tips 4 stars for price, food not bad at all and ease! Wide variety of your typical Chinese buffet food. Plenty meat options and cold bar. I would def come come price is great large container with mostly meat was 7.50.

Being that there are very little recent reviews on here, it turns out this location was not listed and the one in midtown had closed. Well, no worries yelpers, yips is back on Yelp....

Is this a good thing? Well, yes and no. Went here the other day for some lunch with a bunch of colleagues. We did the take out and eat in the office. Let's put this this way: for the price, it's worth it. Just don't expect the best Chinese food ever made.

The line was quick moving and this place does get busy. I ordered the bbq chicken with rice and grilled veggies. And while it was good, I did get a headache and realized thanks to my lady later - the places uses msg. So if you can't do the msg thing, don't go here.  If you can or don't care either way, for the price the food is good.

So the verdict : 3 stars

Damn, that chicken is clucking awesome! I've been walking by this truck for months because the line is always ridiculously long. Now I see why. Amazing American Club, phenomenal chicken, crisp bacon, and delicious sauce. Absolutely worth the wait and now my new favorite truck on Madison Ave! The chicken is their bread and butter and definitely fantastic, but these are also some of the best fries I've had in a long time. Had I known it was this good, I would have been standing in that line weeks ago.

I was going to take a picture, but my sandwich seems to have disappeared...

This food truck parked outside my work and I am not disappointed in trying it.  The sandwiches on Texas toast are savory and delicious.  The toast is soft, crispy and buttery.  The chicken is moist and crunchy.  Additional sauces are great and I am a big fan of the ole'76 sauce.  The fries were good but not nearly the highlight of the meal which was the sandwich.

Good service at the counter and most definitely a place I will try again.  Definitely worth a shot if you see it in your neighborhood!

I'm always down to try new chicken, especially when it's claimed to be one of the best. I've seen Yankee Doodle Dandy parked outside my office building almost daily. Their 4.5 star overall rating is what got me to order from them one day.

The guy in the truck who took my order was super friendly, and gave me my food pretty quickly. I ordered the Winner Winner Chicken Dinner combo which came with chicken tenders, fries, and a slice of Texas toast.

The fries and sauce were a great combo, and the Texas toast was buttery-goodness. The chicken tenders, however, were a bit of a salt bomb. I had to rub the breading off to be able to finish them after my first one. I'm was hoping for more with the all the raving reviews.

Maybe I'll give them another chance in the future, or try their chicken sandwich instead.

Chicken is good, not as flavorful as expected. Probably could use some salt. However, good quality. Gentleman could have explained that the price is the same with or without any sides. $10 for 3 tenders. Came with a delicious sauce on the side. Not sure if that is what they consider bbq sauce but still yummy.

When I see the chicken truck outside I get hyped! MY FAVORITE truck in NYC! I don't know what kind of magic potion he uses to marinate this chicken but it's uot of this world, super juicy, super soft and just mouthwatering.

Also, whatever that dipping sauce is, iTS AMAZING!

Winner winner chicken dinner!

As this was one of the food trucks at the Brooklyn Half Expo yesterday it was a great fit for the hungry  crowd gearing up for the race.

Delicious and juicy chicken tenders platter which comes with Texas toast and hand cut fries. Good portion for the cost, and it's prepared fresh with only a few minutes to wait. So good!

Plus, they accept credit cards.

Saw the stand at Broadway bites while on launch and the lady that was working the register and serving the food was amazing. She was friendly engaging and actually the only reason I actually came back and purchased food. I got the chicken tenders and fries dish( called winner winner) it was good.

Stopped by the food truck to grab a quick lunch to take back to the office.  Decided on the Buffalo soldier platter. The chicken was really good; the buffalo sauce is definitely custom and not just off the shelf. The sauce did take away from some of the crispiness on the chicken, but that also could've been because it took me 15 min before I started eating it. Whatever the sauce they gave for the fries wasn't the best, but ok. I would go again to check out the sandwiches or other flavors. Lots of food for 14 bucks which is nice. Definitely get your moneys worth. The truck worker was super friendly and outgoing. Made small talk with everyone who ordered.  I read the story behind the business on a poster on the truck - pretty inspiring story and glad to see he now can do what he loves!

I wouldn't say they were the best chicken tenders ever, but they were tasty! A good ratio of chicken to breading.

Their sauce was good too. It paired with the chicken and fries well.

I feel it was a bit pricy for what it was though. $20 for three small tenders, some fries and a piece of bread.

It was good for a quick hunger fix, but I wouldn't go out of my way to find where this food truck is.
Simply put - the best chicken tenders that I've ever had in my life! I'm not exaggerating.

Worse garbage ever.. I don't know what was worse the food or the a$$h*** taking your money ... they don't know what customer service is , you order one thing and they choose a similar option that's more expensive and tell you that's what you ordered ... like do they think everyone is just drunk and will eat whatever you give them ... walking up to the truck ,not good people stay away . They are also cheap if you order $25 worth of food you are only allowed one condiment.... You aren't the only person serving chicken fool.

I wish they would update on their twitter daily.  I been trying to look for them for the same spot at downtown Manhattan ever since when I first spot them.  But I haven't see them ever since.  I know they used to be closed to 6th Ave & 46th St.  I had the chicken tender with fries.  The Chicken is really juicy and it is cooked to perfection.  The toast & fries is really good also.  Hopefully they are back to downtown Manhattan soon.  Can't wait to get my hands on them.  Yes I am a big fan of them.

Best chicken strips in the city!  Love this place and eat here about once a week.

Super friendly staff.  Also, Follow them on Facebook to get some freebies.

Best food truck chicken tenders I have had. I ordered the Winner Winner meal which came with 4 chicken strips, signature sauce, a slice of toast, a large portion of fries, and cole slaw as my choice of side. Very reasonable price at $15 for the entire meal. Visited at the corner of 52nd and 6th ave. They provided me with ketchup, utensils, and a loyalty punch card with purchase.
Triple play grilled cheese is excellent! One of best grilled cheese I've ever had. Excellent service and friendly staff. Recommend for a quick and delicious lunch!

Believe it or not, finding a good chicken tender is difficult. If you work in midtown, you're in luck. Yankee Doodle Dandy serves up some legit chicken tenders. The potato salad is on point as well.

My go to order is the Buffalo Soldier which is basically Buffalo chicken tenders. The serving size are generous, the sauce is tasty, and the chickens is flavorful.

I highly recommend this food truck.

- love the chicken tenders
- they do not service alcohol
- love the bread that comes with the tenders
- The fries are decent
- I especially loved the potato salad (It has a high mustard content, if you care about the at stuff)
- The Cole slaw is mayo based, which I do not approve of
- service is great
- If you pay cash, you save roughly $2per order
- This is a great source of picnic food for domino park

I'm glad that Yankee Doodle dandy is around and I will certainly try their food again! The service was truly pleasant and the man who took my order (might've been josh?) bent over backwards to make sure I was happy.

My suggestion would be that they need to make the tenders crispier, because it's the contrast of crispy and juicy that makes a perfect nugget. The seasoning was really good, but the world of chicken and specifically chicken nuggets is so saturated, that they should try to make sure there's more crunch.

The fries are really good, the toast is wonderful, and the potato is salad is good as well!

Was at a music festival this past weekend and their food truck was there. Ordered the chicken tenders and grilled cheese. Both were excellent and the special sauce tasted great! Got to meet josh the owner and he was super nice! Hoping he can expand his trucks to be on Long Island!

Let's start with the service. From the moment you walk up to the truck, you're treated like family. High energy, big smiles and just people who you can tell are really proud to share their love for food with you. The owner knows what he's talking about too "he did win who wants to be a millionaire". Got the chicken sandwich (juicy and delicious) the sauce was on point, fries were great (recommend them Cajun style) and if you don't ask for Mama June's famous potato salad, I feel sorry for you.

Upon the founding of this great republic of the United States of America, Benjamin Franklin had pushed for the national bird to be a turkey, calling the Thanksgiving mascot a "bird of Courage, [who] would not hesitate to attack a Grenadier of the British Guards who should presume to invade his Farm Yard with a red Coat on". Yankee Doodle Dandy's takes the delicious poultry cousin of the turkey and dressing him up in star spangled regalia, hopes to pass the bird off as deserving of your lunchtime meal. Sadly, this fine feathered friend off the back of a truck fails to live up to the regal heights other chickens have set - even those a fast food places nearby.

While the whole story of Yankee Doodle Dandy's is admirable (after winning Who Wants to Be a Millionaire, they used the million dollars to open and start these trucks), the food is not. My understanding of a rubber chicken was that it was supposed to be used for gags and prop comedy, not fried up and served on a bun. Not only was the chicken in my Love Me Tender Chicken Sandwich rubbery and chewy, but it was utterly devoid of flavor as well. This is a sad fact, as there is so much chicken on the bun and so little of it is actually enjoyable. While the recommendation was to slather the sandwich with their "Spirit of 76" sauce (a mix of mayo, ketchup and seasoning), this did little to add to the overall enjoyability of the sandwich.

However, the fries that came with the meal were a great take on the usually overlooked potato - covered in an amazing seasoning, which was complimented nicely with the Spirit of 76 sauce.

Overall, the chicken could use another American Revolution in order to get me to order from this truck again.

This is a solid choice for lunch if you are in the area. I came today around 1 and the line wasn't too deep. I didn't have to wait long after ordering for my food either. I got the winner winner. It's a 4 piece chicken tender meal that came with French fries, Texas toast, and your choice of potato salad, coleslaw, or a pickle all for $11! Honestly, it's a lot of food for the price. The chicken tenders were so delicious. Not dry or bland. They have their own sauce which was really good. At first, I was disappointed they didn't have BBQ sauce, but after tasting their sauce I was very impressed. I don't typically eat fried food but I will definitely be coming back.

I had never heard of it before today when I saw it. It was really good! The guys that worked there were really kind too! I am thankful that credit cards are accepted, but I think it would be helpful to have a better way of accepting credit cards. Not a complaint, just a suggestion. I would eat here again.

Hi Josh, I was unable to respond, so I am updating the review in hopes you would see it. I went to the one on 53rd and Madison.

Let me tell you, Yankee Doodle Dandy's was certainly impressive. Delightful menu items at great prices, amazing mood to unwind at. Yankee Doodle Dandy's has an outstanding Club Sandwich, that was my first time trying it here, and I was pleasantly surprised with how good it was. Staff is pleasant and helpful. Highly recommend - we will definitely be back to Yankee Doodle Dandy's for more.

So, my office moved to Old Slip about 2 1/2 years ago and there was literally a dozen food trucks outside everyday.  These guys are top notch, I've had dozens of meals from them and the have never served a bad meal.  the food is awesome, great value and the folks running the truck are super nice, engaging and happy.  Try it you won't regret it!!
Yankee Doodle Dandy's is truly rather wonderful. It was perfect. I like every thing I have ordered here. The service was also perfect and everyone was friendly. It truly was a great experience.

We had some great luck finding the YDD USA  Food Truck on Hudson Street and King St today being across the street from the Passport Agency office. Best chicken tenders ever. The guys behind the counter were so right! The Winner Winner with their Spirit of '76 sauce hit the spot perfectly. Service was quick and courteous.

Had lunch here yesterday and it was good. I had the chicken sandwich that came with fries and a pickle. Staff was friendly and great! The wait wasn't long at all. The portions are good for the price paid. Definitely worth going again and checking out the other menu items.

In December 2012, I met a guy in the overflow line waiting for a bus to Boston who told me about how he wanted to open up shop in New York and make true, southern style chicken with good southern hospitality. He said he wanted to call his place "Yankee Doodle Dandy's".

Don't get me wrong, there is nothing more American that witnessing someone achieve what they set out to do, but after 3.5 years of waiting, I had high expectations for this chicken. And those expectations were definitely exceeded today.

Real talk, I hate condiments. Especially ones that are salmon or red in color (old childhood trauma we don't need to talk about). That being said, the 1776 sauce made my sandwich. The dill in the sauce perfectly complemented the pickles in the sandwich and didn't overpower the rest of the ingredients which definitely left room for the chicken to really shine. And those chicken tenders - the breading on that chicken was on point - beautifully seasoned, perfectly crisp, and great in quality. Five stars - but if I could give it 50 (soon to be 51) stars, I would.

Walked by this food truck around 48th street and the smell drew me in. I ordered the "winner winner" which is the chicken tenders meal. The tenders were very good, thin breading but still crispy and well seasoned. The sauce had an interesting unique flavor that was pretty good. Unfortunately the fries were not that great and coleslaw was average. I enjoyed the overall meal because of the tenders.

Man what an incredible experience in the heart of Manhanttan which for us New Yorkers we know us hard to find. So I'm thrilled to find my self with a good chicken sandwich but I'm here to celebrate the beautiful woman behind the counter Michelle , Sonya Nikita, really know their product but it is the incredible attention to detail they have with visitors and there's a food truck!!! I'm sold Tks guys really nice work.
We went to the tailgate bar and ordered food from the truck and they lost the order and when they finally arrived after 30 minutes late.
When I tell you they have the BEST CHICKEN STRIPS EVER . Ayooo the bomb . & the sauce !!!! Delicious asf . Had to hit the owner to come to my job ( Hellofresh definitely enjoyed you ) !

I really wanted to like the food here but it's just not very good. The fries and coleslaw were decent but the main item they serve is chicken tenders which were below average at best. Like other reviewers I found their chicken's tenders chewy and rubbery. I've never had tenders that had such an unpleasant texture.

Maybe it's the quality of the chicken or the lack of brining but the chicken was pretty bad.

Thanks for coming to Metro Tech!

I tried the Buffalo Soldier today. I was JUST going to ask pretty please to have a salad option--but there it is, America the Beautiful. It was way too hot outside to read the whole menu. Yes I will be back!

Great big pieces of chicken, buffalo sauce wonderfully spicy, and yes, Spirit of '76 IS better than mayo, tangy yet cooling on the palate.

Really nice guys working the truck.

Thank you again!

P.S. The potato salad was delicious, like a creamier version of German-style salad. I'd like that recipe!

Not sure how to ultimately rate this truck. I find myself echoing various snippets of other remarks left by other reviewers. Everything that was said both good or bad, all is variously true about this purveyor's wares. It's a 'mixed' experience.

Yes, the chicken I had was slightly rubbery and slightly chewy; but it was also very tender. It masticates very easily, by that I mean it is very soft, almost limp as it dissolves in your mouth. Not sure whether I like this or not.

There was some hint of pleasant flavor but nothing to make me leap out of my chair. I doubt the chicken were marinated in any creative or elaborate manner. They were acceptable/adequate for what they were purported to be, I suppose. Best tenders I might ever eat in this life? No, I can't quite see how that claim could ever be true.

Price: a bit steep for the size of the meal, ($13); you can wolf the meat down in just a few bites and no, it was not very filling. The toppings like lettuce/tomato/pickle were all rather half-hearted and average.

Fries were okay; but again--nothing very special or exciting. The much-touted "'76 sauce": eh, helpful in places where the generally moist chicken ran dry in spots. Like a slightly spicy Thousand-Island recipe you can make at home.

Something more disturbing to me (upon reflection) is the patriotic paint scheme, marketing, logo, and symbology of the company and the truck. It's overboard and manic. Spearing a little cocktail toothpick in a chicken tender meal....okay...but with a miniature American flag on it? Come on now. That's tasteless. Please drop that flourish.

Overall: I am glad to have tried a new food vendor and I wish these guys well. Service was lightning fast, efficient, experienced. Truck was clean.

But frankly I wouldn't go out-of-my way for it again. I really wish my #1 truck had been present (for some reason they weren't and Yankee Tenders filled in for them). But man, for $13 what I usually get is a colossal sized hot pastrami sandwich so whoppin' good it slaps my tongue up and down like an upright bass. Meh! I suppose I will give Yankee's a 2 star rating because I know I won't ever try them again unless there's no other convenient alternative. They did a good job... but it's just not that exciting.

Review for the truck on 46th and 6th.

After hearing a lot of hype from my coworkers, I decided to give them a try. The truck smells amazing but I think that's where it ends. The fries were good for fries but let's​ be honest, we're all here for the chicken! I got the Winner Winner for $10 - which consists of chicken tenders pretty much. The chicken is like the other reviewers say... pretty overcooked and just gummy. It's weird. The sauce they give you for the chicken is not good either, it's kind of like a weird take on honey mustard, ketchup, ​and mayo but lacking something to make it all blend well. The toast they give you, well toast so. The coleslaw was pretty bland and gross. My coworker said the same as well for their potato salad. I'm just going to stick with the beloved chicken place on the corner...

Also, CASH ONLY!

Saw the 4 stars and they were in front of my office so thought why not.  Ordered the winner winner but was a little disappointed.  Where the tenders were alright I didn't think they were great. I read somewhere that the tenders tasted fishy but it was actually the sauce.  Only thing I really liked was the potato salad. Wasn't a big fan.  Texas toast was a bit cold also.  Overall average imo.

I really like these guys but they move around too much so they can be hard to find, also they sometimes will forget something in the lunchbox, so it's a good idea to check your order before you leave.

My favorite is the Red White and Blue Chicken sandwich, get it premium for cheese, lettuce and tomato.

Another pretty good food truck option in FiDi. Sometimes they are disguised as Nick's Eatery or something like that. As the guy in the truck will tell you, best chicken fingers in New York. Can't say they're the worst and quite honestly I don't have much room to argue with him.

I've always gotten a sandwich but they are healthy size with 2 big chicken fingers between some glorious texas toast. Very tasty. The buffalo sandwich was good but hardly had any buffalo sauce or bleu cheese on it but still pretty good. The '76 sauce they give with the fries and on some of their sandwiches is pretty tasty. They do give you a big ole pickle spear as well.

The fries are ok, sometimes they have a weird taste, not bad, just weird maybe a grill taste or something. I can't put my finger on it. But overall, for $9-10 depending on what you get, it's a lot of food for a good price. Customer service is also excellent.

They also put mini American flags on all your sandwiches which I love...because. America!

my daughter and i were on governor's island for figment.. upon finding ourselves famished we quested food and found the trucks..

now, when one is inclined towards both food trucks AND chicken fingers, and when a truck boasts "the best chicken fingers you'll ever taste," one is inclined to try those boastful fingers..

well, what should have been crunchy delight was mightily un-chewable (lest one risk a broken tooth); otherwise the breading was much like sadly ignored cereal bested by the prancing of little ponies.. the chicken itself was unfashionably dry.. the few pieces that weren't merely achieved a wetness without what i like to call, flavor.. the '76 sauce was a fitting companion in its embrace of not-flavor.. these folks seem to have researched the worst possible qualities of this most simple of foods and put them all into one tidy box.. with the quality and care of work-study teens at the county fair these breaded fowl-ettes presented themselves and proceeded to do battle with my innards.. i believe the term "heat-lamp" weighed heavily into this most unfortunate experience..

if i found myself exceedingly drunk and hungry at 3am and my options were this particular cerulean truck of doom and 7-11, i would find myself happily snarfing down a pile o' roller taquitos..

get ye gone yankee doodle crappy's..

BEST chicken fingers in NYC! Can't go wrong here..the chicken is moist and crisp down to the last bite. Yum! The brioche bun is really good, tastes like a grilled cheese. Fries are also top notch, and the best part is they're quick and super friendly.

Update.... chicken has totally gone downhill. Mostly reading. Passsss

This truck is by my job once a week and I always walk right passed it, today I decided to try it. I had the buffalo soldier, it was delicious very flavorful. Fries were great and perfectly seasoned, the toast is a nice touch. The guy that took my order was very friendly and I noticed how he knew the names of some of the customers which is always a plus! I will definitely visit again.
The chicken tenders here are incredible. Really flavorful and crunchy and juicy inside. The fries are great too. Will go here again!
Truly a gem, got winner winner a few times and always amazingly delicious. The tenders are juicy and flavorful, bread is great, fries are crisp
I love their chicken! It's my go-to for a quick bite to eat for lunch. They people that work in the truck are extremely friendly and have good vibes all around.

Best chicken tenders in town is an understatement. Stumbled upon this truck one day during a lunch break, and brought the rest of my office the next day. Chicken and fries are always phenomenal! Josh is a great guy, and even when he isn't there all his workers are just as good. Knowing your supporting a good group of people while eating delicious food makes coming here even better. If you're in NYC and near one of these trucks, you gotta try it!!

Not a lot open because of COVID and stopped by this little gem. I'm so glad I did. The chicken fingers are really the best I've ever eaten. These are not frozen! They are cooked to order so be prepared to wait a few minutes. The fries were so crispy. Very nice staff.  I would highly recommend. I'll be back!

If I could give zero stars I would because that is what it deserves.  We had the misfortune to select Yankee Doodle Dandy's food truck last night at the Lantern Festival in Queens.
The chicken seemed to be low quality, it was overcooked and had no flavor just the taste of old cooking oil.  The sauce smelled musty/moldy, fries were not seasoned and texas toast was cold.  Did not even venture to try the potato salad so I can't say if it was good or bad.
We had 5 orders and no one liked what they got, barely ate anything yet still didn't feel well after.
Wish we had picked a different truck.

So Ive been to this food truck twice. They come by my job very often now so I get excited when I find out they are in the area. The food was ready in less than 5 minutes and it was fresh and hot!

The first time I had "winner winner" and it was chicken tenders and fires with some potato salad on the side which was great! But the second time I had "American club" which was a chicken sandwich with some special sauce and fries. When I took the first bite, I was so amazed. I said, "oh wow" out loud and my coworkers were like, "it's good right?"

I never tasted a chicken tender sandwich like that in my life. I would recommend this to anyone :)

I cannot even say how great this place was for dinner. I came here with three other friends to celebrate a birthday. From the moment I walked in the bartender and everyone else couldn't have been friendlier.  

We shared the shrimp and goat cheese apps (2 separate apps); both delicious. They were also very generous with additional bread as we wanted. We then shared the steak, pasta, and mussel entrees. All just fantastic. To finished we had the bread pudding, profiterole, and sorbet. Nothing disappointed. It was so nice to see everyone working together. Our table was helped by the host, waitress, bartender. Everyone was so pleasant, never feeling rushed to leave.

Totally going back again and would recommend to anyone!

great bloody mary but too spicy for my taste 7/10 ($16)
Amazing iced americano (no sugar or milk) 10/10
Goat cheese omlette so good 9/10 ($19)

basically id recommended this if you want a good quick breakfast, not boozy brunch vibes. Very french, host was a lil rude but service was super quick.
They also played Britney and Miley cyrus

4.5 stars for good food.
-0.5 for the host

We stopped by for a drink after walking down the West Side Highway- definitely coming back. The service was very attentive and friendly - I was told they just got a new GM and have been building their staff up, and it shows.

Only had the Orange wine (honestly a great orange wine- had 2 glasses), and escargot (super delicious). We will be coming back for brunch this weekend! Really cute street and intersection in Tribeca. If it gets windy outside they have blankets, fyi.

I went here for a family dinner and i have to say the place is beautiful, the ambiance is really nice. A great place for a date but not for the food. Just come for the aesthetic but eat before. The food really missed a lot of flavor. I am Gf and the fries are dipped in flour so couldn't eat those. Almost nothing was Gf, very little and what was was BLAND AF. We also were the only ones at the restaurant when we came in and they sat us right next to the door letting in cold air. The door kept opening and letting in cold air and when people came in to the restaurant they left door open. We had to call the waiters over multiple times to close it so we wouldn't freeze. You shouldn't be wearing your winter coat at a restaurant but at this table everyone did. My mom got the chicken dish which was pretty but had no flavor just tasted like a rotisserie chicken from Costco that's it for that price point. Super disappointing! I had the steak and asked instead of fries can i have vegetables. My steak came out with so much fat on it, and the place is dark so i had to get my flashlight out to make sure i wasn't eating the fat. The sauce that they paired with it was very bad, not a good combination. The green beans were good so good job for that. Sorry just have to be honest!

We found this French/Moroccan spot, loved the menu online, and decided to go for brunch. Honestly, it was a pretty good meal, but it was an interesting experience.

We got the Boursin, chocolate chip pancakes, shakshuka, and fries. Fries were super good and I loved the mayo aioli they came with. Shakshuka eggs were amazingggg and the pita bread it was paired with was perfection. Pancakes were super light and fluffy, and the ice cream atop them was creamy and delicious. Personally, I wasn't the fan of the Boursin -- I thought it would have the sweetness of cheese, but found it to be overwhelmingly bitter and sour. My friend, however, really enjoyed it, so clearly it just wasn't for me.

Service was interesting -- we didn't immediately get the menus as soon as we were seated, and we were sort of rushed out/got subtle hints to leave less than an hour after sitting even though the restaurant was pretty empty. It was super quiet inside too even though there were a few other people there for brunch. I'll have to come back again during a more lively time!

Overall, good food and will keep this restaurant in mind in the future, esp for din

What an interesting dining experience. Tried several apps with friends and each was unique and delicious. Had French Onion soup, which was on the sweet side.
Overall - nice experience!
It is a fun place in Tribeca. Bartender is great. Food is average. Great outdoor space. Service was excellent!

Came across this little gem on a Saturday evening. Sat outside and watched the sunset over the river. The food was great! We enjoyed tuna tartare to start with. Followed by lamb and the pasta. The lamb was pretty spicy, although packed with flavors. The pasta was light and rich. The serving sizes are definitely on the smaller side besides the burger. The service was a bit slow, but during a busier time. The drink menu seemed to lack in the wine category with few options. We would go back for the ambiance and food.

Nice neighborhood bistro that serves classic American cuisine. Menu is relatively short and contained (which I like), and there's something for everyone, whether you're pescatarian, vegetarian or carnivorous. The chicken schnitzel is massive and delicious - a combination that I'm very into. Wines are great as well. The selection leans French but they have a decent variety from other regions as well. For example, I had a lovely orange wine from Valencia, Spain.
The food was excelling and our server, Angel, was fantastic and so kind and helpful! I will definitely be eating here again. The saffron crème brûlée was a highlight on the menu!

French diner
Delicious yummy food
Reservations required
Brunch on Saturday Sunday
Good menu too

Had Market Salad and Pasta/Orechiette

The favor of salad was like scatter plot, separated but not conflicted.
Many sweat beans was hidden under the mountain of pasta. Need to dig them out. Mixed with skin of green onions, which created a gradient of sweetness. Tasty.

+1 star for participating NYC restaurant week

Stop in here on our way home after a great afternoon roaming around downtown NYC. Loved everything about this spot. The service, very attentive and professional. The food, delicious. Started with oysters and shared the Branzino and drank sancerre. I loved the outdoor seating where you can people watch. Will definitely go back.

Stopped by for brunch on Sunday with my mom, and we both enjoyed the food and the super friendly service. I started with the Beauty & the Brut cocktail, which was tart, but in a good way (it contains plum & red wine). We shared some avocado toast and let me tell, we agreed this dish was a can't miss! The spices on top are a mix of savory with a hint of sweet that is perfectly complementary to the avo. My mom got the croque madame, which she really enjoyed. I got chocolate chip pancakes, that weren't particularly heavy on the chips, but the pancakes themselves were so good, I ended up not minding. And of course, make sure you order some crispy Pommes Frites for the table (with all the sauces)!

Good food but very overpriced.  Even charged me $2 for a 'side' of butter to spread on my dry sourdough.  Not impressed with that at all.

Service was not good either - the wait staff were about to take my plate away when I was clearly still eating.  The whole experience was very strange - would not go out of my way to go there again unfortunately

Can't say I understand the recent social media hype about this place. Disorganized service, mediocre food at best, and pricey for the quality. The bar was it's only saving grace, as the cocktails were actually quite stellar.

We went for Sunday brunch, with a confirmed reservation, waited over 30 minutes to be seated, 15 minutes before anyone checked in on us, and another 45 minutes before any food hit our lips. Tables seated well after us were served items we had ordered first, it just seemed like a free for all. The place was full, but certainly not overflowing, and while we got an apology from our host (who was lovely when she finally showed up), that was the extent of our service experience.  

On to the food & drink
* Fireside Chat -- Get this! Was so nicely balanced.
* Blueberry pancakes -- Great if you have a sweet tooth and enjoy pancakes served with a scoop of chocolate ice cream. We were so hungry and the service so slow, we couldn't be bothered to ask if they had any butter or syrup.
* Eggs Benedict -- Pretty standard, nothing amazing, nothing terrible.
* Shakshuka -- Seemed like the dish to get as most tables had an order. However, ours was overcooked or sitting idly for a while and served lukewarm. The sauce had completely reduced and the "poached egg" yolk was overcooked and dry.
* Breakfast Pork Sausage -- A RACKET at $11. The best description of what we were served was a microwaved Nathan's hot dog. Comical.

Thankfully, our busser cleared our table ASAP and took care of our bill. Couldn't get out of there fast enough. Listen, we're pretty patient folks and certainly not demanding of a certain caliber of service, but I can't see ourselves ever returning, despite being locals in the neighborhood.

My husband and I were staying at a nearby hotel and went walking around looking for a fun spot for a mid-week dinner. We walked in Yves and it was a great decision! Our waitress was really nice and seemed genuinely happy to make our meal great. The food was excellent! I had the chicken with olive dish- it almost made me cry with nostalgia for some long ago dish I must have had as a child! The flavor balance was perfect! I am a cocktail person, and I loved their chili vodka, pinapple cocktail. The vibe and music were perfect. Not so loud that we couldn't talk. Just the perfect balance for an upbeat ambiance.

I found out about this restaurant because it's on Seated, but from the start I wasn't too impressed with their menu since it's a bit limited. I came around 7:15 on a Friday night, and the restaurant was packed. The next table wouldn't be available until 8:30, but the server told us that there's a full menu at the bar, so we decided to head over there. A couple stools ended up freeing up within 15 minutes, so we ordered drinks/entrees.

I ordered the Best Lei'd Plans ($16) cocktail, and it was delicious. As an entree, I went with the salmon ($28). To be honest, I really didn't think the entree was worth the $. The fish was a bit rubbery and the salad didn't taste like anything. My friend ordered the cheeseburger ($21), and I will say the shoestring fries were good!

Overall, this is a cute place to grab a drink, but it's just okay food-wise.

The staff was great, as was the service however 5 people at a table meant for 3 made the night a bit awkward and uncomfortable.  We asked to sit at a bigger table meant for 5 people but were told no.  

So, if you like having to hold your drink all night and your cutlery falling onto the floor, this place is for you!
Food was average- look out for plain toast and a $2 charge on your bill if you ask for butter.

I liked Yves a lot - it reminds me of a slightly more grown-up (and hometown) version of Maison Kayser. I came here for brunch so I can't speak to the dinner but the food was pretty tremendous. Let's just say if you can't get a table at Locanda Verde, Yves is by no means a consolation prize.

Y'all know how much I can never pass up granola on a brunch menu. The version at Yves' was something I'll definitely try to replicate in my own kitchen with the addition of one unique ingredient, rhubarb! It lent a sweetness that went really well with the strawberry and honey.

My group's dishes were all delicious too, I tried each one and I couldn't pick a favorite. You can't go wrong. The seasonal quiche with gruyere probably stood out the most: know that for $17, you are getting your money's worth with an enormous slice and a perfect, flaky bottom. Also liked the croque madame and the blueberry pancakes that the waitress offered with vanilla ice cream.

We were all still feeling an enormous meal the night before but if I had come back in an hungrier mode, there were more than a few appetizers I had my eye on (the boursin and the Arctic char tartine).

The food was delicious, we ordered the omelette with goat cheese & Yves Mezze & market salad. Everything was very well presented and tasted delightful. The service was great, we had Alex and she was sooo friendly and gave great advice with meals. The place was popping!! Great music, lots of people & very chill vibe
The Service was excellent. He was very polite and made sure all of our requests were taken care off. Excellent conversation and recommendations. Shoutout our server Breny.

Salty salty fried but good. Burger was overcooked even tho we asked for medium rare. Terrible service. For these prices I would think they could do better. Honestly tasted like a college campus bar burger.

My sister invited me out because she wanted to try a "new American" restaurant with a flare of French dishes. It was so appetizing. I am so glad I was able to go. It is a small imitate restaurant with is great for going to for a date night. From the food to the ambiance and even the waiters are awesome.
Our waiter was knowledgable of the dishes and gave us great advice on both the drinks and food. It was so helpful because I can never decide on a good drink to pair with my food. The dessert....omg...was on point.  It was just the amount of sweetness I enjoy after my entree.
This is a restaurant which everyone should visit in downtown Manhattan. You will not be disappointed.

Yves is a nice spot for drinks with ample sidewalk seating, including some of your more desirable side street seating options. If you hop off the Hudson River Park after a stroll on a particularly humid day, as I did, it's as nice a place as any for a quality glass of wine or a solid cocktail. I had a mezcal cocktail with some nice spicy bitters added that was well done, and a nice glass of Lambrusco.

Our brunch experience was a bit disappointing food-wise, on the other hand. I had the Yves breakfast--scrambled eggs were ok if a bit mushy, but it's been a long time since I've had such weird, disappointing bacon. Thin and overly cooked to the point of being flavorless, it looked and tasted as if someone took some vegan bacon or an old package of Sizzlean and just dropped an iron on top of it for WAY too long.  The country toast that came with it was quite good, at least, but you really don't want your toast to be the highlight of your brunch. My friend got the salad with grilled chicken, which was deemed "fine." I say this all noting that I'm trying to grade gently these days and not complain as much as I perhaps normally would... I'm just happy to have nice places open in the city--it's just... hard not to feel the letdown of disappointing bacon.

I had dinner here last night. It's a super cute place to sit and enjoy the staff is friendly and they help you with the menu. We ordered the mussels and French fries. Both were super good. I would recommend this restaurant if you are in the area. They also let you chill towards the end not in a rush. It's a little pricy but the foods worth it. They could improve on faster service tho and more dessert options.

Honestly had high hopes for this place.
The location is nice, the decor is cute and I loved the ambiance.
For the food, we tried the homemade Boursin (5* without hesitation), the escargots (amazing, 5* too).
However, the main dish was disappointing. My husband and I took the chicken roast for two. The meat, moist and perfectly cooked, was bland and tasteless. The bread they brought (part of the chicken dish) was rock hard, clearly old. The butter also brought on the board was FULLY melted to the point we actually thought it was a sauce...
our friends ordered the steak frites, the waiter told us they were out of fries and that they would serve chips and firstly refused to serve some fingerling potatoes (that are part of the chicken roast dish). CHIPS. With a 50$ steak? After some negotiation they agreed to give the potatoes. I don't recommend the place especially considering the high prices of their food and the actual experience of it.

Yves has been a bit of a local hit since it first opened, but it reached international fame in late October when President Barack Obama, Robert Denio and Tim Cook went to Yves for dinner. The vibe is great and the cocktails are excellent, but the food can be average. The veal schnitzel was excellent, but everything else was just ok. The staff seems disorganized with no one in charge.

{Overall: 4; Food: 4} Atmosphere: 4.5; Service: 4
Yum! Impressed by the French food here. Great Tribeca spot - still has the upscale atmosphere without being too expensive or stuffy. The atmosphere is dimly lit and intimate without being overly romantic.

Great list of French staples, which are more fun to share.

Stopped in for a quick dinner after an appointment in the neighborhood. Started out well - outdoor seating was comfortable and warm, wines by the glass really good. Ordered the poulet (chicken dish). I love salt but this was SO salty! Lighting was dark but realized texture didn't feel right after biting into a piece. Turned my flashlight on - it was not cooked! Not raw in the middle, raw on one side! Most obnoxious group of people then seated. Asked to move to the bar to finish my wine....was told another group coming in in 15 mins that had reserved the bar. Just wanted to finish my wine and needed to pay bill....server came took my card and 5 minutes later hostess comes with an attitude telling me I have to move for party coming in (that had not yet arrived). Could not get out fast enough!! Definitely will not go back. Should have gone to one of my favs (Walkers or Odeon) in the neighborhood but went with the recommendation of a friend.

Yves was my second dinner during my trip to NYC last weekend.  I met an old high school friend who now lives in Manhattan there.  She had been given the recommendation from a friend.

Yves reminds me a lot of the trendy new restaurants that are starting to pop up in downtown Detroit.  It's in the TriBeCa neighborhood, which is apparently a new hot-spot as of the last decade or so.

The food and sevice was good, but it was pricey.  It wasn't anything spectacular, but it's what I expected.  It may have been what I ordered.  I'm not the most adventurous eater, so some of the things didn't appeal to me.  I should have tried something new, but opted for the burger as a safer option.

Overall the food is pretty good. The homemade Boursin is freaking good and the escargot, along with the beef tartare was excellent. But honestly guys...this $22 cheese plate is embarassing. Like this is ridiculous. Thanks for the 4 Driscoll raspberries and the 5 nuts, and the tiny ass slivers of cheese. Come on. $22 for this? are you crazy??

Excellent small TriBeCa spot (small joint). First had a nice Mint Condition Cocktail and IPA at bar. Amused by small glasses of water, but hey, they work!

Next to a table for dinner. Had 3 small plates and four mains between four. Loved server Stephanie with her backward ball cap. We had great apps including chicken meatballs and entrees including cod and steak. Delish use of veggies. Including cauliflower sauce.

You can always count on Tribeca restaurants to deplete your wallet at the end of a long night. But most of the time they're worth it. Yves is one of them.

Call me basic, but I ordered THE Spaghetti. Yup, I paid $22 for roasted cherry tomatoes, toasted garlic, basil, olive oil, and parmesan...a meal that I could have easily had at home. BUT. Do not be fooled. I don't know what their secret is, but this spaghetti was somehow just SO good. It was not too creamy nor too salty, which made it easy to stomach with a sugar-heavy drink on the side. My bf also really liked his Moules Frites (fancy name for mussels & fries), so I am inclined to say that this place is worth depleting your wallet.

We're coming back for the steak frites next time. And maybe I'll have another order of basic spaghetti :)

Pretty pricey food that was ok, but not so superior as to justify the price. Feels overpriced relative to the portion size. For example, we ordered the grand seafood platter (kind of a shared appetizer) that was $225; it had a few pieces of shrimp, a bunch of rather small oysters, couple king crab legs, and a lobster tail. We could have gotten all that and much more at another restaurant.

Listen to me, there's a fried egg sandwich and there's a Fried Egg Sandwich--Yves is the latter.

What a meal, are you kidding me!

I have a terrible habit of visiting places in the city solely because President Obama likes them, but Yves is truly something. I'm highly recommending this place, if you can't tell. And take a stroll, afterwards, to walk off the donuts.

They forgot to put in our order so we were waiting a long time but after we brought it up, they offered a complimentary drink and sent us a free avocado toast to compensate. Really great service, and food was good.

Bottom line: Yves is a 4.5 star Tribeca dining experience. Very intimate space, good service, excellent menu to choose from and the food itself delicious. Not the cheapest destination to eat but I say they are worth it for the most part. I am a fan!

The Deets:
Yves is a very inviting and intriguing place in the Tribeca area that a good friend frequents before heading home after his work day is done...we decided to try it out and see what it is all about. It is a pretty small venue, a bit dark but I like the bistro like feel. I can't decide if I would call the menu American influenced French or American/French hybrid, or many other derivatives but what they have done is put together a very nice selection of offerings on their menu. We sat at the bar, and our bartender/server was excellent...great customer service. For our visit, we started with the Fried Pork Rillettes served with mustard and pickles. The pork is cubed/chopped and fried up/breaded, with the middle winding up a bit like a pâté after it's all done. These lil nuggets were delicious, loved it...do know that the order was only two pieces so we got one each, and it was great. My next course I ordered Braised Chicken Meatballs ("Coq au Vin" red wine, parsnip, mirepoix per menu) and I liked these, but did not expect the bit of spice that were contained within. I'm not one to enjoy spicy, but this hint was not overwhelming and I could make it through OK because the taste in general was good. My main/last course I selected the Veal Schnitzel (with sauce vert, bitter greens, lemon, poached egg per menu). This schnitzel is some of the best I have had other than in Bavaria itself, very seriously. I was so full after all I had but I enjoyed the meal thoroughly. All combined with a wonderful prosecco by the glass, I had a great experience here at Yves and would gladly come here again. I'd put them around 4.5 stars (they are a bit expensive, do note the prices but most items are worth it) and I am looking forward to seeing them again in the future.

Don't usually do this, but had to come on here, to say that this is My favorite place in tribeca. The food is always stellar and I love the new outdoor seating. Great atmosphere. Feels like real NYC. The oysters taste like butter!! And the pistachio crusted salmon, is beyond. My best friend is obsessed with the cheese burger.

The waitstaff was very nice. But the food is not great, there are upcharges for everything (extra bread offered for the homemade Boursin), and the sound system outdoors is bad and deafening.  It's basically a money pit.

Probably the most disappointing dining experience I've had in the post Covid re-opening. I went there when it initially opened before the pandemic and didn't think it was worth another visit. Decided to give it another shot for an impromptu family dinner as we live in the neighborhood. Fully understanding that restaurants, like many other businesses, are grappling with inflation and, supply and labor shortages, this restaurant somehow found a new low. Very high prices, small portions and completely bland food. Not a redeeming quality other than the location in Tribeca. Service was also mediocre. Save your money and time and just go to locanda verde across the street, or any of several other neighborhood restaurants, that have been able to maintain their good standards at justifiable increases in price.

I really liked the vibe in the restaurant and the customer service. I was OK with the food. I tried the clams and escargot under the apps section. Tried a bit of my friend's ricotta gnudi. I wasn't truly impressed with the limited items I tried.... except the amazing chocolate dessert which had a surprising mix of texture and decadent chocolate and nutty flavors. Might seem out of the way but it is relatively easy to commute to and it seems like a comfortable neighborhood spot.

This restaurant tries a little too hard to be hip and doesn't focus enough on making good food. The wait staff all look like up and coming actors / actresses - good looking but totally aloof to great customer service. I would come here if you like good ambiance but don't care much about the food. At least the drinks are okay.

I had a baby kale salad for lunch (no longer on the menu since it changes every so often) and it was EXTREMELY plain.

Came here for Valentine's Day with my husband and we loved our meal! We had high expectations since it's the chef from Locanda Verde and it exceeded our expectations.

We shared the market salad to start which was fresh but just ok.

I got the pistachio crusted salmon which was amazing and my husband got the roasted chicken which loved.

We got a side of the grilled artichokes which were the best artichokes that I've ever had. I wish I could swim in that sauce - it was so good.

For dessert, we got the profiteroles which were decent.

I'm knocking off one star for the tables being super close together. Also, they were not accommodating when I asked to alter the food in any way. Would still love to come back.

OMG, Yves was really fabulous. It's in a perfect location and we were definitely pleased with our experience. I couldn't decided what to order, but I am so happy that I had Croque-madame, it was absolutely fantastic. Crew is incredibly pleasant and will help you with everything. I will be back to Yves.
Very cute spot, yummy food and great drink list! I'd recommend the fries, they come with an array of sauces.

This restaurant was a find in Tribeca.  My husband and I had a fine meal.  Standard bistro on the menu.   Well prepared.  Decent service, though slow.  My only complaint was the escargot which was a challenge to remove from the shells.

Had it not been for the 40 tables on the rent free sidewalk perhaps we would have had a good time tonight. The food took 2 hours to get to our table. The food was mediocre and the service was worse. I can't wait for restaurants to get off the sidewalk and concentrate on what's going on inside.

Great place to come after work for drinks with colleagues. The environment and atmosphere is great, and it isn't too noisy. Have come here in the summer a few times as well to sit outside and the staff has been friendly. Will most likely be back again! Would recommend the Pilsner beer - so delicious!

This is the third time I've been here, and respectfully, I would like to kiss the chef. One of my best friends and I have made this our go to place and the deliciousness of this damn food shocks us every single time. While we're eating we lose social decorum - we pound on the table, we hum sounds of approval mid chew, and we polish off our skewers like it's our job. Needless to say, I recommend this place.

Came to Yasouvlaki two nights in a row with my wife and toddler. Both nights the food and service were excellent. Each dish, from the skewers to fish platters, were outstanding with generous portions. The kitchen has got its act together and uses quality ingredients.

Our server, Jack, was superb as well. He knew the wines and pointed guided us patiently through the menu.

Can't wait to come back once we're in town again.

We have eaten at this restaurant multiple times, not to mention how many times we have ordered from here. Overall, it is the best Greek option on the UES.

We've had:

- Pork Gyro - very good

- Chicken Souvlaki - tasty

- Tzatziki - very good
