- Greek Caesar - not our favorite

- Greek Salad - good

- Lemon Potatoes - terrific

- Hummus - good if a bit bland

-  Greek Coffee - tasty

The service is good and you can eat outside, which we enjoyed during the summer. Overall a nice eating experience.

Stopped here with some friends for a more casual lunch before hitting the MET, which is only a 15 minute walk away. The restaurant has quite a few tables for outdoor seating, and the staff offered to pull out covers when it got too sunny. Like others have said, the waiters were all attentive even if you sat outside, stopping by to check up on us multiple times.

I got the kefta sandwich - the pita was warm and fluffy and the meat wasn't too dry. I'm not usually a tzatziki fan but I really enjoyed the sandwich!
Though we got the zucchini fries and they were good, especially with the dip, I've learned that Greek fries are AMAZING and would highly recommend just ordering a side of their potato fries if you aren't already getting some in your main dish.

Another place where I easily give five stars. First of all, the service is excellent. I took a seat at the bar; it was small. Luckily, no one was sitting there. The server was attentive and friendly. The rest of the restaurant was packed and had people waiting. It must be quite popular. I discover this place because I was just walking around.

Once I sat down, I knew I wanted to order the Chicken gyro, which was fantastic! It came with a refreshing cucumber salad, and the gyro was served on toasty pita bread with french fries and what I assumed was Tzatziki sauce. I devoured this gyro within just a few minutes. Loved it!

We sat in the covered outdoor seating which was quite comfortable and had a chill ambiance. Staff was great, we did not feel neglected at all despite sitting outside, and they came over multiple times to refill water and check in. The meal started off with free delicious warm pita. We ordered:
-chicken thigh souvlaki in pita: delicious, filling for one person. Plenty of sauce kept every bite juicy.
-mixed seafood grill platter: it's advertised as 2-3 people but we had leftovers even after 2 hungry grown men ate through it. The salmon skewers were a bit dry but everything else was cooked perfectly.

Definitely recommend coming here if you're in the neighborhood!

YUMMMMMMMM. And holy portions Batman! Seriously, huge huge plates that can turn into multiple meals. A friend and I popped in here one evening to enjoy an easy dinner. We sat outside and enjoyed the people watching. My salmon skewer platter dinner was tastyAF. The salmon was cooked perfectly, delicate and well seasoned. The billowing pile of French Fries came back home with me as I had so much pita, tabbouleh, and salad. SO. MUCH. FOOD. SO. MUCH. FLAVOR. My friend raved about his falafel burger. It was like a double decker bus of sandwiches with the falafel piled high. WOWZA. Can't wait to go back!

Unfortunately, I did not have the greatest experience here. Yes, their Greek fries are amazing and the ambience is nice with traditional music and table arrangements. But I ordered the lunch special skewers with a side salad and I did not get much excitement.

The portion size was small. The salmon ($2 extra) was soaked in dressing and could not retain its natural taste. The salad was decent and loaded with feta cheese, but even that was just average.

However, if you order their main dish it is quite impressive (see photo).

One positive about this establishment, is its location. Located across from Whole Foods, restaurant service is quick, getting you in-and-out within an hour while still making you feel "at home." when I return? Yes I would but fingers crossed that I order the right dish.

An extra star for the great service and easygoing neighborhood vibe!  This is one of those hidden gems on the UES that is filled with locals and has great food, amazing staff, and very reasonable prices.  

Be sure to get the moussaka, which is top notch, and one of the skewer platters.  We were very happy with the chicken thigh soulvaki but the gyro is solid as well.  We also tried the beef youtseki, which I thoroughly enjoyed - the short rib is incredibly tender and perfectly paired with the orzo - perfect for a cold day.

If you are not super hungry, they sell single skewers for $6-8 and gyro sides, along with other accompaniments, such as brussels sprouts, fries, and rice pilaf, which range from $5-10 so that you can mix & match for your own DIY platter.

Our server and hostess were great and everyone was incredibly friendly.  Will definitely be back!

Great place to drop by for good tasting/traditional Greek food.

We ordered a nice spread and not one dish was below a solid/good-tasting dish.  I would say this worth a trip to the upper East side to experience good Greek food with attentive service.

Great food, great service fun atmosphere.  I ordered the chicken thigh souvlaki and my wife had the salmon. Two full skewers served with Tibouli and hand cut fries.  We substitute the Greek salad for the tabouli for a small upcharge which was well worth it.  The Greek salad was a cucumber tomato, feta and onions mixed in a perfect olive oil and vinaigrette dressing.  The chicken was super flavorful and moist and the fries were fantasticly delicious.   We also shared the baklava for desert which was delicious.  
There bar only offers beer or wines just an fyi for those looking for a cocktail.    
We are going to make this one of our neighborhood go to restaurants.
This establishment is truly charming, offering a cozy atmosphere and budget-friendly dishes. I definitely plan to return soon.

ALMOST everything was perfect with our recent trip to this restaurant.

The food was spectacular. We ordered the octopus, falafel, 3 spreads (tzaziki, hummus and spicy feta dip), dakos salad, grilled halloumi and hand cut fries. All of the dishes were extremely flavorful. The halloumi and octopus were showstoppers, probably the best halloumi that I have ever personally had. They also had a very well curated wine menu. We ordered the bottle of Assyrtiko from Santorini, which paired well with our food.

The server was excellent. She was very attentive to our needs and made great menu recommendations. Our youngest daughter wanted to get a side of fingerling potatoes, which weren't on the menu. She was kind enough to make this special request to the kitchen and that made our daughter very happy (and full!). The kitchen was also very efficient, with minimal wait times for our dishes. And the service team was always quick to take away any plates once we were done.

The ambiance of the restaurant was wonderful. It was energetic and just enough noise so that you could hear everyone at your table, but couldn't hear the conversations of other diners. The decor is perfect for a neighborhood gem of a restaurant. Think trendy, but still casual.

Literally the ONLY reason that I can't give 5 stars is because of the hostess, who was extremely rude. We entered the restaurant at about 6:45pm on Friday (10/27). We did not have reservations, so we understood that the restaurant might be full. When we asked if there was an available table, she gave us a look that indicated she was extremely bothered by our presence. then her exact words were "Fine....but I need you out by 8pm." She led us to our table, again looking like we were doing her an incredible disservice by showing up. When I asked where we could store our stroller, she rolled her eyes and said "I guess I'll have to find somewhere for it."

Overall, this restaurant is great. And they even have a kids menu, that includes a coloring page and word search, that has a variety of different options for your little ones. The food is wonderful and full of flavor. I just hope they re-train the hostess who was on duty last Friday (10/27) night.

Yasouvlaki  has a wonderful lunch menu - I saw most people ordered it. But I had my eye on the avgolemono - my favorite soup. It was a step above the usual floury version I see in NYC. The chicken soup tasted homemade and the lemon was just the right amount. Would have liked a few more eggs in it. The spanakopita was enjoyable and the chicken thigh souvlaki was tender and well-marinated. Service was good and the outside seating was pleasant. I was a bit surprised to see that no sauce was included with the souvlaki...I did ask for some and was able to get a small dish.

Ya for Souvlaki!
.
This charming Greek restaurant on the upper east side brings a taste of Greece to NYC. The ambiance of blue and white everywhere with the red Paeonia parnassica flower is exactly what you are looking for in a Greek restaurant. The hostess, waitstaff, bar tender, we're all attentive and all helped out.
.
We went here for lunch on a Monday and many of the tables were filled. Clearly a great sign. They have an affordable lunch menu that is perfect and great if you need to do a business lunch or large group as they have many tables insides and outside that can accolade many!
.
For the food we got
- Zucchini sticks - these were cooked and flavored perfectly also were like shoe string zuch sticks unreal, a must get app
- Chicken Gyro Souvlaki lunch
- Chicken kebab Souvlaki lunch
Both of the souvlaki lunches came with soup or salad we got the salad and it was fresh and flavorful and refreshing

The Souvlaki were packed in the pita to perfection and the fries ratio was on point! Usually there are not enough fries and they were Jammed in there really well. The chicken was moist, flavorful and better and better with every bite.

In short:
- Great Service and ambiance
- Delicious food!!!
- Great for large groups
- indoor/outdoor seating
- Go here you will love it

Ambiance (4/5): I was immediately seated around 7:30pm and the restaurant was almost full. There is a high-top bar area to sit. There's also an outdoor dining area that's covered. The noise level was appropriate to actually hear my friend and dining area was open that I didn't feel cramped when eating.
Service (5/5): Due to the small nature of the establishment, I felt like I was attended to throughout the whole meal. Staff came up to take orders, refill water/soda, and check in on us. The food came out relatively quick too!
Food:
Table Pita FREE: They provide a free warmed pita sliced into 4. There's oil and vinegar on the table to enjoy for dipping while you wait for the food.
Lamb Burger $25 (4.5/5): I loved it--the burger was stuffed with spices and I loved the fried Halloumi along with the tzatziki sauce. They do a great job in making the Tzatziki sauce creamy and flavorful. The patty itself was rather small and the bread pretty thick to manage this burger. I asked for my French fries to be cooked well done and they delivered!! The seasoned fries were cooked to a perfect crisp that remained crunchy throughout the duration of the meal!

My parents, boyfriend, and I got caught in the rain after spending the day at the MET. We wanted lunch that wasn't too fancy (as we were all drenched), but with a warm & cozy atmosphere where we could sit down and relax. Yasouvlaki definitely fit the bill.

The servers were kind and welcoming as well as attentive. The food was delicious. My mum, bf and I all had gyro pitas and my dad got the kefta platter. Everything was very reasonably priced with a large selection of wines as well.

Wish I had pictures, but we were all so ravenous!

Yasouvlaki is the new-ish restaurant in the UES with a nice mix of indoor and outdoor seating and a welcoming atmosphere. I enjoy how the place sits on 3rd ave with a lot of foot traffic, but they make still make it pretty cozy.

Ive dined here twice -- once at happy hour and once for takeout. The food here is solid and depending on what you order, the portions are generous. I split a mixed platter with a bunch of my buddies and we enjoy the freshly grilled meats. For takeout, i had the falafel platter which had beautiful packaging, but 4 falafel, pita, and fries running $21 s a bit hefty. BUT i do love that they serve falafel at all because they aren't even greek. Can't wait to come back in the summer!

A hidden gem neighborhood spot in the UES. Welcoming staff in an intimate dining room. We can usually get a walk-in on week nights without any issues. Portions are HUGE and priced very fairly so come hungry. The thicken thigh souvlaki is stellar and the salads are fresh. We usually have left overs at the end of the meal.

Had a great brunch here, we had the gyro brunch wrap and then the chicken thigh platter which came with fries and a nice coucous salad, the sauces were really good!  Super friendly service and a nice atmosphere, will definitely come back to try more of the menu!

Went on a date here for a late dinner. We sat down right away. We split the traditional Greek salad and ordered the pork souvlaki platter with lemon potato's. The pork was so unbelievably good that I want to go back so badly, not to try something new, but to order that again because is was just that good. It was crispy on the outside yet still juicy and tender. The portion was huge that we still had leftovers even after sharing the platter.

This place has amazing food, great vibes and wonderful service. We sat outdoors when was seated immediately on a Thursday night. All the servers were very attentive and accommodating.
My friend and I each ordered a platter which comes with greek tabouli / hand cut fries / Toasted pita Tzatziki/ Yasou sauce / 2 skewers. We swapped skewers so we can have 2 different skewers. i also changed my fries to a greek salad while my friend switched to lemon potatoes.

Greek Orangeade - $3 (4/5) This was super refreshing, not to sweet and also not expensive compared to other places.
Swordfish souvlaki platter - $27 (10/5) The swordfish is a so good. If you like fish, definitely give this a try. The fish on the warm soft pita + the different sauces + greek salad was heavenly. Just commenting on the sides on the platter, they were all pretty much perfect! The sauces were thick and had perfect flavor&consistency. The potatoes and salad was good. The tabouli was also huge and flavorful.
Pork souvlaki platter - $20  (5/5) The pork souvlaki was also really good and had the perfect grilled flavor. I preferred the fish because it was easier to chew than the pork and it added more depth to the platter. Still, both options were very good!

The portions were so big it was so worth the price. I basically had 2 more meals left after my dinner. There was no need for appetizers because the platter had everything!
I had a small glitch when packaging leftovers but the owners were so nice about it and made me feel better. Overall I would definitely recommend and this place is a must if you're crazing greek food!

This place is soooo good. The only reason I didn't give it five stars instead of four was because I didn't like the eggplant dip, but I will definitely be coming back here. It really deserves an extra half star.

We ordered the Greek Cesar salad, and the three dips to share. The Greek Cesar salad is hard to go wrong and it did not disappoint. I loved the croutons they put in it, it's the same crusty delicious croutons they used in Cretan salads. I don't understand why they are so good, but they put regular croutons to shame.

The dips besides the eggplant were perfect. The tzatziki was perfectly creamy, not to garlicky, and just the right amount of lemon. The eggplant dip was just kinda flavorless. It wasn't bad, but just compared to the other too, it just really didn't have the flavor to make you want to go back for more. The red pepper/feta dip was unreal. I don't know what magic was in that dip but it was packed full of flavor and complemented the pita super well.

We didn't get drinks here, but next time I'm here, definitely going to get some drinks and enjoy the rest of the menu
Nice casual sit down Greek spot. Great hummus and pita. The gyros were delicious and so were the dolma. Servers and all the staff were friendly and efficient.

Food was amazing and the service was friendly! With a clean a pleasant aesthetic that welcome any lone travelers.

Very much enjoyed finding this gem, we had to come twice! Excited to try this again in the near future!

The food was OK. But everything was in very small portions and they charged a lot for it. And when you get a dish like octopus you'd expect like a whole bunch of octopus, but they just put one tentacle and cover the rest of the plate with veggies all raw. Display sometimes gets busy so the service is usually slow. And the inside has a bar and they only have a limited amount of seats so it gets filled up very easily and if you have a stroller or wheelchair, you will definitely not be able to fit inside because each table is very compacted and close to each other. They do have outdoor seating, though.

So got here about 8:30pm, was excited to get some Greek food as I enjoy Greek food, walked in and saw all the traditional Greek restaurant colors and regular Greek adornments and got excited to be in the right place, looked at the menu and then got kind of bummed out, they didn't have a lot of traditional Greek dishes, they had souvlaki in chicken, pork and no lamb, they had gyro in three different styles but no lamb, the only lamb they offered was lamb chops, so I got a little bummed at first. I ordered the thigh souvlaki and my guest ordered the Greek lasagna. This is where it changed everything, the meal came out and just packed a ton of flavor, the chicken was amazing, the lasagna amazing, the fries slapped hard and then the WOW of the tzatziki, fresh and light and refreshing. So so good. The staff was awesome and attentive checked on us a bunch. I really enjoyed it here.

Probably the best food I have ever had, the service was pretty good as well. The portions were big, the place wasn't to crowded, but make reservations even for weeknights. We went on the later end of the night so it was dying down, but the price for food was reasonable and value certain was theirs.  I would definitely come back as this was very authentic and plates were large
Enough to fill you and still bring some
Home.

I dropped by and got seated right away without a reservation on a weekday night. Since there was two of us, we selected the mixed grill which had big portions and on their menu says it served 2-3. Delicious selection of meats - chicken souvlaki, chicken gyro, pork gyro, kefta skewers...we loved being able to sample so many. Great dipping sauces too and pita bread as well. The portions left the two of us stuffed.

The service was great - the staff was attentive and kind.

We opted to sit outdoors which was nice.

Overall, I recommend this place if you're craving some Greek food while in the upper east side!

Greek restaurant on the upper east side with friendly service and both indoor/outdoor seating. The menu has it all. We chose to keep it simple usually - hummus plate with shared chicken breast platter to go with the Mythos lager. Overall we've had good experiences both times we've been here.

Had a sandwich and wasn't impressed at all. Everything seemed too expensive for a weekly lunch except sandwiches.
Overall, very plain and the meat was quite dry.
Not worth the money
Service regular. Not friendly but not rude either.
I dont think I will come back

Went here to Celebrate our Dads 90th bday!! Kyle was our waiter, who gave us excellent service and suggestions on what to order. Best service we've had around here in our neighborhood. Kyle suggested great bottle of white for the 4 of us to share. We ordered the Greek cheese & salad. Both delicious and refreshing. Then we shared the seafood platter. Plenty for 4 of us to share. Kyle brought a nice piece of cheese cake to celebrate dads 90tj bday. It was a great night, because of the food, service, Kyle the waiter was perfect!

Yummy spot!

We came here after being in the mood for Greek food. It was somehow 70 degrees in October so we opted to sit outside. Tons of outdoor seating, including the little outdoor shack setup we sat in which was comfy. The staff is super friendly and had our reservation ready to go when we arrived.

The menu is pretty basic, however, it allows them to be great at everything they do make. We decided to split three dips (tirokafteri, eggplant, and tzatziki) with some warm pita, along with horiatiki (traditional Greek salad). All of that completely filled us up that we didn't have room left to try an actual entree! The dips were delicious and we couldn't get enough. The salad was fresh and perfect on a warm evening. They also carry a solid list of Greek beer (Fix, Mythos, etc.).

Prices for food are fair, prices for drinks are expensive ($9 for a beer? Really?). The staff pretty much left us alone as we noshed and caught up. Next time I'll go right to the entrees since now I know the apps fill me up!

I was really excited to try this new Greek restaurant in the neighborhood. The atmosphere is very bright and clean. We came around 4pm on a Friday so it wasn't crowded at all.

To eat I got the Oktapodi, grilled octopus with fava, lentil salad, and tomato vinaigrette. I also got the Greek salad. Overall both items  were good, not great. If I were to come back I would only get the salad. I was hoping to enjoy this place more than I did.

Likes
- delicious food
- close to subway, bus and citibike
- nice and simple decor

Dislike
None

Love Greek food and have been excited to try this place after walking past a few times in recent weeks.
The restaurant is L shaped and half the tables are in the front section and half down the side section.

The food was really good. My meal was mainly a Greek salad and then moussaka which was excellent. My friend had a chicken souvlaki platter which was also very tasty.
Had a few glasses of red wine, tried 3 different ones which were a little hit and miss.

The service was friendly and attentive, and everyone seemed eager to please us.
Probably the best part were the food prices which were excellent (as was the quality). The only thing I would tweak would be to maybe drop the price of the Greek salad and also offer a side portion of the salad (they offer side portions of almost everything else.

If you like Greek or Mediterranean food definitely give this place a try- they already seem to be doing well and it was busy when we went on a Friday night.
We were happy with what we ordered. The wait staff was friendly. It would have been nice to be able to sit outside. They have cute settings, but it was brutally hot to sit outside this afternoon.

It was worth the walk from the Guggenheim to this restaurant. Delicious Horiatiki salad. Fresh and great feta used. I've tried to recreate it at home. Couldn't quite do it.  A great find. I also ordered some keftes that was delicious. The server was attentive and the ambiance comfortable. Well lit and they have outdoor patio seating. I'll be back to try more of their fare.

It was ok - I had passed by this place before and it looked cute/interesting so I came here with a friend.  

Pros:
big portions
food was good
I liked the vibe - it's simple, not trying to be "trendy" but rather a good neighborhood place to get a meal for couples, friends,  groups and I even saw some people eating solo.

Cons:
service was kinda slow
Kinda cramped inside/difficult to move around
I made a RSVP on OpenTable and they didnt check it in
I personally thought the food was kinda salty

One of the BEST meals I've ever had in NYC and I live here. Kali was an INCREDIBLE server and made our night so much better. I ordered the chicken breast souvlaki with lemon potatoes and it was absolutely delicious. Great neighborhood, great ambience, great food, great service. This place got a 10/10 on every angle. Will be coming here again and again.

My partner and I, who both have Greek backgrounds come here almost once a week as our go to spot for a taste of home. The food is wonderful, portions are generous and the ambiance is very nice. Definitely tends to get full on weekends due to being both economical but very high quality food. Everyone working here is so lovely and willing to go the extra mile to make your experience enjoyable. We tend to get the pork souvlaki platter and a few sides. The meat is tender and comes with tzatziki and very nice sauce unique to the restaurant. We love the octopus appetizer and highly recommend it to anyone who comes in here, they do a fantastic job and it comes out exceptionally every time. Definitely worth a visit or a bunch!

I stopped starving on a random Saturday, and Yasiuvlaki hit the spot. We only ordered zucchini chips and pitas, but they were good.

The atmosphere: was a modern restaurant design. It was pretty pleasing.

The staff: and service was reasonably quick. There were not any people there, and they were lovely.

The food: was good. However, they should really say zucchini fries instead of chips.

Cleanliness: it was, as expected, clean.

Definitely a five!!
So, I feel compelled to finally comment on this restaurant, after about a half a dozen visits
Fancy it's not, but I'm good with that.
The dining room is a bit crowded, but in a good way. The decor clean, very simple, but the atmosphere makes up for the simple decor. Actually in the summer months, I'm usually sitting outdoors anyhow
A Super pleasant staff from reception to the wait staff  as there are no holes in this team.
The menu is typically Greek however I find the preparation of their food to be outstanding and very appropriately priced when compared to some of the highly overpriced Greek Mediterranean restaurants in the city
The dandelion salad, a pure novelty, bitter greens, drenched in lemon, are a beautiful, fresh starter. The horatiki salad , beautifully, arranged, and seasoned in a generous serving. The tomatoes are perfectly ripe!
Excellent.
On this night I had Bronzino, which is expertly grilled, with crispy skin, yet tender flesh, while being seasoned, with the right amount of lemon.
I was also pleasantly surprised to see Such a beautiful selection of Greek wines, which are not only delicious, but a very good value for what they are
Overall, it's one of those places where you feel good about the ambiance, the service and the food quality to the extent that you feel compelled to tip, extra generously, which, of course we did
Don't miss out on this wonderful neighborhood gem
The service was impeccable, Kali was faced with a complicated group of friends and she handled everything happily and skillfully without skipping a beat. Great service.
Solid taverna food. Prices are high and ambiance doesn't match. But if you want a fix of souvlakia it's a good choice. It is the best gyro in the neighborhood.

On a Friday evening, craving for Greec food. So my Yelp friend helped us again and we found this place at the UES. This place is great. The food is amazing. We had the calamari appetizer which was really good. It's fried but one can taste that the squid is fresh. Then we moved on to the mixed grill. This thing is HUGE. Says eats 2-3 but you can easily make that for 4. Choice of meats was very good and each flavorful in its own. Lamb, chicken, pork and beef. We had to take half of it home to enjoy another night. We will definitely come back here. Oh and the staff. Very friendly and attentive without being intrusive (skill in itself). They are right there when you have a question though.
Restaurant is not so big but comfortable.

The food at Yasouvlaki is consistently fresh and delicious ... the portions are generous and Executive Chef George is always making an effort to put together thoughtfully prepared specials.  A recent swordfish steak as well as a scallop special were among the best dishes I've had in the city in a long time!  The souvlaki and other regular menu items are also homeruns!

Coming from a former Upper East Side restaurant/bar owner, I can genuinely say this has quickly become my absolute favorite neighborhood spot.  The amazingly friendly, knowledgeable and efficient staff, managed by Maria, makes the experience all the more enjoyable!

From bartenders ... Brett, Sarah, Laurence and Irem ... to servers ... Jack, Kyle, Alex, Angelo and Kali as well as busboy, Manuel ... They're ALL top notch, work well together and I'm honored to be able to call them friends.

The atmosphere and food at Yasouvlaki are authentically Greek and it's been such an awesome addition to the neighborhood!

We ordered from Seamless. The food was passable, but some things were icky. The taramosalata was super salty and thinned down, the chicken thigh souvlaki platter came with a strange mayo-based sauce, less than flavorful chicken, and soggy fries. This is a fast casual place pretending to be a restaurant. UPDATE: the restaurant refunded the price of the taramosalata without my prompting. One more star for responsiveness.
I have been here and the gyro or hero sandwiches are very good and the sparkling orange juice I had never had before but was very good

I don't love Greek food but yasouvlaki was very good. I got the pork gyro pita wrap which was great but I wouldn't get the pork gyro again as it was a little dry. Enjoyed the greek beers and baklava. My date got the platter which was awesome. I'd go back.

The only bodega / deli I know that makes me turn on my Shazam app.  Seriously, this place plays club music through their fantastic sound system most evenings, and I feel like I'm in a music video as I peruse the fruity seltzers and fight the urge to dance.  It's fun.  Go there after 9p to see what I mean.  

To the staff: Please keep this up. My clubbing days are probably over and you're giving me the little mood boost I crave after work.  

Also, the staff are friendly and kind, the place is clean, and they have a good variety of made-to-order food, beverages, snacks, and desserts.

This place has become a staple for me! I really enjoy the sandwiches and salads. Protein smoothies are also delicious as well.

Lots of snacks and drinks to pick from here as well.

Yorkville Deli Market is excellent for the service, coffee, food and prices. The employees are very nice and patient with me. You get a discount when you pay cash! They serve LavAzza Coffee for $1.99 for 12 ounces.
I'm going to be back definitely for the Pesto Grilled Cheese sandwich. I love the bagels and cream cheese too. Definitely Better than eating at Panera!
I'm recommending!!

Good food, good price, good service, good vibes.
I remember this location used to be USPS office.
Stuff are nice, sandwiches are great and prices are good!
Top 3 sandwich I've ever had. Highly recommend the Italian panini. Service was really fast. We were able to get the sandwich chips 2 pickles and a water for 13 bucks. Excellent value.
I come here every morning the service and staff is great and the food is good. They have a great selection of food also and a lot of healthy foods

This deli is a godsend in the area. Terrific selection of hot and cold sandwiches, all types of snacks,  many cold drinks, and they are open a bit later now. Always to to get a good meal to refuel after a late evening workout.

Be very careful!  6 weekends in a row, I've gone down for a breakfast burrito and the Cook refuses to wear gloves. Grabs everything with his bare hands. During the week, they're fine, but on weekends when they're packed, they break every health code out there.  You tell the Manager, and he stares at ya with this dumb look. Same cook, same kitchen manager every weekend and they continue to do it. Has only put the gloves on when he's called out.  STAY AWAY ON WEEKENDS!  I'll go this coming weekend and take pics. Positive he won't be wearing the latex gloves again..

Wonderful clean corner deli offering just about everything - made to order and very well priced. Order ahead and pick up on the app, sometimes food can take a bit to prepare but worth it for a good quick bite.

Happy to leave these folks my highest recommendation. Everything we've ordered has been great. Right now, I seem to have a thing for the lamb pita with white sauce. And the Greek salad was as good as any I've had recently. They also seem to have anything you might need in stock and it all appears to be reasonably priced. Glad to be within walking distance. Keep up the great work.

This place is my favorite!! I always order the hash brown breakfast burrito and a large iced coffee after a night of drinking and it's the best. It always comes exactly how I ordered it and it's delicious each time. Super consistent and pretty inexpensive.
I'm obsessed with this deli. I've never ordered anything here that wasn't good. I have to say my favorite thing is hash brown burrito though. Soooo yummy

So impressed by this new deli! Very clean, well stocked with lots of options! I stopped in on a Friday at 12:30pm and it was crowded. I was 5th in line but it went very quickly. I ordered within 2 minutes and my sandwich was ready within 5 min after that. Right now, with every purchase, you get a free water or coffee! The service was really friendly and patient as I looked over their extensive menu.

I made my own sandwich, honey Turkey, cheddar, chipotle Mayo, lettuce and tomato. Most signature sandwich options $8.99 which is a great value for what you got. Bread was super fresh; I do wish they put a little more chipotle Mayo. I also got an order of chicken tenders with a side of honey mustard for $5.99 which were great; very crispy and delicious!

I will definitely be back and would highly recommend!

Super happy for having this place open
This deli is supee clean with basic you might need.
Haven't tried the food yet but amazed on all the flavours they have of Van leuwens ice cream. They even have more flavours than the van leuwen store!

Such a clean deli with so many options! They have all different types of snacks and drinks. They also have a huge menu where you can get hot/cold sandwiches, salad, paninis, smoothies, cakes, bagels, cookies, and more . They have a great $8.99 sandwich and panini deal. I tried the Murray Hill sandwich and it was very solid! Next time I'll add some lettuce and pickles. Will be back again soon!
Look no further upper eastsiders!! Solid wraps, very good chicken....a wrap will run you $10 but what do you expect it is the upper east ! Deff a go to spot !!
Lots of sandwiches/wraps to choose from. Soooo many beverage choices. Not to mention chips, cookies, candy, etc. Staff was very polite and the business is kept well clean.

Although the stores extremely awesome....Please Bring Back HALS Seltzer. Pepsi and Coke doesn't carry all the flavors Hals Has & Its so Disappointing not to Have...Who's the manager, can you guys please bring it back?!

Clean and well lit store with enough room to move around. I ordered a Philly cheese steak from the deli. They made it fresh and wrapped it well enough that it was still warm when I got home. It was really good. One complaint is not everything is well marked on the shelves.

Perfect Deli! Clean and has everything you need!
Good selection of food, friendly staff and open till late!

The smoothies and breakfast specials are perfect - I got the green smoothie and fresh toast combo

Really like this place a lot! They made my breakfast burrito to perfection, one of the best I've ever had tbh! Did not expect it to be that bomb! Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because they sold me sour chocolate milk which was pretty foul. So when I come back in to get my money back for the bad milk (and likely order another breakfast burrito), if they remedy the situation I'll gladly change it to a 5, as the stuff they have in here is really good! Would def recommend!

Went here on New Years Day for a much needed big breakfast. Got the hash brown burrito and a large iced coffee and both were so good. The breakfast burrito was so fresh and the bacon was extra crispy. Highly recommend giving them a shot. A welcome addition to the UES!

I walk past this market every day on my way to the gym and have always been meaning to try it. I don't know what it was but something compelled me to walk in yesterday; probably the beautiful flower setup they had on outside. I went inside and the service was quick and everyone working was very polite. I ordered an everything bagel with avocado, egg, and cheese. And the bagel was amazing! It tasted so fresh and delicious. Normally an issue I have with bagel sandwiches is the filling to bread ratio, but this place didn't make any mistakes. I also ordered a small iced coffee and it was seriously some of the best coffee I've ever had in my life. I will definitely be returning!

THANK YOU for carrying gluten free wraps!! It is so rare for me to be able to grab a delicious breakfast burrito or lunch wrap, and even more rare that it's a gluten free wrap that actually holds its shape and tastes good. I have tried the hashbrown burrito and Santa Fe wrap and both were great, looking forward to trying more. Also have to mention this is a very bright and clean store and it's just a pleasant experience all around.

Everyone was so friendly, the place is immaculate and full of treasures. I've never got over losing my deli on the corner of 89th and 2nd a few years back and have finally found an amazing replacement in Yorkville Deli Market. Happy to have them in the neighborhood. Got the chopped cheese and fries and it was excellent, much bigger than it looks in the photo.

They have a very extensive menu with great prices and I think once they work out the kinks, this will be the best deli in the 90s on 2nd Ave. It's much bigger than I expected so you can grab all of your bodega style needs. The food is good... I grabbed a tex mex burger. And the service is kind. There is plenty of staff and they are ready to be help you find what you need. It gets pretty busy around lunch time so if you plan to grab a quick bite, I would call ahead or allow for a few extra minutes.

I placed an order for delivery, I ordered  a bagel and a vanilla ice latte. The latte does not taste like anything  it's just water down, if anything it looks like they pour a lot of milk and very little coffee, Plus they didn't even sent a straw when I clearly stated on my order that I wanted utensils. That is not all I ordered a medium ice latte  and they sent me a small cup I wonder how big is the small one. I am very disappointed, definitely not what I expected.
Great selection. We don't have a deli with this kind of variety in this section of 2nd Ave.  The sandwiches and breakfast items are excellent. Very friendly staff and it's so bright and open inside.

Great neighborhood spot! Very clean and well stocked. There are a lot of options. The cheesesteak we ordered was good! However I was a little sad that the panini wasn't on panini bread. Nonetheless, still good.
Full stocked with a great assortment of pantry needs, beverages, and also foods and snacks for hosting. Great hours, clean shop, and great service!
Clean store, a lot of selections. People working there are very nice and helpful. Great addition to the UES.

Great food nice people but NOT a go to for deliveries. In my 5 times ordering always placed on hold for what seems an eternity and I live in the same building as them and it still takes 45 minutes for them to show up. I agree with the other reviews as far as clean,nice people, good menu selection, reasonable prices, generous portions but I stopped ordering from them because it is always frustrating giving the order and the wait is way too long for where they are located in proximity to me. i wish they would step up their game in this area. There are many other places in the area that give much faster service. i hope they work out the kinks.
I ordered an omelette with ham, spinach, feta and olives and received a plastic bowl with ham, spinach, feta and olives. No eggs! Amazing.

Very nice new deli that recently opened. We have tried several items from the grill and they've all been excellent. The chicken halal bowl is surprisingly very good and we order it regularly. The store itself is clean, well stocked and maintained. The prices are very reasonable. The service has been friendly and accommodating.  A welcome addition to the neighborhood!

I visited this deli today.  I ordered a bacon and eggs sandwich on a roll with butter, salt and pepper.  I also ordered a Turkey sandwich.  The Turkey sandwich was ok.  However, when I returned home, I found my bacon and eggs sandwich was only one egg without bacon.  I called the store and they said I could return and they would make me another sandwich.  I asked if they could deliver it and was immediately placed on hold.  The manager spoke with me and said they only charged me for an egg on a roll? The cost for two sandwiches and a free coffee was $16.05.  Seriously doubt I only paid for one egg! Lastly, the manager is a micro manager and several employees touched my sandwich to include the manager who did not like the way his employee wrapped my single egg sandwich.  I will not visit this establishment any longer as they should not charge you for items you bought then say it will cost more to make the sandwich they already charged me for.  This business is as fake as they come.  They will not last because they don't treat customers well.  Besides the egg sandwich was like eating cardboard!

I'm Chinese and generally don't like American Chinese food but this place actually makes pretty good food. The flavor although is 90% or 95% Chinese and familiar it has a slightly distinct tailored taste for Americans.

The man in front is very nice. I've seen disrespectful customers and he still keeps being really nice.

A local American Chinese food spot that is take out only. The decor is pretty plain. The guy running the front is always really nice and quick with service. Portion sizes are good for a place that runs under $10 for an entree, and you get a choice of fries vs. rice vs. fried rice. Since I was feeling a little sick recently, also decided to get the soup--which was actually much better than I thought it would be. It was a good amount of eggs in some nice light chicken broth, just salty enough to hit the spot. I think it depends on the day you go, but today the quality of the food was pretty good. The chicken had a nice bite and flavor to it, and the fried rice, which can be hit-or-miss, is usually made in bulk at the beginning of the day, kept in the rice cooker, and heated in the wok per order.

Pre-Covid I came here quite a few times and the food was really tasty then. Unfortunately, the flavor has changed since.

During this visit I got spare rib tips, pork fried rice, an egg roll, and seltzer water. The food was really bland and it didn't taste like Chinese food. The price and portions are good (total was $10.75 for everything). But due to the lack of flavor, I'll likely opt for another place in the future. Also, shortly after eating here, I got a headache. Not sure if the two are related, but definitely noticed the occurrence. (This is the first time I've ever noticed a headache after eating here).

Overall I'd give 2.5 stars.
Great Place, great prices, great food! The service was quick and the service was exemplary!

Solid Chinese takeout, with tasty food, generous portions, and great prices.  This is about as good as inexpensive Chinese takeout gets.  I used to live in the neighborhood, and miss it now that I'm gone.

TLDR: cheapest decent-tasting Chinese takeout option in the neighborhood

As someone who was raised in a Chinese family, let me start off by saying that I typically abhor Chinese-American food. It always end up being either:

A) doused in oil
B) salty enough to cure meat in
C) cloyingly sweet
D) any combination of the above three

Accordingly, I don't really have high standards when I get Chinese takeout- all I really expect is to not have to pay an arm & leg, alongside being filled up without my stomach complaining.

I got the Chicken w. String Beans Pork Fried Rice Lunch Special today, and it was 'decent'. It certainly didn't blow my mind away, nor did it fall below my admittedly low expectations. At least for my meal, Yummy City gave out big portions, and they certainly don't skip out on the protein.

What separates Yummy City from other Chinese takeout options in the UES and East Harlem however is two things:

1. Price. Their lunch menu is still somehow mostly under $7.00, while all the other Chinese takeout restaurants in the surrounding locale have raised their menus at or above that price-point.

2. Service. The guy working at the counter is a gem- he's somehow fluent in English and Mandarin and possibly Cantonese/Fujianese. There's zero language barrier unlike at many other takeout places, plus the food comes out within five minutes and they make it in front of you.

Verdict: don't expect to be amazed, but take it from a Chinese person, it's the best of the lot

Compared to other American Chinese style takeout restaurants Yummy City is probably one of the best in the city. They do a tremendous volume for a 2 person husband and wife operation across from an MTA bus depot and the heavy foot traffic of Lexington Ave. The ingredients are fresh and the cook is friendly; always willing to accommodate reasonable requests and adjusts level of seasoning/sauce based on request. Get takeout and go to Central Park.
Food isn't as tasty as other Chinese restaurants in Brooklyn or lower Manhattan their prices are good

I had high hopes from all the reviews but unfortunately it came up short in the basic Chinese take out food that imo should be foolproof.

Sadly the chicken and eggplant with garlic sauce wasn't available due to the snowstorm. The general tso's chicken was bland and the lo mein tasted like old oil and overused wok. Crab rangoons and broccoli with garlic sauce were pretty good. Young chow fried rice was above average compared to other take out places. They gave us 3 free soda cans though, which was nice!

If this weren't around the corner from me I wouldn't come back here. Seems like a really popular spot though so maybe I'm ordering the wrong things?

Cheap, decent Chinese takeout place that is good for lunch. The owner is friendly and accommodates requests. I ordered chicken and eggplant in garlic sauce since so it was in all the reviews. Isn't on the menu but he was willing to make it. The garlic sauce wasn't very garlicky and it was a bit sweet, but it was still good. There was a lot more eggplant than chicken. There was enough for two meals. Cash only.

Delicious food at affordable prices.  The owners are so nice and sweet. The food is made to order.  I've only had the best experiences here.  SOOO many options.  Everything I have tried is hot and flavorful.

Be prepared this is a to-go (take-away) place and is cash-only, so hit up the atm before you come here!  You will love it!

To be honest, it's a hole-in-the-wall unassuming Chinese takeout shop. But as the owners spoke cantonese behind the counter and the fragrance of the food wafted forward, I started to have a good feeling about this place.

I ordered the eggplant & chicken with rice for $5.50 (like so cheap I can't even fathom). It was a large portion and plenty to save for the next day if you aren't too hungry. I thought the flavor was very typical and authentic cantonese fare. Not too oily or salty. I would definitely order it again. The owners seem like such sweethearts! A great find in the neighborhood and in the city. I definitely recommend! :)

Not only is the food incredible, but the service is next level. Hands down the most genuine people I've come across in the city to date. Highly recommend coming here to get some good food, you won't be disappointed!

Super, super great deals here! If you're looking for a cheap, Americanized-Chinese meal on the upper east side, this is your place. Portions are large enough to have leftovers for the next day, too. There is no seating so I suggest getting an entrée and a soda and walking the 8 minutes over to Central Park for a picnic!

Hands down the best chinese takeout spot on the UES. The owner is such a sweetheart and takes the time to get to know his customers. My go to is their chicken and eggplant (extra spicy). The eggplant is always super fresh and everything arrives piping hot. Plus you can't beat the prices or value for the portion sizes.

If I'm being honest, I'd probably order more if they were available on Eat24. But I totally appreciate keeping it low key and simple.

Note: cash only!

What an incredible find. Superb location. Magnificent food, Hot & Sour Soup was wonderful undoubtedly. This Hot & Sour Soup was prepared just perfectly. Staff are very pleasant and service is very quick. Go and check Yummy City out - you'll be happy that you did.

Great food for the price. Very generous in servings. Also very accommodating with your requests. I ordered large gen tso's chicken and eggplant and chicken. I got a free can of soda too. Food is so good!!! I am so glad to have discovered this. Definitely will be my staple chinese take out food.

I think I begged the owner to do online ordering for a year straight. I don't think they do it yet, but Lord would it make ordering from Yummy City so much easier. Then again, they'd probably be swamped with deliveries so maybe it's best that they're not online yet.

When I had moved up to East Harlem I was shocked to find that there wasn't a lot of great Chinese take out spots. The ones that littered Grubhub and Eat24 just were not great, and if they were good they were charging wayyyyyy too much for combos. Now, I'm not a cheapskate but I'm also not spending $15 on a Chicken & Broccoli combo meal. Those prices are just not worth it.  So finding Yummy City on here was totally a lazy life saver. For $20 my partner and I could eat like lazy kings. Yeah, I had to call them up like it was the 90s. Yeah, I had to pay in cash. Yeah, it felt like maybe they forgot that NYC has grown and that the industry changed. But it was entirely worth it to order from here. Their food was good (not great, but for like $6 I'm not complaining), and the service was typically really quick. Granted we lived 4 blocks away, but still.

The #1 thing I'd recommend people order from Yummy City - Eggplant in Garlic Sauce. Holy crap was that delicious. I honestly never had it before. I guess I was used to Fine-ese, where it was fine, but it wasn't Chinese. This was legit. I've since gone and had it around the city when I see it on the menu, but they've definitely got one of the best.

The people here are friendly enough. However, the food just isn't good. I've never been a huge fan of Americanized Chinese food so take this with a grain of salt, but I found the food here to be lacking. I ordered the kung pao chicken and dumplings. The chicken was just ok. The sauce was more watery than I liked. The dish was almost 30% peanuts. The flavors were a little monotonous. The portions are large and prices are cheap but it just didn't taste that great.

The dumplings here are as horrible as any of the ones in this part of town. I don't understand, does every Chinese take out in upper Manhattan buy their dumplings from the same crappy manufacturer? The skin is crazy thick and the filling is without flavor. It was not a pleasant experience eating them.

I really wish East Harlem/Upper East Side would get a legit and reasonably priced Chinese restaurant, but given the circumstances of store rent and client demographic, that is unlikely. At least the Q will take me straight to Canal street these days.

Update: upgrading my review to 5 stars after having so many pleasant interactions with the gentleman who handles the orders. I've been given free sodas more times than not, and he always generous with portions. The quality and quantity of food for the price can not be beaten. The spicy chicken and eggplant in garlic sauce is incredibly addicting and their crab rangoons are probably the best I've ever had. Don't be afraid to give these guys a shot.

I love Yummy City and have been going here for years. Their food is always delicious and they have a lot of little yummy treats like fish sticks, chicken fingers , wings, all sorts of stuff. They work hard and are a gem in this neighborhood

I don't usually write review. Just came here for take out randomly. It is a small chinese take out restaurant with only one table.
I ordered a small chicken eggplant with garlic sauce.Great service. Since it is spicy, they asked if I want spicy or not. Good service. It only cost 5.25 and it was such big portion. Not just that. It taste very good. Not like other restaurant making too sweet. It came out just right.
It's a corner stone of Chines take out in Uptown.
This place is my favorite Chinese place in East Harlem. Quick, delicious, and affordable. Cash only, but there's an ATM next door.

The restaurant is very small, I guess it just for take out only. We ordered large chicken with eggplant, 2 large soups, rice come with the main dish. The total was $17 Hot and sour soup is very delicious. Chicken with eggplants has more eggplants than chicken but it was fine for me since I love eggplants anyway but not sure if a meat lover will enjoy it.  The store location is not far from upper east side area, it's more in Harlem side, but looks safe to me.

This place it's a rare find. Excellent food, fresh, cheap and good. The portions are big so think well before ask...
People who attend are friendly. We ask and your order is ready fast either. So it's a good experience.
I Frequent this restaurants  with my dad. They are one of the best Chinese food spots I've eaten in New York since the 90s when I lived in Brooklyn. Just delicious
This is far the best Chinese Food on the East Side Of Manhattan. The owners are friendly and The prices are great. A MUST HAVE

Can't beat the lunch specials for value on satisfying Chinese take out.

I've enjoyed the Kung Bao chicken and chicken with eggplant in garlic sauce.

We split opinions in hot & sour soup. I think it's a good deal, but he would prefer more balanced heat -- more black pepper and less chili oil.

Let me preface this five star review with some context: by no stretch of my imagination do I consider this a five star Chinese restaurant. They are a simple, Americanized Chinese food restaurant catering to their customer demographic - that of east Harlem. They've told me themselves they rarely get Chinese customers, and one of their most popular items is fried chicken and French fries. I travel over an hour for legit, five star Chinese food in flushing; I walk about three minutes to come to Yummy City when I get off of late shifts and don't want to cook anything. With this context in mind, here's why I still give it five stars:

These are good, down to earth people making delicious food for a great price. I've tried a few of the other nearby Chinese joints (Asian gourmet, pick up stix, yoan ming) and this was my favorite by far.

I can't speak to their noodles or fried rice yet, but the chicken and eggplant (yay for real Chinese food) was on point and so so cheap! Beef and broccoli also pretty good.

Also just saw a lady accidentally drop her order on the floor as she was walking out - owner said don't worry about it and just made her a new one for free. You really can't beat that. They good people.

Are you kidding me? Is this food for humans? The chicken noodle soup smelled weird and the texture of the chicken was such that my friend and didn't eat. I had the chicken and eggplant and it was so nasty, I didn't even want to bother giving it to a homeless person. I took home the rice and then tossed It at home because I figured with meat that looked that disgusting, why take a risk. I like hole in the wall places as much as the next but the ratings on this place are downright criminal. How could anyone call this place the best Chinese takeout in upper east side?
Price point here is outstanding. Also shoutout to the guy who works there; he's so nice!
Love them ! Always tasty, best chinese takeout in the area. Quick , affordable fresh and friendly.

This was terrible Chinese food. I know it was cheap, but I got delivery and it was very bad. No flavor and fried rice was not fried (steamed rice with stuff thrown in) and had no egg in it. Dumplings were hard, flavorless, and tough to chew. Will not order from here again.

Never write reviews - but had to write one for this one.  I do like good ambiance, but good food always comes first.   And Yummy City has good food at generous portions and a great price.   It seems to be family run, by first gen immigrants, so tastes a little different from the run of the mill Chinese.

Highly recommend if you are looking for good Chinese food at reasonable prices(and don't care about how a place looks)
Yummy city is cheap and great tasting food.Me and my husband love there chicken and fries.

BEST Chinese food uptown! This is on Lexington between 99th and 100th street. 2 block down there is the same food for more then double. I get a pint of chicken and broccoli with pork fried rice and a small wanton soup for just $6.75. If you want a quick fix for Chinese hit this spot up!

Yummy city has quickly become our go-to takeout  place. The friendly service, quick delivery, and on-point meals have yet to disappoint. We always order the same two items: sesame chicken and beef with broccoli and they are consistently delicious every time. Ordering delivery is cash only and takeout allows for card payments with a minimum purchase of $10.

I used to frequent the other Chinese takeout restaurant a few blocks from Yummy city with the loud screaming lady - however, I have not been there since discovering this place because the quality of the food and service at Yummy is far superior!

This place is your typical neighborhood Chinese restaurant. They're clean, and the prices are affordable. The people are also nice. Don't come here expecting brown fried rice and food in plastic containers though (they'll do the latter if you ask them to). Since Evergreen up the block closed, I'll have to start coming here for my quick shrimp with broccoli fix.
The food was great and the price was AMAZING! Have only tried the chicken and eggplant, as per every other person in the yelp reviews but the sauce was delicious and the eggplant was so tender!

Got the standard general tso's chicken and it was a great choice. They did not skimp out on the sauce and everything was cooked well. Nothing seemed over or under cooked. The deal was the $5.50 lunch special and it was a very filling meal. I ate half of it for lunch and the other half for dinner. Very satisfying. If you're craving Chinese takeout and you're in the area, definitely check it out!

The people are kind, the food is decent and the prices are fair. I always get the sesame chicken, but my bf likes the fried dumplings and fried rice. Occasionally they have free soda specials and they definitely deliver. Yummy City for R E A L.
Fresh delish food, and the workers/ owners are very humble and kind... Best Chinese food hands down
The guy at the corner is always very friendly. Great value for the price - remember that it's simple take out and no restaurant.

Fast delivery, average Chinese food take out. When I say Average I mean this is what I would expect for take out: food cooked as expected and seems clean. If you're looking for gourmet I would keep looking, but if u want a late night quick eat I would definitely suggest this.
This is the best Chinese take out in the Upper East Side.  I've tried everywhere else, and this is your best bet for the money.  The perfect Fat Sunday food
Cash only...but they say they take card. Which one is it? In this day and age you would think its not even a question or option...anyway their loss.
I was shocked by the price on such large amount of food each serve. Moreover, it's really delicious from both Chinese and American views. I enjoyed it very much.

I love authentic chinese food, and went to this place after reading the reviews. This place is not good at all. I ordered lo mein and there was no flavor whatsoever. I needed more salt or soy sauce or something. My friend ordered General Tso's chicken and all you could taste is oil from fried chicken and no flavor. I am not sure if we ordered the wrong thing there, but its def not worth it. They do give large portions and its cheap, but if you want delicious food I would not recommend this place.

This place doesn't offer anything fancy, but the people who run it are good people. They deliver quickly and often give me a deal or toss in a can of soda since I order regularly. A great neighborhood Chinese spot. If you want your fries not to be soggy, order them crispy.
Polite, fast, cheap, and tasty Chinese food. You can tell the owner works very hard and has a good connection with all of his customers. Honey wings with fries is a go to cheat meal.

Came here with a friend and our dogs to grab a coffee and cookie. Cute little place, friendly service, cappuccino was stellar, and the white chocolate oatmeal cookie was great.  Benches outside to drink coffee, and small seating area on the inside.

Would definitely stop by again when I'm in the neighborhood!

Honestly I was pretty disappointed in my coffee. I'd been wanting to try this place for months, so it's sad to admit.

I got a vanilla latte with oat milk and it was just bad. We are talking two extra costs to change the latte to what I wanted it to be and it still tasted bad.

The espresso is not good and I don't know what vanilla they out in there but the coffee didn't taste like vanilla and had a horrible after taste.

I will not be spending over $7 for a latte here again.

Yanni's is a locally-owned coffee shop in the Chelsea 'hood offers coffee and baked items.  I had the mocha with whole milk, extra hot - it could have been more hot, but I enjoyed it so much, that I didn't really mind.  This was super delicious, and probably one of the best mochas I've had!

Staff could have been more acknowledging in terms of patrons coming in and taking orders; there was a slight lull at the cashier.

There are only a handful of seating, but most get their items to go.

Great caffeine pick-me-up if you're in the area.

+mocha
+limited seating

Ah! I love visiting locally-owned coffee shops and this one is such a cute little place that I will def visit again. Of course I ordered a caramel latte (Starbucks girl here) and the barista nicely explained how they serve theirs and offered me something similar that tasted amazing! I ended up staying to read my book for about 3hrs as I was waiting for a friend to arrive to Chelsea. Really enjoyed doing so, nobody bothered me and though it would get a little loud at times because a group would walk in, the place is actually quite cozy.

Really good coffee and even better cookies!

Small little spot but i love the little benches outside. Super clean and chill staff

This cafe is definitely slept on! Loved their coffee, but their choc chip cookie was an absolute SHOWSTOPPER. gooey on the inside and crispy outsides.
The coffee shop is a little bit small, I want them to expand their location to a new and bigger one! I love this place and you should definitely try it. The barista's are so sweet and the general Vibe is a nice clean coffee shop with a surprisingly great cookie!

Got an iced latte for $5.99. It was fine but it didn't wow me and seemed very expensive. I personally prefer bluestone (milk tastes smoother). But I did like that the condiment bar inside had powdered cinnamon and liquid sweetener. They also had a good assortment of pastries including from Balthazar's.

Great spot for coffee if you're in the area! I got a cappuccino and a chocolate chip walnut cookie. I came at the perfect time because I saw them bringing out a fresh tray of cookies. The cappuccino was perfectly balanced and my cookie was super gooey and warm on the inside and perfectly crispy on the edges. Service was friendly. Not too much sit down space, but there's a few bar seats along the perimeter.

Solid coffees and cookies from Yanni's! I sought refuge in this coffee shop during an INCREDIBLY hot summer day. The iced vanilla latte with oat milk was refreshing and the cookie was sweet, but well balanced. The hefty cookie definitely surprised me with how tasty it was!

Great spot to grab a coffee and do some work!

Was looking for a spot to sit down and do a little work and came across this cafe. Their coffee was really good ( got an iced almond milk latte) and they had a lot of bar style seating with wifi and outlets. Seated is definitely limited so might be hard to snag a seat on the weekend or other busy times.

Only got coffee but they had a lot of tasty looking pastries if u want something to snack on as well!

My coffee maker died this morning so I decided to try this place because of all the good reviews.

All I can say is $4 for a medium sized coffee which is low on flavor and very acidic will keep me out of here.

I miss my Starbucks across the street which was a casualty of the pandemic.

My mind is boggled by the 5 star reviews here. I'm so glad my new coffee maker will be delivered tomorrow. Thanks, Amazon.

Was walking around nyc looking for a coffee shop and stumbled across this cute place! We opened the door and it IMMEDIATELY smelled like freshly baked cookies.  We got the iced latte and chocolate chip walnut cookie.  I am not usually a big walnut fan, but this cookie was delicious.

The best place for an Iced latte in all of Chelsea. If it weren't for the fact that they are usually closed by the I get out of work I'd be here everyday. It's probably for the best though haha. Not to mention that the house made cookies are some of the greatest... I'm not a sweets person but the oatmeal cookies are absolutely delicious!
Honestly best coffee I've had in a long long time in the city. Also those chocolate chip cookies are amazing

Been looking for a nearby place that matches Coffee Project for sheer quality and, based on the iced latte I had this morning, I think I've found it.  One sip and I thought: ah, that's where the 5 stars are coming from.  And as someone that uses the 7th Ave Line a fair bit, I have to say that them being right in the middle between 14th and 18th reeeally helps.  Good stuff.  Go here.

Hands down, a perfect mocha latte with almond milk, delivered quickly and with finesse.

It was about six or seven, which is of course too much to pay, but it's Chelsea and that's how much lattes cost in Chelsea.

Here, you get precisely what you pay for. I will be back the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
It's a very small cafe with little bar seatings. The coffee is decent and the cookie is the bomb.

I'll walk a mile for this coffee.

Yanni's coffee, in my opinion, is the best I've had in Manhattan in the years of living here. Their sourcing of the best quality coffee in Sey and their consistent attention to detail really shows in their product. The people that work there clearly take pride in what they make and are super friendly. I highly recommend you stop in.

Walked by this cafe and looked simple and good.

WOW.

The interior is nice and simple. The menu is also nice and simple. Prices are moderate for the area.

Staff are pretty friendly and very quick.

The chocolate walnut cookies ARE AMAZING. Baked in house and super fresh. Literally one of the best cookies I've EVER had.

The latte I had was pretty good too.

This place is so cute!!! Ok the coffee is great as well. I was living nearby for a month to explore the Chelsea area, and this place was a few min walk from my apt. The staff was always welcoming and never too long of a wait. Bonus if you like baked goods, their cookies looked amazing every time and smelled SO good! Too bad I was heading to workout after every time. Prices are normal for the area. Check it out!

Amazing coffee and cookies -- What could be better? This is my go-to coffee spot in Chelsea. They seem to switch out their coffee beans semi regularly and every kind has been great so far. In addition to coffee, they sell pastries from Balthazar and fresh cookies. I would highly recommend the vegan chocolate walnut cookie -- You wouldn't even know it's vegan.
i love yanni's! an awesome neighborhood spot that has delicious cookies and lattes. not a spot to really get work done as its pretty small but i love it a lot

Favorite coffee shop! Delicious coffee, Balthazar pastries, and homemade cookies- yum! Lovely and efficient staff. Small indoor space but beautifully designed and light-filled, 2 benches out front for extra seating.

This place is exactly what it says it is. Coffee  Cookies  Staff  The only problem when the place is limited seating, but I can see why they haven't expanded the seating to pre-pandemic levels. Go for the chocolate chip walnut cookies, and you won't care about the limited seating!
I did go back here, tried their decaf coffee and their cookies. The coffee was good, but the cookies were the real star of the show. Served warm, too!
Best coffee in the area. Great staff, and the pastries that they get are fantastic too
their cookies are to die for  I highly recommend their white chocolate oatmeal cookie.

The Quick : A quintessential New York City small local business. Yanni works almost every day (yes he's a real person) to provide incredible coffee and treats. It feels like a local community business because that's exactly what it is. Go soon, go often, and make sure to tip! It's an incredible spot that has taken every precaution to make sure we are safe during this crazy time.

PS the cold brew is my favorite! They have every type of non dairy vegan plant based milk alternative. Plus pastries from Balthazar!

The vegan chocolate chip walnut cookie is pretty dang good. Cute local coffee shop serving up solid  coffee, homemade cookies, and other pastries from Balthazar. I tried the flat white with oat milk and it was great.

I only get the Chai Latte with oat milk (hot or iced) here but it's seriously hard to find a good one! Good level of spice, the right level of sweetness, and a nice smooth mix. Cute spot inside although no indoor dining for now.

Stopped into this cozy new coffee spot for one of their cookies - homemade, thick, crispy, and doughy at the same time. An incredible and rare balance in a cookie. Also had an Americano which was smooth and a Chai Latte which was so sumptuous, with a cloud of foam at the top. It didn't have that synthetic over-gingered taste of most Chai's. I would definitely get it again.

Their white chocolate-oatmeal cookies are incredible - hearty, mountainous, like a filling breakfast treat that's sweet and addictive. And while I'm not even a fan of white chocolate, these have won me over! I could eat two in a row.

The owner Yanni is also such a kind, hard-working guy. He left the advertising industry to open his own coffee shop, and it's so great sitting at a table, watching crowds of people scooping up his delicious cookies and coffee. Risks are worth taking.

5 Stars!!!!!

I got an iced latte that was $5. The espresso taste didn't come through well through the milk, so I'd probably order something with less milk if I came again, but overall it was fine. It's pretty small inside but cute. There's seating for about 10 people with counter top style seating at the window. There's a decent amount of outlets and no bathroom sadly.
Favorite coffee spot in the city. Consistent, reliable, great atmosphere and reasonable cost for highest quality coffee. Best place!

not good!

I got a smushed/stuck croissant this morning and only realized it when I got home. Paying $5 for a quality croissant but this is not good.

I think you know who I am - so improve your service brother or more reviews are coming.
Best coffee I've ever had. I got a cold brew with almond milk. The coffee has a slight natural sweetness and fruitiness. Amazing

Yanni has been open and I'm grateful for it! The cold brew is amazing. I also recently had a chocolate chip walnut cookie, and it was excellent. Hopefully they'll be able to start stocking more pastries again soon as NYC slowly begins to open up!
the only bummer is that there is always a line! Delicious coffee, matcha and pastries. You can't go wrong. The baristas and staff are also very friendly.
FYI little to no seating (as with many NY coffee establishments. But decent coffee, if that's all you're looking for.

I LOVE this place. The coffee is always very good and made with care, but I dread the day when their cookies are on one of these asinine cable shows and the line stretches out the door and around the corner. Their cookies are that good.  They're better than that. I would say they are the best chocolate chip cookies in New York City. They have walnuts which most bakeries seem to have stopped for fear of some nut allergy lawsuit. But these are sooo good. And to their eternal credit, they never run out and they're always fresh and warm and chewy. Yanni has the good sense to keep baking throughout the day. Give these guys your money, just keep it under your hat and leave some cookies for the rest of us.
Best coffee in the area, independent coffee shop and they really know their craft and are super nice

So good! I came in here because of the reviews and was immediately welcomed by a gentleman who was pouring coffee with a smile.

The coffee was great -- not burnt tasting like Starbucks, which is right down the street. The vibe is more welcoming than your average coffee shop and the service is so friendly, which really puts it over the top for me.

I'll be back the next time I'm in New York!
Open 8-3 during Coronavirus NYC. Great coffee, even better cookies, and a wonderful staff!

Yanni's is an absolute GEM. A cute cosy little spot with lovely lattes and matchas. They have the most *incredible* house-made cookies (including vegan options), which are better than Levain in my opinion! If you're lucky you'll catch them them fresh out of the oven. And the staff is so sweet. There's also always an abundance of very good doggies. :)

Removing one star because after going to this place at least 50 times, and after ordering the exact same drink every single one of those times, and after seeing one of the exact same three baristas every single one of those times.... they still act like they've never seen me before and have no idea what I'm going to order.

Disappointing for a neighborhood place. But their matcha is still really good.
I love this place! The iced latte is my favorite and the cookies are amazing, especially since they are freshly baked. Great staff and friendly service!
a spot I keep going back to!! great coffee aaaand you need to get one of their warm cookies!! they have vegan ones too. only to go coffee but really the best coffee in Chelsea

My favorite coffee shop in the city. The inside is cozy and the coffee is amazing. I used to live right across the street and loved coming in mornings before work. I'm a little further away now but still enjoy going.

The coffee really is better than what you can get most places but the other thing that makes this place great is the friendly service. You can tell they really care about their shop and want people to be comfortable there. That's an unfortunate rarity in NYC and it's worth going here for that reason alone. The good news is they also have the best coffee in the neighborhood so there's really no reason to go anywhere else.

AMAZING COOKIES and great service from the barista. Highly recommend the iced black tea with their chocolate chip walnut cookie or the white chocolate oatmeal one.

Bright cafe with a few small tables - quiet enough to do work in and also for a quick catch up with a friend.

Stumbled upon this cute coffee shop on my way to work. I ordered a latte that came with pretty latte art and the coffee was so smooth. They also serve Balthazar pastries , yay for almond croissants! It would be a good place to grab coffee and catch up with a friend!

Fantastic little coffee shop on 7th Avenue.

I was en route to a meeting and needed a quick jolt. Yanni's could have seriously been a Pret a Manger or Dunkin' Donuts--I was running late and didn't have time to traverse all over town for a third wave cup of coffee. I just needed something even remotely resembling coffee to get be back on track from an afternoon fog. But boy was I lucky that the closest possible place for a caffeine kick was this lovely cafe.

It's bright, welcoming, charming, and has a killer selection of coffee drinks and pastries. They get their croissants and such from Balthazar, but they're very proud of the cookies baked themselves on-premise. After some internal dialog telling myself I shouldn't be eating a cookie at 2pm on a weekday, the fact that the staff were so proud of their own baked goods made me break down and try one. I was happy I did, because the walnut // chocolate chip variety was really tasty. I've tried some of the more famous cookies this city has to offer (Maman's, Levain, etc...) and this wasn't far off. Well done, gents.

I don't live anywhere near this place, but if I were in the area again I'd happily pop in for a second go 'round.
Food is good. Staff are friendly. Try the Singapore Mei fon. It's delicious. The shrimp with lobster sauce is also very good.

Got the basics, some hits, some misses, but for a takeout chinese it is very cheap, which is why it gets 2 stars.

The dumplings were too doughy.  The bananas were actually dried not sweet plantains, which some people like, we don't.  

The bean curd and vegetable soup didn't have good vegetables, only broccoli and carrots; the tofu was broken up instead of cubed as it should be.

On the good side, the general Tso chicken was good enough, and the lunch special was cheap.

The chicken in the chicken and broccoli was meh.

Food arrived on time but the delivery man was exceptionally rude especially after delivering at the wrong address. Not only was he located at the wrong place, he had an attitude because he believed I didn't tip him enough (20%). The rice and broccoli was great, as for your delivery man, he wasn't as good.

Drinks (3/5): Got the mango yogurt with purple rice. It was quite sour and not sweet. I also didn't really enjoy the texture. Overall a bit subpar. I was expecting more mango flavor.

Service (3/5): There is a tablet to order and they didn't really greet us. We had an issue where they lost our order and wasn't sure which one it was. They also didn't give us a receipt which increased the confusion. Fortunately we got the order eventually.

Ambiance (4/5): It's connected to a hotpot place and has a nice seating and waiting area. Seats were comfy and the place had good music playing in the background.

I've been wanting to try the purple rice and yogurt drink from Yomie's for a while now but each time I had walked past it looked closed. I think the stand is a bit deceiving because the lights and the TV screen menus aren't turned on but the shop is open and the people working there will give you a menu to order from when you walk in. I finally decided to walk in last week and got the purple rice yogurt drink and it was so delicious! It tasted like purple sticky rice, yogurt, and ice blended together. It was a thick smoothie like texture with a perfect blend of sweet and tart. The woman working there was also very nice and she was very quick with my order! I will be back for sure!

Ordered the barley yogurt which I often ordered at the flushing location. Very very little barley compared to the Flushing store and very liquidy yogurt. Unsure why there is such a difference.
There is also many large pieces of what might be barley husk in the yogurt that's very hard and fibrous. This I didn't see in the one I had in Flushing.
