I'm so glad to find that they sell vegan onigiri. They have 3 vegan flavors, spare ribs, gongbao, and ginger chicken. Tried all of them with Pogibear and loved every single one of them. My favorite is gongbao and for him, it was spare ribs. Both affordable and delicious. Last time I went they packed our onigiris in this cute eco friendly reusable bags. So yay for that.

Yayas has been a bubble tea favorite of mine for years! So many options of bubble tea to choose from and different add ins as well! The prices are also pretty great compared to others bubble tea spots. I always get a bubble tea with lychee pop and a shrimp tempura rice ball!

I only got fruit teas here until I realized they had VEGAN onigiri! Whaaat?! I tried all 3 of their veg meat onigiri. I would say the Gong Bao is my favorite (most flavorful) followed shortly by the Ginger Chicken, and lastly the Citrus Spare Rib. All of them were a bit light on the veg meat and rice heavy but the small size is bigger than I thought and I was pretty satisfied.

I used get the Boyfriend here all the time and sometimes the I Love Yaya (both delicious). The drinks come with a small note at the bottom of the cup like what you get in fortune cookies. It's pretty cute.

COVID time assessment: no outdoor seating but you can go across the street to the park.

Yaya is known for their onigiri- rice balls. My favorite is the shrimp and the japanese- it has seaweed, eggs, and imitation crab meat. $4.50 for large and if you check in you get a small container of spicy mayo. It taste  really good and fresh. The spicy mayo is not spicy at all and it taste amazing on the rice balls.

Customer service is ok. Not so friendly but fast service.

The drinks on the other hand is absolutely terrible. It is overly sweet and taste very artificial. First love was too sweet and tasted bad.

Milk tea is nearly flavorless and tastes watered down.

We got matcha latte and Thai milk tea, both half sweet. Both were completely unsweet, and hardly tasted of tea. After asking for no ice, I was instead given one with ice, and after asking them to remake it all they did was pass it through a strainer.

This place is just bad. Please just go to Kung Fu Tea.

I've been here twice - once it was super crowded and hard to enjoy the experience on site. Second time, it was dead empty. Just us and our stroller and kids. Finally got to experience what Yaya is all about.

Hubby decided to swing by here on a cold day as our toddler was hungry. Stroller and kid friendly during off-peak hours (when you're able to find a seat).

Salmon rice ball - delicious. Great seasoning and crisp seaweed. Love the packaging. So smart! I believe we also got the seaweed salad rice ball which was packed with ingredients and flavorful!

Peach tea drink - so yummy. Jelly was perfect with this.

Taro bubble tea - just the right sweetness and the tapioca was done right. They also have quotes taped underneath your beverage for your reading pleasure.

Big fan of this place and can't wait to come back to try the other rice balls.

Small but cool shop everyone here was social distancing. Know for their Boba teas with cute names I came here for the Rice Rolls. My favorite has been the Tempura Shrimp and Crabmeat rolls. They were delicious and quite filling. They separate the seaweed wrapper so it's crispy when you wrap your roll. They come in small or large sizes I opt for large and they are winners.
They have a bunch of Asian snacks on the wall to pick while you wait.

I keep coming back for more!! This place has the cutest reusable bottles. I didn't like the tea that I had to order for the bottle but whatever (no hot teas) . Their rice balls are so delicious and they change up the flavours. So yummy.

They also sell imported snacks from Asia. Got a cute photo op background too.

Totally wish they had a restroom.

Just got my order from the delivery guy and it turns out one of the cup was damaged so the drink leaked all into the bag. Unsure if it the delivery guy or the guys at yaya , because the delivery guy didn't even notice anything was wrong. The rest of the food was in good shape so I guess it fine.
LOVE THIS PLACE. My favorite: boyfriend, I love yaya, first car, and first kiss hahaha EVERYTHING IS GOOD

I lovvvveeee this place. I used to come here in HS all the time, so to see this place still up and running literally almost made me cry. The woman who owns this store is still working here (of course) and let me take a moment to collect myself while I had several flashbacks and got to look around at the new renovations. I ordered two small shrimp tempura rolls and chicken yakisoba noodles w/ a small Thai milk bubble tea. Everything tasted exactly as I remember, I was so happy with my order. Great customer service as always, food was nice and hot, and I even got suggestions on what to try when I come back. If you love rice rolls and some good stir fry noodles, this place is definitely worth of a try.

The place where pop singer Lady Yaya always goes to hang out when she's in Manhattan. She has a "Bad Romance" with one of the employees, and she doesn't blame any of the teas for being substandard because baby they were "Brewed This Way."

Named after the Manchester City Legend, his bubble tea shop is nothing to amazingly special although it's very original and very popular.

I do like the elaborate drink known as the  blue blood, which is the best bet on a menu that is all about fruit, without really good milk tea options. The Blue Blood is not too sweet, and nice and cheap, especially for Manhattan. However, it has awful hard tapioca pearls, so for that alone I can't give 5 stars.

The coolest thing about this place is definitely the names of all the drinks. It's just so much fun.

Been a yaya customer ever since they've opened - nearly 8 years now!

Their rice balls/onigiri's are always good and the tea's have been good all these years.

Recently I've been ordering via seamless to my office in chinatown while working late nights and almost every time the order has been late. Late as in the delivery time being pushed back 15 - 20 mins. The yakisoba definitely downgraded over the years. I remember when I first tried it, it was great. I ordered it last night and not all of it was cooked..

I will stick to the rice ball and drinks!

Came here for a drink because Kung Fu Tea down the road wasn't open. To my surprise, this store was really cute. I got the lychee tree drink, which is a white tea. There are photos of the drinks on the wall so that you can see what they look like before you order. I also ordered shumai. It was fried and came with 5 pieces. Probably not the best shumai you can find in the Chinatown area. I asked the cashier what flavors she recommended since I hadn't been there before. I also got a small order of their spam, Yaya chicken, and Yaya onigiri riceballs. The Yaya flavored was my favorite. It contains seaweed and mayo. I like that the packaging is so thoughtful. The seaweed is seperated from the rice until you're ready to eat it so that the seaweed mains crunchy and fresh. Will definitely be going back to try more flavors!
My go-to every time I'm in Soho. I usually order two small or large shrimp tempura onigiri (around $7)!!

Their onigiri/rice balls are good.

Faves are the shrimp, Japanese, and salmon rice balls. Don't bother getting a large over a small. Get the spicy mayo.

There's a wide variety of fruit teas to choose from on the menu at Yaya Tea. I wanted to try them all! I don't remember the name of the tea I ordered, I just remember it being very fruity and refreshing! The cups they use for the small drinks are so cute! I love cute packaging!

Cash only! Make sure you bring cash.
The food is SO DELICIOUS, MUST TRY!
I ordered chicken congee, and my friends ordered shrimp rice roll and dough (you tiao rice roll). We were amazed by the congee- the chicken was so so so tender and never had I ever eaten chicken this tender. All of us were 'fighting' to get more spoon of this delicious congee...

My friend and I stopped by for a warm and simple dinner on a brisk night. It was warm and lively inside, and there was space for us to sit right away! The service was attentive and quick. We tried the pork and shrimp as well as the chicken with mushroom rice rolls. The food came out fast, and it was tasty! The rice roll had a nice smooth texture, and meat was well cooked. It seems like the food is meant to be be pretty simple and unseasoned, so we relied heavily on the sriracha and the soy sauce. Of note - peanut sauce is not included, and costs extra. We didn't realize this until it was too late!

Overall, great sit-down spot for some rice rolls!

Revisiting after a long absence. They have renovated- got rid of the ramp and put in more tables. There is a cute mural.

I ordered a congee and a dry shrimp rice roll. I finished my congee and was about to get the check before the rice roll was served. It took about 30 minutes  to make. Not sure what happened in the kitchen.

The weirdest thing happened when I went to restroom after my meal.  While away, they gave away my table.  They also took away everything away, including the check.  New patrons were seated.  This has never happened to me before in my life.

The bathroom, I always believe, says a lot. Theirs is unattended. The trash bin was overflowing. There are large puddles around the toilet. Not sure if that's water or something else. Not a very appetizing sight.

Unlike most restaurants in Chinatown, they do not offer hot tea. You had to pay for a cup of hot tea, if you desire.

Authentic Cantonese breakfast store with good selection of porridges and their specialty hand crafted rice rolls. The prices were all very reasonable. The service was friendly and helpful with spacious seating.

Tips: if you are an egg lover, get an egg with the rice roll if your choice. It is like a light omelette with the rice roll wrapped within a thin layer of egg. Very unique.

Tips: with porridge, get a fried dough stick in the appetizer section. It's great in the porridge (congee), dipped into porridge, or just eat by itself. I dipped using the sauce from the rice roll and loved it.

The waitress recommended Cantonese milk tea, we ordered with condensed milk and half sweet, it was excellent.

Great spot for a light lunch! My boyfriend and I easily got a table at noon on a Sunday and tried:

+ Hong Kong milk tea (cold) - great
+ Sliced pork and preserve egg congee - great
+ Beef and shrimp with chives rice roll - you can definitely get a better rice roll elsewhere, but the beef was super tasty  
+ HK style curry fish balls - great

Overall, a good choice if you need a quick sitdown place in the area.

This place is known for its rice rolls, but the congee dish arrived first and I knew I couldn't eat both! So I cancelled the rice rolls and will try next time. The server was very understanding. Fast service but remember it's cash only!

I ordered the lai wan congee, which is an assortment of fish filet, meat, octopus, pork skin, and topped with shredded eggs, peanuts, cilantro. On the side is deep fried fish skin. Super crispy and flavorful. They give you a lot!

The restaurant itself appears clean. Kinda small so expect a wait if you're going on the weekends.

Cash only. We had the seafood congee, fried dough, deep fried fish skin, beef rice roll, shrimp rice roll & deep fried steamed buns with sweet icing. The congee was packed with shrimp, green mussels & squid. The beef inside the rice rolls were slices of very tender meat, shrimp inside rile rolls were large & perfectly tender. We enjoyed the sticky rice, well seasoned with plenty of meat & Chinese sausage. So good. The portions were generous- it was a huge mountain of crispy fish skin.

Recently got Yin Ji Chang Fen in flushing. This place is very brightly decorated with modern furniture and decor. It's not a huge restaurant but there is a decent amount of seating. We got seated right away and were able to place our order pretty quickly.

We got one of their congee dishes, the curry appetizer, their shrimp rice roll as well as their stir fried noodles. I also got a drink that was basically red bean slushee. The red bean slushee was very refreshing and sweet but not too sweet. I really liked the curry appetizer as well and it went well with the noodles. The noodles were dry noodles so dipping it in the curry sauce was the perfect combination. For the curry appetizer I just wished that the appetizer had more fish balls and less of the tripe type protein. The congee came is such a big portion and was so comforting - definitely a great bang for buck. As for the rice roll, this was the star of the show. The texture of the rice rolls were great and the shrimp was plump and delicious.

Overall they had a lot of good food and I will definitely be back to try more!

Came here with my boyfriend for a light meal and this place didn't disappoint! For drink, I got the Hong Kong style milk tea and he got the Hong Kong style coffee and tea. For food, we got the dough stick rice noodle roll and curry combo to share. The curry combo is supposed to be fishball, squid, and pig skin and since we both don't really eat pig skin, I just asked for the fishball and squid.

I was raised in Hong Kong and I would say both the drinks and food here tasted very authentic! The flavor of the curry was exactly what I was craving for and the dough stick rice noodle roll tasted very fresh! The fried dough was still crispy and I like the soy sauce that they used! I believe they cooked it with additional seasonings to infuse more flavors into the soy sauce. The milk tea tasted just like the one that I had in Hong Kong! Very smooth and not too sweet. They also didn't put any ice in it so that it doesn't get diluted by the ice. I just wish the drink would be a littler colder.

Total of this meal came out to be around $35 including tips. A little more expensive than other small shops in Chinatown but it was worth it! Just as a reminder, this place is CASH ONLY! Will definitely come back in the future!

Stumbled upon this place months ago when I visited NY. We followed the line and bookmarked this after eating. It was a must when we came back to NY. This time brought my family.

Food - excellent. Porridge was so tasty. Rice rolls are a must. Don't leave without trying some.

Milk tea - yummy!!!!  Haven't found good milk tea in a long time.

I came for the hot soy milk and I was not disappointed! I wish I could get a bigger cup though. Aside from the soy milk, I also ordered the beef & shrimp rice roll, and that was pretty good. Order came out pretty quickly and the price was reasonable. I would definitely come back again to try more and maybe even add a star. Things got confusing because I was redirected on places to sit a couple times, but servers were friendly still.

Make sure to bring cash because they are cash only. And don't forget to tip...to avoid an awkward interaction..

Finally got around to dining in here when the wait was too long down the street at KST. Got to try a bit more from their menu (compared to when I got takeout 3 yrs ago) and I was probably a biiit more impressed this time, but have to say their namesake rice rolls were still disappointing for the most part. We got the bbq pork w/ chives ($7.95) again, as well as the sliced fish ($7.95) and the rice noodle was just too delicate/soft. It was impossible to pick up and all the ingredients just fell apart when eating. You can definitely find better quality rolls elsewhere in Chinatown!

But onto the good: HK style milk tea ($5.25), curry fish balls ($7.50), sticky rice wrap ($4.95) and the *peanut sauce* rice noodle rolls ($7.95). Because the peanut sauce ones don't have a filling, the rice noodle has the perfect texture and doesn't fall apart. The fish balls are so fresh and bouncy - excellent quality & flavor! We wanted to try the congee, but it was too hot of a day. Maybe another time.

Came here for breakfast! I got a good selection of food, and all of it was delicious. They came out with the Shredded Pork and Preserved Egg Congee first. The rice was smaller grain, very warm and comforting. I also got the You Tiao, which didn't come as a full stick. They cut into smaller pieces and was fried extra crunchy, which was not how I expected it to come out. However, I was able to soak in the congee and soy milk.

Everything came out super fast expect for the rice rolls. We had to check with the staff several times before we got our order of Peanut Rice Roll and the Beef and Shrimp Rice Roll. Despite the mishap, it was worth waiting, the rice roll was the perfect texture.

Note: Make sure to bring cash.

Really enjoyed the rice noodle rolls here! They have a really thin wrapping and a great bouncy texture. We tried the shrimp and beef with chives and secret peanut sauce rice rolls and both were great. I thought I wouldn't like the peanut sauce ones as much because they don't have any filling, but it honestly didn't need any. The sauce was really nutty and savory, and coated the ride rolls perfectly. Besides rice rolls, they also serve congee, which I definitely want to try next time.

This is a pretty popular restaurant, and we waited for around 30 minutes for a table at 3 PM on a Saturday, so I'd definitely recommend coming during off peak hours if possible!

A friend brought me here a few months ago. I thought it was pretty good and ever since I've been here like 4-5 times

Super convenient for when you and your friends are in Chinatown but you don't feel like blowing a budget and need something casual but delicious and authentic

True to a HK style cafe - we love love love the HK Style Milk Teas (my favorite is with condensed milk). Perfect middle between not bubble tea but hot and not coffee haha. We also tried the regular and with Ovaltine- both are great!

Also can't go wrong with the rice rolls or congee. I love shocking some non Chinese friends with the preserved egg congee. Everyone can agree any of these congees are delicious and comforting

On the rice rolls side, the only one I wouldn't  recommend is the corn rice roll. Something about the amount of corn and the rice roll makes this item keep falling apart. For meat lovers, the roast duck rice roll is a MUST. Sightly sweet, really exciting. For vegetarians - the veggie rice roll was better than some of the other non meat rolls. It's packed with spinach and different kinds of veggies

I also recommend trying the butter toast. Not pictured but you'd be surprised how well condensed milk goes with this bread without being overwhelming!

This is one of my favorite rice roll restaurant in Chinatown. Their meals are filling. I love that their portions are big and the prices are reasonable. The service is okay. They come clean up after each customer. They disinfect the tables before being new customers to the tables. The wait is usually 5-10 minutes. Oh the place is CASH ONLY. That's the only downside about it.

Got really lucky and came when there was no wait. Really great congee and rice rolls - my favorite was the pork liver congee and the special peanut sauce rice rolls. Servers were nice and all speak Cantonese :)

Everything was very tasty, but I probably wouldn't get the dough rice roll again because the dough texture gets soggy. I preferred it on its own.

Waited around 15 mins for a party of 3 on a Sunday morning. There is free wifi and the place had a low key modern type of vibe. The rice noodles were all delicious and fresh! Prices were average (~$7 per dish) as rice roll plates are close to that price at dimsum restaurant nowadays. We got the fried dough, beef with shrimp, roast pork, shrimp, and special peanut sauce rice rolls. My favorite was the beef with shrimp as they didn't skimp on the filling and there were chunks of beef in it. The rice rolls were all thin, silky, and chewy! The Lai Wan congee was sooo good, my friend said it's the best congee she's had. There were pieces of fish, meat, squid, and pig skin in it. I would pass on the drinks though and this place is CASH ONLY, hence why I took a star away. I got the HK milk tea with coffee, it took a while to come compared to the food and it was just meh for the price.

Came here on accident but don't regret it lol

Ordered about almost all the different types of rice noodle rolls... from original to savory to sweet. 10/10 bro the servers are so quick with it and we didn't have to wait at all. Just wished it was open later to satisfy my night cravings booo

*Cash Only!

It only took me 3 years to finally try this place and I was disappointed. I was craving some good rice rolls and went all the way to Chinatown for it as I remembered this spot is based off a popular business in China. The prices are higher for rice rolls but you also get a hefty portion. I got the beef rice roll and the pork and shrimp rice roll. The flavors and ratio were off. I ended up not finishing my order.  Service was not attentive and the extra wait time was not necessary if they're just standing around instead of expediting orders. I'll stick to other spots in the area.

I remember coming here around when the place first opened and it took forever for the rice rolls to come out so I was so happy to see that it was on the emptier side (it was a 5pm on a Tuesday tho).

We were catered to right away and ordered 4 rice rolls for the table and came out pretty quickly.

I got the pork and shrimp rice roll which I loved. The texture was so perfect and loved the content with the sauce. We also got the dough rice rolls to share and although it was good, I wished they cut the roll more properly. It was hard to split the rice roll when they were half cut. Only other thing is that I wished they provided water for the table. Other than that we had a very pleasant experience and would return again!

Note the place is cash only!!!

We were on a trek to find some good rice rolls (cheung fun) and wanted to try Tonii's right next door but it was closed for whatever reason so we ventured into Yin Ji.

Browsing through the menu, we noticed this joint mainly served congee and rice rolls, a good sign since they had limited specialties!

We ordered the classic shrimp roll and beef roll and curry fishballs. When the rice rolls came, a visual inspection of the dish got me thinking it wasn't going to be amazing. It didn't look silky smooth or translucent, the rolls were thicker than I was expecting too.

I popped a bite into my mouth and the visual inspection confirmed my suspicions. The rolls aren't bad by any means, but it was a super average, not one that I'd be willing to pay for again.

It was pretty disappointing because it was our first meal during our visit to NY and we expected something amazing, which Yin Ji wasn't.

Affordable, cash only establishment that has a bathroom and good AC! We were seated pretty quickly, but the service was a little slow. I got the curry combo, shrimp and chive rice rolls, and the rice rolls with fried dough in it. The curry combo was alright - pretty spicy and had a strong curry flavor and good portion size, but I got tired of eating it after a bit. The shrimp and chive rice roll was a little bland and broke apart because it was a bit soggy. The fried dough one was my favorite - had great flavor and texture. I think I'll try a different place for rice rolls next time.

Welcome to Yin Ji Chang Fen Rice Roll! This cozy little joint is a corner gem for those seeking authentic Chinese breakfast cuisine.

Let's start with the Slice Pork and Preserved Egg Congee. This savory and warming dish was the perfect comfort food for a chilly day. The consistency of the congee was spot on - not too thick, not too thin - and the preserved egg was just the right amount of flavor without overpowering the dish. I give it a solid "Good and will eat again."

Next up, we have the Condensed Milk and Butter Toast. This classic bread dish brings back childhood memories and was executed well, although the bread could have been toasted a bit more. But let's be honest, the amount of condensed milk on that toast was so generous that it was practically dripping with sweetness. Definitely "Good and will eat again."

Now for the Fried Dough Chang Fen/Rice Noodle. Unfortunately, I received this dish last and it was a bit disappointing. The fried dough was soggy and tasted like over fried oil. But hey, it happens - especially later in the afternoon. I might try another Chang Fen next time. My review  "Might try another one."

Overall, Yin Ji Chang Fen Rice Roll is a great spot for some delicious and authentic Chinese breakfast cuisine. . Just be sure to come early to avoid the crowds!

Sit down (take out too), squeaky clean, cash only rice noodle raving spot  

Pork and shrimp w chives rice roll ~$7.95 6.5/10
-more like a rice roll envelope instead of the ribbons of rice rolls I usually like. makes it a lil harder to enjoy while you tear thru the not so velvety rice roll
-missing the womb I combo peanut sauce and chili sauce and hoisin sauce
-love the lettuce and chives and shrimp, the pork was chunky bigger pieces and I just personally like dicier teenier bits of pork

But gorg, clean, peaceful space unlike other no frills places in Chinatown (which I don't mind and I think may have some yummier rice rolls)

Really fabulous..who knew that rice rolls could be a vessel for so many fillings ? 7-9 dollars a piece, well filled and delicious.
Sure, dim sum offers a shrimp or cruller or meat filling but this was a creative variety of many meat/veggie adds.
Great concept, loved it !

I remember when this place first opened, there would be a line around the block.  We happened to be in the area and noticed that there was a short line, so we decided to give it a try.  The service was very slow, but I guess that's expected in Chinatown.  

Inside the restaurant, it was very open, but for some reason it still felt cramped.  Maybe it's the way they set the tables up and you're literally sitting next to another table with 5-6" of gap in between each table.  

We ordered the Shrimp Rice Noodles, Cilantro Rice Noodles, fried dough stick, and the Mushroom and Chicken Congee.  The food was pretty average, nothing special.  My bf said the rice noodles at dimsum are better than the ones we got here and I agree.  The congee was okay, definitely lacking in flavor.  We ordered 4 items and the total was around 30 bucks.  Which wasn't a lot, but we could have gotten a lot more food for 30 dollars at a dimsum spot...

I guess this place was okay; definitely not the best.  Can be a nice introduction to rice noodles, but you should just go to any dim sum restaurant in Chinatown and get better food and experience.

Just as good as last time! Delicious and savory food that didn't feel heavy afterwards but as filling. Service was okay, but I don't come to rate service. Lively place, quick and busy like the rest of New York!

Finally popped in to check out their rice rolls. The place is immaculate & the staff smiling & efficient.

Today I tried their corn filled as well as the shrimp & pork. The rice roll skins are thin & delicate. The filling are ample and the pork & shrimp included tended cabbage as well. Both orders lacked seasoning but every table is outfitted with ground white pepper, salt and sriracha. So...you can season to your liking. The pork was so velvety tender I thought it was chicken!!! The servings are quite ample and at just under $8 a plate, two can order 2 or 3 rice roll plates and be quite satisfied for under $25.

Normally the place is quite crowded but on this Monday, at 2pm, it was only 1/2 full. Perfect timing.

Definitely worth a visit...but not if you have to wait, there are just too many nearby options.

Food: Super plentiful rice rolls in each order (about $9 per order). On the more expensive side compared to other rice roll establishments in Chinatown but it was definitely still worth it to share amongst friends during our food crawl. Lots of shrimp and cabbage filling!

Ambiance/Service: There were a lot of customers dining in and they have abundant indoor seating. Several workers were available as well which I assume make the line move super efficiently. We waited only 5 min for our to-go order to be ready and happily ate in while walking around Chinatown. Service was super quick and efficient.

I had been wanting to try this place for the longest time after it opened up but the line was just too long and I am too impatient.

Upon trying this place I thought it was quite pricey but the portions are quite big.  I found the rice rolls actually live up to its name since it is quite yummy. I was not used to having Lettuce in my rice rolls but it did not throw me off too much.

Same for the congee, I am not used to having lettuce in it but it didn't throw me off. They don't hold back at all and put a lot of ingredients into the congee.

The soymilk drink tastes just like the one from Kong Kee so it wasn't any special for its price.

The hk style milk tea is not bad, similar to s.wan.

I like their ovultine. I hadn't had that in ages! --Since my elementary days so it tasted especially good to me

I was craving some rice rolls and this place really hit the spot!! I think they are a pretty famous chain/restaurant in Guangdong, China and this location is their first US location? Their rice rolls with dried shrimp (虾米肠) were super soft and well-seasoned with a generous addition of the dried shrimp/scallion bits. Loved the amount and taste of the slightly sweet soy sauce. The mixed sauce rice rolls (混酱猪肠粉) were also very yummy! It comes with their secret mixed sauce on the side which is composed of hoisin/sweet sauce and peanut sauce. Although I prefer a higher peanut sauce to hoisin sauce ratio, it still turned out really flavorful. The rice rolls again were super soft and chewy. Their 艇仔粥 (congee with a bunch of mixed ingredients) was also very solid but I like my congee more pepper-y.
Its not a glamorous shop but their food does slap! Had to wait a little on a weekend but service was quick and food came fast! Definitely coming back whenever I crave rice rolls!

I love cheng fun (steamed rice noodle) and can have it any time of the day. It's mainly eaten for breakfast or brunch.

The cheng fun is legit here with many options and add-on. The HK style half coffee/milk tea taste like the one I had in Hong Kong.

The Congee is soft and smooth. We also got the fried fish skin to try, which was very crunchy. I don't see this dish at many restaurants.

The service is quick and there is a line by the time we were done with the meal. Highly recommended when you are in Chinatown.

This place is so clean and unique. Great vibe. Food is delicious and service is warm. I would recommend this place if yours walking down Chinatown. We ordered a chicken mushroom rice roll which costed less than $6 plus tip.

Well well well.

This is one of those "hits the spot" / "scratches an itch" types of places. We did stray away from our regularly scheduled program and got the black truffle rice roll. My companion didn't really like it so I finished it and we ordered a do over with something else which i also had to (gladly) eat most of because she was full. I'd do this again.

This restaurant is actually part of a chain originally from China, so it's not surprising that it is an authentic spot for rice rolls and congee. I got a Beef and Pork Rice roll (R5), which came as one super thick roll that was also loaded with cabbage. This was a bit surprising since most rice rolls I've had come in a couple smaller rolls and less cabbage, but I think this varies by regional style. The meat was tender and the rice rolls were fresh, but the sauce that the roll was bathing in was too salty. I tried both the Crunchy carp congee and a signature seafood congee. These came in generous portion sizes and I especially like the carp congee.

The biggest issue with this place was that they forgot my order. I came in a midsize group and somehow they forgot to make my order even though the server wrote it down. I ended up flagging the issue ~20 minutes in and then they made it for me after double checking. This place is a bit more expensive than neighboring Chinatown joints but still a good deal compared to greater Manhattan prices.

Consider coming here for breakfast. At least that's what we did. We were seated here fairly quickly. The place is casual and can get a little loud. You're not sitting too far from the next table as I was able to hear the lady sitting near me her comments about me taking photos when I had yet to take photos and was just on my phone. When we made the order the drinks arrived not too long after. We had HK milk tea and Fresh Hot Soy Milk. Highly recommend both. We also ordered congee, rice rolls (we had both the sweet and savory) , and Deep Fried Steam Bun with condensed milk. All of it was so delicious and I will definitely come back for more.

Stopped in for lunch and was happy I did! The food and service are great, and the place is very clean and welcoming!

You can create a custom rice roll. It comes LOADED and more than enough for one person. I ordered the shrimp and beef rice roll and added a few things and the special seafood congee. I've always ordered a warm soy milk since it was chilly out and a red bean dessert to end on a sweet note.

The rice roll was delicious, loaded, and filling! The congee was okay, I wasn't impressed especially for something that they're known for.

The warm soy milk was so comforting, and the red bean dessert was really great!

I definitely would return here in the future!

This is possible one of the best rice noodle place in NYC. Can't go wrong here.

Favs: anything with chives + shrimp

Drinks: do yourself a favor and get the HK milk tea. It will warm your heart in the cold winter. The tea is stronger than your typical milk tea.

While in the area for an event, I saw this across the street and had to go and try it out.  Even though rice rolls have been around for ages (hello dim sum and Cantonese breakfast spots) they've become more popularized in recent years and I'd say are almost trendy.  Of the locations I've tried that only serve rice rolls, Joe's Steam Rice Rolls is my top favorite.

Upon some initial research I discovered this is a chain from Asia so I wanted to see how they compared to Joe's!  This location was cash only and my sister and I arrived close to closing.  Luckily this meant there wasn't much of a wait and they brought the food out not too long after we ordered.

We ordered two rice rolls: the beef and shrimp with chives rice roll and the beef with chives rice roll.  Compared to other rice rolls I've had, this was on the chunkier side and it was wetter.  While that might sound like a weird way to describe it felt a little mushier in some parts though it was cooked.  The filling was tasty and there was a decent amount of it.  I may just be used to my thinner rice rolls so I'd be willing to give some of their other options a try.  This is a good spot for a quick bite, snack or Chinese breakfast!  I saw they have congee as well which I didn't sample this time but would order it next time.

FOOD
The ultimate comfort food! I always say when you go to a cash-only establishment in Chinatown, you know it has to be extra good.

Chang fen is a quintessential breakfast food in Guangdong (southern province in China). If you have never tried it, you must at least have it once in your life! The top layer of the Chang Fen (can think of it as broad-based noodle) is thin and translucent. There are a dozen choices for fillings - shrimp and barbecue pork is a classic. I like the beef option as well. Once you take a bite, you will for sure enjoy the explosion of flavors in your mouth! I like my chang fen with a little spicy kick so I sometimes put a little hot sauce on it. Whenever I'm in Chinatown, I try to stop by Yin Ji for a quick meal that always leaves me satisfied for weeks after.

They also have iced HK milk tea so I always order that. Along with some good steamy congee (thousand year egg and pork is my go to).

SERVICE
Quick, efficient and courteous.

AMBIANCE
Cozy, bright, and clean

I waited around 20 minutes to get seated inside. The food was okay, this place is known for their rice noodle rolls but I personally liked the congee better than the rice noodles. The peanut sauce rice noodle tasted good at first but after a while the flavor is too much. The beef and shrimp rice noodle was okay, there wasn't anything special for it, especially with the price you are paying. I wouldn't recommend the truffle mushroom rice noodle, I think it's overpriced and there's not much flavor or mushrooms in the filling.

(Overall: 83% | B) - I found the atmosphere to be a bit hot and undesirable, and talking to the workers there is equally unpleasant, but the food is good and takeout is well worth.

(Beef Cheung Fun: 97.5% | A & Shrimp Cheung Fun: 97.5% | A) - These rice crepes are perfectly made, and reminds me of my childhood in Guangzhou -- the noodle is silky and thin, there is a plentitude of tender beef and flavored shrimp, paired with crunchy romaine, and topped with a soy that has enough sweetness and saltiness that makes this dish heaven. If the presentation were improved, this dish would be perfect. Highly recommend everyone to try these dishes, it is fantastic.

(Pig Blood Congee: 85% | B) - The pig blood is nicely textured to be firm on the outside, yet somewhat soft on the inside. Although, this is far from American food, I think it highlights the uniqueness of such ingredients. The only thing I wished besides improving the presentation is for the congee to be seasoned more aggressively.

(Pork and Century Egg Congee: 87.5% | B) - Century egg is another ingredient that is mainly popular in Chinese cuisine. Its adds a distinct flavor that pairs well with some salty congee and tender pork to help someone sick get through it; the herbs add a nice kick as well. The presentation remains bare though.

(Street Style Cheung Fun - 92.5% | A) - The street style rice crepe has phenomenal texture as with the rest of the cheung fun, and has a good seasoning palette, mixing sesame, peanut, and hoisin.

(Crispy Donut Cheung Fun - 80% | B) - Not pictured is a crispy donut rice crepe, which has good texture individually, but I think would work better with more than just soy sauce to elevate the dish.

Came in to eat almost was ready to order until we saw the cash only part now we were gonna go grab cash and come back as we were really excited to try the place but with pos people like this nope.

I told our server that we dont have cash right now and we just saw cash only signs he was cool with that, my gf headed out and was gonna grab cash and me who really needed to use the restroom was waiting in the line to use restroom(now I understand restroom for customers only policy) and our server was totally cool with me using the restroom this other total moron comes and asks me if I have a to go order to which I said no and he then proceeded to tell me that I cant use the restroom in the most demeaning way possible and in all this our server who knew everything had no issues. But we didnt go back and wont with such stupid people.

After going through bunch of reviews and the response of owner I can understand the bad service part, not only they dont care they dont own upto anything they just keep bashing the customer for being wrong. So makes sense that the staff is equally bad.

Super delicious snack to prepare for a day of browsing the streets. Some day I'd like to eat in, but we only had time to quickly stop by. Can't say much about their other food, but their chang fen is soft, fresh, and delicious.

There's unfortunately nowhere inside to wait so you have to stand outside in the cold. So make sure you're dressed warmly. It takes them a decent amount of time to cook too.

Quite possibly the best cheng fun spot I've encountered in New York Chinatown.

We got seated almost immediately when we walked in and ordered the Hong Kong style milk tea, the pei dan (thousand year old egg) jook, and two cheng fun. We ordered the shrimp cheng fun and the beef.

Everything was a 5/5. The jook was amazing. The cheng fun (rice rolls) is a must. The sweet soy sauce on top of it pulls everything together.  What's different about this place is that they out lettuce and veggies in their rolls. Diff from many other places.

Yum!! Can't wait to come back.

Silky rice rolls filled with toppings - we got shrimp and a beef and shrimp and they came pretty quickly after ordering.

We also had a small soy milk and a yin Yang milk tea. The milk tea was strong and smooth and soy milk was fresh and thick.

For 4 items with tip it was about $30!

My friend took me here after work and it was my first time trying rice noodle rolls. The server was very patient with me as I couldn't really decide what I wanted. I took a recommendation from a friend and decided on the pork and chives rice roll. The rice roll was delicious! The sauce complimented it very well and the pork inside was juicy. I also tried the congee and loved every spoonful of it. I would get that the next time I go. The inside is small but well accommodating for a group of 8. Just be sure to let them know in advance so they can set up a table for you. Overall, great place to eat in Chinatown and I'm glad I was able to experience something new!

Service was very quick, but the food was delicious! The rice rolls were fresh, and the beef in the porridge was so tender. I would definitely come back again for a quick breakfast.
It's cash only.

We ordered the shrimp, beef and chives rice noodle and the marinated beef rice noodle. We were able to grab a table when we walked in, although the waiter was constantly reminding us how long the food will take and what items they're sold out of before we sat. This was our first time having rice noodles and I'll say I wish I tried it sooner. It was very good, fresh, filling and was only about $7-$8 each. By the time we left, there was a long line outside of the restaurant.

Cash only!

My favorite rice noodle roll place in Manhattan!!! I try to make a trip every time I'm in the city. Their rice noodles are thinner than other places and the texture is silky and perfect! My favorites are the signature and the cilantro and scallion, but all the varieties I've tried have been great. Don't forget to choose sauces when you order, otherwise the rolls might be a tad plain and sticky!

Also, there's no seating in the restaurant. It's more of a grab-and-go kind of place. The ordering/pick-up space can get crowded and the wait can get long on weekends, but it's definitely worth it. Overall, very hole-in-the-wall and very tasty! We look forward to being back! :)

Surprisingly this place served really good food, but it took a really long time. The ladies in there were working so hard. They had a long line, and some people got really upset when they found out they couldn't be served right away or at all.

I'm just grateful my friends came here early and placed the order for me :)

I had a shrimp cherng fun, beef with egg, and a side of fish balls. The rice rolls were so good. The fish balls were just eh, but a nice thing on the side. I actually got full off of it.

I would come back!

I order at the counter for rice noodle rolls and the Chinese lady says "1 hour wait." Eep! I have to take the E train to fly back home from JFK *in* an hour! Fortunately she brought to my attention a few pre-made containers of rice noodle rolls that were off to the side. I asked what were in these rolls and the only thing I understood from her fast reply was "radish" lol. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ I'll take one!

Wow, I can understand why the rice noodle rolls here are in high demand. Paper-thin yet sturdy and super elastic rice noodles. Also, the filling in the noodle rolls that I had was very hearty and well-seasoned (along with the radish I think I tasted some pork). Since these rice noodle rolls were sitting out for a while they were a bit cold, but I can imagine fresh batches being even more stellar.

I also got a small-size black sesame paste/soup, which the lady had no trouble pouring quickly into a cup. Pretty standard black sesame soup but still hit the spot. Great $2.50 pick-me-up.

Ultimately, try to avoid peak hours (I visited on a Sunday early afternoon, silly me). Definitely worth checking out if you're looking for an on-the-go light meal/filling snack!

The silkiest rice rolls I've ever had! My go-to order is pork with cilantro. Get a large. Trust me. Also, got an order of tea eggs and it was really flavorful.

Wait can be pretty long sometimes, especially on weekends so I'd highly recommend calling in advance to place your order. It's also a small store so not a lot of space to stand. We waited around an hour for our orders on a Saturday morning.

Don't you hate it when the so-called locals/influencers tell you where to find the 'best of' in a neighborhood/city, and they're always wrong? Like, ALWAYS wrong?!

Well, if you are in the Chinatown area, make sure you go to Yi Ji Shi Mo Noodle Corp - this place is not one of those 'usual overhyped' places, and they will not disappoint!

We were actually looking for another cheong fun cart (which ended up being super gross), and we saw that there was a small steady line in this carry-out place; there's a large menu stand outside, and, when you're ready, you take a few steps down into their space, and you order at the cashier - make sure you state what sauces/toppings you want on your cheong fun (peanut butter sauce, sweet sauce, hot sauce, and/or sesame seeds).

We just ordered a #10, which was the Beef Rice Roll; this comes in a 'small' or a 'large', in which we opted for the small, with all 4 of the sauces/toppings.

We were told it'd be about 10 minutes or so for our order, which was totally fine with us!

OMG, these were literally the best cheong fun ever!  They are made to order, the rice roll was perfectly cooked - not under- or overdone!  The filling had plenty of beef bits, but their sauces/toppings were the perfect consistency and savoriness in the flavor, that it totally elevated this dish even more.

I wished we had ordered 10 more of the 'large' sized ones!

Staff here were friendly and efficient; not sure what others were complaining about in terms of service - maybe just know what to order before you stand in line and articulate when you speak?

This place is cash only, so make sure you go to your bank/ATM beforehand.

I can't wait to return to try their other fillings!

+best cheong fun!
+tasty sauces/toppings
+friendly and efficient service

Good place cheap eat in New York!
Even though they are a small place, not even an "restaurant", but their food are really in a high quality.
The Rice Roll is very smoothly, and in low price! Top rated breakfast option in Chinatown, NY.

They don't have dine in. I ordered to go. Also recommend their Almond drink.

Ordered Beef Cheung Fun and fish balls. The Cheung Fun had green onion in there which made it flavorful. The fish balls were well cooked down to its core and the curry was on point. Definitely loved this place. Will come back in the future :)

THE BEST RICE NOODLES YOU WILL EVER HAVE IN YOUR LIFE! Seriously though I always thought I didn't like rice rolls, turns out I just never had a good one. These rice rolls were so melt in your mouth soft (rather than chewy), which perfectly complemented the texture of the fillings inside, and the soy sauce to top it all off gave it a necessary umami saltiness. We got the signature and there was actually a lot of filling, great ratio of pork egg and shrimp. There's no seating as it's super small inside and we had to wait 45 minutes for our order on Saturday mbecause this place is so popular, so order ahead!

Great rice rolls in the heart of Chinatown. I got their shrimp rice roll - the steamed rice roll was perfectly succulent and shrimp was tender. The sweet soy sauce was perfectly balanced to complement the rice rolls.

Service was transparent and clarified that there would be a 25-minute wait for rice rolls. They're a cash only establishment, and there is no indoor seating (pick-up only).

Reminds me of my parent's business when they sold rice rolls to the Chinese working class.  Good times.  Thank you for the walk down memory lane!

Place is everything you would expect.  Loved that there is a wait, and it's all Chinese people about to go to work, which means it's good! Would definitely come here again.

Be nice to them, they are hard working people!

Absolute must go for cheap rice, fresh, and best-tasting rice noodles in Chinatown.

SERVICE:
Always quick and friendly!

AMBIANCE:
There's no seating in there; you simply order and wait for the noodles to be made.

FOOD:
They're all amazing! I like the roasted pork noodles the most, but you won't be disappointed with the price and taste.

Found this place as a cheap eat in nyc China town so I went in. They're CASH ONLY.
I got their signature rice roll and it opened my eyes to the world of rice roll. I never knew why people hype rice rolls so much but this one CHANGED MY MIND.
The sauce and the texture of the rice roll with the flavors of the inside and everything just danced beautifully in my mouth. I almost feel like I drank it. It was gone before I knew it.
There are some small small small area in the store where you can stand and eat. If not, outside, there are stairs right next to the place but I'm not sure if it's a residential something or what.
Delish rice rolls 150% recommend.

My absolute favorite place for steamed rice rolls in Chinatown!! This unassuming, no frills restaurant may not have the fanciest decor or seating but the quality of their cheung fun is out of this world. The texture of the noodles is perfectly silky and thin, and the fillings are fresh and delicious. As with many places in Chinatown, they are cash only but the prices are incredibly reasonable, making it an excellent choice for a quick, affordable, and incredibly satisfying meal on the go.

Tiny Cheung Fun spot.
No indoor seating, really just a takeout spot.

Quick, cheap, delicious.
You know it's legit when the cashier lady starts talking to you in canto.
Super nice lady btw

I will definitely come back!

Mmmm... decided to drop by to get one of my favorite foods, steamed rice rolls, as a snack and this place really hit the spot! I love how there were different portion sizes and you could customize the rice rolls to your own liking. I got the shrimp rice rolls with eggs and the rice rolls were so smooth, slippery, and savory... filled with flavor and stuffed with plump juicy shrimps.

This place gets busy on the weekends though so expect ~20 minute wait after ordering. It's also cash only!

I begrudgingly took a detour here after my sister's pleading for me to pick up some food for her. She claimed that this place has the BEST steamed rice rolls, and I brushed her off, thinking that they couldn't possibly be that much better than the standard ones at the Chinese restaurant.

My second error in judgment came when I ignored her recommendation to call ahead and place my order. I placed my order for 2 Curry Fish Ball Noodles and 2 Tea Leaf Eggs and resigned myself to the 15 minute wait. While waiting, I noticed most customers popped in to pick up their phone orders. Despite it being a very small space, it seemed like they had a good system in place, running smoothly.

It was another 2 hours before I could get home and try my order. The tea leaf eggs were pretty standard: good flavor, very salty, best enjoyed with rice.  Now as for the rice rolls: I fully believe these are probably the best rice rolls in NY. Nothing stood out on presentation, but wow, the texture of the rolls is unbelievably smooth and crepe thin. I enjoyed peeling apart the layers and drizzling soy sauce all over it to mix with the gentle sprinkle of curry powder. I had already eaten lunch before this, but the thin, silky texture of the noodles made it feel like a light snack rather than a meal. The curry fish balls are very salty and good for pairing with plain noodles.

It was love at first bite with the noodles here. They also have an English menu with the prices clearly written out. Get the large size and you won't regret it!

Came for the shrimp rice crepe and while the pieces of shrimp were small they were super juicy and tender and the texture of these rice rolls lemme tell you are so fresh stretchy and warm they really warmed the soul and all for a great deal. Highly recommend !

If you don't speak Chinese there is an English menu and they will more or less understand as I saw some customers navigate it easily. Small hole in the wall.

Mixed feelings...

The good - noodles are super thin and stretchy and fresh. The almond and sesame soups are legit, silky and not too sweet. Prices are good.

The meh - The soy sauce is not amazing, and that makes a big difference when it comes to rice rolls.  Fish balls are sub par, taste like the same stuff as the artificial crab meat, no fish flavor. There's ones I buy at the supermarket (fresh in the refrigerator section!) that tastes more like real fish balls had in Hong Kong. The wait time is very long and the hours limited.

This is a no frills and cash only place. I got the large shrimp rice roll with hot sauce and soy sauce ($4.75). I was told it was going to take 30 minutes so I walked around Chinatown to kill some time.

The rice roll was super yummy and it tasted fresh.

A wonderful one in the wall local speciality! The lady working there is super kind and quick. Their menu is a modest one - full of delicious hand made to order rice rolls (you can see the guy making them right behind the cashier!). Such a tasty and filling snack with good portions for....$3.50?!?!

Unheard of in this day and age. We'll definitely be back! No seating inside as it's rather small but you'll see tons of folks coming by to grab a quick take out and eat it on the go.
Silky, delicious cheung fun noodles made to order. One of my fave cheap eats in Chinatown. It's a no frills spot with just enough space for a few patrons to order/wait for their meals.

The rice roll here is some of the thinnest and smoothest I've eaten, way better than any dim sum restaurant you go to. However be prepared to wait for a bit as they're always slammed with orders during the AM. I've typically waited between 30 minutes to 1 hr. Do not fret, they're very organized and you can call ahead of time prior to leaving the house or take some time to go grocery shopping while you wait, you won't regret it!

Overall: 8.5/10
Taste: 8/10
- I got the shrimp rice roll and it was a pretty standard one you could get at dim sum places. The rice rolls were well made as I liked how thing they were without breaking apart. The shrimp were small  and definitely felt frozen.
Price: 10/10
- Just like many places in Chinatown, this place was an incredible deal as I got something for half the price at a typical restaurant. The portion size was better than expected as well.
Service: 8/10
- The woman taking orders was nice and also knew how to speak English.
Ambiance: 8/10
- The place is tiny and there is really no place to eat inside the restaurant, however, the kitchen looked clean.

A humble little shop, serving up some of the best rice rolls I've ever had. Ordering and receiving is a straightforward process, go to the register, order, then wait.

Because it is FRESH, they let you know that it will take a awhile. About 10-15 minutes depending on how many people there are. I heard some people ordering through the phone, so that is a possibility if you want to save some time.

The rice noodle is soft and silky, shrimp is satisfyingly bouncy. The soy sauce is really ties it together as it is savory and warm in the best way.

Staff is nice. Price is fair.

I started visiting when they first opened and continue to visit quite frequently. I have brought my colleagues along with me.

It takes 2 large orders to fill me up. I often get the cilantro & scallion rice roll and the fishballs with mixed sauce.

I have also tried their black sesame soup. Its alright. Its better than the ones from places like mango mango.

Omg this place is ASTOUNDING.  I have had thousands of rice rolls in my life, and this place blows all of them out of the water by miles!!!  The rice rolls are so silky soft and literally the Platonic ideal of what a rice roll should be.  

Just know that it's a hole in the wall, and if you can, call your order in.  Service is friendly enough.  But the real star are the rice rolls!!!!!!
Got a beef roll, skin was perfect and thin. The sauce was really good and not too salty. Cheap and good.

Sometimes you just do not want to spend too much money ($6+) on your favorite dim sum dish, a shrimp rice roll. I have finally found a solution in this amazing restaurant.

Now, this place has no seats and it is cash only. However, my picture is of a small rice roll for $3.50! No regrets! It was fresh and their rice roll soy sauce was one of the most flavorful I have ever had!!

You know I am coming back and with some friends!!

I love the price and the space, great rice rolls but wish the texture was more bouncy and chewy. It's a bit too delicate and soft for me, I prefer a good mouth feel. It's a good place for a good cheap eats, cash only, take-out only, but because they make it fresh made to order, it'll take a minimum of 15 min.

I also ordered a soy milk and if you have Asian tastebuds like I do, you'll like that it's very lightly sweetened and so refreshing.

tiny Chinatown steamed rice roll joint squeezed into Elizabeth Street. TAKEOUT only. a dive-y old school Chinatown vibe, but everything is pretty clean in the tiny space. picked up a large beef rice roll (added an egg) and a small roast pork rice roll from here and was super happy with each dish. noodles were thin & soft, proteins were flavorful, and the portions were good. the large was pretty filling and the small's portion works  as a savory snack -- i inhaled both post-gym! there are other items on the menu like tea eggs, curry fish balls, and a few other eats. the staff are friendly and quick. call in your order if you want to save time. if you're in Chinatown and in the mood for rice rolls, stop here.

Best congee ever! I got the pork and preserved egg congee a week ago and I haven't stopped thinking about it. I accidentally ordered congee from another restaurant in the area and was so disappointed when I found out I called the wrong place. Nothing compares to this congee.

I wish I could have it delivered to my apartment for those sick days and hangover mornings.
Unfortunately they are just takeout and cash only. So worth the wait, really cheap prices.

I tried the cheong fun from here and the cart on the corner of the same block, and I thought Yi Ji Shi Mo was the clear winner. The rice roll was soft, and their sauces added nice flavor. I got the #1 signature with no cilantro (bbq pork, shrimp, egg) and no peanut or sesame sauce. I would definitely come back next time I visit NYC!

A little semi basement, hole in the wall.  Delicious food awaits inside.

One of my favorite places to get rice rolls in Manhattan Chinatown.  I like the consistency of the noodle which comes out delicate and thin, giving a nice mouth feel.

My usual is a large size beef or roast pork rice roll with added egg, cilantro and
extra meat.  Choose your sauce.  I usually use peanut sauce, soy sauce, hoisin sauce and sesame. Super delicious.

They also have soy milk which is pretty good too.

The place is very popular.  Sometimes it can be a madhouse in there.  Cash only.

Best. Rice noodles. Ever. Like they're actually amazing. I haven't had such good rice noodles even when I went to authentic cantonese dim sum places. The rice noodle here was thin, soft and did not break when you picked it up. The shrimp one was my favorite. It's also very cheap! I got the fish balls as well - they were good but nothing really special.

Fyi there isn't really space to sit/stand and eat there at the moment so takeout is the best option here!

Probably my personal fave in NYC for Cheung fun/rice rolls. Texture is consistently perfect every time. Each is always stuffed with a generous amount of meats and ingredients, and the sauces provided are the perfect. A wait is expected due to both phone orders and customers waiting in line. No seats available, but there are a few counter spots where you can stand and eat if yoy want.

It looks like I didn't get renewed for Yelp Elite in 2023, but I hope you'll still listen to me.

The best black sesame dessert here is the best I've had, and this is including dedicated dessert shops in Hong Kong.

Beef is my wife and daughter's favorite. Even without any sauces except the provided sweet soy sauce, it's a phenomenal experience. The skin to the roll is so thin with the perfect amount chewiness, that this is worth me driving from Fresh Meadows to get, especially on Saturday mornings. I like the curry fish balls and mini shrimp ingredients as well.

Tip: call ahead while you're still traveling and give the order a 20 minute lead time, so you're not standing around waiting. I usually get in the car at 6:45 a.m., dial in while driving, order, and then pick up when I arrive at about 7:00 a.m.

Oh, cash only.

Five stars.
Pretty good flat rice noodles, freshly made and the soy sauce is okay too. It is like a small hole on the wall but you can find it. I'd come again.

Tips:
- Bring cash
- Go early
- Add egg
- Get ALL the sauces

This is the best (YES BEST) rice roll place in all of NYC. Nothing else compares because they make it fresh when you order, and the skin is sooooo thin. The cilantro and scallion rice roll is SO good, and I like to add shrimp to it.

I would suggest not getting the curry fish ball rice roll but to order the curry fish balls on the side instead.

SO GOOD.

I'm not a chang fen expert, but something about Yi Ji Shi Mo Noodle Corp just hits different. I got a small portion of the Fresh Shrimp for $3.25 for the perfect mid-day snack.  

The rice rolls were extremely thin and soft in texture. A huge plus for me was that the rolls didn't clump together (even after I walked around for ~20 mins), which is probably a result of how they mill their rice flour on the spot. The sauce to noodle ratio was perfect, and I was pleasantly surprised to see a generous number of plump shrimp even with my small order.

The shop is a tiny storefront where you order at the window and they'll call you once your order is ready. The staff are super nice and efficient, but I've heard that lines can get long on the weekends.

I have yet to try all the other chang fen spots in the area, but I have a feeling that Yi Ji Shi Mo will be my favorite. Definitely worth a trip (or many trips) down to Chinatown when you want some amazing chang fen in the city!

Whenever I get dim sum I have to order beef cheung fun (rice rolls) and finding out there is store dedicated to making this dish made me so eager to try it. I got a large beef and large shrimp and it was made fresh to order for $4.25 each. Ten minutes later the noodles were ready and steaming hot. The noodle itself is thin and stretchy, and so satisfying to eat. I was a bit disappointed in the lack of beef filling there was, but the shrimp roll had more little shrimps. Also, make sure you add the soy sauce to the tray, it makes a delicious difference.

Wonderful to come back to the Big Apple for a visit and a good friend suggested that we have lunch here. I have never been to this place, but trust my friend's tastebuds so agreed to it.

Because she was taking a longer lunch, to save time, she recommended we call in our order, so when we arrive, it will be ready.

We decided to get the beef, egg, cilantro rice roll and the curry fish ball rice roll.

When we arrived, our order was ready! For two orders, the total came to $9.50. Wow, pretty cheap meal! And both meals are more than adequate and will fill you up! Please note this place is a take out spot mainly, so there is no seating at all.

We took our order and walked to the park and dug into our food. And what an amazing delightful meal that brought me back to my childhood! Each bite was like heaven!

The steam rice rolls can often be found at dim sum places also, some have called this the Chinese crepe. Steam rice rolls are soft and white and by itself doesn't have too much taste, but pair it with you favorite protein and then add some hot sauce, soy sauce and peanut sauce and melt into bliss!

I will be back to eat at this place again and so happy my friend showed me this place! Economical and delicious, cannot beat that!
Fresh soft silky and affordable rice noodles! Cash only. I'd  call ahead and order since it can get fairly busy
No frills rice noodle spot. Service is efficient. Specify if you want sauce on your order. Cash only. Highly recommend #1 (shrimp and everything), with peanut sauce.

The rice noodles were simply amazing! They were perfectly cooked and had just the right amount of chewiness to them. The variety of toppings and sauces available ensured that there was something to please every palate.

The portions were generous and the prices were reasonable for the quality and quantity of food.

Would definitely recommend ordering ahead of time as there can be long wait times.
The best rice noodles. No mames los Chinos si comino. Can't go wrong with number one. Takes some time during noon time but it's the best.

Omg! Must try when in the area. We shared the shrimp rice noodle and the scallion and chive rice noodle. They give you sauce in a packet. It was delicious, it curbed the dim sum cravings. We ordered a small one, that was my only mistake. Next time I will get a large. The service is great, the lady behind the register is very friendly. The ambiance is cool, just a small take out spot. The food comes out and tastes fresh.

Top rice rolls in Chinatown where you can customize your order and have one of the best breakfasts you can ask for. Cash only.

It is all delicious and you have the ability to customize to your favorite toppings. My top recommendations are to add cilantro and radish to balance out the meat and umami sauces.

This is a staple in any weekend food runs and Chinatown food crawls.

The large fresh shrimp was only $4.50.... What a crazy bargain. The quality was amazing and I would most definitely go back. The texture was perfect and the sauce was the perfect balance of sweet savory.

If you are craving some rice rolls then come no further. The shrimp rice rolls are extremely fresh and delicious. I'd recommend asking for all sauces which will include a peanut sauce and a spicy (sriracha-like) sauce which are both super good. The place is extremely affordable to being $5 for the large portion in the photo. Also, be sure to place your order by calling ahead so you don't have to wait (usually takes them about 30 mins). Lastly, bring cash! They don't take card!

This is the best cheung fun I've ever had. I came here twice during my 7 day vacation in NY. This place is truly a gem. I ordered in cantonese and the lady was very kind. I was able witness how these rice noodle rolls were made!

I got the beef and char siu cheung fun. The rolls are insanely silky, smooth, and delicate-- just the way I like them. I also recommend the tea leaf eggs. They are so flavorful and yummy. Keep in mind, they are a bit over cooked but that's how they are usually made. The prices are beyond reasonable and affordable. Definitely worth the trip!

I am so incredibly sad I will never get to eat these again unless I take another 5 hour plane ride. If you are in the area, I highly recommend checking this place out!

Expect to wait a minimum of 15-20 minutes as these rolls are made to order. I had to wait 45 minutes during my second visit due to the high volume of orders they had but it was worth it.

This place makes THE BEST fish ball soup in Chinatown!!! Rumor has it this place was the first restaurant in Chinatown that served this dish and then everyone else started to copy the dish because it was that popular among locals. Pretty historical I thought! The dishes that they offer on the menu are pretty simple yet delicious. I had their famous fish ball soup and it was so good and comforting at the same time. The owner, a guy named Ken, very friendly and funny. It was my first time there, and he recommended the specialties of the restaurant such as Sweet & Sour Spare Ribs and Pork with Dried Bamboo. I was very satisfied. Everything tasted so fresh! They also sell their pre-made frozen packed fish balls that you can cook at home. I bought 3 packs of those cuz It was that good and the price is extremely reasonable! 3 Bucks for a bowl of fish ball soup! Come on you can't beat that! This place is specialized in Chinese-Fujian style cooking (a province located near Taiwan in China). If you're in town this is a must-go-to-place! Oh and you have to be a bit on the adventurous side cuz obviously there won't be any Orange Chicken, Mushu Pork, General Tso's Chicken or Chow Mein whatsoever! I really think that this place is underrated but hey this is the real deal folks!

Omg you guys are the best! Ordered from GrubHub last night and I've never been more impressed.  The food was fast, it was some of the best quality Chinese food I've ever tasted (a rarity in New York City), and it was all cleanly organized into these cute little plastic dishes. Also the portion sizes were heaping so I had plenty leftover.

I will DEFINITELY be returning here again!!!
Shocking amount of celery for a chicken cashew dish that didnt even list celery as an ingredient, and about 5 cashews.  Be warned of their dirty tricks.

This is the worst chinese food I have ever ordered in my life. Not only was the delivery guy over a hour late and the food was cold but the quality of this food is beyond poor.

The pork fried rice that comes with the lunch special had 1 tiny piece of pork in it which was rock hard. The rice has ZERO flavor and the general tso's chicken was soggy and cold. My friend got the sesame chicken lunch special and had the same reaction.

The soups that came with it also again ICE COLD!  STAY AWAY from this place as it is horrendous. The best thing about this was the packaged fortune cookie that they obviously do not make at this terrible, awful, pathetic excuse for a chinese restaurant.
Ordered from this place on seamless. Food was cold, greasy, and had no flavor. Possibly the worst Chinese food I've ever had.

I usually ordered from this place and they were my favorite, but when I ordered from them Monday night I got the worst food poisoning ever from their sesame chicken! Turns out, I'm not the only one! My friend ordered the mapo tofu recently and ended up having food poisoning as well!
I only order delivery from here but the food is always delicious and it arrives in a timely fashion. The hot and sour soup and Mei fun noodles are life.

Food was both yummy and Chinese, as advertised. Delivery time, however, was NOT  as advertised. Was told to expect the food in 30-40 minutes: it took well over an hour.

A great price point and good food, but the slow delivery was disappointing.

NEVER  again will I order from this place. Took over two hours to deliver...they estimated the delivery time would be between 8 and 8:10pm. By 8:30pm, it still had not arrived so I called them and they told me it was on the way. 10 minutes later I called again and they said they would call the driver and call me back. 15 min later no callback and so I called them and no one answered. I called about 15 times and there was still no one answering. At this point, I assumed they got lost or something had happened so at 8:50 (50 minutes passed the delivery time) I went out and got another dinner. When I get back the food had finally been delivered (around 9pm- one hour later than expected). So at this point, I paid for two dinners. Once I got back to my apt, they had literally just dropped it off. Too late now. I was out over $60 now. Never order from this place.

I just ordered the lunch special orange chicken. The prok fried rice was bland, had minimal pork and no vegetables. The chicken was tough, stale and frankly it tasted like chemicals. I called the restaurant to let them know that their sauce may be expired, and they said "no, you are wrong. It is not expired and it tastes fine". I had 4 people taste the chicken and 3 of them spit it out. I was never offered a refund or an apology.

Uhh, I got food poisoning from here. Not an accusation I levy lightly... but when you eat dubiously cheap Chinese food then get riotously ill five hours after... yeah, that's food poisoning. Avoid, unless you want to lose 10 lbs in the least enjoyable manner possible.
I really don't want to tell you about this restaurant because I don't want them to get busier than they already are. Family owned and operated. Closed on Sunday.

I've only ever gotten delivery from here but it is THE BOMB. their combo meals are incredible. You can get your choice of chicken, pork, seafood, etc and it comes with fried rice and a egg roll for less than $9!! I usually get the orange chicken, sesame chicken or Kung pow chicken and it is so good! The dumplings are actually amazing too. I would say they rival prosperity dumpling in that regard. Extremely fresh. Plus my food always arrives in 20 mins or less. Yummy Chinese is what's up of you want something quick and delicious!!
Ordered on Seamless- fast. Delicious. Great service. Will order again!!! I wish they had egg drop soup but it doesn't matter because their food is amazing!

Oh my god. I visited New York a week ago and this is one of the only meals I can't forget! The soup is so good for you and hands down delicious along with the fried rice. I wish I could go back for seconds!

5 star for late night deliver. they deliver until 1am up in mid-town. that's a dream come true. generals (all white meat) was very good and the pork dumplings were awesome with thick chewy dough. really great dumplings. this all coming from someone who does not like chinese food.
I like this place. Idk why the reviews are so bad. They give you a perfect lunch portion. I had the Chicken and Broccoli and thought its was banging.
The sweet and sour pork was awesome. I also got the scallion pancakes which were tasty. It's one of my favorite Chinese delivery options because they are fast and are good value.
This place is always solid, timely, and a good value.  I order from here often and it always meets my expectations ;-)
By a wide margin the best Chinese food delivery spot I've found in LES in the two years I've lived here.

I ordered my chinese expecting a yummy and quality experience, yet when it arrived it was not only 3 minuets past time, but also COLD. As I opened the food, I called lady asking where my white rice is, she said I didn't order it. WRONG. Then I opened the boneless rips, which is chunks of ribs ripped off the bone!! The dumplings, were fried on one side and steamed on the other, it takes talent to screw that one up. I will not return to this restaurant the quality was poor and the food was worse.
love this place always get my lunch delivered foods always good and they get here in a decent time

Chinese BBQ is one of my favorite street foods of all time.  Most skewers are only about $2. Unfortunately, these carts are becoming more and more rare. This one is located on Forsyth and Division St. in Chinatown.

Whenever I find myself at one of these carts, I end up getting close to twenty skewers of various meats. My favorites are the lamb and beef tendon, coated with their five spice seasoning.

Hits the spot when you're craving a quick snack in Chinatown! The aroma of the spice is so strong (in a good way) that you can smell it from blocks away. The spice is great, however the meat texture is not consistent as it was tough a couple of times.

Have the egg plant,  Chinese chives with bacon, pork stick, lamb stick and beef stick. BBQ is very juicy and delicious. My favorite is the eggplant, my friend's favorite is the pork stick, which is crispy
Where is this cart?  Is it only warm months that it's open?  Forsyth and division streets?  Can't seem to find it.

Was looking for a quick bite on canal st around 11pm and stumbled upon this cart. After seeing people waiting in line so late at night i decided to give it a try and did not dissapoint. The skewers are freshly cooked and the spicy seasoning is very on point, not overly salty or spicy but enough to complement the smoky flavors. Easy to order and reasonably priced -  my only regret was not getting to try some of their other varieties like squid.

Love this place for fast and cheap eats. Very kind couple who runs it. The chicken and eggplant are fantastic. Grilled over charcoal with amazing flavor. I've been three times since I first tried it, it's so convenient. Heard good things about the shrimp too. Hard yes.

At $1.50 for most of the skewers, you really can't go wrong with this place!

Came by for to grab a few skewers as a snack before a late dinner and it didn't disappoint.

The lady running the cart was super nice and made sure to ask if we wanted spicy or regular. Get the spicy if you can handle it!

We ordered the chicken heart, chicken gizzard, lamb, beef, fish tofu and squid skewers. Everything was delicious. Grilled perfectly and so flavorful. My top favorites were the fish tofu and squid. The squid was glazed with a sweet chili sauce and it was SO GOOD -- tender and delicious!

It can take some waiting around for your food but that's because they grill your skewers to order. No complaints there!

Some actual Chinese BBQ in Manhattan!
I got two chicken, two lamb and one mushroom. I like the chicken and the mushroom but was not a fan of the lamb - not very fresh so it got that special taste of lamb, which I don't enjoy.
The way they cook is traditional. The seasoning they used was right. The food was a little burned on the outside but they cut those parts off before handing the food over(wrapped in alumni foil if you ordered a bunch). Price is cheap, and no seat.
Overall a nice surprise.

There's only 1 thing you need to get from this place: Xinjiang Cumin Lamb Sticks!!! Each stick is $1.25 and extremely flavorful (ask the guy to make it spicy). Their beef, chicken and seafood're just meh in comparison.

I like this particular location because the lamb has some fat, which adds to overall flavor and aroma. Other bbq carts in NY are typically too lean. The only bad thing about this cart's that sometimes they just don't show up. And there's no phone number to confirm lol.

Was walking around Chinatown and my boyfriend was like let's try this and I was sooo sketched out. I was thinking idk where they store the meat, how they cook it, honestly was just scared I would get sick from eating this stuff. I basically said no and let him order what he wanted.

He ordered one beef stick for $1.25 and asked for it to be spicy. He offered me a bite and it was actually the most delicious thing ever. I ended up stealing his food and eating the rest of the beef stick. The meat was seasoned well and the spicy powder on top was addicting I can't stop thinking about it. And I didn't get sick! I would definitely return and maybe try the chicken as well next time!

So yummy and spicy!

I was trying to find the exact spot of the cart around 10pm at night and of course it was empty. Disappointed, I went to get boba at Kung Fu Tea before heading home and then the cart was right in front of me!!
