I know they are mostly a noodle shop, but PLEASE give their jian bings a try. I got the pork floss (basically dried pork with a fluffy texture) jian bing  and will definitely be going back to try the others!

Staff is extremely nice and are able to make accommodations. There's not that much seating though, so eating in with a big group is probably not a good idea

I decided to try this place today, I got the Duck Jian Bing. Having had good Jian Bing in Shanghai and one place in Flushing, I am usually skeptical.

This place has REALLY good Jian Bing, the duck is incredible tender and juicy. The contrast of it to the Crispy Wonton makes for a great combo. This is definitely the best Jian Bing in Manhattan by far.

The duck one is NOT on the menu, you have to specifically ask for it. It will come out to $13. Very high, but very worth it.

I love this place and have been here a few times now. It's comfortable and service and food are all great! I always get the minced beef noodle soup and I'm never disappointed. My boyfriend has tried a variety of other dishes from here but always says the minced beef one is best. So if you're going to come here, just order what I did and you won't be disappointed. The potato dish was decent not amazing, but it's a nice wash of flavor in case you want to balance the amazing flavors from the noodle soup with something a bit plainer. I didn't try the intestines so can't comment on that.

My favorite secret lunch spot and place to getaway from my annoying coworkers.

Nice owner, always treat me nice.

Love the broth, Good Soup.

My fav comfort food is always the pork noodles.
It's not too heavy, it light and green and savory. Love a simple meal with decent prices.
Indoor and outdoor seating available. Very small. So pay, eat, and enjoy

***Cheap Quick Service, $10 Credit Card Minimum, Pickup Only Review***

There's limited indoor dining and a signage that says vaccination card and ID required. I only did a pickup order so I'm not sure if it's complied. However I ordered the pork bun and jianbing. Both were delicious and well flavored.
Friendly staff. I'm not a fan of spicy food, but this noodle soup is very tasty and comes with fresh fish fillets. Hot noodles for hot summer!
Great Chongqing noodle soup and nice service, very hole in the wall place with just a kitchen and small eating area but worth the stop for after-work dinner on a week day.

I am so glad I accidentally found this place when wandering around! The food was so cheap and there was so much - I paid $9 for a very big bowl of noodle and dumpling soup. The owner was so sweet, and he brought me the food probably within 2 minutes of me ordering. The interior is also very cozy and well decorated! Will definitely be coming back!!

Very disappointed this time.
I tried the spicy intestine noodle this time. But the soup is flavorless. It's quite spicy but apart from that nothing left. The intestine is not fresh and tasted like frozen in the fridge for too long. Not salty and flavorless for the intestine.

For the cucumber I order is not fresh as well. Won't try again.

Relatively cheap eats serving very specific things. I was in the mood for a jianbing so we stopped by. We got the pork jianbing which was very average; the pork was really a pork belly and though it says "spicy" its not spicy at all. We also got the chong qing noodles and those were average as well - adequate level of spice and flavors. But all in all, nothing I would crave again and if I was craving jianbing i'd probably look at other options before returning.

An excellent value for the noodle soups. I find that a lot of places can be heavy on the noodles and light on other ingredients, but there is a great balance of the fish and lots of veggies as well in this soup. Bold flavors on this one and also the spicy beef noodle soup I tried in the past. It's one of my go-tos in Chinatown.

I came here for dinner on a Thursday night with my sister.  They had noodles, jianbing, and baos.  There was more seating than I expected.
You order at the cashier and they bring your order to you on a tray.  We shared the pork belly bao, the duck bao, and wonton noodle soup.  I enjoyed the wonton noodle soup the most since it was a large portion.  The wontons tasted homemade and the noodles were not overcooked or undercooked.  The baos were okay, do feel like the bao buns were not that fresh.  I liked the duck bao more than the pork belly bao since it had veggies in it so there was a good crunch.  The prices were not bad compared to other places.  Also, the portions were larger than I expected.  Service was friendly and fast.  I would come back to try their jianbing and other noodle dishes.

Warning: they charge you for every little thing.

Stopped by to get a bowl of noodle soup because it's cold outside. First, the CC minimum is $15, ok fine. But then they charge you another 3.5% on top for using a CC. Why even have a minimum on CC if you're going to have the customers pay the CC fees anyway?

Noodles were ok. I'd give it a 3 out of 5 for the food.

I asked for a couple of to-go containers because I had to over order to hit the CC minimum so I couldn't finish my food. They charge you for the to-go containers...which turned out to cost a little over 6% of my order total.

Don't recommend this place if you don't have cash on you.
Most horrendous Chinese noodle I've ever had. Hard to imagine a Chinese noodle place is using cheap non-handmade noodle. The soup is just full of soy sauce, nothing else.

The service was really good - the lady in front is super nice!

The jian Bing portions were huge, and they really hit the spot. Super flavorful and tasted pretty authentic

This is part 2 of my so-called stakeout quick eats.  I was in an unfortunate situation where I was tasked to man the car in New York City, whilst  busing my MIL from one appointment to the next.  What better thing to do during these moments of boredom than to scope out some good quick eats on the Yelp app?

I did just that and was delighted to learn that just mere 10 yards ahead of my perched car was the Yiwanmen or yee won mien, which literally means one bowl of noodle.  Since this was to be consumed in front of the steering wheel, I had to forgo their staple noodle entrees and go for their snacks -- specifically their savory crepes (jian bing) which were actually prominently featured in their menu.  I was going for their Pork Belly Crepe for $6 based on the takeout menu.  To my dismay, the new price was now $8. I thus changed my order to the Pork Belly Bao and the Beef Bao instead.

It took a mere 5 minutes for my order to be ready.  While welcomed in light of the fact that my car was illegally parked, it wasn't a good sign for the food.  The buns weren't very fluffy; I had to wonder if their were microwaved. The visuals were enticing; unfortunately that was dampened by their miniature sizes.  I'd liken them to the size of my credit card.  A bit of a bummer.  The pickled radish gave each bite a nice crunch, along with a sweet and acidic kick; however, the pork belly wasn't moist like I had expected.  Between the two, I preferred the beef Bao, partly because I had no expectation.

Despite the modern glass exterior, this is a hole-in-the-wall joint with charming interior and fun menu items.  While not impressed on this outing, I wouldn't mind trying their other offerings in the future -- but not their baos.

This was a great discovery! Very nice spot with tasty beef noodles. We tried the pork intestine noodles too - also very tasty. The staff is very warm and friendly.
And the noodles are only $9 (not $13.50 as shown in the Yelp photos)
Great hidden gem on Mott Street! Always kind and wonderful staff, super fresh, a must try!

Duck jianbing. 4/5. We got takeout, so the crepe got a little more moist than ideal but it was rather tasty! Loved the fresh cucumbers inside the softened crepe, along with the duck. Pretty darn tasty, even after it had been sitting in the bag, waiting for us.

There are 2 small tables with 2 stools each just outside the store where you can eat your food during these covid times.

I ordered the wonton shrimp noodle  soup, theres no shrimp inside the wonton. Also they didnt cook the wonton well and made me so sick after eating it. I didnt finish my meal and I throw up . I regret ordering the shrimp wonton. Also original price of my meal was 14.50 but I paid with card and they charged me extra 4 bucks for subcharge. Def not going back again

Best spiced chicken I have ever had!
Best crab tofu!
Can't wait to come back!!!!
I like it
forbidden city was great. the ambiance was also pretty good. Would go again
10/10 good service gr8 drinks yummy food goood ambience good food great for dinner and not dinner .

Ye's Apothecary has been on my bucket list for months and finally we got a chance to give it a try with my foodie squad.

Ye's Apothecary is a perfect spot for drinking and there wasn't various food options. However, the food was surprisingly decent and my personal favorite was the Crab Tofu. We also loved their Golden Corn which was appetizing and matched with alcohol.

It was a really cool vibe; my friends and I went here because we couldn't get into another restaurant, and I'm really glad we weren't able to! I'm not sure why this place isn't more packed. It passes the cool person's vibe check.

It had really good music, it was dimly lit, the decorations were great, and I feel like Feng shui principles might have been considered when designing the place because it was a bustling restaurant where everyone could have their own separate group conversations and there was always an energetic space/border between every group. Things flow well there.

I loved my drink, it was something with caramelized banana. They only thing that I didn't like; the food portions are so small for the price!

I would definitely come here again for drinks

This place has a great ambiance, the bartender was great! He's quick, friendly, and makes amazing drinks.

I had "days of being wild" cocktail, and my wife had "nude and noble"; again, both were very well balanced cocktails.
Holy cow these Asian cocktails were amazing. Really interesting flavors and combinations. Got the tea drink and pandan one, both heavenly. Will be back.

Mediocre food that lacks spice, decent drinks though.
They are strict with the 90 mins per table and have no shame in repeatedly reminding you.

Food 3.5/5
Ambience 4/5
Price 3/5

I've had this spot bookmarked for a while because I saw others posting their iconic sign all over social media and I love Szechuan food so I decided to give this spot a try.

It's a cool speakeasy vibe so lighting is dim. Each party has a 90 min time limit so be aware!

They have a fairly large drink menu with unique names and flavors but I thought my drink was just ok.

The food was ok but if you factor in the price... not really worth.

Overall, I don't regret giving this spot a try but probably won't return. There's many other Szechuan restaurants and speakeasies.

I came for my birthday because I wanted some Szechuan food. The moment you walk in, you get transported back to 1930s Shanghai. The decor is beautiful since I think Chinese interior designs from 1930 are amazing. The place is small so you do feel very close to your neighbors.

The alcohol list is very unique and highly recommend trying out their cocktails. I love that it is a nice Asian & Western fusion and there are liquors that I've never heard of before. Definitely worth getting one or two a try!

We ordered a bunch of dishes to share and all of them were amazing. My favorite was the Chairman's Pork Belly, but my friend likes the Truffle Mushroom Salad. The Changsha Spiced Chicken is ma-la, definitely more on the numbing your tongue side than being spicy. I highly recommend that if you like spicy food.

Our waitress Tsering is the cutest. She kept on checking up on us and has a wonderful personality. We chit-chatted quite a bit, in between her managing her tables.

Why you want to go:
1. Beautiful ambiance, great for date night or just to hang out with friends
2. Food is good (and they come quick). I love tapas style as everyone get to try different things
3. Cocktails are super unique
4. Tsering!

Why you want to skip:
1. Small place. It feels claustrophobic. Not ideal for large groups or plus sizes
2. Time limit. I feel like 90 mins feels rush. We didn't even get to look at desserts.

I had Ye's Apothecary bookmarked for a while and finally got to try it! The restaurant had great ambiance for sure - dim, intimate, and fun is how I would describe it. Our server provided thoughtful recommendations on drinks and food, and even told us that we ordered too much lol.

Scallion pancakes (3/5): Good, but dry, kind of doughy, and flavorless unless dipped in the sauce.
Szechuan beef (3/5): Was not hot when delivered to table; weird texture where beef was rock hard and difficult to chew, but flavor grew on me.
Garlic prawn (4/5): Big prawns with tons of chopped garlic that had a kick in the end.
Eggplant tempura (2/5): The tempura was so soggy because the entire dish was literally covered in sweet garlic soy vinaigrette. It was too overpowering.
Chicken truffle soup dumplings (2/5): Worst soup dumplings ever. Skin was doughy and thick and fillings were so dry with barely any soup on the inside.
Red sorghum and Shanghai 75 (4/5): Specialty Baiju cocktails that tasted somewhat herbally. Not my favorite, but still glad I got to try them.

Overall, Ye's Apothecary was fun to check out but the food was not memorable and overpriced.

A win for this neighborhood! Walked in on a Saturday night and was able to be fit in with 2 people as it was right before the dinner rush around 5:30pm/6pm. Food/drinks were great and strong.

Can get a little loud and dark vibes but thats the mood nowadays!
Ye's apothecary is a Low key-vibey den in the heart of Lower East Side! I came here because of the baijiu cocktails that they have and it didn't disappoint! Try the red sorghum when you are here!

We were a table of 5 in this modern Chinese restaurant and bar on a saturday evening. It is a dimmed light cozy setting with some old Chinese inspired decors. The table is a bit small for 5 people so we decided to get drinks and appetizers first before getting the mains. The cocktails are all Chinese ingredients inspired and have a good range of strong to weak ones with different liquor bases. I particularly liked the Rice Gorg and HK Milk Punch. The chicken wings were really flavourful and tender, a little bit spicy that helps elevated the flavours. The beef skewers are extremely juicy and tender as well. Overall we enjoyed almost all the drinks and dishes we ordered, and definitely feeling coming back for more in the future!

Moon goddess: very unique presentation, like I'm drinking a warm tea but instead drinking a warm cocktail. Taste like plum wine, which I personally like.

Quick and attentive service even amidst busy Saturday night at 8:30pm. Would recommend making a reservation ahead of time to avoid waiting on line (thankfully made that reservation).

Overall, a bit pricey but really cool and cute date vibes.

I want to eat the Duck Fried Rice every day for the rest of my life. We stopped in on our first day in New York and we're glad we did! The ambiance is lovely, the staff is friendly, the cocktails were delicious and the food was amazing.

The Earl Grey Gimlet was unique and delicious and the Fortunella Sazerac was good but I ended up liking the Gimlet a little more.

The Duck Fried Rice was my favorite... ever.

The Yuzu Shrimp was pretty delicious and the Szechuan beef was yummy but came in 3rd place out of all the food.

This place is cool and I will absolutely be back for the Duck Fried Rice and the Earl Grey Gimlet one day.

I reallyyyy wanted to love this place. I just felt like the portion sizes were incredibly small (yes I know it's more of a tapa place) for the price. It really wasn't that filling and we ordered 6 things amongst 4 people. Personally not sure if I would recommend this to others. Drinks weren't too bad either but felt like it wasn't too special.

Ambience was really unique but other than that nothing really stood out

Great time and amazing company. Came here after work on a Thursday and had some cocktails. I had the monkey king which was a rum, coconut and pandan drink. Delicious! My friend had the birds nest which was on the lighter side taste wise.

The place is known for baijiu cocktails so be sure to try that too! Great vibes. Will be back

This place was such a vibe! Food was extremely flavorful - just the right amount of spice and our waiter prepared us well for that! Drinks also were good, we got the Nude and Noble along with the Birds Nest. Super underrated spot!
Nothing special here. Food came out so fast it felt like there was no way it was prepared for us. We got it before the drinks we ordered.
A fun & sexy ambience with cool drinks! This spot is great for a girl's night out or a date! My favorite dish of the night was the fried fish -- it was to die for! I'd highly recommend.

I love love love the ambiance. You get a speakeasy vibe, especially viewing the entrance and it's got a cozy interior.

So the ONLY thing that's a pain is the 90 min time limit. They mean business when they say you have to be done by then. Our server came over at one point, and I ordered one more dish, only to be told "you know, you only have 30 mins left at this table," which was very off-putting tbh. I can appreciate that reservations are not super hard to come by, but it's just a little bit stressful when you're constantly being reminded that your time is nearly up (and to glance over and see empty tables, too).

The food? Spectacular. We had the wontons, the dan dan noodles, the cucumber salad and the pork belly. You can't go wrong with the food here, even though they are more well known for their drinks.

I started with The Remedy, which was strong (but delicious) and later had the Plum Blossom (sweet and light). I definitely want to come back to sample more of the cocktail menu.

I was a bit skeptical since the drinks seemed more popular than the food itself, but I really enjoyed the meal! They don't skimp on the spice, and each dish was packed with flavor. The only thing is the tables are quite small, so it may feel cramped if you go with a big group.

Night Market Noodles ($22): pretty average
Garlic Beans ($18): delicious
Chili Filet-o-Fish ($24): my favorite, but pretty small of a portion
Crab Tofu ($22): strong salted egg yolk flavor, would've liked to see some spring onions to spruce things up
Changsha Spiced Chicken ($21): a crowd favorite! The chicken was super crispy and had a slight numbing kick

The staff was also very attentive and quick with any additional requests. I would come back to try drinks and other menu items!

This place deserves six stars for the ambiance alone. The vibes are immaculate and the service is top notch. I ordered a Baiju drink and while it was not my cup of tea, I could tell it was crafted well.

One star removed for the food being cold when it arrived at the table. But it was tasty nonetheless.

With supper from across town in our bellies we sat at Peety's Pies on Houston thinking where shall we go next.  Because the deliciousness of Peety's makes your night want to go on forever.

So we thunk hmm, Ye's is pretty much right across the street and people seem to like it on Yelp so why not.  We had no reservation, but that no longer dissuades us.

On the stairs down were two couples ahead of us.  I poked my head in past them and the lovely hostess said we can get you in in 15 minutes or so and that's like a fraction of Double Chicken so we were all yes.  We will wait on the stairs.  Then one of the couples left and the other was seated and bam just like that in we went.

So much fun.  Seriously.  The space is small but not cramped and cozy.  The staff are over the top nice and prompt and fun and even saved the young lady at the next table from drinking her candle by mistake after doing that shot.  Saved the day!  

Drinks are inventive and the food for our second supper delicious.  We had the noodles and the chicken on fire or something like that.  The lights were low so I didn't get that fire meant hella hot peppers errywhere on the plate but after the first mouthful I looked closer and the fire died down.

Zero hesitation to recommend Ye's.  I really wanted to love this place.  So I did.
Amazing baijou driinks! Especially loved the sour Shanghai 75 and the forbidden city. Most interesting and innovative drinks here.
Super cute place!! Drinks are innovative and the Nightingale is soooo good esp if you like rosemary

Very nice date night spot with Asian inspired drinks. Me and my girlfriend were seated immediately on a Saturday night at around midnight. We got the monkey king and the mid autumn special: the hojicha Collin's.

Both beautiful in presentation and tasty. Highly recommend!

Overhyped speakeasy - always wanted to come here and when I did the drinks weren't even that great to be honest.  We were a group of 4 and let's say all four of the drinks were not good so that says a lot.  

Didn't try their food menu so this is only for the drinks experience

We chanced upon this spot walking around les, and it didn't disappoint. The ambiance was ridiculously cool and aesthetic, you can interpret it as overwhelming or eye candy.

We got a table almost immediately for drinks and they were pleasant, but took some time. Would recommend for a date night.

It is a cozy setting with dimmed lights and antique Chinese decor. The cocktails, based on Chinese ingredients, have a good selection from strong to weak with different liquor bases.  The chicken wings were very flavorful and tender, slightly spicy which helped enhance the flavor.

Came here on a Wednesday night with some friends without a reservation but the host was very kind and was able to seat us right away. The drinks are strong and phenomenal. Strongly recommend birds nest, the remedy, Shanghai 75. I would definitely come back for food because it smells really good when other tables ordered food. The host was very helpful in making drink recommendations.

Drinks: 5/5
Price: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5

Besides their disappointing dry, hard and crispy tofu, I love this place. The service was great and the place really had a theme going on with its dark vibes and warm red and orange lights.  

If you love duck, be prepared to smell the aroma of duck fried rice here. Not only did it smell good, it tasted great!

The cocktails were very good and strong here. I don't remember the names of what I had but the drink with the yellow lollipop was my favorite! Will defs get that again.
This place is so nice and love the atmosphere. Come through there's plenty of space. They close around 1 and they have great asian inspired drinks

Easily made a res for 7:30 on a weeknight and came by after eating a quick dinner next door at Okiboru. Drinks were hit or miss. I tried:

+ The remedy
+ Bird's nest
+ Desert flower
+ Monkey king
+ HK milk punch

The bird's nest and milk punch were the best drinks. Would skip the desert flower next time. The rest were decent.

Vibe was great (the decor is very fun) and service was good. Overall would recommend for a chill cocktail spot.

Insane. absolutely insanely delicious. The drinks will definitely get the job done QUICK!

see ordered almost everything on the menu and it was killer. The best szechaun spot in manhattan! service was incredible and i just can't emphasize how great the food was. wontons and crispy beef were my favorite.

Had a great time here for a date night! We went on Friday at around 5:30 with a reservation. The area is small and cozy, and I will say we had to talk a little louder to hear each other but other than that it was a great vibe. I loved the decor and the theme of the place and the food/drinks did not disappoint. It was also in a great location, so walking around after to digest was fun to do :)

WHAT WE ATE:
- Cucumber Salad
- Scallion Pancakes
- Beef street skewers
- Golden Corn

WHAT WE DRANK:
- HK Milk Punch
- Monkey King

We went the small plate route so it felt very tapas style. Each dish was about $15, and even though it felt like little food we were so full with just this. The golden corn was the highlight of the meal -- big fan of salted duck egg covered things so I would highly recommend. The drinks were so unique and so fun to drink also. I would recommend these two drinks for people who like a slightly sweet but still refreshing cocktail!
Amazing, creative, and strong drinks! Mine had a nice spicy kick in it as well. Love the location and scallion pancake. Saw it on instagram, and can confirm it is worth the hype!

Really fun (4 hour) visit with skilled & super welcoming Josh & Jose manning the bar. The drinks were sophisticated & delicious. We had several drinks (5? ) including the Rice Grog, Earl Grey Gimlet, Martini & a couple off menu creations.

The food, which we hadn't planned on, was a wonderful surprise! Crispy Szechuan beef, Godmother's Chicken Wings & Yuzu fried baby shrimp were ALL delicious. A very memorable visit.

I highly recommend Ye's Apothecary but I'd suggest a pre 7pm arrival as there are no reservations & it's not a large place.
Super yummy and would highly recommend! The vibes are immaculate and food paired well with the cocktails. Super unique. Our server bandy was excellent

Took the always great, little wait, 5:00 weekday opportunity to hit this amazingly decorated craft cocktail spot.

This cocktail menu is wildly creative and geared toward those who are looking to get outside what they're used to. The good news is the bartenders are happy to explain the menu quite thoroughly.

Can't wait to go back and add some food, it definitely smelled amazing.

I came here 2-3 times. I would only come here for the drinks. They are small but strong. Very creative.

The food is mediocre.
Either too sweet, or two salty.
Crab was under salted. Do NOT come for the food. The ambience was nice tho.

Service was good tho.
We got the Szechwan beef but I was soooo sweet and not spicy. And super hard (over fried).
We also got the soft shell crab which came with a super sweet sauce and wasn't seasoned.

They were able to switch us out for the spicy chicken tho, it was spicy but super salty and soggy.

Come here for the drinks and vibes only.

Awesome cocktail bar, the food is always on pint as well as the drinks. My friend and I tried the garlic prawns and they were perfectly cooked and well seasoned.

The employees are so accommodating, they gave us suggestions and answered all of our questions and concerns.

Will definitely return!

sometimes i think im treated too well in life, so i come to ye's apothecary to get humbled and treated like ass once in a while

but honestly i rarely ever give one stars - i've given 3 before - and almost never about service (the only one about service was mcdonald's). but please check out the reviews for this place on google or yelp - the food is fine, but the service is absolutely atrocious.

our waitress came around every 5 minutes demanding us to order more food or more drinks. if we said we were ok, they would say extremely passive aggressively, "we're going to take away your plates then," even though we were midway through eating and the plate was half full of food. we told them that we still had half of our dish left; they would glare at us, walk away, come back 5 minutes later, and repeat the same phrase. at the end, they refused to let us tip less than 20% - not an enforced rule, but the waitress held onto the payment machine and blocked us from hitting the "custom tip" for less than 20% LOL. wtf?

the really weird thing is we had a 2 hr table reserved from 7-9pm (for the correct amount of people too, it's not like we squeezed in extras) and this started happening at 8:10pm. it's also not like we barely ordered anything and were just taking up space - we ordered $200 of food between 5 people. i'm not sure what you can do to get treated normally here...

honesty, i'm quite torn. this is the most caustic review i've ever left at a place by a large margin, and i almost always err on the side of the restaurant, but we were honestly shocked by the service we had at this establishment - hands down the worst we've experienced in the city (or honestly really anywhere, except maybe the Philadelphia McDonald's that is now shut down?)

I really liked the interior, definitely less of a speakeasy vibe and more of a cocktail lounge but I enjoyed the decor! The drinks my friend and I got were a little off and not exactly what either of wanted. He got the old fashioned and I got the sichuan old fashioned and I got the Shanghai 75. The old fashioned was extremely spice-y in a cinnamon/clove way that was a little too aggressive for our liking and the Shanghai 75 tasted like a green apple jolly rancher. Overall not my favorite and I probably wouldn't choose to come back here over other cocktail spots any time soon.

Vibey place for date night. Dark, moody and very empty on a tuesday night at 6pm. Ordered shanghai 75, very strong and very delicious! Perfect "sour" drink. My favorite dish was the chili fish. I thought that could be in a sandwich. It was so crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. It made me sweat and I can tolerate spice. The yuzu shrimp came in second for me. I dont think I tasted enough yuzu nor was it spicy but I'm glad I tried it anyway. The pork belly was underwhelming for me. I didn't like the sweetness of it.

Definitely want to come back and try the other food items on the menu but the prices are a steep for me because the portions are small.

Food portions are small but priced accordingly. Can share a lot of food with friends.

The baijiu cocktails here are very good. Perhaps the best ive tried in new york.
Great food and drinks!!! Super fun flavors I enjoyed the hk milk punch and monkey king

I love the decor here and the ambiance. Chinese fusion speakeasy type of bar with cushy couches. The food smelled soooo good but I was already full and just getting drinks. Next time I will have to get the food!

I loved the Monkey King!!! Pandan, banana, rum. It was so fragrant and never lost its taste even as the ice melted. I also got the HK milk punch which was good but kinda wish the cream on top wasn't so thick, I had to find ways to get it out of the glass. But still -- SO delicious -- the cream was probably the best part of the drink. Then I got the Bird's Nest which was light and refreshing, but my heart still belongs to the Monkey King.
Mango chicken and garlic prawns were delicious! Shanghai 75 was light and refreshing. Would definitely recommend for an intimate vibe and good eats!

Was in NYC to visit our daughter and knew what I had to do: get a freshly baked (never fried!) knish from Yonah Schimmel's.

I've ordered many Schimmel knishes over the past couple of years and had them shipped to me in San Diego via Goldbelly. And my daughter's brought a bunch to me when she comes to visit. But I had never bought one myself at the shop.

That changed this past Sunday morning. I went with a kasha, which is my personal favorite, then took it to Bar Verde up the street where my wife and daughter were having nachos and coffee for brunch.

In a word, it was DELICIOUS.

I don't do the mustard thing, but Bar Verde's homemade habanero salsa was the perfect accompaniment to Yonah Schimmel's homemade knish.

I suspect I'll be eating these things until the day I die -- they're THAT good.

Well, first time at this long running knish business that sells amazing products.  We had passed by the other day and saw some trays of goodies in the window.  As luck would have it, our travels brought us here before stopping at Katz's so we had to check it out.  While there was nothing in the window and the sign did display open, we thought they were closed.  Thankfully no and they had product in the back.

While the savory knishes sounded good, we settled on the blueberry one.

It's got some hefty to it and I'm curious to know what is all in the filling.  It has the tartness and creaminess of cream cheese which is probably one of the ingredients along with farmers cheese.

It's decadent and something I'm going to savor slowly.  The "crust" is very thin similar to a crepe.

Definitely give this place a try and continue to support this local business.  I'll be back for more!

One thing that I hope never changes is the potato knish from Yonah Shimmel. About the size of a bagel, and fluffy potato, so not heavy. It makes a satisfying side dish for a meal or a very substantial snack. Even my finicky relatives never having tried one love them.

I do too.

This is such a great spot. Hit up Yonah Shimmel's for some real authentic knishes! We tried 3 flavors, the classic potato, spinach, and one of the specials which was cheddar jalapeño - everything was delicious!

The staff were super friendly. This is a great hole-in-the-wall LES classic spot.

Best knishes around. In a class of it's own.
Strictly takeout when we were there in Se 2023.
A hole in the wall this establishment takes you back in time.

We ordered and ate red cabbage potato knish,
Potato knish, kasha knish and  jalapeño cheddar.

We all couldn't get enough of the stuffed knishes.
We love potatoes and this is the only place that still makes them like they did years ago.

Pre Covid we ate the sweet dessert knishes which were pleasantly tasty and delicious.

It's a real treat for us.
We were disappointed they weren't making egg creams.

Overrated and overpriced.

The elderly guy behind the counter/cash register was not friendly nor welcoming.

Mushroom knish was all potato with three errant pieces of mushroom lost in the mounds of potato mash. Lacked salt, seasoning, and taste. Just a bland pile of mashed potato. Not a fan.

They were out of many knish items. Sweet cheese was not bad. But so tiny for $5.50z

No bathroom for customers. Thank goodness there's a Whole Foods a block away.

I reviewed this place, and noted how much smaller the knishes I received via Goldbelly were as compared to the ones we  purchased in person many times over the last few decades.  I was accused of mis-recollection.  The replacement knishes they sent were a little bigger by a couple of ounces each.  My memory isn't perfect, but I sure as heck know what my family has been purchasing for many, many years.

One of the few legacy kosher jewish spots left in the lower east side.

The knishes here are the best you will ever have and have people coming back for more all the time. If you are in the area you have to stop by this historic spot and grab a knish.... Sooo good
My first knish! So filling and tasty! This quaint shop has been there for over 113 years! Go in and give it a try, and if your an old hand at knishes, go anyway!

I enjoyed the Lower East Side food tour and this was our first stop and our meeting spot. Although the knish was large enough to share I have to say it was OK but not something I am a big fan of to be honest. Of course it was interesting to be at a business that had been around since 1910. I enjoyed the history more than I enjoyed the knish.

First time trying a knish! My brother-in-law, sister-in-law, hubby and myself stopped by Yonah Schimmel's Knish Bakery to pick up a few knishes to-go.
My brother-in-law has had many of the knishes on the menu and highly recommended the fruit and cheese selections. We ordered 1 blueberry and cheese, 1 apple and cheese, 2 cherry and cheese. The only one I tried was the blueberry and cheese knish. It was delicious, especially after 20 seconds in the microwave. This knish was hefty! The dough was dense and smooth. The blueberry filling was slightly sweet and was perfect with the cream cheese. I really enjoyed it! It can be eaten for breakfast, a snack or dessert. I can't wait to try another flavor next time I'm in NYC.

A piece of NYC history! These knishes are amazing. Flaky, tender crust on the outside with hearty, creamy filling on the inside. I tried the sweet potato, potato, and spinach. All excellent! It's no wonder they've been going strong since 1910.

My best friend placed a mail order with Gold Belly.

They arrived and we heated them up. They came out perfectly done. My friend, his wife and I each had one and we ALL agreed. Meh is being generous. Almost flavorless and to say I've had better is a dumb statement - every knish I've ever had, and I grew up near a Jewish deli, has been better than these.

$79.00 for 6 knishes. What kind of effery is that?

As Jewish people around the world say, "Never again."

A knish is a traditional Jewish snack of dough and filling.  Yonah Schimmel has been around NYC since 1910, and are some of the best!

I had the potato and the vegetable, served hot.  It was like comfort food served in a palm-sized cake.  Perfect on a blustery, cool day.  So fresh and seasoned and tasty!

They also had cabbage, broccoli, sweet potato, mushroom, jalapeño and cheddar or mozzarella.  They also have sweeter knishes, such as blueberry, apple, chocolate, cherry.

Humble storefront, and indoor dining is closed, but many nearby benches and parks to enjoy.

I travel for business.  So good that I shipped an order of 12 best sellers to my husband back home through GoldBelly.

Cheap and fantastic.  And when I went on a Saturday afternoon, no line.  Don't pass this up.

Been going here for many years and the quality is still superb. The only thing I'm disappointed in is that their knishes have shrunk in recent times. It's a real pet peeve when any establishment does this. Other than that, I still love them.

I just have 1 special request - Please bring them back to their original size even if you have to charge slightly more. It's understandable during these challenging economic times.

I can't even remember the last time I had a knish.

Yonah Schimmel's knishes remind me of the old school ones I use to eat as a youth. Mrs. Stahl's in Brighton Beach had the best knishes around. And yet I have a found a new love.

The interior is similar too, barebones and stainless steel kitchenware, maybe a little worse for wear but in the way that marks a New York City institution.

I ordered three knishes: potato, cherry cheese, and blueberry cheese [$4.25 each]. I've always been biased toward a cheese knish. It's kind of like a more savory cheesecake, at least in my mind anyway.

These knishes are THICKKK and hearty. They are an excellent size. Like someone else said, the potato knish really does taste like mashed potatoes, the kind you crave the day before Thanksgiving. The cherry cheese and blueberry cheese knishes are stuffed to capacity with cheese [slightly sweet but not too much] and oozy cherry or blueberry filling- think warm pie that came straight from the oven. The crust on all the knishes are doughy, flakey, and perfect.

This is really the epitome of knishery.

So delicious!
Best Kinishbive ever had. The bakery is takeout only these days but that doesn't stop people from lining up out the door and down the street for these savory and sweet Kinish. Great for a snack or lunch.

Yonah Schimmel's Knish Bakery is an iconic Lower East Side establishment serving up Knishs and other Jewish comfort foods since 1890. We tried the speciality of the day, a mozzarella jalapeño Knish as well as a spinach and blueberry Knish. They all came warm and ready to devour and were as delicious as they looked. Yonah Schimmel's is the place to get a Knish when you're craving one

The knish was most excellent. So many options what can you say. Me it's basic potato with mustard.
Only issue we had was place is still had full Covid in place. Sitting area was blocked off and it was February.
Kid allowed us to eat there in the front, it was cold outside.  Will do again but in warmer weather.

I'm glad I had the opportunity to get knishes from Yonah Schimmel's, seeing as it is one of the last remnants of the Lower East Side's historical businesses. I was pretty disappointed by the knishes though, as they were totally lacking in the traditional baked dough crust ... they were truly just thick (but not large) mashed potato patties with a few bits of the specified adjunct mixed in. Very weird.
The reference knish. I picked up four in person last November and heated them up at home for a little longer than their website suggests. It's the standard against which I measure all knishes.

I had never had a knish before, so figured this NY institution was the best place to try it first. With nothing to compare it to, I thought it was pretty good! The potato could have used a little seasoning (of which there was none), but it was a substantial snack and the mushroom variety I had was a nice compliment to the base knish. If looking for a quick snack nearby, worth giving it a try!

The..best...knishes. period. I've gone through knish phases where we'd buy a pack and just eat those. I've also had them at Kat'z Deli but none of them compare to their knish in taste or size. Literally a hole in the wall and looks like it was built in the 30's but stopped by here just out of curiosity and saw all the reviews.
They sell a lot of savory and sweet knishes. They also sell merch should you want a keepsake. Make sure to ask for mustard on the side and they'll heat it up for you if you want to eat on the spot. Definitely recommend.

Cute little Jewish bakery read in downtown Manhattan. We'd never had a Knish Before stopping here and actually only came by because the place looked good when we walked past.

The knish, as we found out, is one part bread with some fruit and about seven parts warm cream cheese. We grabbed a cherry one and a blueberry one to share between the five of us. Admittedly, we all thought afterwards that it would've been good to get a savory one in addition to a sweet one, but c'est la vie. I'd be very interested to eat one of these after it had some time to cool. While the pastry was delicious, there was basically a half a stick of cream cheese sitting at the bottom of this, and it was a little bit overwhelming.

The place definitely has some history, and they're obviously doing things well or they wouldn't have been around for as long as they have been. We got to eat our Knishes watching a bunch of people play basketball at a park next-door and that made for a pretty solid afternoon.

As of late June, 2022, they're still takeout only, so the dining room is blocked off and I couldn't photograph it.

Everything is good here, so beyond skipping things you never like anywhere, don't limit yourself to just the wonderful classic potato. I just tried the potato and red cabbage blend, and it's a winner!

Other than Zabar's, Yonah Schimmel has the best bagels and knishes, anywhere. The key is the kasha and baking the bagel the proper amount of time.

Most places sell bagels that come frozen, half baked on a speed rack. Schimmel's makes theirs fresh and from scratch. As a professionally trained baker I have made bagels and there are no shortcuts to getting the properly browned outside (crust) with a soft and chewy, not underbaked, inside (crumb).

Bagels are not hamburger buns, they should not be pillowy at all. They also should never be toasted, unless they are stale, imho. They should be re-heated at 275F in a regular or convection oven and served immediately. Never microwave a bagel!

The variety of knishes available at Shimmel's is the largest I have ever seen. When I lived in Tribeca, we would walk to Houston Street every Sunday morning to stock up for the week. Now, when I am in Manhattan, I make it a point to do the same thing and carry them home on the plane.

You can order them too. Knishes can be frozen (I wouldn't do that with bagels) and gently reheated at home.

This is a treasure and I am thankful they are still there. New York would not be the same without them.

I had a red cabbage knish, and it was so great. The knish is like a mashed potato in its warm and comfort and texture inside, but the vegetal sweetness comes through from the cabbage and the thin outside has a pastry flake to it.
They kindly heated it for me and waited for me to get cash at a nearby ATM ($10 minimum to use a card!). I can't wait to go back.

Another favorite stop whenever I am home.  My goto is the kasha knish.  my family loves the potato.  their veggie knishes are excellent too:  broccoli, sweet potato, red cabbage and spinach. I have yet to get their sweet knishes.  Dear Yelpers, come get a knish.  You will not be disappointed.

This is my first time ever having a knish. Literally didn't even know what a knish was. We got the potato and spinach knish. I don't know why we chose pretty much the plainest knishes they had. The potato knish tasted like a little bit firmer version of a mashed potato. The spinach knish tasted like a little bit firmer version of a mashed potato with spinach.

I'm sure if we chose better flavors the knish would have been much better. But even so, I'll give it 5 stars because who does't love a firmer version of mashed potatoes? Potatoes are great.

First time having knishes, it remind me of potato pie. Personally didn't love it. Had the potato one and the jalapeño. Of the two, I like the second one better. The potato was too salty. Wish the staff had been more friendly and helpful with suggestions.

I've been holding off writing a review until I made it through all of the knishes that I ordered, but that might take a while.

So, I'll post more pics as I consume them....if I remember to....but I'll tell you that these knishes are authentic perfection. They're just the right size - and the traditional potato and kasha are exactly how I remember from when I was a kid.

There are MANY varieties to choose from. I've never had a sweet potato knish - until now. DUDE!!! I think it's my favorite so far. I mean, I love the regular potato and kasha....but the sweet potato is off the hook. It's ALMOST a dessert....so. good.

I've sent these knishes to several family members and friends. I haven't tried one of the cheese-based sweet knishes (yet!), but my dad said that it's super rich and rather fabulous. Some of the combinations I spied were: chocolate-cheese, blueberry-cheese, cherry-cheese and just sweet cheese. Yes, please...to the cheese!

I used Goldbelly to order these for myself and others. Yes - you'll pay more when using Goldbelly. But I'm living like a hermit currently and go almost nowhere. Worth every penny - and - everyone that received them as gifts have raved about 'em.

Best knish and such a good snack. Got the original potato knish, comes heated if you want and with mustard. The combination is amazing and it's so hearty, potato is soft and dense but warm so it's perfect on a somewhat moderate temperature day.

Have cash ready because they don't take credit card for under $10? (I think I don't remember specifically).

There's plenty of other flavors so I will definitely be back- the raspberry one looked really good too.

Jalapeno Cheddar Knish --- so good! (Daily Special).
Top half was the best because the sliced of cheddar and jalapeno add that cheesy spicy flavor.
Bottom half was more just the potato, would love it more if there are more jalapeno bits mixed in so the spicy kick is there every bite.
YUMMMY

Yonah Schimmel's is a NYC classic, but somehow it took me seven years of living here to stop by. Potato knish was definitely solid, but my favorite was the broccoli knish. Perfect for a quick breakfast or snack!

I returned to Yonah Schimmel's 2 weeks ago and was both surprised at the rise in knish prices ... now $5.50 per knish. The two young men doing counter work were slo-o-w. Buying a dozen knishes and getting one free one came to nearly $70.00. The knishes are smaller and lack the knish taste I associated with Schimmel knishes. I don't think I'm returning to Schimmel's Knishery anymore.

Ok wow. Best place to get a bite in the area. By far the most delicious and healthy snack u can find, I'd argue in New York. This spot has some great history and even better food, and feels like a truly classic New York gem.

I recommend the potato and spinach classic knishes, and maybe either ask for some mustard or walk a couple minutes to Russ and daughters for some condiments.

AMAZING.

I grew up on knishes and want to love this place given its history. But I recently bought a dozen knishes, a mix of sweet and savory, and found them mediocre. The sweet potato knish, a savory, was so sweet it tasted like cough syrup. The shell was so crumbly it fell off. The vegetable knishes had a weird taste. The knishes that were actually meant to be sweet had too much of that cheese you'd find in blintzes. The price of the knishes here is very high relative to Jewish delis. I agree with other reviewers: Overrated and overpriced. I much prefer the knishes I buy weekly at the farmer's market (from an Italian bakery no less!). I won't be returning.

This was a fun shop to visit during our walk around the Lower East Side. We were there late in the day so unfortunately a lot of their options were sold out; recommend going earlier in the day if you want more variety. We got the basic potato Knishes and they were warm and very flavorful.
Received a 6 pack by gold belly. Brought back lots of memories. Delicious even frozen.

Knish is potato ball. I got the regular flavor (potato) and it was really bland. They have a wide variety of flavors varying from sweet to savory. I heard they are more known for their sweet knish. I.e. chocolate and cheese.

I can't claim that knishes are part of my heritage or that I had one before I came to New York but I've been here 20 years and I've had many. The knishes that I had from this shop were some of the best that I've had. I recently enjoyed the potato knish and the mushroom knish. Both were excellent. Tasty, sustaining, meatless, portable, affordable and great for the cold weather. The history with these, I wonder if it's like the original fast food from the old country. But what do I know? Cheap and delicious!
Cheese knish with blueberries is what the angels brought from from Heaven as a teaser.

NYC Jewish bakery/deli that is over 100 years old (it has been there since 1910), and that specializes in knishes. I'd never had a knish before coming here, and I was pleasantly surprised. It is basically the jewish version of a perogi/dumpling/blintze. They have a wide variety of Knish, as well as a few classic drinks options. I tried both a potato knish (the classic one) as well as a blueberry and cheese knish. I preferred the blueberry/cheese. There is some seating inside as well. 10$ minimum for credit cards

8.5

It doesn't matter if you're a lifelong lover of these delicious pastries or you've never had a knish in your life - there's a flavor here for everyone. My family has been enjoying Yonah Schimmel's knishes for generations, and it's must-go for every trip I take to NYC. My absolute favorite dish in the world is kasha varnishkes, so obviously, I gravitated to the kasha knishes, but having never tried a sweet knish, I ventured for the cherry cheese, and it didn't disappoint!

If you want to be surrounded by culinary history, if you want to drown your sorrows in the most comforting of comfort foods, or if you just need a quick snack, Yonah Schimmel's has got you covered.

Absolutely no frills to this old school spot, but nothing but 100% quality inside the door of Yonah Schimmel's. I stumbled upon the bakery by accident one day while walking around the LES & decided to throw caution to the wind & see what they had to offer. Before discovering Schimmel's, I didn't even know that many varieties of knishes existed!

Since that first time, I've made it a point to return anytime I'm in the area. I've never had a bad knish experience from them. You can never go wrong with the classic potato knish paired with spicy brown mustard, but I encourage you to explore some of the other options they have available. If you want my suggestion, go for the onion & garlic knish. The knishes are rather large and hearty, definitely will fill you up. They also have a few other non-knish menu items, but I can't speak to them personally.

Pro tip: A few doors down, there is a basketball court with steps. I recommend grabbing a knish & sitting on those steps during a nice spring/summer day while people watching for peak enjoyment.

They've been open almost 110 years & it's no wonder why. I'm so happy to see that they are surviving during the pandemic & didn't shutter like so many other small business have. If you're not local, they also offer delivery via Goldbelly!

Randomly stopped to try their knish.. tried the blueberry, apple, spinach, and jalapeño.
The blueberry was fresh from the oven and was by far the favorite. The apple was good, but not as good as blueberry!  The jalapeño fell short of expectations, but the spinach was a good choice.
Definately will stop again and again.
Cool blast of LES history.  Knishes are great.  They are an occasional treat and great to share with others.   It used to be reasonable to ship them but now it is not.  Only get them when in NYC.

So despite being a major NY bitch I haven't been fortunate enough to savor the sights and sounds of a genuine NY bagel in a hot mf'ing minute. I had to take advantage of my fleeting presence in the mother land recently for my tongue to caress that sacred crisp dough. This place was around the corner and sounded Jewish enough.

It's pretty old school and don't expect to be impressed by the ambiance.

There's a bunch of shit in the glass case by the entrance. It's hot as BAWLLS in here during the summer and I was surprised to discover there is actually AC.

There were NO EVERYTHING BAGELS LEFT! It's always a toss up in that situation between sesame and poppy but I did what I always do and deferred to my GF for the tough decisions in life. She went with sesame. We had that bad boy toasted and stuffed with cream cheese.

Our eye was caught by the knishes and we ordered a jalapeno cheddar.

The bagel was DELISH. Crisp on the outside, soft on the inside. The cream cheese was tasty and squeezed out all over you when you bit down. Classic.

The knish was literally on fire as it had just been removed from heat but this was delicious as well. Can never get enough starch and simple carbs #carbsafterdark #carbthefuckup

This is a gem and if I lived nearby or in NY in general probably I would be 800 lbs.

Really nice little knish bakery, tasty, cheap, and filling. The potato knish is a must. The sweet knish is nice too, super rich, the entire knish is filled with cheese.
I've also heard good things about the sweet potato knish, red cabbage, and mix veggies.
Kasha knish is blend but got a strong buckwheat flavor, which is a bit weird for my taste.

I thought my favorite go-to "NY food" will be bagel until I tried Knish. I never even heard of Knish until I arrived in NY (pardon me if perhaps I'm not particularly that cultured) but I'm curious and have been wanting to try it for a while so this was my first time ever. I didn't have much expectation at first. I thought it will taste like English pie but with potato filling. Thick, buttery, flaky dough on the outside (which I'm not a huge fan of because often it's so dense) with thick dense potato filling (which I expect to be kind of dry too). Not that I want to have such a negative expectation, it's just usually potato patty (like Irish bubble and squeak) tends to be dense. Then when I first saw it for real I thought it will be bready / doughy. I was SO WRONG about everything

I got a Sweet Potato Knish. it was served warm. apparently it was very soft. when I first touch it I was surprised. and apparently it smelled so good! Then when I took a bite, I figured it wasn't doughy like bread or thick like pie either. I don't know how to describe it well but it's thin and soft, and the fillings was super generous. Unlike what I thought, the fillings are soft, warm, fluffy, comforting, mashed sweet potato (with some chunks) that tastes very scrumptious! It's so light and does not feel too much at all. It's anything but dense and dry. I finish the whole thing in a breeze and the portion was just right! I can't wait to try more flavor!

on a side note, the place is not too big and might not seem like much from the outside but the staff is friendly and helpful. i think the price can be considered pretty cheap.

I'm not sure if this place is Authentic Japanese or not but the sushi was pretty delicious.
I got delivery from this place and it came pretty quickly. I order 2 spicy tuna rolls, Philly roll and a shrimp tempura roll.  The rolls were HUGE! I was shocked because of how low the prices were.  I do however feel that too much rice was used so it kind of took away from some of the taste.
If you are in the neighborhood and looking for a quick fix, this should be your go to place.

Delivery was quick from Seamless Web. Never actually dined in here though. My roommate and I were hungry last weekend so we chose a new place in the hood. We ordered a rainbow roll, spicy tuna rolls, and salmon rolls. I also ordered Shrimp "Japanese Style" Fried rice. It was definitely not Japanese style. The fish was pretty fresh tasting, but I felt as if the place is not Authentic Japanese, but owned by Chinese. Also our spicy tuna rolls were one giant piece with a bunch of spicy tuna on top for 2.50. That was unexpected.

I don't know if we will order from them again, but who knows?

I came for lunch and the atmosphere was nice, but definitely rather bland. It was empty at around 4:30 pm on a rainy day. I ordered the sushi deleux which was alright. The portion sizes were good and the sushi was quite fresh, but nothing spectacular. Price wise, I wasn't too impressed, I still had some room left and my bill was at 17 bucks! Even for Manhatten prices I felt this was a bit much. Washrooms were acceptable (if you've read my posts this is always my "must see"). They have mochi for dessert, which is a KEY japanese dessert (doe around icecream)... unfortunately they did not have it that day, but I'm sure they will.

So all and all the menu seems alright, nothing outrageous but they seem to have a few interesting rolls (though served at other restaurants), and not quite the flare. The staff were friendly and considerate.

Still worth a try!

Terrific! Fresh, delicious fish. The people there are really nice and they throw in free stuff with the more money you spend.

Plus, they have a lot of different fun special rolls. Who doesn't love fun special rolls?

I went to this place back in June hoping for a quick sushi fix (being that there aren't the greatest options for sushi in LES, let's be serious)....NOPE! sorry....this place was disgustingly horrible!

Not only did they take 40 minutes to bring me a bowl of chirashi, but the salmon AND tuna were still FROZEN....that's right....FROZEN by the time it got to me!! you'd imagine after making us wait 40 minutes for fish that doesn't need to be cooked it'd taste golden....NOPE! and I already wasn't the biggest fan of salmon sashimi so you can imagine how i feel about it now....

This place should be shut down.

To say the least, I will not be venturing anywhere near this joint again!

Hmmmm. Let's see..  After not finding any reviews here since 2011- I took a chance and ordered delivery.
I just hope that  I am not gonna get sick as I am sure they don't sell much of the fish without business.
Rolls were not good looking. Not good tasting.
Shrimp shumai was good but too small for this price. Seaweed salad was good but VERY small. More iceberg lettuce then seaweed ....

No, no, no. The few times I didn't look at Yelp or Zagat turned into an epic failure, and this is definitely one of them.

The place has a few tables that aren't jam-tight and there's liteFM on. Mango chicken's not available (but on their special menu), the sushi was mediocre at best, and there were barely any limp mushrooms or carrots on my $10 flavorless vegetable yakiudon.

One star for service and cleanliness.

I used to frequent Gracefully on Ave A - RIP :( :( - but after 4 visits am really into E&S so far. Their sandwiches could be $1-2 cheaper but are still worth it, and love the variety. I also appreciate the selection of healthier snacks and treats, as well as smoothies and juices! Those prices definitely beat places like juice press.

I'm not sure what kind of "service" people are expecting from a neighborhood bodega, but my experiences have been pretty typical for an nyc deli, if not better. You order and pay and get out, i don't care if they say a special hello or get off the phone, they're just selling goods not a restaurant.
Place used to be better. The cook doesnt listen and there is 100 flies in the place now. Really used to like it but it's just not it anymore.

The owners of this store take advantage of customers in a very vile manner.

Came in yesterday and bought a cool new CBD drink by VYBES in a peach ginger flavor for $7.99 each. I loved it so much & hadn't seen it sold near my hood in Gramercy so I checked Yelp and saw they delivered. Wonderful news, right? However...

Called to place the order and they delivered me 3 bottles this evening. When the delivery man hands me the receipt, each bottle says $9.50 plus tax. EXCUSE ME? I know exactly what the owners were doing and it's up-charging a customer just because he feels like it.

The delivery man called the store and the owner says it's fine just let her have it for $7.99, I declined to keep or pay for the drinks because I won't give my business to any store that is owned by greedy, dishonest men.

You could've made a lottttt of money from me guys. But instead, you thought I was a dummy. I'll order VYBES by the case straight from their website from now on. I was trying to support local businesses for god sakes! Shame on Your Wholesome Foods.

Hands down the worst customer service I have ever encountered. I ordered delivery on grub hub from their deli (called Milly's) and EXPLICITLY wrote "ALLERGY: no mustard" in the order notes and it came with mustard. Usually not that big of a deal, places generally redeliver if they make a mistake, but not this place. They refused to redeliver the sandwich because it wasn't worth the delivery person's time to deliver one sandwich. That's actually what they told me. (I had tipped 20% on the original order and would gladly have tipped a second delivery person--it's not the delivery person's fault.) I will never order from this place again and you shouldn't either, especially if you have allergies and need an ingredient left off.

Great place to order delivery for some really great breakfast and lunch sandwiches.  The chicken club (chicken, bacon, lettuce, mayo) is my favorite.  They also have huge, fresh salads that you can customize to your liking.  Their chicken caeser wrap is also super good.  The food pretty much never disappoints which I feel like is rare when ordering delivery.  Definitely one of our go to's for a while now. Only complaint is we have had a couple issues where they are out of something (everything bagel) and they just choose to sub it with whatever they think instead of calling.  Similarly, one day half of our order was missing and it was because they said they weren't making breakfast food however they never called to see if we wanted to adjust as needed.

Used to love it here. I work nearby and go everyday. However, today, in the midst of chewing something hard and strange in my salad, I spat out this huge cockroach / cricket. Not sure what it is, but neveR ever ever will I walk in there

This place is FILTHY. during this pandemic we are in, we all should be  5x, 10x better in cleanliness and hygiene. But maybe they missed the memo. I ordered a juice. As the worker prepares the fruits, he drops an apple on the floor, but proceeds juicing it anyway without even washing it. I couldn't believe what I saw. They should be reported to the health department. If they are doing this in front of customers, imagine what they are doing when no one is looking. BEWARE.

Ordered on Seamless. After an hour past the delivery window, had to leave for a meeting and called to tell them I wouldn't be here when the food came. Was told I would get a refund, it's been a week, called them asking when I would get the refund. Said they never bothered to look for my order to refund it. Don't do business with this place, when they screw up, they don't own up for it.

Never catering my meetings again or ordering with
these liars.

The deli man is the most kind hearted, hardworking guy and he makes great sandwiches! All the staff is sweet and they have the cutest cat, Millie. The store has pretty much everything. I had to write a Yelp review of this place because of how amazing the staff is. Give them your business!

One of my favorite deli's in the lower east side. They have very decent prices on regular foods,Ben n Jerry's, chips, frozen foods, drinks, alcohol, etc They're freshly cooked food is amazing and the best price you'll find in NYC. They stop cooking around 9pm so plan ahead. The cooks are usually the same and they work fast. Love these guys

Philly cheese steak
Mexican quesadilla's
Chicken pesto wrap
All bomb

This place is awful! I ordered a ham and cheese sandwich on a hero paid 7.00 dollars for it and when I went to eat my sandwich it had literally one slice of ham in it. I took it back and the guy behind the counter making the sandwich's said oh I thought it was a ''breakfast sandwich''.Am not really sure what that meant but said he would make me another I gave him the one that was given to me and he said he would redo it. when I got back to work to eat my sandwich it was stuffed with a different brand of ham that was totally a different color! I just decided to trash it! No sense it going back they clearly don't care about their customers!

So annoyed!

They always try and rip you off with prices and each day the price is never the same. Never consistent. The deli guy behind the counter thinks he's a big shot and always has an attitude. You work in a deli man, you're not doing well.
4 am munchies delivery on a Sunday morning! Arrived promptly. Wraps were delicious. Will order again.

Overpriced but very, very convenient. 24-hour stores have a special place in my heart.

They have a great selection, including a great representation of vegan food; in this neighborhood, you really have to.

When I was staying with a friend a few doors down for a month recently, I spent a lot of bucks here.

These guys are THE BEST. The selection is absurd. There are so many organic/natural products, too, and the delivery is very fast if you live in the LES. Get the meat and cheese on a bagel. Yum. I also love the delivery guys. Friendly and happy and loving their jobs. What a gem. Keep up the good work, Wholesome!

As far as convenience stores go, this is the best place I have been to.

Great wraps/paninis at an awesome price (love chicken salad wrap + cajun chicken panini). Freshly made smoothies/vegetable/fruit drinks that you can't find at this price range anywhere I know in the city (love the incredible juice and rejuvenator).

One of my favorite things here are the freeze dried fruits (kiwi, pineapple, mangoes, etc.) and an ultimate guilty pleasure - chocolate covered potato chips - yeah, its as awesome as it sounds.

a quick tip, order your food directly to the food guy, because sometimes the cashier gets annoyed lol

Anyways, the gold standard of convenience stores.

I don't know why this place only has 1 review. I recently moved away from LES, and of all the famed restaurants/bars/boutiques there, the one place I miss the most is this little market.

I first found it when I lived in lower East Village, and would take the 15min walk here for the $5.75 paninis. Then I moved to a block away from it on Ludlow, and ended up coming to E&S almost everyday. Imagine having a 24/7 mini Whole Foods just around the corner. For its size, they have a pretty good selection of everything: produce, fruits, groceries, beers..etc. My favorite is the $3.5 breakfast sandwhiches, which they serve until noon (after it's $1 more)! The staff is friendly, it's always squeaky clean and it's always open! Minimum for credit card purchases is $10, but they've never given me a hard time when I didn't have enough cash.

Actually writing this review made me realize I kinda regret moving away...

I come here on a daily basis; it is in the perfect location in Lower East Side.

They offer the basics at a gourmet level.  And E & S's grill isn't bad either, offering breakfast goods to sandwiches to quesadillas.  (The prices are pretty reasonable too.)

Further, the service is excellent!  The guys who work the counter are super friendly and helpful.  They are open 24/7 (save for Mondays) - a huge plus!!

I love coming here for my morning/midday/midnight snacks!

New management, oh well. The new management seems to really treat the old staff poorly and ignores you when you come to the counter to pay. They did replace the wonky freezers but they make going there such an unpleasant experience I'd rather go to the new place that opened about a hundred feet south of them.

I am a very, very, very big fan of E & S Wholesome Foods. It's on my way to my yoga studio (at least when I take the bus or subway, or if I decide to walk that way), they stock Harmless Harvest coconut water AND price it at $4.99, not more like other bodegas/delis and they stock green juices and gluten-free snacks AND they make smoothies! Oh, and you can get "healthy" chocolate here (like chocolate covered açaí or goji berries. Or crystallized ginger... Yum.) I mean, how do you not win with this place?

I love coming here pre-yoga to grab a bottle of coconut water and a green juice. And sometimes some candy. The coconut water for during and after my class (and sometimes in between if I'm doing two sessions in a row); the green juice for after class (so I don't overeat after a good vinyasa flow); and the candy to snack on during the week.

The people that work here are always really nice and friendly. I want to try their juices and smoothies one day - maybe even a sandwich or two. But this is like the perfect post/pre workout stop because you can get all the drinks and bars (I like having a Kind bar after sometimes) you need. So check it out!

I'm actually really glad I stopped by this morning to get breakfast. I always pass by before bus to work and today I had time for once. I got your standard fare breakfast and ordered the Casablanca , probably one of the most refreshing smoothies I had in the morning.

This place is a 24/7 market only closed on sundays and mondays.

All in all this is definitely a gem in the neighborhood .

Minimum of 10 dollars use a card

This place is great. I shop and order from here often.

I'd suggest to get take-out if ordering from their menu. The food is great and very low-priced BUT the delivery guy is slower than molasses and dumber than a rock.

Their selection of organic items is impressive for having such a small place. And their beer selection ... don't even get me STARTED SON! It's incredible. They have a small space with about three dozen CRAFT options! (Yes, even non-craft trendy crap beers like PBR, kids ...)

They also make delicious smoothies.

Some people may bitch about the prices but they tend to forget that:

a) We live in NYC
b) You pay a little more for organic items due to the higher QUALITY

Screw Whole Foods. Come here.

Check it out.

The Rejuvenator - beets, ginger, other healthy stuff - saved my life after a night of drinking.

Love their selection of fresh juices and smoothies and the fact they're right around the corner from the apartment I stayed at. The prices are pretty reasonable too.

I totally LOVE this place! Wish it was a bit closer to my apartment but its worth the walk. Wraps and smoothies are a MUST TRY! Prices are reasonable for Organic products and cashier/staff are friendly as well. RECOMMEND!
--
Delivery was very late and the food was cold. No notice was given and the order was wrong. Absolutely horrible experience
ordered the turkey club hero.  Big sandwich and so good with lots of bacon! :-)  I will be ordering again.

The Rejuvenator is like my boyfriend; it is the best out there in the sea of mediocrity.

The Rejuvenator, which contains many fresh ingredients including beets and ginger (my favorites), is spicy and yet comforting (again, like the boy).

Love it.

I work in an area and there are limited options for a good lunch.  This is a go to spot when I have time to hop on the 14A bus, order one of their great wraps and then walk back to the office knowing I'm going to be satisfied.
My friends and I visit this location almost daily.  The environment is always clean. They make the best wraps and smoothies.  On top of that it is all healthy. Holla!

I love E&S. Everything I have every got there was delicious and not too overpriced. I mean, it IS the LES, after all... The veggie juices are my favorite, only second to the dope beer selection. The people who work here are local and hella nice. George is so cute that I'd go just to see him. =) Bring back the pates!!! the mushroom one was the bomb!
I love E+S...The staff is great, and so is their fresh juice selection (also reasonably priced, at $5).  I go almost every day--highly recommended LES deli.
I thought the sandwiches could be a little better quality. (Like better quality ingredients; not the fault of the guy who makes them)

I go to this store every weekend when I come out from the local bars in the neighborhood. I love the food here and not to mention talking it up with the friendly staff at 4am is a plus. If you go to this spot try the Hangover Wrap!

Huge shout out to E&S!  Best, most reasonably priced juices on the LES.  Wish they had wheatgrass, though.  Still, this place is friendly, has free wifi, and decent coffee.  What more can you ask for in a deli?

While there are a some positive things I could say about E&S, it has one fatal flaw: its employees. Some of them are great, Renee in the daytime is awesome.. The others.. they range from ok to downright boycott-worthy (which I have been doing, Freshco across the street has more options anyway).  I understand Spanish, as does my gay ex-roommate who used to live with me - and neither of us are comfortable with the homophobic bs that we have heard  - or the downright rude attitudes of certain employees (not all) in the store.  It's a shame, now I have to cross the street for my food.

Way overpriced. I live near by so I used to go a lot, until one time I went and they said that my card didn't go through the last time I was there. I looked at the items purchased and it obviously wasn't mine, they actually argued with me. When I asked to see the name on the card they told me never mind... Shady. Not to mention its 10 dollars for a six pack of Pabst

You really cannot beat this place. Even after moving out of the neighborhood a few months ago, I still make frequent trips back. The wraps are delicious, the staff is friendly (and eventually will recognize you and remember your order), the store is squeaky clean, their selection of everything is fantastic. Plus, they're always open. Truly, what more could you want from a little deli? I am so ridiculously impressed with this place.

I have been around the Lower East side for many years and a place like this has been way long over due. Not only are their Wraps off the chain but so are their smoothies. I go here often to shop and actually enjoy speaking with the spanish guy at the front cashier. He is very friendly and sometimes funny. I strongly suggest you try the Chipolte Chicken wrap with everything on it!!!!!!!! Also the Beer selection is SICK! ....Go check this spot out you wont be disappointed.
this organic plus gourmet shop is the closes you cud get to wholefoods with out the long lines

Food 10/10
Yoshino has stolen the show and is now my favorite Omakase place of all time. The ingredients used were classic but also creative, everything was top quality and you can taste the freshness and premium perfection of the fish. A holistic journey of different pieces and plates, and there was just the right amount of courses. They clearly took that extra step to prepare everything beautifully and precisely. Chef Yoshida does a spectacular job with the nigiri, and his saddle-shaped rice is unique and incredible. If you do get a reservation, you HAVE to go.

A few of my favorite dishes:
Aokri ika / big reef squid: the first dish. The crunch of the seaweed was refreshing and paired perfectly with the smooth texture of the squid
Monkfish liver: also outstanding, so much better than foie gras. Light and airy, yet somehow creamy at the same time
Karasumi Mochi: as someone who is very much obsessed with mochi, this was the perfect addition to the meal. Freshly made mochi, along with bottarga. I made sure to savor every bite, and I ended up eating the slowest among all the diners haha
Chiaigishi Chutoro: a gorgeous gradient of hues, a generous amount of tuna, put together through a legendary craft, produced this outstanding piece. Might be the favorite one of the night, and apparently they only serve this piece once every ten days because it's very difficult to obtain

Atmosphere 10/10
Light wood interior, a super subtle entrance that guides you into an intimate yet not too tight dining room. There are limited amounts of seating, which is probably why it's so so difficult to get a reservation here. Bright lighting that creates the perfect stage. Subtle and minimalist designs keep this place feeling relatively lowkey. There's a bonus: a spaceship-shaped toilet, beautiful and sleek.

Service 10/10
There was absolutely no sense of snobbishness or elitism that can commonly be felt at fine-dining restaurants. With Omakase experiences, there is a history and a tradition to it, and I really appreciated the interactive elements throughout the entire meal. All of the servers were friendly and homely, I felt really comfortable and enjoyed every part of the dinner.

This is the best sushi omakase I ever had.

Food wise I think it's more special than majority of the 1 star Michelin omakase.
And you will easily be inspired by chef's energy. Unlike other places, you feel like you are eating with a friend rather than watching a performance.

Chef Yoshida and his second chef are so friendly and welcoming.  
The food is extraordinary. Chef takes pride in his food and it's well deserved.
Jazz music track is fun.
The room is stunning. The 300 year old counter, the ceiling, art installation and the DOORS!!!
The dishes, cutlery and glassware are gorgeous.
Make a reservation. Yoshino is absolutely worth every penny.  
Thank you to the entire staff for a great evening.

4.5/5

Yoshino is objectively a top 2 sushiya in NYC but it is not my favorite. With Yoshida-san at the helm, Yoshino is arguably the only sushi restaurant in New York run by a sushi master rather than an apprentice or budding chef. The high price, critical acclaim, and difficulty in securing a reservation create extremely elevated expectations that Yoshino meets, but doesn't exceed. For me, Yoshino, though excellent, is a destination and not a place that will become my regular spot.

Yoshino opened in 2021 when Yoshida-san decided to embark on a new adventure and follow his dreams to bring his restaurant to New York. He prides himself on sharing traditional Japanese culture with the international community and features a menu laden with the highest quality seafood that he can source from Japan.
