We sat in the back in a corner by a service entrance.  Uncomfortably dark.  Otherwise the space was clean, modern, and comfortable.  Ventilation was surprisingly good with vents along the grill, so we walked out without smelling like grilled meat.

They're charging premium prices but didn't serve up a premium experience.  And really, charging for lettuce?  And for stews that usually come with meat packages elsewhere?   They know exactly what they're doing.

I had high hopes and there's definitely potential here but I was still disappointed in the end.

I was blown away by Yoon Haeundae Galbi. I came in with no expections and was so impressed with their meat and bibimbap. The vibe is upscale but not too stuffy. The service was attentive and helpful. Tried the ssam platter, shortrib bulgogi, and shortrib bibimbap. Everything was top notch, and better than any other Korean restaurant I've been to. The bibimbap's rice became hot and crispy from the stoneware pot, and had plenty of vegetables and shortrib bulgogi in it. The grilled meat itself was perfectly cooked and great to wrap. One of my favorite restaurants I've tried in NY, worth a detour for.

I came for a birthday celebration dinner for my boyfriend. The ambience and service were all great.

We ordered the prime package, which comes with four meats. This is plenty for two people, we actually had some leftovers. We also got the grilled mushroom ($19) and lettuce set (it's $7 and not worth it). I usually like to get the lettuce ssam set with my meats but for $7, you get three of their house made sauces, some lettuce, and leaves. It was not worth it.

The grilled mushroom dish was an add on and it costs another $19. It was great but wouldn't necessarily order again.

Overall the package was alright, the meats didn't have much flavor nor did the cuts felt like they were high quality. Personally was really disappointed by the meat quality and taste...

I wouldn't necessarily come back here again for a good dinner due to the food! But it has a great ambiance and very accommodating.

We had a dinner at Yoon during our recent visit to NYC. We chose a dumpling appetizer as well as a barbecue set for 3. What surprised us was the fact that the waitress barbecued everything for us as opposed to doing it ourselves. I remember that during our previous trip to NYC we had a Korean barbecue at WONJO and we were barbecuing the pieces ourselves. This makes the dinner less intimate because the waitress is with you the whole time - we've encountered someone not very talkative or interactive so it's honestly a personal preference as to whether you'd like that. The food was good but nothing was mind blowing or memorable enough to make you want to come back.

I get why this place is so highly rated and talk about. My wife and I came here for a Sunday lunch. Unfortunately, there was a Dominican festival, so some of the roads were blocked off and the street where the restaurant was the life of the party, so you can hear the loud music inside the restaurant.

Aside from that, the ambiance, hospitality, and the food was excellent. The BBQ meats and even the YookHwe was top notch in taste. I love how their mul nengmyun had an ice slurry and the ice was frozen broth. I really enjoyed the broth.

The place can get pricey, but the quality of the meats is up there compared to other locations of Ktown.
Had the bone rib soup and their famous dumplings, which were slightly too salty. Good enough to go back a second time

Love this place! A Busan style Korean bbq restaurant established in 1964. This is the first overseas location. It is different from other k-bbq place, less hustle and bustle, more chic. It is great for friends meet-up or date. I made a reservation via resy a few days prior, got seated right away upon arrival. You can scan the QR code to see the menu. After reading the reviews online, we decided to order the fresh short ribs (Haeundae cut), sirloin galbi, seafood tofu stew and busan neighborhood pancake.
I love the short ribs. I heard that Haeundae cut is a unique way to prep the meat invented by the first generation of the restaurant owner, it was to make the meat more tender. When I took the bite of the ribs, it did tasted soft and tender, so yummy.
The busan neighborhood pancake was tasty too, it had potato noodle hidden inside with egg and shrimp on the outside. Love the seafood tofu stew, it had a lot of ingredients inside and the seasoning was perfect. The sirloin galbi was not as impressive as the short ribs but still tasted good.
I also like the mocktail, very refreshing.
Overall, had a great dining experience here and would definitely come back!

I had an excellent experience at Yoon Haeundae Galbi. The restaurant came highly recommended so I decided to check it out. We made reservations on OpenTable and were quickly seated upon arrival. The ambiance and decor is chic and modern.

Our server was very attentive and helped us narrow down our options for dinner. We started with the jap-che which was delicious. For our bbq we ordered the marinated short rib and marinated sirloin. Both were incredible! I'm partial to marinated meat and these were perfect and not too sweet. To compliment the meat, we also ordered the kimchi fried rice which was also excellent. This was plenty of food for our party of two. Aside from the great food, I'd like to emphasize that the service was top notch. Our server was nice and cooked our meat to perfection. I'll definitely be back!

Reservations are surprisingly easy to get considering how good this place is! The moment I walked in, was immediately struck with how clean and modern the interior was. Has date-y vibes, but the tables are a bit wide, making conversations a bit strained when talking across from each other. Price is also reasonable given the quality of the meat and the overall experience! Banchan was also much better than other kbbq places I've been to in ktown. Would definitely recommend.

Galbi Dumpling - 4/5 Solid, but does break apart really easily.

Mushroom Plate - 5/5 I'm personally not really a fan of mushrooms, but I was pleasantly surprised at how good this dish was, especially when paired with the rest of the meal. The accompanied sauce is extremely good and goes well with the rest of the plate.

Prime Package - 4.5/5 Favorite meats were the short rib and the brisket (literally melts in your mouth!). The other cuts were slightly too chewy for my taste, but still solid. For the price, quantity was actually really good - both my friend and I were barely able to finish this (and we usually eat a lot!).

We made reservations on a Friday night and were immediately seated. The restaurant is in Ktown, and has a very modern interior. They also have a coat check so you don't have to get the Kbbq smell on your coats.

The Prime/Mari package was enough food for 2. I have pretty high expectations for Kbbq as I travel to LA a lot, so I wasn't that impressed by this restaurant. The dry aged ribeye was decent, but didn't have as much of a dry aged flavor as better American steakhouses typically have. The marinated short rib was excellent, however. It was incredibly tender and the marinade was very flavorful. This was probably the closest meat to what I've had in Busan. We really did not like the potato noodles. The sweet soy sauce was decent, but the noodles had an odd taste to them. The picture from my post is what we ended up leaving as we each just took one bite from it. This was disappointing as we were excited to try it. Overall, I believe the meal came out to around 230 for 2 after everything.

What an outstanding Korean restaurant. Being in Murray Hill, it's really set apart from Ktown or any other Korean establishment nearby. You really feel welcomed by the staff here. It's like walking into a new haven, filled with grandstanding aromas of the food cooking.  

The service here is what truly stood out to me before anything else. Our server was incredibly knowledgeable and even offered suggestions according to our party size to portion sizes. She helped us choose the perfect meal and it was delicious. They also cook the meats for your party and also serve it to you. We loved having to not cook for ourselves!

We had the Prime Package that came with the most amazing fresh short rib I've ever had. As well as such tender wagyu short rib, brisket, and dry aged ribeye. We were a party of 5 and it's portioned for a party of 2-3 so we added a soybean stew and it was honestly beyond this world. I've never had a stew that was so ethereal in both textures and flavors. It tasted like something your mother would make for you after a long of work and you wanted to savor every spoonful.

If you're ever craving Korean BBQ, come and be adventurous and give this place a try first before looking into KTown.

We had a group of 10 on a weekday evening. We got a few starters (japchae, steamed dumplings, fried dumplings) and four combos, including two Prime combos. The meats were super delicious and fresh, definitely one of the better KBBQ places I've been too. Waiters are also kind and quick.

I appreciate that we were able to get a reservation and the tables are not super close together so you have some space.

We also got Asian Pear Sorbet with Cinnamon Syrup and Mochi for dessert. The sorbet was so so good.

After a long day in the city, we had no dinner plans and stumbled upon Yoon since it was a close walk from our hotel. When we got there, we were asked if we had reservations, to which we said no. The hostess offered us a table upstairs without a grill and we accepted. Immediately walking into the restaurant, I noticed how beautifully sleek and modern the interior design was. I was really impressed with how aesthetic and clean everything was. My table shared all the dishes, and since it was a colder day, we opted for more homey dishes rather than solely meat dishes.

Galbi Bibimbap: For this spot to be known for their galbi, I wasn't impressed with the flavor of the meat at all. It was lightly marinaded and I thought it lacked flavor. I would assume that the same galbi they use on the grill, is also the same one they put in this dish, but if not I was disappointed. Aside from the meat, the vegetable toppings and egg were delicious when mixed in with the crispy rice on the bottom of the pot.

Bulgogi over Rice: Just as it sounds. The bulgogi was tender, but lacking flavor like the galbi.

Short Rib Stew: I was not expecting a light clear broth when we ordered this. There were thin rice noodles and tender pieces of short rib, but the initial taste was extremely bland. We were given a dish of salt on the side to add in, but I didn't expect the broth itself to have no flavor at all. With the addition of salt, it was better but nothing to rave about.  

Banchan: This was probably the best part of the meal tbh. We went through  three new dishes each during our time there. The kimchi and fishcake were our favorites.

Overall, for this spot being more high-end I would expect more. I was not impressed with the flavors here, and I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that the dishes we had weren't the same as the bbq meats, but still disappointing. There are plenty of other authentic Korean spots in the area that top this place.

I was pleasantly surprised by my experience here! First off, the decor is very clean and modern which is not very typical of Korean restaurants. I also liked how it wasn't so crowded and was fairly quiet enough to have a conversation.

Now to the food...it was pretty good. The fried dumplings were tasty but the pancake was just okay. I would say that they weren't very traditional, especially the pancake. I would recommend the dumplings but not the pancake.

Folks liked the galbi lunch set, galbi bibimbap, the tofu soup was tasty but pretty spicy and spicy pork bibimbap was very good. As expected, the banchan (side dishes were limited) but tasty. Service here was fantastic and even mixed the bibimbap for someone that was not familiar with the dish.

Overall, very good! Not the most authentic experience but close enough. Good spot to take colleagues, for work and even for friends. Would I take my Korean parents who are used to typical Korean restaurants....probably not. Expect to pay a bit more to dine here given the decor and location.

A modestly priced, good quality Korean BBQ restaurant in the heart of Koreatown.

The portions were plentiful. We had a party of 9 and decided on two meat packages, two stews, and an appetizer. With the banchan, it was more than enough to feed us all. The waitstaff were also accommodating. Since we got two different packages, they split it into 9 portions, so we everyone could try all of the meats. They also divided the stews into 9 portions for us.

The pork kimichi stew was very fermented, and it was a nice break from all the richness of the meat. The short rib stew was a bit more heavy, especially with the noodles, but it was good nonetheless. Busan neighborhood pancake  was thinner than I was normally used to in regards with pajeon. The flavor was good, but I wanted it to have a more crispy exterior. Banchan were plentiful and were refilled as it ran out.

The meat was great. We got the prime package and the marinated package. The marinated package has the same marinade throughout the meat selections, so it does get a little boring. I suggest getting the prime/mari package if you want to try it, so you still get to try the meat as is as well.

The reservation process for larger parties was a bit tedious. I called the restaurant to book the table, only to be referred to emailing them. However, once you make the booking you have to confirm your information and put down your credit card. I ended up calling them back to give my credit card information as I didn't feel safe sending it over email.

Make sure to keep track of your time because they do hold you to a two hour limit as they get fairly busy and need to turn over for reserved tables.

Make reservations on resy ahead of time as they do get pretty busy on the weekend! We came here around 6:30pm on Sat for our reservation and were seated promptly. It is really modern and sleep inside (there's 2 floors). We were seating upstairs, lovely space.

We ordered the busan pancake (very fresh! It had shrimp and slices of beef bulgogi). For our main meal we got the prime package (~$150). It came with brisket, short rib, wagyu short rib, and dry aged ribeye. Our favorite was the short ribs! The quality of the meat is great! It was all very delicious. We also got the spicy beef noodle soup (very flavorful broth and not too spicy). We got the lettuce sam set (~$7) to pair with our meats. It comes with 3 different types of ssams and a bowl of lettuce. I recommend getting the lettuce set because it doesn't come with rice and it goes nicely with the meats.

Great and friendly service!! High quality Korean bbq! Nice interior! It is on the pricier side but worth the quality.

The restaurant is very classy and beautiful. The service is amazing, they cook everything for you. The food is very good quality, and the side dishes taste amazing. Would recommend if you are craving some quality korean BBQ!

I really enjoyed the experience and the food here! We had a reservation in advance which was very nice as we got seated immediately. My boyfriend and I shared the marinated beef belly and short rib. I think that was a great amount for both of us to leave stuffed! My boyfriend got rice as well to eat with the meat. The ban Chan is included and they refill for you too! It's nice and clean inside and two floors

Shared the prime package, seafood rice cakes and the soybean stew among four people and it was more than enough. The rice cakes are generously portioned, and the soybean stew was much thicker than I had anticipated. I was thinking it would be more clear broth based, but it actually has potatoes, beef, etc so was more like a beef stew with soybean paste. The prime package was delicious - favorite part being the melt in your mouth wagyu short rib.

The prices are very expensive though for what you get, we ended up spending $60+ per person after tax / tip. For the price, I would have expected lettuce wraps to be free, but you have to pay $7 extra for a basket of it. The salad banchan was also a bit wilted.

We were able to get seated immediately (party of 4) on a Thursday night around 6:30pm. I did like how they didn't seem to rush us out once we had finished eating. I would recommend if you want bbq but didn't make a reservation in advance.

If you want to have the most amazing marinated beef short ribs, Yoon Haeundae Galbi is the place to come!

My friends and I had reservations for this place on a Saturday night at 9 pm. We decided to stop by an hour earlier because we were in the area and luckily they were able to seat us an hour early.

The restaurant had great vibes and really friendly and attentive staff who thoroughly explained the menu items and story behind the restaurant and the meats which was nice. The menu had a bunch of different packages for the bbq but because we weren't super hungry we decided to pick and choose 3 of their different meats to try. We started with the best, the marinated short ribs which was the best thing I've eaten in a very long time. It was so tender and juicy and marinated and cooked to perfection. Next we decided to try the Bulgogi, which I personally didn't like that much because it was a bit bland and felt a bit soupy. I prefer the dry marinated Bulgogi better. Lastly we decided to also try the beef brisket which was pretty good but nothing compared to the beef short ribs! That was the star of the night for sure!

We were also provided with an array of unlimited side dishes which were delicious. Overall, had a really fun time and I look forward to coming back here for the short ribs and to try some of their items.

I'd like to say that

If you want to sit in the cool seating downstairs definitely make a reservation

I didn't do that so we ended up having to sit in the upstairs bar area. Nonetheless we still sat and ate and we had a party of 6! And we were accommodated within 5 minutes of arriving.

The bathrooms were also clean.

my experience at this restaurant was incredible! The attention to detail by staff is phenomenal. As we drank water and ate the small spreads they put on the tables they kept re-filling as we ate. The waitress was beyond attentive but not overwhelmingly so like you experience at some restaurants. The ambience was nice, cool, calm.

The restaurant is elegantly decorated.

The food was my favorite part it was amazing!! And it was super hot throughout as it was in a hot bowl. I will say that although I had an amazing experience my vegetarian friend did not have much for options as there were only 2 on the menu. Nonetheless she was very satisfied with her food as well would just be nice to see a little more variety or to be able to do substitutions for vegetarian/vegan options to be more inclusive.

Overall I would absolutely recommend this restaurant for their wonderful service and tasty food. My stomach and tastebuds had a blast!

FINALLY made it here! With a little bit of luck, i snagged a 7p reservation for a Sunday night the night before. Definitely would recommend getting a resy a bit earlier in advance.

Food was stellar - two of us got the prime package plus an app, which was a ton of food that we barely managed to finish (but we did!) Each cut of beef was insanely good, and the staff cooks it for you, so it's timed pretty well. Of course, the meal comes with all the usual side dishes too.

I would come back again! Mostly because I think the quality of the meat really stands out among other similar restaurants in the area.

Haven't had Korean bbq in ages so decided to give this spot a try esp after it was recommended by a friend. Family-owned, this is a sophisticated, elegant spot w shareable plates and a variety of beef options. Although the short ribs are their popular dish, we decided to have other items and each dish had an amazing taste even the extremely spicy dish called Octopus over rice (stone bowl); there was nothing we disliked. Waiter/service was on point and checked in on us frequently. Ambiance seas very chill and relaxing. Went there w low expectation but left w the opposite. Def a spot to try even you like Korean bbq.

Environment:
Fun, well decorated, inviting, comfortable.
A good people watching spot with diverse patrons

Service:
Excellent
Waiter helped order food
Attentive waiters, cook, servers (Even offered me a Tide stick when I got sauce on my shirt!!!)

Food:
Delicious cuts of meat with
many sides that ranged from savory to spicy
Ordered a scallion egg pancake and Galbi soup which were tasty!

I WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK!

My favorite KBBQ place in the city!

This is where I take guests when they ask for Korean BBQ in the city. The quality of the meats here are top notch - I typically go for the prime package. The banchan are tasty, and they are quick to refill when asked.

I've brought families with young kids here, and they have always been very accommodating. Service was incredibly attentive, and they cook all the meats for you. Reservations are the way to go, else you might find yourself waiting during peak times.

Can't wait to come back!

We came here without a reservation on a Saturday evening and they were able to seat us upstairs (bar side). Staff is very attentive here, always refilling our waters and there to answer questions. The banchan is complimentary and you can ask for more, my favorite was the potato salad. We ordered two rice entrees. The spicy pork belly bowl came with a perfectly cooked egg and the spicy pork was definitely spicy. The bulgogi in the stone bowl was sizzling which gives the rice a nice crispy bottom. Felt fancy inside yet still casual with dim lighting and a candle on every table. Would definitely come again to try their kbbq

Came to celebrate my best friend's birthday & Yoon did not disappoint! We made reservations for 6pm on a Sunday & thankfully we did because the restaurant filled up quickly! For the 2 of us, one of the sets seemed to be a little too overwhelming so we decided on the marinated short ribs and the chef's cut (wagyu short ribs) instead. We also added on the lettuce saam set, soybean stew, potato noodles, and cold noodles.

I really have to commend Yoon on their beef, which was incredible and cooked to a perfect medium rare. 2 meats were definitely enough for the both of us, & it ended up being a lot of food! The wagyu short ribs were soft & tender, & I enjoyed these with the sauces that came with the lettuce set. While it's a bit mind boggling to pay $7 for a lettuce saam set, it was really necessary to get the full experience of making wraps and having the additional sauces - Yoon only provides a dipping salt and sesame oil. To be fair, the set was generous and comes with lettuce, perilla leaves, endive, carrots, garlic, & jalapenos. My favorite cut by far though, was the marinated short ribs. Each piece was flavorful & tender, & worked well with or without the sauces.

A few notes about the other items we ordered - the cold noodle broth was different from other places I've been to, but still made for a good accompaniment to the BBQ experience. In comparison, the soybean paste stew was initially good, but ended up being a little too thick and beef stew-y - not really what I had in mind when wanting a stew! Potato noodles came at the end and were cooked in a sweet soy broth. It's not bad by any means, but also not a favorite/must get. The texture was almost a little too soft. Banchan here was one of the best I've had - everything was really delicious!

The service here is overall really good, though it erred on being a bit overbearing at times. There was quite a bit of hovering, to the point of almost making us feel like we had to rush to eat the meats and move onto the next cut. We also didn't really have a chance to take pictures of anything we ordered, because it was divided up as soon as it hit the table. To Yoon's credit though, they were really thoughtful in providing a complimentary birthday dessert.

Overall, a great dining experience with incredible meats. Will definitely be back again for a special occasion, as it is on the pricier end.

5/5 taste
5/5 service
4/5 portion
5/5 price

Just based on their stew dishes, the dining experience was not too bad. The food tasted really solid and very authentically Korean. However, I felt like the portions could be slightly bigger, like 15-20%. We ordered off the dinner menu but I walked away feeling kind of unsatisfied, but not enough to order anything else.

For NYC, the prices of the stuff like stone bibimbap and yookgaejang weren't that crazy. It felt a little pricey but I wasn't too chafed by it.

Overall, I definitely wasn't unhappy about anything, but I don't think I'd come back again if I don't feel full from their dishes.

Delicious Korean BBQ spot with excellent service in a stylish, modern venue!

I came here for dinner with a group of 6 people. We had a reservation and all arrived at different times (some early, some on time, some a few min late) and each person in our party was sat immediately as we rolled in. I always get nervous that we need to wait for the whole party to arrive before being seated but it wasn't an issue here, which I see as a huge plus.

The server who took our order was friendly, experienced and smart-- we definitely over-ordered but instead of trying to talk us out of the dishes that we were excited about, she waited until we were winding down and then checked in with us. When we realized we had a whole other package of meats coming in that we no longer had room for, she let us know that she hadn't put that second order in just yet because she wanted to see how we did (brilliant!).

The food was very appetizing and flavorful (we ordered a few sides as well as BBQ). The cocktails are fun and yummy too.

I will definitely be back-- I think this place will be one of my go to suggestions for out of town visitors looking for Korean BBQ in Manhattan. I like the whole package: food, service and ambiance!

This place is mediocre for the price point. There are some great meats in the prime package but the marinated meats were no different from an AYCE bbq. The side dishes were below average, kimchi was not sour enough, the sweet tofu/inari was mid, kimchi pork stew did not taste correct.

The majority customer demographic in the restaurant at the time was non-asian which speaks to the type of korean restaurant this is. Just go to Queens or some other place like Jongro for better kbbq.

If Ktown is too loud for you and you're looking for a nice place to sit and eat solid Korean food while having a conversation, this place is for you! A bit pricier than your average Korean bbq, yes, but food was great overall, including meat selection and quality and all banchans. Amazing kimchi and the milmyun was so good I went back the next day just to eat more of that!
Service was also very pleasant. Definitely look forward to going again!

Dunno why it's taken me so long to write this one. My only excuse would be that I've been so caught up in bringing people here that I haven't had time to reflect and write.

Prior to Yoon, a certain multi-story "J" spot held court as my favorite Korean bbq joint in town. For party and rowdy vibes, I'd probably go back there for the atmosphere however Yoon now takes it for quality of beef. The cuts taste beefy and the the un-marinated platter needs no sesame oil for the in house roasted salt. I think it's a real testament when the banchan, spicy beef stew, and kimchi stew actually taste like what mom made for me growing up.

Service has always been pretty great, as they are well-staffed however one time at lunch, I had to prompt someone for the check (perhaps my friend and I looked deep in conversation and didn't want to be bothered). Kinda miss the days of the service call button.

Dollar for dollar, Yoon gives the best quality and tasting food compared to Let's Meat, Jongro, and Baekjeong.

Came here for a birthday celebration. Ambiance was nice. Waitress, waiter, host and bus boy staff all were super friendly and professional.

We ordered the prime package with the lettuce add on. (Add on was not needed). Also we ordered the uni rice and seafood package.
While the seafood package was good, we probably won't order again. The prime package and the uni rice was more than enough food for 2 people lol.
The uni rice was super delicious and unique to try. I definitely recommend ordering this.
The prime package is enough for a party of 2, no need for any appetizers. We couldn't even finish the prime package, it was a lot of food.  
Soju flight takes you on a journey and nice to try.

I spontaneously stopped by for dinner and I'm so glad I did! At first I was intimidated by how upscale the restaurant is, but their soups were reasonably priced, especially for how authentic, flavorful, and packed with ingredients they were. We got the pork kimchi stew and short rib stew, and it was some of the better Korean dishes I've had in Manhattan. I'd definitely recommend checking out their soups if you're looking for a delicious, hearty meal!
Steak tartare is good, the bbq itself is mediocre. Service is subpar for a kbbq at this price range. The restaurant is very noisy so had to scream for conversations.

I really liked this place! The service here is great, there was someone cooking our meat for us, filling our waters and just being very quick and attentive if we needed anything.

I also really liked the food here, we ordered the galbi, lettuce wraps and mushroom medley. If you like mushrooms, you have to get the mushroom medley, it was probably my favorite dish here. The rice here was also really good, probably some of the best rice I've ever had. The meat here was also really juicy and tender. I could tell it was high quality. I'm looking forward to coming back to try more dishes!

I would recommend making a reservation here if you can. It seemed pretty packed when I went during lunchtime, but the restaurant is also quite big, so you might be able to walk in--no guarantees. If you are a kbbq fan, you should definitely visit here!

One of the best kbbq spots in the city. A bit pricey but definitely worth it. Meat is high quality and so flavorful. Highly recommend their dwenjang jjigae as well! Loved their banchan and as a Korean, you know a restaurant is good when their kimchi is good. Service was amazing and I will be returning for sure!

I officially have a new favorite KBBQ restaurant! Restaurant decor is tasteful and spacious. Quality of the meat is very good, especially the NY strip and ribeye. Special mention goes towards their Korean fried chicken (we got the galbi) which is super delicious. Service is good and they have great banchan! Which is how you know a Korean restaurant is gonna be good. Their rice bowls look good too although we didn't get any, but it's def something I want to try in the future.

Really nice spot with a beautiful clean interior. Stopped in for a light snack between meals and we were not disappointed. We tried the daily special - Filet Mignon and Galbi Dumplings. The Filet Mignon was so tender and delicious, I would highly recommend. Our server was wonderful, he cooked the meat for us and was very attentive through out the meal.

We were in the mood for ramen, so tried this midtown option. Its located up a flight of stairs. The restaurant is actually fairly large, with a lot of seating.

I ordered the Shoyu ramen. It was actually a fairly large bowl, with a few different items. I really liked the broth as well as the pork, which I found to be quite tender and flavorful.

Will definitely recommend if you are looking for a cheaper ramen option in the area.

Here for restaurant week, the staffs are friendly. The restaurant is located in the second floor. The lunch or dinner is $30 per person for the ramen or you can order the sushi for $45. We reserved via Open Table however, they took us right in and seated us even though we came in early.

For appetizer:
- Yama Wings: their fried wings with soy and sesame pepper are very crispy and delicious.
- Lka Karage: their deep fried squid comes with spicy mayo to dip is also very crispy, tastes like calamari.  

For ramen:
- Shoyu Ramen: their broth is rich also tasted sweet, would recommend getting their Shoyu Ramen. It also comes with corn.
- Tonkotsu Ramen: their broth is a little on the saltier side but also very delicious.

For desserts:
- Two matcha mochi ice cream per person

Would recommend eating here!

Ambiance at Yama Ramen is great. Staff are very friendly. Came here after work with a friend on a weekday and it was pretty empty. They have a pretty good happy hour menu for snacks and drinks if you are down for that. We ordered quite a lot got two people. Sashimi was ok, not as fresh as I thought. Takoyahi and tuna roll were pretty good and these two are on happy hour menu. We also ordered a miso ramen to share. Ramen did not meet expectations, pork was over cooked and hard. Soup base was alright. I would come back for happy hour but not ramen

I came here for a quick bite on a Friday night. The restaurant is on the second floor. I sat at the bar. It was busy, but not packed.

They have happy hour specials until 9:30pm, which is a rare treat. I had the $8 happy hour red wine. The pour was a bit small but it was a nice, balanced cab.

To eat, I had a sweet potato tempura roll with a side of spicy mayo. The roll was tasty with very crispy tempura. They charge $1 for the spicy mayo which is a little steep for a condiment, but worth it for the spicy kick.

Service was fast.

Great service, long happy hour, affordable price.. My takoyaki was good, but the ramen, sorry, it's just alright. Nothing special about it.
Will i come back? Maybe, for the appz and happy hour.. but not for the ramen
Ordered delivery from here near the office. The sushi came in 30 minutes and was super tasty. I loved the spicy kani avocado roll. Would order from here again!
I don't know about other reviews, but this is literally the worst ramen I ever had in my life. The broth tastes nothing like "tonkotsu", but horrible salt that leaves a bitter taste in your mouth.

Yama Ramen is a really great Japanese restaurant in Midtown West. Great place especially for Ramen . The Miso Ramen had such a good broth and the Pork Belly was delicious! The 30 Rock was a great sushi roll with a mix of Salmon, Avocado, tuna, yellowtail and Creme cheese. We also got the Shishito - Japanese Pepper. I'm not a huge spicy fan but this really wasn't spicy at all. It actually reminded me of edamame lol. I had a little bit of Sake too.

Great casual hole in a wall for bites and fantastic happy hour. Beers are like $8 and wine is about $9. Their hot sake is $7.

The sushi and ramen is very average and I would honestly come for the appetizers like takoyaki and sushi rolls. There was a lot of rice in the chirashi bowls and donburi but those tasted ok. Overall. I think it's a good happy hr place to start the evening.

Been a while since I came here, if you need a quick, decently priced meal come here.  It's really 3.5*.

Service is fast and efficient (don't except small talk).  Turnaround for a table is fast, it's also gets crowded during lunch or dinner time.  Order, eat, get check, pay and go.

We got:
Appetitzers :
crispy rice with salmon.  If you like the brunt rice on the bottom of the bowl, this is a must order.
Crispy Brussel sprouts

Entree:
- tonkotsu ramen
- shoyu ramen

Both were good and we finished the bowl.

Good spot for Midtown.

I'm a little sad to give this 3 stars but I feel like it's a fair warning.  If you can manage a table at TsuronronTan just a few doors over - go for that instead

I wanted to like this because it's $30 for a restaurant week meal that includes miso soup/salad - sushi omakase - and choice of mango/green tea mochi

Instead I just felt uncomfortable? Everyone is packed upstairs and clearly there were multiple business groups coming by too so it was really hard to hear each other (also no Covid consideration, everyone mask off for obvious reasons)

The food was good but straight forward. There wasn't really anything special/interesting about the omakase - like takeout sushi, fish on rice. Which is fine! But a little disappointing for the hype around Restaurant Week. The only redeeming part of the meal was the mango mochi for me.
Came for restaurant week with some friends. Service was good and the food was all very fresh. The restaurant is really small so it was super loud and it can be hard to have a conversation.

Came for lunch on a Saturday looking for ramen and tsukemen. Seated quickly with two kids. Tonkotsu tsukemen made me sad; broth was thinner than the actual tonkotsu ramen. Noodles were so so. Kids got tonkotsu ramen, which was mediocre- broth not very creamy and was watery. Gyoza not well cooked. Wait staff pleasant and satisfactory.
Good place for tourists coming to Rockefeller center eating generic "Japanese", would not come if actually want good ramen.

We snagged a reservation for Friday night and were seated immediately upon arrival. It's a very cozy place, definitely for smaller groups. We got Yama Big Bowl (basically just a larger portion of the tonkatsu ramen) and shoyu ramen with pork belly. There was a good amount of meat and bamboo shoots, which are my favorite! The portions are quite large so we left very full and happy.

Upon arrival, we noticed there was a line going up the steps (there's about 10-15 steps to climb as the restaurant is a small space on the second floor). It seemed like the wait could be long, but we only spent about 20 minutes waiting, which was not bad at all considering how many people it seemed there were.

The space was beyond buzzing, so busy and you could see how hard everyone was working to have a quick and efficient turnaround.

There was an amazing happy hour, which went until 9:30 pm including drinks and some appetizers.

We ordered a bottle of red wine ($40) - in retrospect we should have done glasses since it was still happy hour for most of the time we were there. We got a California roll which was part of happy hour ($5.0), a shrimp bun, pork bun ($6 each) a tonkotsu ramen and chicken shoyu ramen ($18 each).

There was a decent turnaround, especially considering how busy it was. One thing to note though., tables are really close to each other, so there's not much personal space so be ready to feel cozy with your neighbors.

The California roll was nothing to write home about but a good and solid roll. The buns were incredible, but did come out after the ramen, so I ended up taking my shrimp bun home - being too full from the ramen.

The ramen was wonderful, nice Al dente noodles, a good sized portion, a rich and delicious broth, and of course, as ramen tends to be, so filling.

I was really happy with giving this place a try and it was certainly worth the wait.

Ramen !!
Service 5 stars
Food 5 stars
Prices 5 stars
Environment 5 starts

I think they have the best Ramen in Manhattan, even NYC. I been looking for the best ramen about 2 years ago and I find it.

The portions are really good, they are so tasty and traditional, you can feel that you're in Asia.
The restaurant is gorgeous and comfortable.
The service is excellent and kind.
The prices are good, i can even say for the service that they give, the food and the environment the prices are cheap.

I order for the table
Tonkutsu ramen: it was delicious.
Veggie ramen: this was the most surprising one because was really good, and it wasn't spicy ( mistake that the restaurant make when the do something vegan/veggie they make it spicy )
Chicken ramen: really good too.

This is based on their ramen and bao buns. The buns were good and so was the ramen but I wish there was more flavor. I got a ramen that said is spicy but I really didnt taste any heat. The half egg that came with it was almost fully cooked I like it more when it comes out runny with ramen. The staff was nice and the ambience of the restaurant was nice.

Food  best I've ever had. Japanese soda 10/10 S tier definitely  recommend this. Presentation great  on edamame. Edamame A tier. Don't get rainbow  roll texture is very off- putting. Service fast ! Water  great  soooo much better than my home  in Ridgefield

When I say that 3 stars are a generous thing, it is hard to pinpoint one issue. From the overly contrived meal where they put what tasted like sweet potato chips on the salad to add color to the presentation of the sushi to the broth being just so so. It was a challenging meal and maybe it gets better because it seemed crowded. So I'll give the benefit of the doubt that this might have been half of my expectations not met and half of them not meeting them.

This has quickly become my go-to spot before a show. It's on a side street and with Times Square so close, foot traffic is lower here and the prices are great!

I've only had the sushi though because you can't beat the happy hour price of 2 speciality rolls for $30 (excludes 2, but there are still plenty to choose from).

It's such a relief to have a place I can go for a quick dinner because I try to spend as little time in the area as possible because it's so touristy.

All the workers are friendly and the food comes out fast. You have to be able to walk a flight of stairs from the street level.
Delicious and quick service. The staff is friendly and helpful. They have the best of both worlds because they have sushi and ramen which are both really good

The restaurant is located on the second floor. It is both a sushi bar and ramen place. Definitely not good for group because most of the tables are meant for 2-3 people. I was amazed at the pork of my ramen. It was the best that I ever had! Even though there was only 2 pieces in that bowl, I savored every bit of it. Service is pretty fast and the wait time for table was surprisingly fast. Max of 10 minutes.

Food was fresh! Sushiwasmade to order. Ramen is good. Small place on 2nd floor. Service was good. Would recommend it and definitely go back! We tried several ramen, and all were very good. We had kids with us, and they accommodated their simple ramen requests.

I came here for dinner with a group of 6 people for a friend's birthday. They have pretty good happy hour deals since there's discounts on appetizers, sushi rolls, and drinks. Their happy hour is everyday until 9:30pm. We ordered the pork gyoza (dumplings), takoyaki (octopus balls), ika karaage (fried squid), crispy Brussels sprouts, spicy tuna rolls, peking duck rolls, and double dragon rolls. The best dishes were the ika karaage and the double dragon roll. The ika karaage had Cheetos dust which was interesting. I would pass on the Brussels sprouts since it was soggy from the pickled onions and jalapeños. The peking duck rolls had soy paper which I'm not a fan of. Service was very friendly and fast. I would come back for happy hour.

We came across this 2nd floor eatery when our original destination was unexpectedly closed.  There are a bit of steps involved with reaching this location. The wooden staircase and decor reminded me of a posh tree house.  The overall decor is wooden throughout, including the tables and backless chairs where you'll be sitting.

Service is friendly and casual, and no one rushed us out as we lingered over our beers.  When we arrived it was almost empty but it quickly filled up.  The pace and quality of service remained the same. We tried the Tonkatsu ramen, the spicy kim chi ramen, one of the rice bowls, assorted sushi rolls and some beers.  We left full, happy and unbothered by the bill. Bathrooms are adequate and out of the way.

I'd return if in the area to see what else this place offers-- particularly on a weekend.  Enjoy!
The sushi combination tastes really good. Usually I am not a big fan of sushi , this time is an exception. The place is super crowded and the wait time is very long. It is not safe during pandemic.

Ambiance is very tight and small. Probably the only thing I didn't like about it. I'm just used to restaurants having a lot of space in general, and enough space in between chairs and tables. I was about a foot away from two different tables beside me. It felt a little awkward. There aren't enough hooks for jackets/bags. I had to sit on my jacket and put my bag on the floor...
Service was great. They're definitely on top of it. I believe I went on a Friday and I didn't have to wait much for any service.
The food was mediocre, but not bad.

This is a great, cheap, casual sushi place centrally located in the touristy areas of NYC. They have a fantastic happy hour. Mon-Fri 5p-930p and pretty much all day on the weekends. For food, they offer some select appetizers and sushi rolls. The drink specials are Sapporo, house wine, and hot sake. But their non-happy hour prices are very reasonable. We ordered edamame, shrimp shumai, and shishito peppers. I have had shishitos, and with these ones, all were spicy. I wasn't prepared for that, but we powered through. We also order some standard rolls like spicy tuna, kani, and California. All were decent. My 13 yo daughter and I had a great dinner and loved the casual vibe.

The customer service was great and the ambiance was cozy. The gyoza had a good flavor however the texture was off as the outside was a little mushy. The tonkotsu broth was lighter than expected and missing the depth of flavor that I have come to appreciate with this dish.

Went here for NYC restaurant week as I was craving ramen and they were offering an awesome $21 app+ramen+dessert deal. To start, the service was a little unprofessional and disorganized. I wanted to check out their menu before I got seated and the guy at the counter gave us a weird look and didn't seem too impressed. Fast forward to us actually being seated, it took quite some time for the server to take our order despite it being 5PM on a weekday and the place was by no means busy.

Why I am giving this place 2 stars: the ramen, which should have been the highlight of the meal, was absolutely, and I repeat, ABSOLUTELY horrible. If it weren't for a decent appetizer (chicken wings), I would have given one-star. The Tonkotsu ramen came out looking very appetizing in a huge bowl and loads of toppings (thick pork belly, bamboo shoots, half an egg, wood ear mushrooms, and some cabbage). However, one sip of the broth and I knew this was going to be a long meal. The broth tasted like salt thrown in some water with a little bit of some kind of protein. It was honestly one of, if not, the worst ramen broth I have ever had. The broth was also lukewarm and the noodles itself were definitely not authentic ramen noodles.

The green tea mochi dessert at the end was good but not nearly enough to make up for the terrible ramen I had here. Would definitely not recommend their ramen here.

Great food, great service , lively atmosphere!
We came back 2 days in a row , we got lucky both times and were seated right away.

booked a restaurant week res for 2 and was seated immediately ($29 for appetizer, ramen/sushi, and mochi ice cream dessert, with tip and tax extra). The service was fast; our meal finished in about an hour. There was a coat rack and bucket for umbrellas. Would recommend for both a quick meal or a group outing!

Found it on yelp. Pretty good sushi for pretty low price on the city. We had two specialty rolls, a regular roll and beer. It was pretty good would definitely order the one rock roll again. The service was also really good we got sat down right away. Didn't try the Ramen that everyone is raging about but will probably go and try it again.

Went to Yama after searching the nearest good sushi spot from Bryant Park. It was a trek but Yama was worth the hike.

I got there just in time before they ended their lunch service. The restaurant is located upstairs and inside is cozy with about 10-15 tables.

I had the happy hour deal for two rolls and appetizers. Along with Sapporo . The lunch was great! Sushi was fresh as well as the edamame.

The only thing was that I felt a little rushed which is understandable since they were transitioning from Lunch to dinner service.

Over all service was great and food was good comparable to the LA sports I grew up on.
I mean.... just look at the picture. The service and location is good, but the food quality was just straight up not it.

The restaurand is on a second floor so you need to go up some stairs. Their sushi rolls are okay, tried the TUNA, SALMON AVOCADO, SPIDER, RAINBOW, and the LOBSTER MONSTER ROLL. I would say the SALMON AVOCADO and the RAINBOW were better but I was not surprised by any. There is a server who is a bit rude and may stand close to you when you are about to finish, kind of forcing you to finish quick and go. They have a hangers for the jackets, which is pretty useful. They have nice decoration

ESPAÑOL:
El restaurante está en un primer piso así que debes subir unas escaleras. Sus sushi rolls están okay, probé el TUNA, SALMON AVOCADO, SPIDER, RAINBOW, and the LOBSTER MONSTER ROLL. Diría que el SALMON AVOCADO y el RAINBOW eran los mejores pero no me sorprendió ninguno. Hay una camarera que es un poco tosca y quizás esté a tu lado cuando estés terminando, se siente como que quieren que termines rápido y te vayas. Tienen perchas para colgar los abrigos, lo cuál es bastante útil. La decoración es bonita.

Yama Ramen is super cute! It's very traditional inside and it feels as if you've been transported into either a movie or another country. Happy hour is SUPER affordable.

If you are site seeing at Rockefeller Center or shopping around that area this is a great oasis! Lots of options and great vibes. The service is awesome as well.

Bring a friend or go with a group. It's family friendly!

Wanted to try something new during lunch at work and came across this place. I've had really good sushi before so I wouldn't give this a high rating or say that it is anything special. The rolls I got were kind of dry and the spicy mayo was overly spicy while the soy sauce was overly salty. They did have a lunch special for 2 rolls, salad and miso soup so I will say the deal was good for the quantity but the quality was definitely lacking.
Sushi came with practically ALL rice and a tiny TINY sliver of fish. Returned an entire roll. So many other places to get decent sushi. This place is terrible.

Close to work & quick on meal break..
Food & service very good. Love the authentic feel of the place
AMAZING ramen in Hell's Kitchen. Great ambiance, service, and food. Worth the walk there if you're considering it.
Sushi lunch special is super good price and always delicious - they are also very fast with online pickup orders
Ramen is outstanding.  Sashimi is 3 star.  I would come back for the ramen.   They need to upgrade their sushi as I was disappointed based on the reviews.
Located on the second level and it's literally 5 minutes walk to the Top of Rock. The ramen tasted really good. Nice decor and everything. Waiters are nice.
Food was good, restaurant was clean.  Food was reasonable price and portions.   Bathroom was very small for 1 person at a time.  Only 1 bathroom and was not very clean.  Pleasant atmosphere.
Very good takoyaki, dumplings and sushi rolls, even though the jalapeños don't really compliment the sushi. Nice lively environment but tables are extremely tiny. Overall pretty good still.

Super quick service on a crowded Thursday lunch. The seats may be a bit close together, but that's really to be expected. Had the miso ramen (chicken) and my friend had the shoyu ramen (pork) and we split the lunch special of 3 rolls (which came with miso soup and a salad) which were great on a cloudy, cool day. Would recommend, especially on a busy day. Good location and good food.
Great atmosphere. First place we ate on our NYC trip. Loves the sushi and ramen bowl.

Time: fast, seated quickly
Quality: 4 stars we got 2 miso soups and 2 spicy snow crabs. They were yummy!
Ambiance: 5 stars - cozy, dimmed lights. Came for lunch on Saturday and still received great service. Location also was a plus. Right off 5th!
Cost: 4 stars - very reasonable for the amount of food received
The food was pretty good gyoza were very good definitely recommend and the tuna was good as well

As a vegan/vegetarian, YUM YUBU in Urban Hawker is heaven. Ordered some vegan dishes for me and they didn't disappoint. The food I ordered not only looked good but theyr're delish. I've tried different restaurants serving Mushroom bulgogi, but for me theirs the BEST! And the Mushroom bean curd pockets, delish! I can't wait to bring my friends and let them try their food. The staff was nice, friendly and very accommodating. The food hall is better than the one we went to downtown. I wish they have bigger space tho. But I'll definitely come back!

Another great Thai restaurant in Hell's Kitchen! I came for dinner and ordered from the prix fixe menu ($27), which was quite a good deal for a soup, salad, appetizer, a main dish, and a dessert (although everything other than the main dish was quite small).

To start, the Thai garden salad and original spring rolls were very standard in quality - not much to note there.

The Galangal soup had a very nice coconut flavor to go with the chicken pieces and mushrooms inside.

The Pad Woonsen was definitely my favorite dish as these stir-fried glass noodles were surprisingly flavorful - more so than normal glass noodles.

For dessert, the coconut ice cream was nice and creamy and had little coconut shavings inside too.

Outside of the prix fixe menu, I also tried the Mixed Seafood Pineapple Fried Rice ($21), which was good but rather standard in quality.

The place itself has a pretty normal Thai restaurant kind of vibe. It is medium sized with a decent amount of seating inside. Most of the tables were full when I went for a Friday night dinner, but I only had to wait a couple minutes to get a table. The staff are fairly friendly and attentive. The service speed is pretty quick.

Overall, I would definitely recommend Yum Yum Too if you are looking for good Thai food in Hell's Kitchen. I think the prix fixe menu is a good value way to explore a number of different options from the menu, and would particularly recommend you try the Pad Woonsen.

I ate here last night. The food was very mediocre, the portions were small and our waiter was very unfriendly.

The prix fixe menu was a rip off.

I won't be returning.

This was a great place to go to after the theatre - It was quite late -11:00 pm. And it did not disappoint We got shrimp basil sauce with Thai fried rice and tom yum goong (soup that has shrimp in it and more). It was very good and we were only sorry that the kitchen was closing down. The waitress was very attentive and that was excellent. I would recommend this place to all ages. 9th Avenue has a lot of restaurants and this is one that has been here for a very long time. If you like Thai, I recommend it.

Was walking around HK with a friend and saw thia Thai spot to grab a quick bite to eat. So glad we ate here because we were able to soak in fresh air outside and enjoy great food with each others company.

We were immediately served and seated outside- the menu looked delicious but we just knew we wanted to share the pad thai and drunken noodles - keep it simple and easy. our food came out pretty immediately and omg the pad thai is perfectly seasoned with a rich peanut flavor, not overwhelming at all. probably one of the best pad thais ive had. the drunken noodles i wished were spicier bug they were pretty good. enjoyed both these dishes

we also got 2 drinks and i must say cocktail and food prices here are so reasonable. definitely would return and recommend!!
Drunken noodles and sticky rice hit the spot. Nice sized portions. Flavorful and not too spicy. Will order again!

I ordered takeout from here last night and I was pleasantly surprised with the food. I got the karee curry and the portion size was great and so was the taste. We stopped in to order the takeout and they took care of us very quickly. The restaurant also looked cozy so I would definitely dine in here in the future!!

I really love this place. I've been a few times and recently went for their lunch special. It's super affordable and the service is always wonderful. I ordered the chicken pad Thai and it was so so good! It's also one of my favorite restaurants in the area because I love the laid-back atmosphere. Location-wise it's also in a great spot, located in Hell's Kitchen and super close to the busy Times Square area. I would also add that their dumplings are very authentic and have a delicious taste.

Lunch
Wish if there were no stars to put for today's experience.. I came here during my lunch limited time to try out this place for the 1st time "I am a big fan of Thai cuisine " but I got out immediately.. the server "a girl with glasses" was extremely rude while I was asking a question for a vegetarian soup , she was like do you want someone else to serve with a pissed off face .. he manager wasn't professional as well .. I heard her talking in a loud voice complaining about my order right behind my back and it was embarrassing .. once I decided to leave the manager didn't do anything other than removing the glass of water quickly .. such a shitty service, server & manager & a waste of time !
Will never come here n will let my colleagues n friends know about it! literally anyone!

Edit: I see a lot of complaints about this waitress n service in general on google + food quality .. Glad I didn't order

Quick fast lunch here in midtown west. Their lunch special consist of an appetizer and an entree. I ordered the vegetarian spring roll and pad see ew with beef. Nothing special - mediocre for an affordable price. I was in and out in 30 minutes.

Total meal cost $10.75 before tax and tips.

I came here with my friends a few nights ago. I called ahead to see if we could make a reservation but they said they do not take reservations and that it is first come first serve. I arrived around 7pm on a Monday and luckily did not have to wait for a seat, but maybe it was because it was raining outside. My friends and I ordered the pre-fixe menu with came with 5 courses -- I ordered the tum yum soup, spring rolls, salad, green curry as my main dish,and got coconut ice cream for dessert. We also ordered beer which is singha. Overall, it was a great value meal since it came with so much food. The pre-fixe menu has two options -- I believe one side was around $26 and the other side was around $35 but both had amazing options. The servers were extremely kind and always came to check up on us and refill our cups of water. The ambiance was also nice as they had great decorations and a calm, modern looking space. I would definitely come back again in the future!

I went here by accident. I thought I was going to another place with a lot of great reviews on yelp and didn't realize my mistake until the food arrived and saw something didn't match up. I was taken in by the prixe fix menu and should've know better. Nice enough staff, the restaurant itself was quaint, minus the flying bugs that kept landing on my table--it's September and cool out, so not the heat of summer, so I was not expecting insects.  
But the food was probably the worst Thai food I've had in years. The low point was the peanut sauce, giant blobs of it on the salad and salad garnishes on the spring roll plate.  WAAAY too much, horrible consistency, and almost no flavor, so not worth the calories or the fat. The spring rolls were fine, but the dipping sauce was also super sweet and uninteresting and adds nothing to the spring rolls. The Galangal soup was tasty enough, but the chicken pieces were hard as a rock and I had to give up on chewing them and settled for the mushrooms, again, fine. The biggest disappointment by far was the pad thai.  The flavor was almost there, but lacked depth of any kind, and the presentation, a big premixed glob of spaghetti thin rice vermicellin instead of the standard rice stick, a more flat linguine shaped noodle, really ruins this dish, along with the fact that they mix in WAAY too much finely crushed peanut, so it's inescapable and I had to stop midway through the dish it was so overpowering to the texture and overall flavor of the dish. The flavor was lacking, so I asked for cilantro and they had no cilantro.  No cilantro in a Thai restaurant? Um, send someone out to the store, you can't operate for a night without cilantro in a thai restaurant. That just shows a lack of caring I just can't understand.  The food here was overall really bad, if you are reading this, the other restaurant you want has a similar name and is on 49th St, go there, don't make the same mistake I did!
Very nice Thai Restaurant on Restaurant Row. If you like Thai food, you will love this one.

Solid spot for good food near theaters post-show. Fast service and ambiance was good. We got classic Thai dishes, like the Tom Yum fried rice, pineapple fried rice, drunken noodles, and a chefs special Bangkok street noodles.

My favorite local Thai in Hells Kitchen
Great food and gear prices
Excellent friendly staff.
Our local go-to!

Food is tasty and well prepared.
It was received promptly and was piping hot. Thank you.

OMG it took a lot for me to finally try this place and let me tell you I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED! I had the shrimp basil fried rice and it was amazing good to me. I tried the shrimp spring roll (not enough shrimp) the sauce was good. The restaurant is small and service for takeout was pleasant.
Good food, good service and reasonable prices. Took off 1 star for small portions and only have 2 types of ice cream for dessert selection.

Great tasting food that was accompanied by very fast service and warm waiters. The dining room is large and comfortable if you're considering whether to dine in or not.

Long story short, you'll get good tasting food, quick service, and a relaxing ambiance at a great price!

Very pleasant. Nice decor. Great location. Reasonable service allow 30 min for food after ordering - can be a consideration for pre-theater planning. Specific food comments with my pictures: vegetarian soup,

Very authentic Thai food with good service.
The restaurant itself seems needed some deep cleaning or it is the NYC style?
Food was amazing and reasonably priced. Everything came out very quickly and hot. I got the veg/tofu pad Thai, YUM YUM (2). Toilet was a little dirty.
Best food and service we had in NYC (for price range) great service, food was excellent. Will definitely return so many other dishes I want to try.

I ordered Tom Yum noodle soup at Yum Yum Too today. It was recommended by the staff for today's chef's special. And I am so glad I had it, very yummy! It is not too spicy, but it's perfect for the winter, warmed my body and my heart. Highly recommend it to everyone! The Thai iced tea is also my all time favorite.

If you're looking for delicious Thai food at prices a little less than others in the area then go to Yum Yum.  I have been going for five years and have never been disappointed.

Friendly staff with no attitudes.

Upbeat and modern playlist.

This is a 3.45. I am not rounding up but I'm coming back to confirm the size of entrees and the ingredients. The servers are very friendly and there's no fuzz nor glitz here--one meal is meant to be for 1 person only regardless of the size of the plate.
Why am I not rounding up: ingredients are not as pictured and stuff is salty. W46 is my street for late dinners. This is my second time on W46 for dinner at 10PM on a weeknight.

Food
Pad See Ew Black Sauce w/Mock Duck
-.5
Noodles are so broken that I would not call them noodles, I would call them noodle shreds. I have never cared about presentation but it was like the left overs of any noodle they had left
-.5
Missing lotus root slices and other veggies ie bell pepper as pictured in the menu are not on my dish. And, missing noodle if you ask me!
-.5
Salty noodles
Very salty mock duck

Price
$13 min for an entree is reasonable, but not for this size. Alone, you still feel hungry after. You can't share 50/50 with another either person family style either bc it's more of a small(er than average) appetizer after splitting

Service
My glass of water got refilled 4 times in 40 mins. That's 5 glasses of water on a warmer day. The other chair at my 2 top (I ate alone) had drops of some liquid on it so I sat in the other chair

Overpriced generic Thai food with no flavour. Left 15% tip and the waitress stopped us at the door to give her more money. When I said we didn't think it warranted a higher tip she said not to return. Don't worry, would not be. Very rude. Avoid

I have been coming to this restaurant for the last 4 years but I have noticed that lately my favorite dishes are no longer the same ! It's sad cause the flavor of the cuisine used to be great but the last 3 times I visited this place including tonight that for the first time I send a dish back and cancel my order cause it's absurd that you order a dish that supposed to have beef and you literally can count the 4 little pieces of meat the dish had ! The time before this last I had to send the dish back and they added the quantity like it used to be before but this time I had enough ! It makes me sad the restaurant's like this compromise the quality of the service !!
Will definitely not come back !
Made my takeout in ten minutes and gave me water while I waited at the counter. Great service and food was solid!
Called ahead. Told they couldn't take reservations. Showed up for a party of five and was turned away...like f this place! What? Your just going to refuse customers?

The food at this place in years past has been so much better than it was on this night. The spring rolls tasted like iceberg lettuce and were flavorless. The highlight were the coco shrimp, which is disappointing when I ordered four appetizers and only one was really good. The salad was as terrible as the spring rolls. Definitely iceberg lettuce and the whole meal was just disappointing and I didn't eat most of the meal. There are too many Thai spots in the city, I won't be back here. And my friend waited 35 minutes for fried rice. We were asking for our check when the rice finally came.

Place was super cute. They checked our vaxx cards and we were sat right away. Not to far from time square either, but just far enough to escape the madness. We order margaritas and food, which all came out super quick. Our server was lovely so was the hostess. Food was pretty standard but good.
Came in for a quick bite. While the service was fast and  friendly, the drunken noodles and spring rolls were mediocre at best.
Great and fast service, delicious and healthy food. Perfect for every occasion.  The restaurant has different options to choose from for sharing or taking individual plates.

they really have great food!  because of their location, they serve you so fast, you think you are being rushed out the door. all of their restaurants used to be in the theater district.  this one not so much. still they rush, rush, rush!  it really comes off asig they are rude. some of the waitress'were rude.  i have not been to this location in a long while.  i will give them another opportunity to see how they are serving their customer's now a days!  their food is actually delicious! hopefully the waitress' have been in this country long enough that they won't be so kurt!! we will see! you know, i can always update this review to kill their business or give them a great review!  
my friends!!! within the next 3 werks for the next home giants game i will be back in

Comfort food to the core! After walking around the city I saw this restaurant and figured I'd give it a try, 100% satisfied to the max. Exceptionally flavorful and overall delicious! And don't even get me started on the drinks!!

I give it 3 stars because the place was filthy very dirty the table clothes were disgusting they had flies everywhere not healthy however it does not take from the amazing food the quality of food deserves 5 stars simply they need to clean their restaurant I enjoyed it

Came down to the ninth avenue street fair . Wasn't really happy with the food choices and prices. So decided to eat here instead. We tried the prefix menu for 24.95 . You get soup salad appetizer entree and dessert. Was a good value. The only thing that I didn't like was the 18 percent tip posted on receipt. We should decide how much to tip . The food and the service was good though so probably would have given that amount anyway.
We always stop here when we visit NYC. Food is delicious, staff is welcoming and prices are reasonable. Recommend the Pad Thai and the duck roll appetizer.

A review for take out. Food was prepared quickly.

Tom yum goong soup (spicy lemongrass with mushrooms and shrimp) was unique. My friend didn't like the fishy, slightly acidic/sour flavor, which was unusual at first, but with every new spoonful I savored the fullness of it. I'm not a fan of soups, but this one was satisfying and original. The broth had the flavor combination that I've never tasted before. Not particularly spicy--just right (this is coming from a white person who can not handle any spice). Would definitely get this again!

Drunkman noodles was perfectly mild spicy. I can't handle white--I'm as white as it gets, so I enjoyed the mild heat of this dish. Good ratio of protein to noodles. Tasty sauce that was the right consistency. Enjoyed this dish.

Sautéed beef with broccoli and rice was meh. Too little protein compared to rice.
Prices good, pad Thai better. It was a last minute find before Broadway and no regrets. Delicious.

Love popping in here for lunch whenever in Manhattan ( Times Square area)They have a great lunch special--under $14 with 2 starters and 1  entree. Food is flavorful and service is attentive

I usually opt to start with the Tom Yum Shrimp  Soup( 1 medium shrimp, mushrooms and scallion in a flavorful broth) Vegetable Dumpling (2 pieces) then an entree such as the pineapple fried rice  or pad Thai. For additional charge, you can add in chicken, beef, shrimp etc

They also have a prefixed menu which comes with fried ice cream dessert $24+

As much as I wanted to like this place, food was just OK:
- Setting leaned more towards casual than fancy but the crisp white linens with a layer of white paper on top added a touch of fanciness
- Merlot was decent though not overly bold or complex - but very good happy hour prices
- Mango salad was lacking a lot of flavor - while mango was the perfect ripeness, the 'dressing' was sorely lacking heat, sourness and tartness
- I couldn't find any basil (Holy or otherwise) in the pad kee mao - that's a big no-no

Cute little spot. I took my cousin here for a bday lunch and we loved the food and most importantly... the price was amazing. They had an amazing deal for lunch. I believe it was an option of 2 starters + a entree. I got the pad Thai and dumplings and the salad with ginger dressing. They obviously are small portions than if you were to order from the regular part of the menu but they suffice.

Dumplings were not bad but i would try other stuff on the menu. The egg rolls are delicious. Super crunchy and have  the most phenomenal sauce. The salad was amazing. Fave starter. The dressing gives the salad this delicious little oomf to it. I would describe it as salty yet gingery vinegary ( couldn't put it any other way) . Not bad at all

seating was outside when we went. Since it was closer to the summer, it was nice to sit outside and enjoy the meal. I would love if they made it a little more private though, like add a railing/ green wall.

Overall great lunch and will be coming back to try the rest

UPDATE: went back on 12/2020
They are taking the proper precautions necessary. You walk in, they take your order and you wait. This time around I hate their lunch special ( 1app and an entree)
Had their tom kha Kai ( coconut soup) & pad woonsen ...
the coconut soup wasn't really my favorite since I noticed it was a bit watered down in my opinion. It tastes sweet of course, with a bit of mushroom, chicken and scallions. I wasn't the biggest fan but it wasn't bad

The pad woonsen though... okay wow! Delicious. I enjoyed its glass noodles and all of the vegetables that came with it. It was an amazing dish and if you're a pad Thai lover and like veggies, THIS is the plate for you.
The food was all takeout but they give you such a large portion and with an app, so it's perfect. the best part is that it's only $10 !!

The only reason why this place gets a 1 star is because of their costumer service & the aroma of the food once you walk in. My food tasted horrible and I'm not sure if ordering 30 minutes before the kitchen closes played as a factor. My food tasted rushed ! At the bottom of my drunken noodles it was very oily (I never had drunken noodles oily before). The drunken noodles HAD NO FLAVOR. For a second I thought I was eating noodles from a soup. I asked for my noodles to be spicy and it has o spice. We ordered drinks to go and it was filled with ice. Maybe if we dined in we would have a better experience but my to go experience was horrible. Sorry Yelp family, but it's a no for me!

I came here on a weekday and got their lunch special. You can get 2 starters and 1 entree for around $11 which is a really good deal! I tried their Shrimp Tom Yum soup, Chicken Coconut soup, Vegetable dumplings, and Vegetable Crispy Rolls. Both the soup taste okay, they're both pretty sour. I would not recommend the vegetable dumplings, you could definitely get better dumplings elsewhere, but the vegetable rolls were pretty good. For the entree I tried their chicken pad thai and chicken drunken noodles. Both entrees taste delicious! Overall, I prefer the entrees over the starters but the food is great for the price! I would definitely come back to try more entree dishes
Overpriced mediocre Thai food. The only saving grace is the location which is close to the theater district. McDonald's would have been cheaper, faster, and better.

Great deals on food. Great soup. Everything else is mediocre at best. Let it be known that I really try not to give bad reviews, especially during this time. The experience I had here was something worth mentioning, though.

The most noteworthy event was that I found a piece of wood (maybe?) and tons of eggshells in my Pad Thai (which was recommended to me through the seamless app so they have definitely made it countless times...)  Not exactly what I want to be awkwardly crunching on  mid lunch. I have included pictures of aforementioned pieces that should not have been in my food.

The only reason for the two stars was because the soup that came with the disastrous Pad Thai was actually very delicious. So flavorful, I wish that I had just ordered a full order of the chicken coconut soup. The flavor of the pad Thai itself was ok, pretty basic and a bit too greasy for my taste.

Maybe I'll give them another shot and update, who knows

I enjoy my visit whenever I come to the city.

The food here is overall good but sometimes I find the it could lack in flavor sometimes. However, the portions for the entires are a decent portion. For those who love to eat its enough for one person but for those who have a lighter appetite it you could share a dish.

They do offer two pre-fixes, where you receive an appetizer, entree and dessert. Yet the distinguishable difference is that one pre-fixe has more entree options than the other. The pre-fixe is super economical and great for tourists who want to eat good without breaking the bank.

Whenever I come the service is always quick and they make sure they check in as need be.  

As for the drinks, the ones I have tried have been weak in flavor and alcohol. I understand that a good cocktail won't necessarily taste like alcohol, but theirs dont even have taste...yaknow. For instance, The Mango Fizz, wasn't a tasty drink. It didnt have the mango flavor I was expecting but it did have the fizz and it wasn't sweet like you would compare to a mango, but actually tasted a bit sour. Non-cocktail drinks like their Thai iced tea, always slaps.

Overall, one of my favorite cheap quick eat thai spots.

Ordered delivery on a Friday night. Estimated time was 30-40 minutes and it got here in only 20, so fast!
The order came in easy to recycle or upcycle deep plastic tupperwares, which I appreciate.
We got two entrees and both were fairly priced at $14. I appreciate that regardless of your choice in protein (beef, chicken, shrimp) they all cost the same. Many other Thai places charge $2-$4 more for adding protein that isn't tofu.
The drunken noodles had the flat noodle and a spicy sauce with some basil. The vegetables were a bit over cooked but overall it was good.
The pad woon sen with glass noodles was pretty bland but generally speaking it's going to be mild because it's like a gravy sauce.
Is it the best Thai food I've ever had? No. Does the price and fast delivery make it a viable Friday night option? Yes, yes it does.

In the mood for Thai food after going to a Broadway show or just strolling by Restaurant Row? Look no further than Yum Yum Too, an Asian fusion Thai restaurant serving delicious traditional and modern dishes.

I've been frequenting Yum Yum Too for a decade. Over the years, I tried many of their dishes and I always get the calamari, chicken curry puffs, duck rolls, and summer & regular spring rolls for appetizers, then paw se-ew black noodles, drunken noodles, pad thai for our entrees, and green tea ice cream for dessert. When I felt adventurous, I had the snapper and salmon - both cooked to perfection. When we dined in the restaurant, we always ordered the prix fix - such a excellent 5 course meal for a reasonable price!

Although the restaurant space is not big, I appreciate the chic interior design and quaint space . No restaurants have a simple and tasteful wine glass chandelier like Yum Yum Too. The space permits one to actually have a private conversation unlike other restaurants in the area. Perfect for date night or a catch up with friends. The drinks at the bar varies as I usually stick to my glass of wine but my friends had their mixed drinks and beer during our last dining experience.

I highly recommend checking out the plethora of flavorful dishes at Yum Yum Too. They are currently offering an update menu for takeout or delivery - lunch at $8 per entree and dinner at $10 per entree amid COVID-19. Happy to do my part to support local business.

OHHH Me GOODNESS SAKE! I live down the street from this wonderful place , and no SHITE, me " cutie  BEAR" and I order the " family platter" . Two of them !  Two different ones . . The food is soo fresh it actually will last in your Frigidaire if you have any left over . There are plenty of " sushi" places around here, but none like this ! Great prices as well . Their delivery " chap "  is here quickly , with everything packed up precisely as wanted , many a time a few xtra treats included ( ohh me gosh ! Now I sound like a pup! ) I've ordered many times from here , and never have had one problem . Anyhoo Cheers to all you foodies.
About the same quality and flavor as supermarket sushi. Blandest miso soup I've ever had.

Although small and unassuming, they have very quick service perfect for takeout and many sushi options.

I got the tiger roll and soft shell crab roll. They were fresh and filling, and I got my order within 10 minutes. Highly recommend!
