Still a great place for takeout sushi. The maki are prepared with skill and speed, and generously proportioned with high quality fish.

Prices have gone up a little, and they no longer offer a 10% discount for pickup, but this is still my go-to takeout in midtown.
A hole in the wall - amazing sushi for great prices. My go to sushi takeout. Lots of vegetarian options!

Their food is excellent & their service is terrific. Whenever I order from them, they prepare my food in no time at all! And the people who make the food are really nice. Highly recommend if you're looking for a sushi  place in the Times Square/Restaurant Row area! So good! Thanks, Katherine PS Their spicy mayo is on point. Order extra! : )
Really high quality with large portions of fish in each roll. Service is always under 15 mins, highly recommend for takeout!

Ordered once from this place, for delivery, and I was shocked at how quick and delicious it was! Today is Thanksgiving, they have not answered the phone yet, but I am hoping they are open so I can put another order in!

Still have not dined inside but the service, food and time delivered was 5 Stars!

This is my new favorite sushi place in Hell's Kitchen! Definitely a hole in the wall, I've walked past many times and hadn't even noticed it. I got the salmon lover and it was so good I had to come back the next day and get some sashimi. Great sushi especially for the price! Will be coming here a lot more often.
Great place for takeout food was on point and affordable. They had it ready quickly and we're very friendly.
I've gone here several times since I live right by it. I usually get their combo with the salmon avocado, eel avocado, and spicy tuna. Cute little shop, but overall good sushi!

amazing! you'd be surprised of what type of rolls comes out this hole in the wall mom & pop's sushi spot! I'm not a big fan of eel but OMG! The Dancing eel from Yuri is pure amazing! No dining in, only take away! they make the rolls fast too!
The shishito peppers were a little salty but the crispy rice and sushi was really good. The tuna fans sushi roll and the spicy tuna were great and i would buy from here again.

Tried this place for take out and really liked the food. The fish tasted fresh. I tried the spicy tuna roll, rainbow roll, and samurai roll. I usually hate take out or delivery sushi because the fish doesn't taste fresh but this place is meant for take out.

Recently ordered Sushi Deluxe... 9 pieces of sushi and 1 tuna roll. It was prepared well, delivered promptly and was fresh tasting. No complaints regarding the quality of the fish but the selection left much to be desired. Generally, when you order a sushi entree with multiple pieces you get a selection. Often time a 7- or 9-piece entree will actually give you 7 or 9 different pieces of sushi. This was not that. In fact, it was multiple pieces of the same sushi. 2 and even 3 pieces of the same sushi which was very disappointing. Perhaps they simply don't have a great selection, and this is what they do. Honestly it was no different from the sushi you can get a grocery store in terms of selection. I didn't want 3 pieces of salmon and 2 pieces of this and that. Again... it was good but just not much of a selection. Don't think I'll ever order from them again.
Fair prices, great phish to rice ratio, quick delivery, don't sleep on their shumai soup ! Packed with veggies and a nice broth, order from this place on the regular.
small hole in the wall takeout joint, fish was really fresh and yummy. a little pricy for the size but worth it! i would come back to try the lunch special
Great takeout sushi spot. I enjoyed the Spicy Scallop Roll & Salmon Avocado Roll, very fresh and flavorful
Very quick service, picked up sushi less than 10 minutes after ordering! Spicy tuna and avocado were good. Easy quick place in Hell's Kitchen.

Perfect sushi!!
The fish is fresh, the vegetables are of excellent quality, and the price is fair, their service is excellent, and they arrive all the time on time, I will continue to order from them, recommend the place!!!!!
I ordered online for pick-up and thr sushi is great! Rice to fish ratio is perfect if you like less rice like me. Prices aren't outrageous either, would order from here again in the future.

Delivery.com said it would take an hour but the guy arrived in about 20 minutes so was happy with the speed, the fish tasted fresh and not too soaked with sauce on the special tiger roll I ordered and reasonably priced.  I don't like spicy sushi but the special roll I got (tiger) had some kick to it and it was still delightful. I'll be back!

Yuri Sushi is mainly a take out and delivery restaurant since there is essentially no seating. I have had their sushi a few times and for the price, it did not disappoint. I believe you get 10% off if you pick up the order instead of delivery.

My friends and I pitched in to get their party tray #1, which is essentially 10 maki rolls. I like their fish-to-rice ratio because you don't just get a bunch of rice that dilutes the flavors of the fish. They were also nice enough to substitute one of the rolls since no one liked that particular one.

I have also tried their sushi and sashimi combo lunch special, which includes 4 pieces of nigiri, 9 pieces of sashimi and a 6 piece California roll and comes with miso soup. The quality of the fish is pretty average, but it definitely was good enough to be enjoyable.

I would order from them again if I am craving sushi but don't want to splurge on more expensive sushi. They are a good mix of quality and affordability.

My go to sushi spot. Their maki combos are a great deal and because they are take out only the fish is always fresh (sometimes I feel sushi restaurants that do both send home the less pretty looking fish). I also always get the seaweed salad and the proportion is huge for the price! Love this hole in the wall delicious place!

Was looking for a new sushi spot and stumbled on this restaurant. If you're looking for a sit down...don't even think about it! It has two stools and no other space! Workers were right behind me as I sat there.

If you're looking for just for the food to grab and go or order out...it was great! The sushi wasn't fishy at all! Very tasty and the rolls were packed! I also ordered a chicken udon soup. The chicken was grilled and I really that. Normally you can't tell it's even chicken. It had lots of veggies inside too. I also got 10% off my order. I would definitely order from here again. To go...not to stay.
A little hidden gem in my neighborhood! Fresh tasting and super fast. I usually get the lobster wasabi roll, spicy tuna, and eel avocado roll.
Fabulous neighborhood sushi . Fast delivery . Excellent everytime . Will keep going back

This place is great for takeout. I ordered online and when I got there, one of the staff was ready to hand me my order. So quick and easy.

I ordered the shrimp and vegetable tempura bento box ($12 with tax). The miso soup was delicious with lots of little soft tofu cubes. The tempura came with 7 pieces, 3 shrimp (yum!), 2 broccoli and 2 squash/pumpkin - all delicious. The tempura sauce wasn't what it should be, but still a good accompaniment. The shu mai was standard and the 4-piece Cali roll was really good! Overall, it was filling and satisfying. I'll definitely be back and look forward to trying more of their sushi.

I was heading to another place for dinner, but saw the great reviews they had for Yuri so decided to stop by.

This place is literally a hole in the wall. The restaurant is probably 10x20 space with the kitchen taking up half of that. They have a few window seats by the entrance, but you probably won't want to sit and eat. Majority of their business is delivery/take out.

Eats.
Charming salmon roll. This is a basic roll with salmon and avocado inside & salmon and crunch on top. My order, unfortunately was missing the crunch. Nevertheless it was delicious! The quality of the fish here is SO GOOD! I haven't had fish this good in a while. Plus I love that they don't put too much rice with the roll so you can actually taste something other than rice :)

I placed my order and received it within 5 minutes. You can't beat that for the city that never sleeps! I'll def be back if I'm ever in the area again, looking for a quick bite.
Delivery is great! Sushi is fresh and a great value too. I call the restaurant and order direct though. They are very lovely and their delivery is prompt and done well.
Great simple rolls - always fresh. Usually delivered early. Love the spicy tuna, Californian roll with snow crab and salmon +cucumber. Great steamed broccoli and nice salads.

Super solid, good value, tasty, and fast. The spicy scallops rolls are my favorite, spider roll is yummy too. If you pick up you get 10% off. I feel like every time I've ordered over $50-$60 they've thrown in edamame! Definitely recommend.

This place actually doesn't look like much, but the sushi definitely delivers. I have lived here for almost 2 years and haven't found any fairly priced sushi that's as good as Yuri. Sushi in the city is always overpriced and mediocre but my girlfriend and I were so surprised when we tried Yuri for the first time!

A great little sushi place in Hell's Kitchen. Their sushi is amazing and fresh. One thing that stands out is the not so common crunch sushi which uses special crumbs to give the sushi extra taste which is great. Their spicy tuna and salmon and my favorites. Their chicken teriyaki is also great and the bento box is one that I get most often when it's around lunch time. They just have no place to really sit and can get pricey mainly during dinner if you want some of the entrees.

For one year I've been ordering here because I work a block away ,, one time they charge me twice and my credit card company called me to adjust it and now I place an order and the person over the phone is like oh we don't want to take your credit card no more only cash because you dispute last charge I'm like I didn't my banks said you charge me twice same amount and he said he doesn't care and I should've called them instead I'm like my friend my credit card company saw a double charge and called me so what ever I hung up and will not being doing business with them ever again .. during COVID they doing this and insulting and embarrassing a  customer over the phone
Really good sushi for a slightly high price. There's nowhere to sit so make sure you have plans to take the food somewhere or else you'll be eating on the side of the road

Super fast delivery! Estimated time was 40-50 min but came in maybe 10-20. The regular sushi rolls are great and so is the salmon sashimi, though didn't love the yellowtail or white tuna. The sashimi cuts seemed much better than the sushi cuts so will opt for sashimi going forward. Sashimi orders come with 2 pieces. The miso soup was incredibly bland but didn't mind since the sushi was good. This will probably be my new go-to sushi delivery place!

Note: no real seating inside. Mostly just a delivery place.

Seen a mouse in the kitchen yuckkkk!!!!
Not coming back for sure..definitely not recommended!!
Go to take out sushi. Food has always been consistently fresh and quick delivery. Owners are really nice as well :)

Fastest delivery I've ever experienced. They handled my food allergies very well and my food was delivered so fast (our hotel was a few blocks away). I really appreciated how quickly our craving for sushi was satisfied. Sushi was very fresh and we hope to enjoy their sushi once more before we leave NYC.

Very solid sushi!!! As mentioned by others, this is a takeout/delivery place, but I'm fine with that as I travel for business and don't like to sit alone in a restaurant anyway unless it's a real treat. Sashimi was nice and fresh and good size pieces as compared to some others. Rolls are good (I particularly like the King Rainbow). Have had their sushi 5 times in the last 2 weeks and I find it to be very consistent.
Really great takeout sushi spot. Fresh ingredients and affordable. Recommend for a night in sushi order! Good spicy tuna. Fresh salmon. Great fancy rolls. Yum!

Hidden gem or maybe I'm just the last to get the memo (very possible).

It is safe to say this is the most affordable and delicious sushi I have found in my hood. Especially when I walk home, strategically, right passed this place and snag the 10% off if you order there.

Don't be deceived by the exterior because it is excellent sushi!!!

Really great lunch specials.
Have tried the chicken teriyaki bento box, maki specials, as well as a chef special roll. All delicious! Fish is fresh. Highly recommend.

Yuri Sushi is a cute little sushi shop right off the corner of 46th. The place is a little small, but there are a couple of seats available to dine in. The place seems more like a grab and go rather than a sit down and eat with your friends though.

The place is run by the a very sweet asian lady, who even gave me a free miso soup on my first visit.  

The menu is actually quite extensive with many different rolls, sushi, sashimi, and even noodles and rice dishes. I usually opt for the sushi tools which are fairly priced and quality is pretty good. I have ordered a variety of rolls from here (salmon avocado, eel avocado, yellowtail scallion, tuna avocado etc.) and have not been disappoint ed

For a quick sushi fix, I highly recommend coming and checking this place out. Also on the window it says 10% off, which is a great deal!

Lovvveeee this place. I ordered delivery for lunch, and everything came out amazingggg. I ordered shrimp tempura, the spicy mango crunch shrimp, and spicy tuna roll. I ordered the lunch special with the three rolls and a ginger ale that comes with it. Honestly, this is a really great deal considering the fact that you're basically paying for the rolls and a free soda. Everything tasted amazing and fresh. This was my first time ordering from here and it definitely won't be my last. Also, if you're looking to order for lunch, they're really good at on-time delivery. I ordered my food at around 11 and it was delivered by 12:30.

Fantastic sushi place. Reasonably priced and the fish is always fresh. Delivery is always super quick. Every time I've done pickup they are very COVID conscious which is important to me. All in all one of my favorite neighborhood spots.

It's a tiny spot in the heart of restaurant row in Manhattan for takeout only.  I've only ordered sushi and sashimi lunch specials which were awesome.  I'd like to try their fatty salmon and tuna next time.  I noticed they are the only ones who serve these in midtown west.  Atmosphere of the place looks cramp. It's a tiny hole in the city. But it's great !!! Food is neatly packed !!!

Quick takeout - good sushi at a decent price. I just got a spicy tuna crunch roll and a salmon roll, but it was super good. Highly recommend for a quick fix if you're craving some cheaper simple sushi in the area.

I just ordered from this place. 15 minutes after their estimated arrival time, I called the restaurant to check on my order. A woman picked up the phone with a "Hello?" I thought I had the wrong number so I asked, "Is this Yuri Sushi?" It was. What kind of business answers the phone like that?? Anyway, I finally received my food 20 minutes past the estimated time.

The pork gyoza was definitely not fresh. It had weird unidentifiable lumps in the meat. The sauce was also unenjoyable. I think it was vinegar and soy sauce.

The shrimp tempura roll was big, but I asked for no avocado, and of course, they gave me avocado. The roll, itself, was only okay.

I'm disappointed in this restaurant's lack of professionalism, wait time, and poor food. I will not be ordering from here again.

Updated: I'm taking off a star from my previous review because I found all the fried tofu in my fish spicy pot to be moldy. They tasted awful and had green moldy dots on them. Very disappointed because I really wanted to like this place.

Old review: I've never dined in here but I've ordered delivery from them about a dozen times whenever I get my hotpot crave kickin. All the delivery I've received were on time. They give a good portion. The spicy pot, mala tang and dry pots are delicious, I highly recommend them if you miss hot spicy soupy food and feel too lazy to go out to a restaurant - these are the best alternative you can get in Manhattan midtown without spending more than $20.
I've also tried their noodles and dumplings and I must say I understand why people give them negative reviews and get frustrated that this is not the "real kungfu steam bun" place. They're rather plain. And yes the other kungu steam bun place does have better noodles and dumplings. But hey, this place now call themselves "Yummy Malatang", I think they've done enough effort in recommending what is good to order from them - Malatang.

Food: 6/10
Service: 5/10
Atmosphere: 6/10

My wife and I stumbled into Yummy Malatang by mistake (we were actually looking for Kung Fu Kitchen), in search of soup dumplings and hand-pulled noodles.  We were admittedly a little disappointed when we realized that we were in the wrong place, but decided to stick with it and give the menu a whirl.  We started out with some steamed pork dumplings, which are really big and have a good flavor, but the wonton skins are a bit thick.  Next we decided to try the Fatty Beef with Chili Oil Noodle Soup (they aren't kidding about the fat and oil... not much flavor outside of that and kind of feels like you're hunting noodles in a vat of oil) and the Stir Fry Chicken with Noodles (really great flavor with super tender and moist chicken, and noodles with decent bite).  

In general, the food is fairly decent, and I probably would feel more positive about it had I not gone in literally expecting a totally different restaurant (the storefront signage seems a little intentionally misleading).  Service was polite, but a little inattentive and interactions felt awkward (hard to place, but the cadence of a normal diner-server conversation was definitely lacking, and any conversation/inquiries beyond the black and white of my order felt laborious).  Lastly, the atmosphere itself isn't too bad, and has a sleek traditional eastern Asian type of feel, but there's a really odd 30ish minute movie that they play on repeat in the background.  As far as I can tell, it is a documentary about an unfinished movie that the owner/founder was involved in - it's a good conversation crutch for a date, but it may not leave you at any less of a loss for words!

*** DON'T DOUBLE TIP THEM!!! ***

I saw this place from a foodie blog. When I stepped in today, I started to realize it is a wrong decision to have lunch here because it is the 'KUNGFU KITCHEN's sister restaurant.

Everybody knows KUNGFU KITCHEN plays their customers with tip fraud. BINGO! This place did the same thing $_$ PLEASE BE AWARE THAT THEY HAVE ALREADY CHARGED 15% TIP ON THE CHECK!!!!! So, when they return your card and bill copy requiring your signature, PLEASE DON'T WRITE ANY NUMBER ON 'TIP' LINE even if there is a writable place on the paper!!!!! Those goddamn waitstaff will not remind you because they just want to SCAM more money from you.

Seriously, if there is only TIP FRAUD issue but the food is good, I will leave at least 3 stars on Yelp. However, the food is mediocre. DRUNK CHICKEN tastes gross and SPICY COLD NOODLE is seasoned with TOOOOOOO much salts and MSGs. Moreover, nobody will add so much sugar in SPICY MIX DRY POT and SPICY HOT POT SOUP. I am willing to teach the chefs how to make the most authentic Chinese food.

Lastly, let me leave one word here: SHAME.

I've been ordering from this place on Seamless/Grubhub since they've been open.  Generally been a fan, like their sister restaurant and was one of my favorite malatang place.

Unfortunately tonight when I ordered there was some sort of insect (looks like a big ant or some sort of winged) in the beef malatang.  See photo.
Nasty!  

Malatang has a ton of ingredient and you have to trust the restaurant to be sanitary with them. Unfortunately there are clearly issues.  I'm grossed out as heck but also sad that I am losing my favorite malatang place!

I was there but I got kicked out because I had a kicked scooter with me. One of their staff yelled at me that I had to leave me scooter outside. I was there to pick up my food but he was so rude to me. So no more eating here. Fuc* this sh*t restaurant!

No stars.No such restaurant at this address.  I live 2 blocks away.  Phony reviews, unless Arby s, Jollibee, and Indikitch are going out of business, this place does not exist.  Edit: outside pix in prior reviews is of Kung Fu, across the street.

Ordered the sliced beef appetizer, noodles, and a tea for a late snack. First, for $14, the sliced beef appetizer is minuscule!  The take out box it came in was literally about 4 inches by 4 inches. Then the tea was put inside the paper bag -- it's not a bottle just a cup with lid -- so 30% of it has spilled out all over the rest of the box. The noodles were average.

Super disappointed, almost offended.
Truly delicious and authentic...cold skin noodles, cold noodles w sesame sauce, drunk chicken were all very tasty! I want to go back to try the dry pot.

Had both the beef and chicken dry pots, delivered. This is a top tier authentic dry pot experience, the blend was savory and aromatic without being overly salty. Was surprised by the quantity and quality of ingredients despite the low price. I'm really excited about this place and it has instantly become my favorite delivery in the area. Before taking the trip to Flushing, try this place.

No star make up restaurant can't find the place in the neighborhood. Picture from KungFu Kitchen and don't know why they photoshop another restaurant name on the menu from this "hope" yelper. Very disappointed

I believe this place share has the same owner as the ramen and steamed bun place next door. But this place has a much smaller selection of items and everything seems to be overpriced. They also don't taste as good.

On my first visit here (takeout), I ordered the pork dumplings which did take the advertised 20 minutes along with the house special Ramen. I must say while the packaging for the dumplings was impressive, as they were all individually separated, they did not hold up to my expectations for a 20 minute wait. Nevertheless, I would say they are average to be better than average dumplings.  

For me the house special Ramen was better here I think the stars of this bowl were the broth, noodle as well as the hard-boiled egg. I definitely think this was a yummy Ramen. I'll be back to try it again when I'm back in the area.
not that good, I went here today. Not friendly. Also not too spicy. I won't now go there any more.
Order food delivery. Terrible, all soul is spilled. cannot be eaten anymore. Never come back

Ordered the hot pot, veggie noodles and dumplings. The veggie noodles order was given after a few minutes but no other orders were given. I saw other customers coming in later and their orders deliveres promptly! Called the staff'  attention- one said that our orders really take a long time to cook; the other one said it's still cooking while another said "the machine is not working." In short, no one really paid attention. They offered discount but we just paid for the noodles and left. Horrible! Worst service!
Very friendly staff. Easy to get a table. Prices are fair. Quick services and the meat was very very good. Nice clean well lit dining room too.

When was the last time you came to a second story restaurant with no windows?  

Upstairs with the menu written on the steps going up.  

Very clean restaurant, but windowless, unusual for a second floor restaurant.

Menu has hamburger misspelled as hamburg in several places.  Hope their cooking is better than their spelling.  

Service is very slow.  If you are in a hurry to make a Broadway show, this is not the place to come to.  
 
Wife ordered the $15.50 beef vegetable in rice soup with egg.  Excellent presentation.  Ate it with a spoon.  Saw a lot of bean sprouts, rice and scrambled egg in a soup, but not much beef.

I had the $15.50 bibimbap.  Came steaming with mushrooms, egg, bean sprouts and rice in a boiling stew of water.  Tasty and looked good, but skimped on the meat again.  Perhaps an ounce of beef at most.  

The food portions were decent but small.  So little beef in both dishes that my vegetarian brother in law could have eaten it.  

We were supposed to go to Donburiya at 253 West 55th ave, but that was downstairs, and Tohbay was upstairs.  Won't make the same mistake again.

Came here hungry, left hangry. 

The only Japanese BBQ I've been to is Gyu-Kaku so I was really excited to find this restaurant. Unfortunately, my experience was underwhelming. Service was friendly but slow even though it wasn't busy (4 tables). Prices on the menu looked reasonable but when the food came, my friend and I were both surprised at how tiny the portions were! Since we were still hungry after our BBQ orders (and we didn't want to spend $100 more on meat to fill us up), we ordered the pork sundubu. Again, we were shocked at how small the dish was. We probably devoured the dish in 4-5 bites. Side note: if you want to fill up quickly, you should order a bowl of rice, which is ironically large given the size of their other dishes (we did not order rice but I saw how big of a bowl it is from the table next to ours). 

This place has potential but just overpriced in my opinion. I think I'll stick to Korean BBQ in K-town.

The quality of the meats here are pretty good and better than other yakiniku places I've tried at this price point. They also have some interesting items that you typically do not see at other places such as conch, 4 different varieties of intestines and pork jowl. We ordered the special assortment platter, conch, two types of intestines, pork jowl and the beef and vegetables rice soup. Everything tasted great, for some of the items they marinated it with miso or ponzu and it was delicious. All the items were also very fresh. I was pleasantly surprised with how delicious the rice soup was. It was so comforting, full of umami and just the perfect way to end the meal. I would come just for this soup!

The only complaint is that service is incredibly slow. The waitstaff was super friendly and nice and apologetic when food came out slow so I feel bad about the complaint. I think the problem is really with the kitchen service which from what I saw was only staffed with two people.

This place has a lot of potential because it's authentic, price is reasonable, has interesting cuts of meat that you can't find at some places, and everything is so clean here. I really hope they can address the slow kitchen service issue. I will definitely be back again.

I had a fantastic meal here. The place is clean and chill. Meats are fresh and good. The red meat platter is a winner. We also had the bibimbap which went well with the meats, the skirt steaks, and pork jowl, all which were very fresh and great.

Service is friendly, but at a slower pace than typical in NYC. Come when you're not in a rush, and you're in for a treat.

Considering the prices of everything these days, the cost was very fair, not too bad. We'll be back to try the wagyu platter!

Phenomenal restaurant. We wanted to go to the place next door originally (which is also great) but we've seen this one and I decided to experiment. We've never done the "cook for yourself" thing with various meats before so this was our first time and we had a blast. We tried the wagyu and the beef tongue. Clearly the meat is high quality and it was thinly sliced so it's ready in a minute or two. Both the edamame and the cabbage appetizers were good and my bibimbap was amazing as well as my husband's curry. Sake is also tasty and we arrived at the right time as there was happy hour with 50% off drinks. Yay! Our waitress was lovely, polite and very helpful (as I mentioned this was our first time in a restaurant like this so we needed some guidance, lol). The tea at the end of the meal was such a thoughtful gesture. Highly recommended!!

Great service very clean and good meet.
I like row liver !!!
日本の焼肉屋さんです。サービスも良いし美味しい！

We saw the soft opening information about Yakiniku Tohbay on Facebook. We love BBQ and it looked really appealing so we decided to give it a try. We did reservations for a group of 4 on a Saturday night but it's not really needed since there were lots of tables available.

The options on the menu were various, especially for testicular which is relatively rare compared to other restaurants. We had their Kimchi, Liver Sashimi, Assorted Beef Platter and Japanese Wagyu Beef Platter.

The food was decent, especially the beef platter, which was fresh & good quality with reasonable price. We won't recommend to order the Wagyu Beef Platter since it didn't taste better than the beef platter with much lower price.

However, the entire dining experience wasn't pleasant due to their service. The staff served everything quickly but their attitude was reluctant and rude. One of the reasons might have been the lack of staff, but it wasn't that busy.

Came to Yakiniku Tohbay on a Saturday night. We made reservations, but given this place was relatively new walk ins were available without a wait. I enjoyed the edgy decor of this Japanese bbq restaurant, and we were promptly seated upon a temperature check and filling out a contract tracing form.
We ordered the special assorted beef platter ($58), assorted Japanese Wagyu platter ($95), liver sashimi ($11), and kimchi ($6). One thing that struck me as pretty odd was how pushy and impatient the server was. Granted he was the only server for the night manning all the tables, but given that the restaurant was new he seemed to want to grab the menus from our hand and move on to the next table as soon as possible. From a service perspective it felt pretty uncomfortable and disappointing.

Despite not being a liver person, I took a stab at the liver sashimi which had ginger paste, scallion, and sesame oil on the side. At first it was a good balance, but the aftertaste of the liver was way too strong for my taste. We opted to bbq the liver after and it tasted much better to our liking. With regard to the special assorted beef platter and assorted Japanese Wagyu platter, I definitely recommend getting the special assorted beef platter. The amount of meat was similar and hands down the special assorted beef platter tasted much better in general (also almost half the price of the Japanese Wagyu platter!) Ordering kimchi was a good decision to balance all the meat we've cooked, and it wasn't too spicy. The overall quality of the food was pretty decent, but as other Yelpers noted, the dishes seemed to be on the smaller yet pricier side.

4 for food, 3-3.5 for service

We've been here twice for their Monday 40% off deal. Short rib, finger meat, and short plate all 40% off! Best if paired with their 50% off happy hour from 5:30-6:30.

Small portions, $3 rice, slow service (forgot our checks both times), but there are only 2 servers for the whole restaurant.

Place was okay, food was good but there were no ventilation systems and the smoke filled the entire restaurant! My party could barely breathe! Even the other people eating there were struggling. It would be a lot better if there were vents.

Came with my S.O. and it happened to be happy hour for some drinks and a discount for the skirt steaks. The food wasn't bad, but the portions were on the smaller size. Got the assorted marinade beef, an order of the wagyu skirt steak, and 2 orders of the Angus skirt steak. It comes with 2 dipping sauces which weren't bad, but you have to pay for rice and veggies if you want them. If it wasn't for the discounts, I don't think the price would be worth it. The service was quick and friendly.
Best japanese bbq ive had. Customer service was amazing i would 1000% recommend and even wish to keep that to myself because this is such a hidden gem and i will be back

Liver Sashimi：＊
Egg soup: ＊＊
Assorted Japanese Wagyu: ＊＊＊＊
Assorted Intesty： ＊＊＊＊
Vegetable: ＊

We arrived a bit after 6 pm on a snowy Saturday and were seated after a very short wait. They have a decent size dining area as well as limited bar seating.

We kept our meal light, ordering an app and two bowls. The liver sashimi was extremely fresh and tasty with the sesame sauce. The rice soup was a solid portion, however, only had two small cuts of beef. The beef intestine came in a smaller bowl but was filled to the top. Both were served boiling hot and after cooling off slightly delivered above average taste.

Service was good but it was a slow night. I enjoyed the complimentary tea that came at the end of our meal. I would go back to give the bbq a try!

Price: expensive
Portions: small
Ambience: modern & minimal

I've been to many Japanese bbq's, Korean bbq's and to Tokyo but I do not agree with the other reviews. The food was decent but not worth the price point. Menu lacked options and especially side dishes. Portions are extremely small.

I went to this restaurant with my fiancé and ordered sautéed kimchi $8, assorted meat plate $58 and assorted vegetables $8. Meat was cut smaller than other Korean/ Japanese BBQ restaurants in the area. I could've definitely ordered another meat plate for the portions we were served. Our server was very nice but gave no instructions on how to cook/ what to recommend ordering. The menu was minimal with no marketing on background of restaurant, how to cook bbq or call outs for what's best to order for a party of 2.

very clean restaurant and more space than most nyc japanese restaurants. only tried the japanese wagyu but pretty good! the thicker cubed pieces were the only ones i wasnt a fan of because they were tougher and more chewy. overall worth the price. i do wish all the sides werent charged separately

Great Japanese BBQ. The meat quality is great. Nice and fatty to make flames on the grill. Service was great also. If ya go, try the truffle salt seasoning on table. It's like a flavor explosion with the meats. What's also good is the table spacing, not close to others grilling n being loud. We will be back

Meat was good. Service was very slow though. We also ordered the cold noodle on a whim but it's not very good. Stick with the meat if you come here.

Place was a bit hard to fjnd, you have to go upstairs from the other japanese restaurant downstairs

A refreshing Yakiniku option in Midtown West! I would say this is one of the most authentic Japanese BBQ joints in NYC. Flavor of the meat and homemade sauces were beyond amazing!

The reason for 4 stars is because of the price. The portions are pretty small and the menu items are limited, probably because they opened not too long ago. However, they have a wide selection of alcoholic beverages which is perfect to go along with Yakiniku! The service is exceptional (as with Japanese culture) And I believe a lot of the customers were Japanese so it definitely adds to the credibility!

Because it recently opened, there wasn't any wait when we went, but I feel like it's going to start getting more popular, so go before it does!

I came here after work with a friend and ordered the Pork Sundubu for $9.75.  Wish I tried the BBQ!  The soup was good - small, but for less than $10 it was worth it.  Definitely interested in dining here to try the BBQ in the future.

We got the curry bowls, but they looked like they were leftovers and not appetizing at all. There was barely any meat and over priced. Service was fine, but overall not a great experience. The menu is also extremely limited
10 out of 10! The fact they have Wagyu 40% on Tuesdays is making this my new go to spot. The happy hour pricing is great and the staff was incredibly attentive. We had a fabulous meal and experience.

I had the stewed beeftendon curryrice, which was quite yummy but a small portion for the price ($13). It wasn't enough for a full meal, and I would say that I don't usually like large portions. I had a Sapporo premium beer (600mL), which was $9.5, quite a reasonable price.

My friends had yakinimu. They really loved the short rib and flat iron, but didn't think much of the pork belly (which is usually their favourite). They found the Kobe beef to be decent. The vegetables were just okay.

Unfortunately, the service wasn't great. My food arrived long after my friends', and it always took us a long time to wave down our waiter for any reason.

I would maybe come here by myself again, but wouldn't recommend it to a friend.

This place is clean and modern and spacious inside. I'd give it 4 stars for that and the food, which was very good (and quite expensive). However, the service was mixed. The waitresses were friendly and real Japanese - again 4 stars. But service was the slowest I've ever seen at a New York restaurant. It's a yakiniku, where you grill the meat yourself. So all the kitchen has to do is slice it. But each time we ordered meat, it seemed to take 20+ minutes to come out. How can it possibly take that long?!  1 star for speed. Speed matters a lot to me.  I can't be waiting and waiting when I'm paying $80+ per person (without drinks at that). If the speed were better, I'd rate it 4 stars overall.

Oh my God, Yakiniku Tohbay was actually something else. Love the workers and the atmosphere. The menu is really amazing, so many great choices, I had to go with Chuck Short Rib, and it was great. Service was good and everybody working here was very nice and generous. We're certainly going back soon.
Got the marinated beef platter, bibimbap, pork belly, and flap steak as well as one of the tofu soups. Very good but portions were small and pricey compared to other places.

My boyfriend and I came here on a whim after visiting Spyscape (a spy themed interactive museum, which you should also check out!) Which was right across the street. This placed only opened 3 weeks ago, but I'm so happy to say that this place GREATLY exceeded our expectations!
Interior is very nice and kept very clean as well. I wouldn't go here with a big group as the biggest setting could probably fit 5 or 6 if you squeezed in. The wait staff were all very welcoming and friendly, and service itself was pretty quick.
As for food we ordered the assorted rib set, pork belly, and Korean style cold noodles (). The best by far had to be the assorted rib set; the meat was very good quality and my boyfriend and I frequently barbeque places pretty often but we both agree this place is in our top three of places we've been to! We were very surprised with the cold noodles, as this is a Japanese barbeque place we weren't expecting them to be anything more than good but they were very delicious as well! The pork belly was our least favorite but that isn't to say it wasn't good. The pork belly was very good as well, but we did have it after the rib set so I think our palattes were hoping for more.
Overall, very good experience and definitely planning our next visit very soon!
Newly opened Japanese BBQ restaurant. Food is decent. Interior is very clean. Service is great.
This was really good. It's a shame the area is still so deserted because this restaurant is really good. I sat at the bar and had the grilled meats where you diy.
All the meats were amazing! Portions on the smaller side but definitely worth the price!

A refreshingly traditional and minimalist take on Japanese bbq with a focused menu in a low-key setting. This place is not for those looking for all-you-can-eat korean BBQ dowsed in marinade and surrounded by a dozen side dishes. It is geared toward folks who want to sample flavors of different cuts of quality meat To me, this was a welcome addition to the area.

Came here on a Saturday early dinner. Place is a little hard to locate, upstairs from another Japanese spot. Setting is quiet, relatively intimate, suitable for conversation and a leisurely meal. Service was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. From a fairly limited menu we ordered beef tongue, kobe beef, assorted ribs, beef tendon curry rice, and sides of radish/cucumber sticks, roasted assorted vegetables, and salted cabbage.

The meats: beef tongue was a surprise hit. Thinly sliced, savory, and quick to crisp, we enjoyed both the flavor and texture. Kobe beef was lean as expected, but very tender when cooked to medium (comes in cubes). From the assorted ribs, there is a center portion of chuck short rib that was absolutely delicious. Not fatty, and yet extremely tender, juicy, and flavorful. We ordered a separate order of just this chuck rib, it was just that good. The other portions included a portion of short rib and short plate, between which I think the short rib was a little better. Meats come with no sides and two dips - a soy-based and a mungbean based (I think). Both are excellent; the soy-based one seems to complement the meats a little better. The curry rice was not that memorable, but the tendon was tender. Among the veggies, the corn and onion were surprise hits. We ended up grilling the salted cabbage for a little extra flavor. Radish/cucumber sticks had very little flavor in themselves, but was a nice palate-cleanse.

All in all, I would highly recommend this place if you want to enjoy the natural flavors of good, grilled meat in sensible portions. If you're looking for large portions, heavy sauces, and a wide selection of sides/appetizers, there are more suitable establishments a few blocks away in K-town.

It might be more pricier than those Koreantown bbq places, but the meat quality is way more superior - imagine the meat melts in your mouth...  I have been a fan of Donburiya and this place is a great spot as well. Also, you cook your meat on your own pace, no one will rush you, which is something I really enjoy.  Highly recommend!
The food was good but for the price it wasn't quite there yet. We came before they were officially opened so maybe that made a difference.

New Japanese bbq spot on midtown west area! Love the vibe here and service. We ordered tons of meat and it was delicious. There isn't a wait since it's fairly new but I could see this place picking up soon. Would definitely come back here again when we are in the area.
Found this place really by accident, and the quality of the food and price totally surprised us. Come here if you want a decent Japanese barbecue experience. Appetizers are also amazing
Seems like this place is a bit of a hidden gem. No wait on a saturday night. Meat was high quality and tasty, good seasonings, friendly and fast service.
Great barbecue, ramen and rice. A little bit of everything! Would recommend getting the assorted beef platter to get some variety to share.

I can't believe I can find a Japanese yakiniku in such reasonable price next to time square! The staff were so nice and warm and food are fresh and delicious! This restaurant is definitely the one I will go twice and more next time. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
love love love all the meats and especially Torifu salt (must try!) wonderful service. nice and clean place
sooooooo good. good quality and good service. the assort and rice are highly recommended

3.5 / 5.0 - Yakitori Totto used to be one of my favorite Japanese spots in the city, serving authentic Japanese food.

During my most recent visit, I was overcharged for a rice ball--only ordered one, but was charged for 2. They're $5 each, so including tax and tip, that's $6.50 of overcharge. I only realized after I got home and called the restaurant the next day, but they never picked up. Considering the amount, I never followed up, but it left a poor impression. Still giving 3.5 stars, considering how delicious the food was, although a bit pricey.

One of the great things about Yakitori Totto is that you can order a variety of dishes to share.

My friend and I ordered:
- Kyona Arugula Salad ($15+)
- Dashimaki Tamago ($11+)
- Gyoza / Dumplings ($10+)
- Eringi x2
- Momo
- Negima
- Sasami x2
- Yakinasu Dengaku x2
- Yakionigiri
- Onigiri / Rice Ball
*All skewers and rice ball: $5+ each

I would recommend everything except for:
- Sasami (unless you like wasabi--no flavor without it)
- Yakinasu Dengaku (I love dengaku in general, but the amount of miso paste on the eggplant was overpowering)
- Yakionigiri (my friend ordered this and it wasn't what we'd envisioned)

If you're not a big eater or drinker, this may be enough food for you and you could keep the cost under $100 per person. Drinks were $10 or higher ($10+ for beer, $12+ for plum wine), so you can easily exceed $100 if you have a couple of drinks and more skewers.
So it's not a cheap option, but if you're looking for a taste of Japan, you can find it here.

Ok the cities restaurants are slowly going to hell in a hand basket I lost two this week. This place has turned into Gyu-Kaku it's NOT what it was just a year ago. Probably not their fault it's just this city slowly degrading and taking all the good restaurants down with it.

The quality of the food has slipped and it's just not the same. Can't justify the prices when compared with other options around the globe and in the states.

I hope they can return to the previous standards.

I noticed how if you don't make reservations and come later on, it would get filled up. However, we went much earlier, so there was no line. We did get counter seating, which was fine. Towards the end of us eating, it started to get filled up. The service was really good as the waitstaff came by often enough.

We ordered a bunch of skewers and a few appetizers. The food was good, but nothing was amazing, that it felt memorable. I did enjoy the drink that I got there, which was the Calipco sochu. It tasted like the non alcoholic drink. The enoki bacon skewer and the wagyu were enjoyable. There were other Japanese restaurants surrounding this one, so I'm not sure if I would go back as there's plenty others to try out.

A pleasant pleasant surprise
Got sat immediately on a Saturday night with no reservations--got lucky

Food
Cold tofu 4/5
Presentation was good. The pairings (onion, sesame, yellow egg ginger substance, bonito flakes) were dry and missing actual sauce but we made it work with soy sauce. The consistency of the tofu is soggy and not mousse like.

Edamame N/A
My date wanted to order it. Just boiled

Seaweed salad 4/5
Unique different color seaweed

Eel over rice
A bit too salty (just a tiny bit)

Service 4/5
They check in on you almost too much at the wrong times but I guess that's better than not checking in on you at the right time?

Price 2/5
Grilled eel over rice should not be $30 albeit it comes in a box with a lid

Ambiance 4/5
Cute bar like narrow set up at the entrance and a surprisingly enclosed quiet dinning area in the back with 4 tables

Cleanliness 4/5
Did NOT use the bathroom

This was a fun unique experience we normally can't get back home.

We ordered: pork chicken breast, heart, skin, wagyu, skirt steak, short rib, combo, scallop, asparagus, zucchini, tofu. It was hard to wait and take all the pictures at once as the stuff came out at various times and I gave up so you get what you get and you don't throw a fit.

Enjoy!

I loved dining at Yakitori Totto, it felt authentic and brought me back to my time in Japan. We had a reservation for 8:15 on a Saturday night and it was clear you need a reservation, every seat was filled. For dinner we ordered the chicken with wasabi sauce, the flank steak, shishito peppers, the cambo mambo. It was all excellent, especially the steak.
My biggest tip: don't skip dessert! We had the green tea affogato and the frozen banana in cream with tapioca. It really made the meal feel special. 10/10.

Walked in without a reservation for a 9pm dinner. I was surprised by the quality of the meats overall, but I didn't get a picture of everything. The items that stood out most to me were the chicken tail, eel, king oyster mushroom and the lamb chops. Everything was grilled perfectly, no complaints on the food or the service. The dessert was particularly great, I believe most people will underestimate it. The soft tofu is very refreshing after all the skewers with a nice subtle apricot flavor.

The only minor issue might be that it would have been nice if some of the items were cheaper like the wagyu or the lamb chops since the bill can add up depending on your appetite.

Got a variety of skewers and sat at the bar. Each skewer was generous and I have to say don't skip on the wagyu. It was the highlight of the meal! I also enjoyed the cucumber as a palette refresher and the crispy rice with salmon was amazing. Usually other places only offer crispy rice spicy tuna so this was a refreshing change!

Service was friendly and it was fun getting to watch the skewers grilled from the bar. Definitely recommend making a trip in if you like izakayas!

Definitely the best place to get Yakitori. Anthony Bourdain used to eat here. I understand why. I had a few different ones, my favorite was Yakitori Kawa (chicken skin). Delicious. Accommodating staff. Typical midtown-could-use-an-update decor. I don't mind. I could use an update too...

Good place to stop by for some food and drinks.

Most of the meat was cooked well, but could use more seasoning. The chicken skin for example was a bit bland, but the lamb chop, chicken wings, and pork were all delicious. For dessert, we also got the green tea affogato which was smooth and creamy. We definitely recommend that after you finish your yakitori.

???)(?)

i got a lot of skewers here and it was solid as haaaaaack and the service was nice. did a reservation on like resy or something and it was chill, didn't even need to wait at all and it was upstairs and hawt and ready to gobble

service was good they gave us the MEAT quickly, yeah i like to do it.

then yeah i can do it do it,

i like to do  it do i t

i like to do it do it

i liek to

DO IT

Came for friends birthday with reservations and was seated right away. Everything tasted great, highlights were the Shishito stuffed wagyu, ton Toro, negi pon, and karaage. I was really excited to try the combo mambo but it was only okay. Loved the Calpico shochu Sake, service was good. Solid date night option tooa

My husband and I were staying around the corner at the courtyard, Marriott hotel, and we're looking for a late night dinner. This place did not disappoint. Best Japanese food I have had in a while. Super attentive service and fresh food. The flavor of all the dishes we tried were amazing. We will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

Generally the food was pretty good, with some dishes standing out in terms of seasoning and preparation. But given the price point, I felt like I should be expecting more.
Also, the overall experience was a bit underwhelming. For starters: my friends and I arrived right on time for our reservation, but we still had to wait an extra 5 or so minutes to get seated. We even saw a couple who arrived later get seated before us, which was odd. Additionally the service felt very rushed, although that might just be driven by how busy the place was. And the restaurant space was small, leaving very little space for folks to move about.

Nice food come fast
Just not the best and every stack 3-10$
Little expensive
Good for try

Came here at 10pm on a Saturday. Business hours end at 10:30. We were lucky that two people ahead of us cancelled their reservations. We were seated in a corner by the bar. Food came pretty quickly and was fairly delicious. So many yakitori to choose from! Alas, the pork options were limited as it was so popular, they were mostly sold out.

The biggest thing that shocked me was my salad dressing. Each bite was a zing to the brain. The dressing was tasty but a little heavy. My nasal passages definitely cleared up by the end of the night.

It's rare to find a yakitori joint opened for lunch in Orange County, but there were a few we found here in Manhattan. And we chose this place and glad we did. The servers were really sweet and attentive. If you enjoy yakitori, you gotta check this place out. They had a few specials of the day and we ordered a few. One that we tried was called Chicken oyster. Do you know what that is? Rooster balls. Wow. And guess what?!?!? It was actually tasty. I had it for the first time today and I enjoyed it. They seasoned it perfectly that I ordered another skewer. Hahaha. It was that good.
I'm definitely returning here on my actual birthday to try more food before flying out.

Rating (maximum points = 5)

Value for money: 4
Cleanliness: 4
Food Quality: 5
Customer Service: 5
Look and Feel (Ambiance): 4

Whenever I go to NYC, I always make sure to try and make a special trip to this yakitori restaurant. The staff is always welcoming, friendly, and attentive. Their grilled skewers are packed with flavor and grilled to perfection. With the NYC autumn air, the agedashi tofu took my number one spot for the dish of the evening. The soft pillowy house made tofu was heavenly in the semi sweet soy based broth. My top three favorite skewers ended up being the following:

1. Pork Belly
2. Asparagus wrapped with bacon
3. Eggplant

I also tried out the salmon onigiri but couldn't finish it since the skewers were my priority. The only reason this review gets 4 stars is because the price has gone up significantly (totally understandable with inflation and post-covid world) and the restaurant could use a deep clean. The tables and floors felt sticky with layers of oil and grime collected overtime.

Would you go? Let me know. Follow me for all the sips and trips.

I came here on a date with my boyfriend, and we would absolutely come back. We passed by the front door a few times, and we were surprised by how small this restaurant is. However, it is very cozy and intimate! We started off with the tako wasa (marinated octopus). It tasted very strongly of wasabi, and I wouldn't recommend it unless you really love wasabi. We also got some miso soup, which was refreshing and not too salty. We split a bunch of skewers so that we could try more of the menu.

The chicken heart, thigh, and heart were all a little too dry. However, everything else was delicious! We enjoyed the hatsu-moto, shishamo, harami, and kalbi. Our favorites were the combo mambo, eel, and pork neck by far! Despite all the delicious meat, the thing that we loved the most was the yawaraka annin tofu dessert. Definitely make sure finish off your meal with that one :)

As a note, the servers are pretty strict about the 1.5hr time limit, so it would help to know what you want before you go in!

Pretty good skewers and other Japanese options, but a bit overpriced. I ordered the Totto Hanamaru Udon (with chicken, shiitake mushroom, nori, and scallions) ($15) - the udon was decent and the noodles were chewy in a good way, but the chicken was also kind of chewy in a not-so-good way. The broth was pretty flavorful and not overly salty so that was good.

I tried two yakitori skewers: the Combo Mambo Yakitori (eel, shrimp, and scallop) and the Hotate Eringi Yakitori (scallop and king oyster mushroom). Both were good, but quite small - definitely not worth $8 for each.

The staff were average friendliness and the service speed was fine. The interior is a bit small and cramped but not bad. You have to walk up some stairs from the entrance to get to the restaurant. It was pretty busy on a Saturday night but we were seated without a reservation and the noise level is moderate.

Overall, if you happen to be in the area and are in the mood for Japanese food and yakitori, then Yakitori Totto could be a decent option. Otherwise, it might not be the best bang for your buck.

While the food was undeniably tasty, I left feeling a bit unsatisfied due to the small size of the skewers and their relatively high price point, ranging from $6-10 per skewer. Despite this, the selection of skewers was impressive and the quality of the ingredients was evident.

Of the skewers I tried, my favorite was the unagi yakitori, which had a nice char and was perfectly seasoned. The chicken skewers were also good, but not as standout as the unagi. The short rib was another highlight, though the portion size was quite small for the price.

While I enjoyed the food, I found myself needing to order a lot of skewers to feel full, which added up quickly in terms of cost. The service was friendly and attentive, and I appreciated the staff's recommendations on which skewers to try.

Overall, while Yakitori Totto is a bit on the pricey side, it's worth a visit for its high-quality skewers and impressive selection. Just be prepared to order a few more skewers than you might expect to leave feeling full.

Cute & cozy upstair restaurant with great skewers & tasty Japanese dishes.

Must tries:
Chicken gizzard
Chicken heart
Chicken meatball
Pork thigh
Yaki onigiri
Ochazuke (they bring this out after you're done with skewers, but you can ask the server to bring it out earlier)

Recommend a reservation as it is a small restaurant. Will be back to try other menu items!

So so good! One of my new favorite places in nyc. Definitely get the roast beef bowl, kalbi beef, chicken oyster, enoki mushroom bacon, bacon wrapped asparagus, and UNAGI. The unagi eel was so soft and melted in your mouth.

Came here for lunch on a Saturday a few weeks ago and feel a little sad that my favorite yakitori place is no longer up to par. I always thought it was a little bit pricey but was happy to pay for the quality. The price is pricier but not worth it. The food was bland and definitely did not taste as good as it used to.  My daughter had to salt everything which is odd as they normally brush a good amount of bbq sauce on the skewers. $120 for two and we ordered less than we normally do. Good thing about lunch was no wait. Maybe the head chef was out?  I always used this place as a special treat for my kids. Not sure if it's as special anymore.

I think this is a very good yakitori restaurant. I'm quite impressed that they managed to get a nice grilled flavor without using charcoal. We ordered many skewers and a few places and there are some very good ones and some okay ones.

Very good:

- pork neck
- Chicken thight
- Galbi
- Gizzard
- wings

Good:
- meatball
- heart
- Unagi
- wagyu
- skin
- Agadashi tofu
- Yaki onigiri

Meh
- spicy Grill chicken don
- Negi tori skewers
- Breast
- match affogato
- Grilled eggplant with miso

Overall 4 stars. Recommended.

Came for a later dinner after walking up an appetite around Central Park and  it was a great place we stumbled upon. We weren't planning on coming here but when we were Yelping around the area this Yakitori spot showed up and had great reviews. We only had to wait around 10 mins to get a table but once we were seated service here was lightning fast. This made it so easy to enjoy so many options!

I got to try an assortment from the seaweed salad, MOMO, TSUKUNE, LIVER, HATSU, NEGI PON, TON TORO, ENOKI BACON, COMBO MAMBO, HARAMI, ONE AND ONLY, and EBI. All were delicious but the standouts for me were the liver, enoki bacon, and negi pon. The ton toro was a little chewy for me but it's worth trying.

We were seated at a two person table but there seemed to be larger tables that were more private near the back if you're in a larger group. The space looked really cool but we had great service where we were and they were so nice! Our drink cups never reached the halfway point before they stopped by to refill and they were quick to remind us 1 hr before the kitchen was closing iff we wanted to order anything else. Items will run you close to ~$8 each entree so it can add but but it's worth coming with others to sample multiple things.

When looking at the reviews later I also found out Anthon Bourdain ate here which is pretty cool.

One of my partner's and my favorite Japanese spots. Usually we get the agedashi tofu, the eggplant, one or two rice balls, and a mix of robatayaki (chicken / veggies). If we're especially hungry we'll split an udon.

It's Japanese food so everything is on the lighter side (both calorically and in terms of flavor) which means the price adds up pretty quickly, but it's all really yummy and well made. I recommend everything I mentioned above, but I'm sure it's all good.

There isn't a ton of seating so definitely better to make a reservation!
Good food .  Had few sticks and they were tasty. Service was good. Would recommend..Will recommend to make reservation since it was crowded for dinner.

We came for a pre-theater dinner, and we enjoyed it. The biggest issue I had was accessibility. There is a long flight of stairs to get to the restaurant and the restaurant is small so anyone with mobility issues would have trouble. Other than that it was a great experience. First make sure you as for the limited specials of the day. They do not offer them without asking.
For a drink I had the Calpico Sour which did not taste like it had any alcohol in it, so I had to keep reminding my self to drink it slowly because I was so thirsty from it being hot outside.
All of our items came out hot, but many things needs a little something extra, either a pinch of salt, or soy, or the hot chili blend they put on the table.
For appetizers we had Crispy Rice with Salmon Tartar, Gyoza, and the Braised Pork Belly. The rice was crispy and it paired well with the salmon, the gyoza were average, and I was disappointed that they were kinda stuck together, the pork belly was spectacular: sweet salty and full of umami.
On to our skewers. We had a total of 9 and combined with appetizers we  were full. We had 4 different pieces of chicken: skin, heart, meatball, and oysters. The skin was so crispy and flavorful. The meatball and the oysters we also very nice, the heart really needed salt. We also had shrimp, pork with scallions and ponzu, a lamb chop, eggplant with miso paste, and Wagyu beef. These were all very good as well the lamb chop and eggplant being my favs. Having had A5 wagyu before this did not compare but it was still tender and juicy.
I discovered that there is another location close to home and would love to take my wife there for a special date night soon.

I literally loved loved the food.
Went for weekday lunch to get the specials and it did not disappoint!
The meat was oh so tender and FULL OF FLAVOR!!!!
Shishito peppers we more a meh. I mean good but I guess I was expecting something outstanding.
Price for lunch special good
Service was amazing
Place decor is super cute and intimate. It was really quiet so I really enjoyed the vibes.
Will def come back again

Everything was good. Lunch specials are a great value.
Cook to order but they are fast. Can't get enough. They have choices of chicken, beef, veggie and seafood.
The cut may be a bit minuscule for the price.

Yum! :~)

Cute and cozy. Tight entrance up a long flight of stairs, there's no room to wait anywhere except on top of other people on the staircase... The only reason this is an issue worth mentioning is because they've got a big crowd, for good reason too! So make sure you make a reservation, unless you don't mind a bit of a wait.

Once you enter the actual restaurant, the staff i've encountered has always been friendly and again, the interior is cute and cozy. There's bar seating as well as table seating. Nothing too fancy, just a humble ambiance.

The menu is lovely, a variety of red meats and different fish. When I come here, my eyes being bigger than my stomach isn't an issue, as I always find myself wanting more.

The one drawback I experience personally, I always have the worst stomach cramps and feel so sick after I eat here... regardless of what I've eaten or drank before hand, after a meal here, for some reason, my stomach is always a mess and I'd like to think I've got a stomach of steel! Again, this is more of a personal issue though...

Nonetheless, worth it... ‍
Try this place!

Prepare to go bankrupt ordering skewers here! The wagyu skewers are so good, and they're only** $13 each! If you wanted to get your best value, then probably just go for the chicken skewers and fill up on the big rice ball onigiris. Everything here is grilled fresh and dripping with juice and sauce. The seafood combo skewers with shrimp and scallops for $8 are very good as well. The place is pretty small, so make sure to reserve or prepare to wait a while. They had some bacon wrapped enoki mushrooms which my friends thought were weird, so maybe only order that if you really love mushrooms. Too bad they don't have bacon wrapped scallops. If you like gizzard like me, then this place has some pretty crunchy ones. Chicken thigh and skin are so good. Save the sauce of the other dishes so you can dip the chicken in the wagyu fat for example.

Super delicious skewers but definitely pricey. We ordered the chicken, beef, pepper and a few other skewers. We also got the chicken karaage and the chicken don. Make sure you make a reservation ahead of time but I believe they do take walk ins. Everything was delicious but I definitely recommend ordering some apps because we left a little hungry. The portion size of the skewers are small but delicious. The staff were very friendly and respectful.

This place is absolutely amazing! We watched the little clip of this place (available on their website) of Anthony Bourdain eating here, and were further motivated to get out here after reading all the great reviews by other fellow Yelpers. It definitely did NOT disappoint!

We made a reservation a week or so in advance. Headed in for a dinner and got ordering right away. Things then started flying out of the kitchen in quick order.

I know a lot of people have been raving about the skin, but to me, that was far from the highlight of the night.

What REALLY stuck out to me was the heart - and the piece that comes right after it in the menu (that is escaping me right now) which is the part adjacent to it. I'd never tried it before and I fell absolutely in love with it! It could be a pretty strong flavor if you aren't too comfortable with the other inner parts of the chicken (it actually felt a lot like liver to me) but if that's something you like, then this is definitely down your alley!

Ambience-wise - the place was a bit on the small side, and pretty packed (as one would expect). But it was all very comfortable and we got a great seat at the bar so we could also see the chefs at work. The wait staff were also very efficient and attentive throughout our meal.

Although it was a little pricey - with all said and done, I'll definitely be back!

We decided to venture to Yakitori Totto last min right before last call on a Monday night and it was, the best decision. We ordered the lamb, short rib, chicken skin and pork neck and everything was soo fire! I was so surprised we enjoyed everything we ordered.

Skewer breakdown:

Short rib: unbelievably tender and well seasoned! A must order

Lamb: tender and not at all gamey tasting. This practically fell off the bone

Chicken skin: they give you a pretty generous portion of skin per skewer. It was crispy on the outside while soft and had a great chew inside

Pork neck: this one was a first for me. The texture reminded me of chicken thigh and was pretty tasty

You must order the Yakitori sauce to dip for $1.50. They give you a huge portion of it and it goes perfectly with your charcoal grilled skewers. Thank me later.

FYI: Last seating is at 9:45pm and last call is at 10pm

My friend and I enjoyed a great dinner at Yakitori Totto.

My favorite dish was the tori dango with steamed rice dumplings filled with chicken meatballs, and the beef tongue was also fantastic. The Tebasaki chicken wings, broiled eel, bacon wrapped asparagus and the shishito peppers were also highlights of the meal.

The service was great, and the food came out quickly. The waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and made great recommendations. The food was fantastic, and the prices were very reasonable. I would definitely come back here again.

The restaurant was very busy, but the service was great. Our waitress was very attentive and helpful. The food was fantastic.
Best yakitori in town, plenty of choices unless you are a soy-free, gluten-free, vegan.

Yakitori Toto is always my number one choice restaurant whenever I visit the city. The service  is  always marvelous!
Bravo! Yakitori Toto!

Thigh: let's get the more mundane skewers out of the way. thigh with salt. juicy, chickeney, slightly charred. good, but not very interesting
Oyster: upgraded thigh that comes with some crispy skin on it. slightly more interesting than the thigh, but that's not what we're here for
Skin: i liked the charred bits but the insides were a little rubbery for my taste, if we're going pure connective tissue, preferred the tail

Neck: they were out of this so i didnt get to try it =(
Tail: mostly connective tissue and fat, but this was probably my third favorite
Heart: almost beefy, slightly gamey, offered something more interesting than just run of the mill chicken meat, my second favorite
Shishito with chicken meatball: i LOVE shishito peppers, and with the chicken inside with the sweet soy glaze, this was my favorite

Ambiance: 4.5/5. You go upstairs and there is a bar and seating area. It is nicely decorated and gives a good vibe to chill with friends!

Service: 2/5. Maybe because they were busy, but the waiters were not as attentive. We were a party of 6 and couple of our friends were running a little late, but one lady kept asking us to order and making sure that the rest of our party was coming, like every 5 minutes..

Food: 4.5/5 The food here was amazing, especially for the price! I loved the plating as well.
Yakitori is very delicious! Highly recommend for all the dishes. Note that the tea is charged per cup ( not free to refill).

Bit pricy but so worth it.

Their limited premium japenese beef don is great. The beef is very good quality

THIS IS A PSA *GET THE UNAGI SKEWER*
Get two because they are that good seriously

I think 5 skewers + small app was a good amount of food for me

Late Night Eats

Yakitori Totto is most well known for being a favorite of the late Anthony Bourdain

As a fan of Japanese food, it's easy to see why the small, intimate restaurant located on the second floor (after a walk up a narrow stairway) makes one reminiscent of Japan

The menu is an extensive one but he specialty are their grilled items and they have several unique combinations of their own

I loved the variety and the impressively fast service

Space is tight but there are several larger tables for groups that are separated from the more crowded areas

Loved the food although I'm always disappointed by oyakodon that is more home-cooked style than the runny egg style I love at Tori-toh (Tsukiji Market, Tokyo) and Sumika (Los Altos, CA)

Kawa $3.5 ~ Chicken skin / Momo $3.5 ~ Chicken thigh / Asparagus Bacon $5 / Hotate Eryngi $5 ~ King Mushroom and Scallop / Shishito Tsukune $5 ~ Shishito Pepper with Chicken Stuffing / One and Only $6 ~ Japanese Premium Hamburger / Combo Mambo $7 ~ Scallop, Eel, Shrimp / Tako Wasa $7.5 / Zaru Tofu $9 / Spicy Negitoro Don $14 / Oyakodon $15 / Ice  Banana $8 ~ frozen banana served with coconut topped mint

Yakitori Totto (West 55th Street, NY)

First visit in years, but some things haven't changed, like the experience of waiting in the stairwell.  Worth it though.  

Got here early without a reservation and ordered way too much, as I wanted to sample everything again.  Prices per skewer are a little higher than elsewhere, which adds up when you're ordering 10-15 of them.  However, the skewers aren't dainty. Definitely get the chicken oyster and neck if they're available.  If you can handle the richness, of course get the tail and skin. The kara-age with sweet and spicy sauce is surprisingly good.  The prime roasted beef don is also a stealth gem and a delicious way to carb up a meal.  The ochazuke will feed 3.  

Go for dinner if you want the fun limited items!

Beef: 5 stars 10/10 recommend all
Chicken: 4 stars we got gizzards heart (over done)
thigh and wings were okish
Pork: 4 stars
Do not get the scallops and mushroom, not worth it, 1 small scallop split in half and 3 piece of mushrooms not very flavorful
Asparagus bacon not worth imo

Good food and we enjoyed a lot.  All dishes are authentic to japanese yakitori with some other dishes to fill up at the end like ochazuke and dessert.

Typically don't go to kushiyaki because of price per skewer, but we really enjoy a the dishes and had a great time.

We can definitely come back for our next occasion or celebration

STRONGLY RECOMMEND AGAINST COMING HERE FOR RUDE SERVICE.

Never have I been chased out of a restaurant and asked to leave "higher tips" aggressively by a waiter to leave a higher tip.

This was incredibly rude and worse of an experience. Never returning and suggest you don't come here for incredibly "average" service that makes you question your tip in the first place.

A small place that fills up pretty quick even on a weekday (for lunch). Looks like they have a lunch set menu but we opted for the regular menu to try out their yakitori. Favorites were: pork neck, agedashi tofu, chicken skin, wagyu, and enoki wrapped bacon. Staff was kind, checked up on us several times, service was not too slow but not quick either, and the food was delicious! A casual spot to grab some skewers and sake/beer.
I am sucker for Japanese restaurant. The atmosphere was so good and was definitely an authentic feel

The food is really good here.

Prices are quite reasonable for New York, and the quality is great. For appetizers, I highly recommend their agedashi tofu. This lightly fried tofu is topped with scallions and served in a dashi broth. It was so good we ended up ordering a second one!

For rolls, they have so many delicious choices. We got their California roll, the pickled radish roll, the fried sweet potato roll, and their salmon roll. Each was excellent in their own unique way.

I also have to comment on the radish they serve on the side. I really like how fresh this radishes as it is not too strong of a flavor for those who are not used to it. It is a little lighter and sweeter.

If you don't like, fishy smell, sit outside and eat, as the inside of the restaurant is a heavy fish smell. Service is a little slow as they have very few staff serving many people, but they do a good job.

I came here yesterday for dinner and I really enjoyed it. I ordered the pork gyoza, rainbow roll and lobster roll. The lobster roll was huge and very fresh; I did not like the wrapping but did enjoy everything else. I would get the rainbow roll again; I was so delicious. The pork gyoza were so delicious and fresh. The service was great very attentive and patient. It was my first time here but it will definitely not be my last time. The quality of the products are great and I was very full. The place smelled good and was very clean. I definitely recommend this place and look forward to trying other items.
I order delivery here and it was fresh and delicious worth the money. Chirashi was awesome and the sushi rolls were delicious. Great portions. Great job.

The ambience was nice, few people when we arrived on a Friday but around 7:30 pm it got packed. We ordered the Udon noodle soup which came with tempura vegetable or chicken or beef. I'm personally not a fan of Udon noodles I prefer Ramen, which they didn't serve or soba. I didn't want the tempura with the soup but that's how it came. So I was disappointed by the limited soup options available. I also got the lotus root which was decent, the sake was nice and hot. My friend ordered the sushi which I didn't get to try but which looked great. All in all I would come back, maybe for the sushi next time and the intimate setting with Japanese pop music in the background. No complaints.

(If you read my initial post, please re-read.  That was a draft that posted prematurely.  Here's what I wanted to go live.)

Yuzu gave me a solid 3-star dinner (albeit only for delivery.  Perhaps dining in would provide a more well-rounded experience).  

Cool menu with some items you don't often find elsewhere.  I'm thinking they may have just had an off night when I ordered.  So I might consider trying again for delivery...or pop in if I'm in the area...or even make a destination hang if I'm looking for a nice pay day option out.  Though the jury is gonna be out for a while considering there were so many "off the mark" points.

I ordered the following:

Kue
Spicy Hotate Roll
Kanpachi
Ikura
Wagyu Appetizer
Akami
Hirame
Chu Toro
Tamago
Chili Roll
Gyoza
Madai

For the positives, this was the single best tasting Tamago sushi I've ever had, with the rice being well-seasoned for this and all items I ordered.  The wagyu appetizer is priced quite well for the serving size.  And the delivery was relatively quick, with all items being well-packaged.

For the points I wish had been better:

Other than the Tamago susih, nothing wowed or made me look forward to ordering it again.

There was an imbalance with the sushi ratios.  Very generous portions, but with far too little rice for most.  And for the choices which required seaweed to keep the bite in place, the seaweed did not go all the way around.  So the sushi started to "unravel" when picked up (only for the individual sushi...we'll get to the rolls...).

The menu did not specify or give an option to choose deep or pan fried for the gyoza.  The picture used also shows pan fried dumplings.  Being someone who prefers steamed or pan fried, receiving a deep fried dish when this wasn't listed or pictured was unappealing.  This could have been salvaged had the dish been flavorful, but I found it to be rather bland.  

My largest issues were with the Spicy Hotate & Chili Rolls.  As you can see pictured, my Spicy Hotate Roll arrived squished flat in some places, pulverized in others.  Also as pictured, the Chili Roll I received contained shrimp tempura, though the description (and picture when viewing the menu) only lists crabmeat and grilled salmon.  Perhaps this is different on the dine-in menu?  Either way, it usually would be great to get bonus shrimp.  But in this roll, the texture and flavor profiles were impacted.  Didn't work for me.  And the chili sauce was very disappointing.  Added nothing and arguably took away from the roll.  It really tasted like thinned-down sriracha.  

With complete understanding that some of these points are easily addressed with Yuzu giving better attention to their online menu descriptions, I'm not quite sold on adding Yuzu to my rotation at this point.  But it could be a good fit for others.  

If I try again and the experience improves, I'll definitely be back with an update to keep things as fair as possible.  Til then, here's to hoping you have a good go of it if you treat yourself to Yuzu.
Great food with attentive service. If you're not sure of what to get, chat with your waitress. Ours was super helpful and attentive.
The sushi fish was not fresh and smelled. I couldn't eat them any longer.  It used to be much better.  I am so sad.
Excellent sushi place in Harlem.  Both eating in and take out is consistent in quality - very high.

The website was difficult to navigate.

Hated that share with FaceBook crap at the end. Found that quite presumptuous.

Ordered 2 Sashimi platters for $35 each plus $5.00 delivery fee.

The portions were laughably miniscule and looking quite old and sad.

I was going to bring it back to them personally and demand a refund.
