The moqueca's seafood taste was overwhelmed with the sour taste, so I was not able to finish the dish, but the portion size was worth the price and there was no skimping on the amount of seafood in the dish.

For someone who is sensitive to the taste of alcohol, the coconut caipirinha was sweet and masked the taste quite well, which fit my preferences, so I recommend this drink.

Deliciousness. I really enjoyed my poached eggs with salmon. The Avocado toast was nice and the French toast warm and comforting.
I only wish they served complimentary nachos here.

Mera's Tip: brunch here

Amazing slow roasted pork! The steak was great too but the pork will keep you coming back! The service was friendly and the team kept your water filled. We didn't have drinks but their happy hour seemed like a popular thing to do. This is a truly authentic mix of foods located on a busy corner and has a cool vibe! I definitely recommend and will hopefully return before going back home. Trouble is... there's so many great places to try in the area!

As a regular here, i know the whole playlist the dj plays. There is too much new music that is made for clubs that the dj could be taking advantage of but i keep giving it a chance to hope to hear them . I would love if they could bring some of these amazing latino club hits to the mix and it would really make it the best club ive ever been to
One of the best bars to go. You might have to do a line to get in but it is totally worth it. The drinks are strong and tasty. The music is great!

Note: My review is based on a night out with drinks and not a food, dining experience!

Checked out Yuca Bar as a first stop on a night out with friends in the city! Had to pay a $20 cover at 9:30 PM (which I was surprised a bit being that it felt early, but then again it's NYC), but overall it was a very average experience and small dancing space. Honestly, not worth the cover in my personal opinion. The drink was cheaper than other places, but quality was matched with price. Probably would go again, but not a go-to!

I'm no connoisseur of anything but I know what I like.  Hubby and I were here for dinner for the first time on Sunday 5/28 after the Loisada Festival in Alphabet City. We had the churrasco which was perfectly cooked.  Any churrasco lover knows it's a slippery slope with churrasco, just a few seconds too long and you're eating rubber.  This meat was tender and very flavorful.  It was perfect. They served it with mashed potatoes--I never had it with mashed potatoes but it was excellent. Hubby, not in the mood to be venturesome, asked them to swap out the mashed for rice and black beans.  Very deelish!!!.  We started with quac, salsa and chips and both overdid it so we ended up taking home leftovers and having flan to go.  Dinner for 2 was $118, which included  soft drinks and one piña colada.   Bit of a tight fitting restaurant with a tiny table for 2.  Loud music but not too loud for normal conversation.  Flan eaten later that night was perfect.  Leftovers next day deelish!  Restaurant was very busy but the service was on point.  Will definitely go back.

Came here last week for a few happy hour drinks + snacks before a friend's show nearby. Seating was fast (we decided to hang outside in the breeze) & team was really friendly. I had a few frozen mojitos (yummy), and only really ate the Pico & Guac + Fried Calamari because I wasn't that hungry, but portions were great. One of my friends got an Arepa dish & the other a sandwich with Yuca fries, and my bites of everything were really tasty. Would go back, (with a bigger appetite, of course).

I've always wanted to try this spot for Happy Hour and so glad I did!! If I remember correctly, it was $8 drinks and there were so many flavors. Loved the fact that I could choose to have it frozen or regular, so good for anyone who wants to be by the beach. HH is everyday from 6-8 (I think)!!

Food, we ordered the chicken quesadilla which was very good!! It was stuffed with lots of meat (not complaining), and was very juicy. The seafood paella could have more flavor, I felt that it was very bland. Guac&pico was FRESH, but nothing too special. Overall, a great place to come again and grab happy hour drinks and some food.

Came here for a night out with friends. We had a blast! Def recommend coming on a Friday night and ready to dance because the DJ was great. He played all the best Latin jams and regatón. The bar staff were super nice and friendly and all of our drinks were fantastic.

I came here last night with a group of 8 & overall we had a good time! To start off I got a classic Margarita. It wasn't bad. I do like that they use Cazadores instead of house. We got the fried calamari which was amazing, chicken empanadas, and the chicken tacos also good. We of course had to try the yuca fries lol they were okay not your typical yuca fries. Note they don't have vegetarian options. They gave us a free shot at the end since we were celebrating a birthday, which was so sweet. It was a fruity type of drink.

The place itself gets pretty packed but the staff was very accommodating in adding chairs for those who joined us. They played good music old reggeton, Bad Bunny, Karol G, etc. At 8:30 they remove all the tables and open up the dance floor. The kitchen closes at 8. I also noticed they do a $20 cover charge after a certain time beware of that. Get there early so you don't have to pay that. Overall there's good food & music at this place would recommend if you need something easy & chill with little frills.

Love love love this place! The food, atmosphere, drinks, and staff all amazing! Brunch (which is available throughout the day) and dinner are both great. The place is a mix of very authentic South American cuisine. My favorite dishes are the Arepas, Huevos Rancheros, and Benedict. Prices are also pretty fair and they offer bottomless brunch! My biggest complement - they are dog friendly!!

Note: this place is a bar at night with a very young crowd so keep that in mind. They play great Spanish music and usually have a $10 cover.

Latin restaurant/bar with open window seating and great music. We went here for a bottomless brunch which was affordable. Bottomless mimosas or sangria is only $17 which is an absolute steal in NYC plus the cost of food. We ordered steak and eggs, served with rice and beans or fries. The steak was cooked to perfection and was savory. Drinks are strong, felt tipsy after just one mimosa.  Hearing the nightlife at Yuca Bar is a must experience.

This is literally one of my favorite spots.
I have been coming here since I was 19 years old!
IT IS AMAZING!

Food and drinks are always ok. Felt a little weird today since I stood at the front for about 10min without anyone acknowledging me.  Hostess just looked over and just sat the bar to have her meal.

Finally a waiter acknowledged me, sat me and gave me water as I was waiting for my niece. Then my niece and I moved toward the back since I use a cane and wanted to stretch my legs. Not sure why but the last waitress told us it was our "last drink" once we finished our tapas. We were not part of the brunch crowd and we were paying for all our drinks. We were planning on staying longer but felt like we were being pushed out.

Andrea was amazing and great, so attentive.  But the others kinda wanted us out. One of the girls told us that someone was waiting for our table. That was kinda weird as we did not say we were leaving yet.   Whatever... will not be visiting again for a while.

For being able to seat 7 people at a cramp bar, I have to give them props for making it work. I had a pretty fantastic time!

Walk ins only. The vibes was popping on a weekend night, with loud music and parties from one end of the circle-like interior layout to the other. The workers were efficient and friendly in seating us despite how busy it was. The area they gave us was nicely private and enclosed.

I ordered the Churrasco, Quesadilla de Churrasco, and a Frozen Mango Margarita. They have a happy hour special every day (including weekends!) from 12PM - 8PM.

Original margaritas are $9 and flavors are an extra buck. The Frozen Mango Margarita ($10), although hard to drink at first given the fat icy chunks, was so so yummy and fruity. I always love when I can taste the mango flavor that is equally as strong as the alcohol.

The Quesadilla de Churrasco, or Steak Quesadilla ($15), was disappointing to me. I don't recommend getting given the small portion and the lack of cheese. I'm glad I didn't waste a Lactaid pill on this!

The Churrasco ($29), on the other hand, was AMAZING. I took one bite, and I fell in love. That grilled skirt steak was perfection, and they actually gave me a true medium rare! Easy to cut, easy to chew, and with the slight sourness of the chimichurri sauce? Perfection! Plus, those beautiful golden baked yuca fries offered an even heartier and sweet embellish to the classy meal.

They also gave us a fat portion of Chips w/ Guac & Salsa on the house. Everyone else's food looked amazing and the staff was fast and wonderful. Totally come here for fun vibes and a comforting night (or brunch!) out.

Terrible food, bad service and credit card fraud.

It looks so cute from the outside...nice seating, tasty menu, etc. But the reality is that the food is terrible (and by terrible I don't mean mediocre, I mean it tastes awful) and overpriced, the service is slow and they don't even know what they have on the menu (can I order the steak quesadilla hold the steak? No. Do you have Coke or Pepsi? Don't know).

The worst part, though, was that the minute they ran my credit card there was fraud all over the card thereafter. Someone stole it.

I'll never go back here.

I hate leaving a subpar review. This isn't about anything else but what I ate-the moqueca, the brazilian seafood stew. It tasted very muddled and unpleasant in the way you don't want a stew to taste . I really couldn't eat more than a few bites and that upset me because I really wanted to like it!  I would definitely try this dish somewhere else as I don't want this experience to color my view on this important dish. I also do think the dishes are a bit pricey but it makes sense with the location I guess

The East Village is always happening and hopping. Speaking for myself, I don't know it inside out so when my friend suggested Yuca Bar for brunch, I was in!

This space is a large one---sitting on the corner with adorable interior, but also with wrap around outdoor accommodations. This could be said for most spots in the EV as dining al fresco is common.

They supposedly have HH going on daily but we stuck with coffee and tea.
There was a pretty good selection of Mexican and traditional selections on the menu and I was immediately drawn to Guacamole Toast better known as Avocado Toast. My friend chose the Steak and Eggs.

Service was really good and our meal arrived not long after placing the order. We were also informed as soon as we sat down that the dining limitation would be for 90 minutes. I can see why.
When we left, the place was packed.

My Avocado Toast was delicious. One big slice of sourdough bread layered with fresh/well made Avocado and finally topped with 2 poached eggs.
A side salad accompanied the entree.
My friend had no complaints with her selection and raved about the Chimichurri sauce that was served on the side.

Overall, Yuca Bar is a fun and always festive restaurant to consider for brunch, apps, drinks or dinner.  It won my approval!
I love the Yuca bar. The Sunday brunch are amazing. The service is wonderful.  I love this place and the atmosphere is fabulous

I have been to this place twice now. Both times the wait staff has been super friendly and the food has been delicious. They have drink specials and the drinks are always tasty. Both times I have had sangria but people I have gone with have had margaritas and specialty cocktails. The portions are a good size and everything is pretty shareable. They have indoor and outdoor seating and usually not a very long wait.

This place is my absolute favorite spot in NYC! The food is amazing, music is always good, service is fab and on weekends after hours it turns into a latin club that is SOOOO fun. I can't say enough good things about this place. Prices are pretty reasonable, and even when it's really busy I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a table. They have a lot of outdoor seating too so it's perfect for the summer and people watching. If you're looking for a place to eat in the EV LOOK NO FURTHER! This is the one I promise you won't regret it.
Recs:
Food wise I recommend getting a bunch of plates and sharing so you can try multiple things. I love the fried platano relleno and the arepa churrasco. The guac app is really solid and well portioned and I love that it comes with pico as well (and plantain chips which imo are far superior to regular tortilla). I've had the empanadas and really liked them too. Honestly everything here that i've tried has been delicious.
Drink wise I usually have their virgin mango mojitos (I don't drink) and could literally CHUG it by the gallons it's so good. I've eyed the frozen margs tho and they look amazing.
And my biggest MUST HAVE: THE TRES LECHES!!! I'm a BIG dessert girl and also latin and this is for sure one of the best tres leches I've ever had in my life. Seriously so good.
Great happy hour spot. Tuesdays they have 2 for 1 tacos. The drinks could be made faster but when they arrive at the table they are great. Spanish music and outdoor dining are great additions.

Great spot that wears many hats including good brunch restaurant, nice spot for happy hour and snacks, and an all out dance party spot late night.

This particular visit was for brunch and the egg burrito certainly hit the spot. Could have used a bit more guac with it, but overall was very happy with my meal and of course the frozen marg to wash it down

Came here on 4th of July for some Tapas with my husband. Was seated pretty quickly but sat and waited and waited as we watched others come in after us, get seated and served. My husband had to go up to server to ask for service. Should have read the signs and left then but we decided to stay. Was never served water or anything. Food came out rather quickly, the shrimp quesadillas was pretty good as well as the plantains but the chicken and beef skewers were over cooked and dried out. I do not recommend this place and will never come back. Horrible service, at least for some people.

Great vibes here!! Really generous happy hour (daily from 12-8). Mojito comes with a sugar cane garnish which is really fun & actually delicious & refreshing to chew on.

Queso fundido was good too but wish it came with more tortillas (homemade though!) First time trying and now definitely one of my favorite happy hour spots!

Food was reasonable but nothing extraordinary.  This place is usually really crowded and the music is loud so hard to dine with a bigger group.
They have happy hours during weekdays which is nice - drinks were average.

Absolutely great food.  And fairly cheap for the area.  Cocktails were strong. Open fairly late as well.   The atmosphere is friendly, but packed tight, so not a lot of wiggle room.  Try the tostadas!

I've been wanting to give this place a try & finally made my way here, we came in & were seated right away.
Drinks to start had the Caprihana ah very harsh w the lemon taste not that great, we switched to the Red sangria much better.
On the Tapas we tried the stuffed platano relleno, tostada & yuca fries.
The Plátano relleno aka stuffed plantain was very good, the roasted pork meat was very tasty, The Tostada was great as well , decent size good tasting meat.
The Yuca fries were the winner of the night they were delicious, nice taste fried but not greasy really good fries.
Decent looking place , good music playing , service was good & prices are reasonable, we enjoyed our food & drinks.

This place really surprised me.  I'm not big on Pan-Latin American food nor tapas.

Sitting down outdoors, I liked the setting but was really struggling with the menu because I was leaning toward the Arepa but I kept picturing an extremely dry mouth at a Pan-Latin restaurant.  Luckily this wasn't the case.  

First, I was more than pleased that I was able to get a meat free option and most importantly it tasted so good.  One of the best Arepas I've had and I've had them in Bolivarian Republic of Gran-Colombia so I was beyond pleased.

Service was top notch and I am glad that I did not let my judgement get the better of me and I experienced a new spot.

I had such an amazing time here with my friends! We went for brunch and the food was Amazing! Very delicious and flavorful. I loved how the manager Alicia and host Juliana treated us all and was soo kind . Thank you so much for everything! If you haven't been there you must visit ! The location in perfect it was such a vibe.

I love me a good Latino bar/club so it pains me to write this bad review but reviews give us true insight! Social media oversells this place for what it really is which is a damn shame because it looks like a lot of fun right? A group of friends and I were on line during "club" hours, acted cordially and received attitudes from people working the door. A shame the owner gives people attitude and the bouncers tells people it's cause "he can do what he wants". That type of mentality is toxic and not a way to conduct business. My friends and I went to another place near by and the bouncer there told us Yuca doesn't have the best rep. We found out the hard way unfortunately. Be aware

Happy Hour every day here basically ! ! !

Octopus - itself it's quite tender but a bit lack of the sea flavor that an octopus should have. Avo hummus that came with it was really good.

Pork Rib with Espresso BBQ sauce - so goood so tender the meat just fell of the bone and the sauce was delicious and rich but not too rich.

Arepa (white corn cake) Jardinera - arepa was a bit dry to me. Not loving this as much as to the other two.

Drinks are a bit too sweet for me here.

Went here with a few friends to catch up over food and drinks and it was definitely a vibe.

The hostess was so accommodating we were a party of at least 10, don't remember exactly how many of us it was. We did bottomless drinks. Everyone else got bottomless sangria, I did bottomless margaritas. It was so good. The chips and salsa was amazing. I got a burrito with yuca fries so so good.

I would definitely go back again, perfect place no matter what size the group is.

After so many years of coming to Yuca bar with family, friends, and co-workers, this was the spot. I was happy they survived the hit of the pandemic. I returned a few times. I saw the change in management and some staff, and as time passed, it didn't get any better. The food was cold; the flavor was different, as if it was pre-cooked. Yuca fries are now frozen and soaked with oil. I thought maybe it was an off day, but then it became worse. The kitchen closes early, and it becomes a drinking spot which is cool had the quality of food not declined so significantly. However, last month I went with my sister, who came from Florida, for brunch--hoping that brunch would still be good. It was awful they served frozen fruit with the French toast; it was soggy and nasty; really, what would it cost them to put fresh fruit, especially at their prices? Now what was unusual was that it wasn't crowded like it normally is guess they are losing customers and rightfully so good-bye, yuca bar sad to see the original go and this poor quality come to take over. The

This is such a fun restaurant in EV. Depending on when you want to go there, you might need to be prepared to wait.

I've dined here and drank here on multiple occasions.

What i'd recommend is:
- Guacamole, though the last time I ordered this I did feel like it was lacking salt.
- Fish tacos
- Arepitas cubanas with pulled pork
( I want to try the arepa churrasqueso soon)
- Pinchos de pollo

I haven't been able to come for brunch, but don't worry- it's on my list!

They have a HH special and the margarita's are pretty good.

The vibe is fun, it always seems like a decent crowd that turns out and I know this turns into a night party once the restaurant shuts down on the weekends.

Should you check it out? Yes! Reliable, good food and decent drinks.

I'll definitely update my review once I come back for Brunch.

4.5/5

Man I have been here for brunch and lunch maybe 10 times. The frozen mojito was always to die for and the food.
Lately I seen that in the evening it turns to a party place but I didn't think anything of it. So today I tell my husband let's go have a dinner at the yuca bar because I'm craving a frozen mojito.
Well the coconut frozen mojito is apparently not frozen any longer the waiter said the only thing frozen is margarita. Well the coconut mojito and the frozen mango margarita both tasted exactly the same disgusting and sour. So I'm assuming that now that it's a party place they refrain from making there drinks taste good like other cheap bars. Then they give you your check and tell you to get up because they need to set up at 8:30pm. Then we decide to stay at the bar because it's pouring and the host turned bouncer tells my husband to take off his hat. No hats allowed in this place apparently after 8:30. I said to my husband I rather get soaked let's get out. Worse $50 I spent on 4 nasty drinks. So I'm done with that place sadly.

The food was great but the service was AWFUL! We sat down around 830 and by 915 the waiter told us we had to get the check and leave. I guess it turns into a full on bar at a certain time but we weren't even done with our drinks and we were asked to leave so they could put our table away. I told the waiter we would at least be finishing the drinks we purchased. But no one told us as the beginning of dinner we had 45 minutes then had to leave. We also wanted to split the bill but our waiter told us we couldn't do that and almost lost nia him. But -'yeahs the both rooms are awesome

I went to yuca bar last night with a friend around 6:30 and got seated inside. They have happy hour every day until 8pm so we were able to get a few drinks at $9 for the deal. The passion fruit and mango margarita we're great! My friend got two mojitos and the addition of the sugar cane was a nice touch for garnish. To start off, we got an order of guac pico de gallo and chips and it didn't not disappoint. The portion size was generous and the Chip basket also included plantain chips. We decided to get a few different tapas to share and I'm glad we did because everything was delicious! The pulpo ala parrilla was so flavorful and was one of the favorites! The shrimp ceviche was also super fresh and the avocado chunks in it was a nice touch. We also ordered the Brazilian steak skewers with chimichurri rice and they were very juicy. Overall I would definitely come back.

Honestly I really like this place. Don't be scared from the reviews if you live in the East Village and want something reliable. The food is always correct, hot, and prepared well. I've  ordered from Yangs countless times over the course of my life and will continue to do so!

The place is Cash only so be aware.

Haven't been done a long time since the original owners had it went there today very rude man doesn't care place was dirty so I can imagine what they're serving and then the place is the food and the bin and doesn't even say hey ma'am your stuff is done like like so rude $18 for nothing I'll give it to my dogs

There could not be a more misnomer of a name for this joint.
Reasons this is one of the worst places in the city to order food:
A) Qhen you place an order over the phone and then when you arrive, they haven't bothered to prepare it for you.
B) They refuse to acknowledge you. I was there 10 minutes standing at the counter and they did not say a word, even when I said hello.
B) The staff, if you can call them that, are like zombies. They look half asleep and watch a TV set up there so they don't have to pay attention to the work on hand.
It is so crazy how rude and un-involved they are in running a shop.
Don't support this type of business when there are others that better deserve your support.
Yummy and fast .. the people are really nice .. I order the pu pu platter usually it's so good

Last month we have ordered here four times. The C5 Dinner Combination with Broccoli and Shrimp. Together with a portion of 48 Chicken Lo Mein.
Two times we ordered by telephone. Within 20 minutes our order was at our door. Two times I went there for a take out order. Within 5 minutes my orders were ready. The order gives a free Egg Roll and a free can of soda. That all for $ 15.20. We prepare cooked white rice before we had the orders in our house. Easily we could eat to our satisfaction with three persons of the ordered portion. The only thing is that the number of shrimps with each order delivered was less than before. The broccoli is fresh.

Wish the food was like their service. Horrible service and they will over cook your food if they don't like you! Beware prices on the menu is not the price he gives you! Definitely will over charge you!

I love my Happy Wok! They are pretty consistent.  If you ask for things the way you want 90% of the time it comes correct.  I usually ask for the honey wings, or regular wings, chopped in half, extra crispy with not too much sauce and they are delish!!
Ordered for a delivery and they kept telling me I told them the address wrong and that the delivery man was in front of my door. He wasn't and I never got my food.

Various Dishes

So, I'm a pretty big fan of this place, not because this place is pretty close to my apartment and I get delivery when I'm feeling lazy.
Their food is not as greasy as other chinese fast food and their service is outstanding!

The fried rice is always fluffy instead of grease mushed, and their chicken dishes as well as their noodle dishes are big in portion for the price! You can easily get 3 dinner specials (which is meat + rice or noodle+rice) for less than $25!

However, I have to say, my biggest disappointment was their tofu dish. Didn't enjoy them as much. Maybe because they did such a great job on their meat dishes that I was disappointed, but their tofu wasn't crispy enough for me.

Cheap, easy to get and not too greasy for fast chinese food. Hey, you don't hear my complainin'

Foods okay , guy who takes your order sounds like he hates his job. Also be sure to ask for your free item or they will play you and not bring it upon delivery. Also an egg roll should be an option to get a vegetable or shrimp roll it's made out of the same shell. Apparently not. :::sigh::: I asked what sodas they had he was like we have a lot what do you want I said tell me what u have he repeated himself . I much rather order from No. 1 Chinese on 14 st. 1 Ave much cheaper and food taste way better but they are closed Sundays !

They really try if you have special food needs,  I cant eat the sauces and wanted some flavor, not plain steamed, the man gave me the idea of broccoli w. lg shrimp sauteed in garlic sauce, yum. I was happy. Fast delivery .

I used to live on 11th street, so i would come here frequently for a quick take out meal on a busy night. I would have to say that this is probably the dirtiest Chinese place in Manhattan. Not only have I FOUND a cockroach in my egg foo young, I have also witnessed (on 2 occasions) the lady at the counter reach up above her and squash a cockroach with her finger. The second time might have been with a napkin, but I still have the finger squashing in my head. Other than dirty, gross and unsanitary, their food is actually quite good. I would just say if you order from here, definitely check out your food before you consume it.

It's a small place like the usually Chinese takeout restaurants. The food is definitely better tasting then the average takeout. Especially the pork fried rice. It is soft and very tasty. I usually order chicken with broccoli. They give quite a good amount because the boxes are usually fit full. It is all fair priced. Never had any problems with them. The food offered is like any other Chinese takeout.

much respect to a place that will advertise pizza rolls on their menu... and then highlight that by taping an old, faded box of Totino's Pizza Rolls to the wall, with a small sign stating "10 for $3.00". that's a hell of a mark up - but advertising where your food comes from - priceless.
Classic no frills bodega. Exactly what you expect, exactly what you need sometimes. Good breakfast wraps.
Staff does not wear masks, zero lack of awareness for what has been going on regarding covid

Great sandwiches, especially egg breakfast sandwiches. 24/7 is awesome. One really bad experience with Bacon Egg Cheese -- last time I went, ridiculously spicy... pepperjack cheese and what else? I couldn't eat it it was so spicy.

Despite that, great deli.

Guy who picked up phone.... very nice dude.  Paid attention.  It's crazy how this one skill has lost it's importance. I was riding around looking for parking for to alt. Street cleaning..ugh and was hoping get some bkfst...  I grew up in this area and oh my God where are all the places to get a simple egg sandwich? They're all gone . I was lucky to come across Yankee daily on 11th street and they did not disappoint. Though I ended up paying almost $7 it was worth it. The coffee was good. The sandwich was great and the customer service was top notch. Definitely will be back  love MY l.e.s.
Gross and overpriced, lots of expired products. I guess because they're in the lower east side they charge more but I would not recommend going here at all.

Their chopped cheese is terrible. There was more tomato than meat and something tasted off as if the bread or something in the sandwich was expired.They don't have French fries.

Buy a soda or a snack from the grocery area of the deli but don't get anything from the grill.
Horrible and fucking sandwich maker is the worst piss off all the time ...am highly annoyed  spending ur money bullshit ass deli. Chesse even taste weird
Beware Be alert and stay cautious while entering this establishment! Getting over on prices is his expertise. A artist of conning and manipulation.

My favorite deli in LES. They always take care of my cravings even when they sound crazy. They're sandwiches are delicious. I haven't had not one complaint about them. They're staff is super friendly and their prices are reasonable especially in this neighborhood that's up and coming. A+++
Every time I've gotten a sandwich here I've been sick the following day. Same goes for my roommates. Enough said.

I've lived in the east village for 4 years and have probably been into every deli but none of them come close to yankee deli. They have everything you could possibly need and then men who work their are always so kind. (Shout out Louis) After signing a new lease and deciding to move out of the neighborhood I will truly miss yankee deli the more than anything. Go say hi and try their breakfast wraps if you are in the area.

Verry friendly people that work there and food is great will go again  
Also the prices are good on the product they sell also I love their sandwiches

Every single time I come here they raise the prices and the sandwiches aren't even worth the money.  This deli is in a low income area and they charge prices that are absurd and overcharge me every time I go, probably because there's a Target and a luxury building now with a pool on Ave A. It's getting ridiculous already. Also they have expired produce so they don't even check to see how fresh it is. I even saw expired soda. Do you know how long it takes for soda to expire?? A long time

I love coming to this place at 3 am cause they make banging sandwiches.

Bacon, turkey, salami, Munster, Swiss, cheddar on rye bread? You got it. That's what gets me to come back around.

But it helps if you're Spanish cause you'll get grade A service. Otherwise expect attitude.

I give this place two stars because I always order the same thing and experienced being charged from $9-$12 depending how drunk I look. But I remember ... They've even charged me extra for paying by credit card

Happened to walk past this place on my way home from running errands. Decided to stop in and was pleasantly surprised by the Chicken Supreme Sandwich ordered. I definitely recommend if you are in the neighborhood.

This deli deserves a Deli award!! The sandwiches are unbeatable. Like seriously if you order sandwiches from other delis and order one from here you can really taste a difference. The prices are high but what do you expect? You get what you pay for. The deli is nice and clean and open 24/7. They have a $5 credit card minimum and they do charge extra if you use a card to make up for the fees. Which is expectable so what are people complaining for? Other delis have a $15 minimum for card use. The staff is nice and they offer so much more than other delis. It's worth the extra tax money to come here
The deli gets one star! They make sandwiches on stale bread and refuse to offer a tangible solution to correct there error. My sandwich was not eatable! Shame on you!!!
Need to upgrade their customer service. Loud music too much specializing among staff. Orders get mixed up. Also it needs to be inspected by NYCDOH.

I have lived in the neighborhood a long time. I go to this bodega practically every day. The staff is always pretty friendly with the exception of one of the ladies. I dont know her name, she is not there all the time but when she is, she is cold and not friendly. She has dyed blonde/ red curly hair.   I know it's a family business so I know this chick will always pop up. There are 2 other bodega's in the area that I am taking my business to from now on. I dont need shitty attitude when I'm the one giving you MY MONEY.  Screw this joint.

This place is good and bad.

Good: 24/7 sandwiches! It annoys me that some delis stop serving hot sandwiches after a certain hour. So Yankee deli gets MAD PROPS for catering to my 2am drunken hot sangy needs. The portions are always extremely generous, and the griller/sandwich dude is always friendly. Oh, and the ATM machine only has a $0.99 fee. I haven't seen anything cheaper than that.

Bad: It's a small deli, so there's a limited selection, and it's not the cleanest deli in the world.

Polite and friendly staff. I normally get a bacon egg and cheese sandwich with 8 grain toasted bread. The prices are consistent and reasonable and they have just about everything you need in this small bodega.

This deli has the best sandwiches. 24/7 sandwich service too. $5 and better than subway. They are always playing telemundo too, so you have something to do as they're making your sandwich for you. It is kind of dirty, and if you just ran their to pick up some random thing like sugar or baking soda, then it is kind of expensive. But C-town across the street closes to early. The cashiers and sandwich guy here are really friendly too, and always help me find stuff when I stumble in, in the A.M. drunk.
Great sandwiches and amazing beer selection. Amazing staff and friendly owner. Real sturdy LES bodega.

Everything is overpriced; CTown & Associated offer same goods at cheaper prices.  Breakfast egg sandwiches taste funny, as if they diluted the egg mixture or something. And there's always youth loitering, which makes it hard to walk in.

Great value. Slices are in the classic NY style huge, hot and fresh with a nice crunch in the base. Sauce is sweet with a good ratio of cheese to sauce.
Meatball hero was hot on arrival, bread toasted well, meatballs had a great taste. I liked that it wasn't over packed or bursting at the seams.
Greek salad was huge! Super fresh vegetables with tasty balsamic dressing, but you can choose a different dressing if desired. They didn't scrimp on the feta cheese or olives either which is appreciated.

Delivery was within 30 mins as quoted and everything arrived undisturbed and hot. Will definitely order again.

Im a critical reviewer and I feel every establishment has to earn their stars. This Pizzeria is by far the best in LES with very reasonable prices. OMG it was a party in my mouth. Sooooo good. The dough is perfection, the sausage was cooked throughout and the sauce is mouth watering. I recommend this place over and over again. The staff is very polite and friendly and the place is well kept and clean.

Wow! What a pizza. I have two categories of pizza: sit down and to-go slices. This place is definitely the latter. So no, it's not Lucali or Roberta's, but within the to-go slice spectrum, it is excellent. And sometimes that's exactly what you need (I have a rule about getting high-end sit down pizza to go: don't do it!) We ordered a simple pepperoni pie for pickup. It was thicker than most pizzas, with a nice, chewy crust (more doughy than crispy) and a generous portion of cheese and pepperoni. Thoroughly enjoyed it.
Not such a good experience pizza Not so good service  was just okay I would not recommend this place to anyone
I got to some respect on their name I love their pizza one of the best in the ave I recommend order with extra cheese

I'm no pizza snob but the pizza here was one of the worst I've tried in some time.  I also ordered bbq chicken wings just to hedge the potential disappointment.  Wings were pre cooked, reheated while I waited and smothered in some gloppy food service bbq sauce.  
Back to the pizza. I ordered the  Queen Pizza which is advertised as
"Fresh mozzarella cheese, marinara sauce, fresh spinach, grilled chicken and sun-dried tomatoes."

The only thing fresh on this pie was the dough.  Everything else ( I subbed onions for the spinach, which became red onions somehow ), was processed canned crap or some other processed food variant .  This rivaled supermarket pizza which I can forgive knowing it's a supermarket after all.  This was just inedible and I had to scrape the toppings off and eventually throw the whole thing out.  Lucky me,  the bbq wings were just bearable enough to stomach, probably because I was starving.  Ironically the pepperoni pie sitting on the counter didn't look as horrible. Perhaps this is the place to order just the basics. Don't know coz I don't want to try again.

It looks likes an average pizza place from the outside but I took a chance. Wow! Really pleasantly surprised. Very good selection of fresh pies, nicely displayed. Had a slice each of the Meat Lover's and Buffalo Chicken. Excellent. Crust was perfectly cooked and plenty of toppings. Went back two days later for the Meat Lover's but they were out. Had Pepperoni instead....delicious....not oily and greasy like a lot of pizza joints. The place is clean, bright and the staff is very friendly. Happy to have found this place.  

Tom M.

Well I been meaning to order from here for a while now. A friend of mine had a pizza part for her son and ordered the pizza from this pizzeria. I loved it the pizza was amazing. I been waiting for a Friday night off of work to order for myself and my family. Also so I could get their all day Friday pizza special for a large pie for 11.99 which if anyone knows great pizza there is none at this price here in the Lower East Side Anyway so I decided to order in tonight.
I also decided to get their buffalo chicken wings which by the way where a great price as well for only 5.99 for 8 pieces. Wings are my thing!! so yess!!  super excited to get them .
Yes I receive my delivery faster then expect  that was A plus the pizza looked great as well.
What got me upset was that as soon as I opened the container of wings you could smell through the hot sauce that the wings where not good. My husband is like no they good and proceeds to take one and starts to eat it. So I take one as well . Oh god as soon as I bit it I knew they where old.
I decided to called them to replace the wings and they said that my wings where fresh and that was all they had.  The person on the phone was talking to to me and the cook who was yelling in the background tell her they fresh and to send them back if she doesn't want them. The young lady on the phone said exactly what he told her and she said to me, I can give you a refund.
I was so disappointed that I wanted the wings and not the money that I was just like,  you know what Thanks and just hung up.
I said that to say that it upsets me that I loved the pizza the buffalo wing sauce was on point and so was the blue cheese but the wings ruined the whole experience. I'm sad to say that it was not worth it
in to grab a slice and boyyyy was it good small but yet cute this will be my second time here oval all its pretty decent service also

People here aren't very friendly, which I can see past. The pizza, though, is unfortunately flavorless. There is no reason for a slice spot in NYC to lack flavor. I didn't know lack of flavor it was possible for pizza. But, it is.

It is also overpriced: $9 for two tasteless slices, three bland garlic knots, and a small bottle of water.
Customer service was good but the pizza was bad it tasted sweet like they added sugar to the sauce and very greasy not the best if pizza for the expensive price

The pizza is great here! You can tell they use good quality ingredients- not that dollar slice stuff. My favorite is the Greek salad and buffalo wings. I have also had the chicken parm, which is really good   Chicken is juicy on the inside crunchy on the outside. Delivery is pretty quick and the staff is super friendly. Highly recommend for real deal NYC pizza.
This pizzeria is pretty alright. Buffalo chicken pizza, regular slice, & order of garlic knots for $8, not to bad.

Love this new pizza place that recently opened up in the les. The pizza is superb. I stumbled across this little gem on my home one night and I'm glad I did. The spinach artichoke pie and meat lovers pie is the way to go if you wanna try something new and tasty.
Terrible chicken parm I got food poisoning from it! Never ordering from this place again!

Grabbed a bite here mid afternoon and was astonished. One the best slice of pizza I had in NYC. Margarita slice was Very crispy and well flavored even though it was only reheated in the oven for a minute of so. 10/10 would return to try other toppings.

If you are thinking about ordering pizza here, please think again. Just take a look at this pizza and see why I am writing this review. I never posted on Yelp before but having paid 25 DOLLARS for this I felt the need to do so. I suggest ordering dominos, at least you will know the quality will be better
Wow I love the pepperoni slices. Can't wait to come back for more!! Great atmosphere and really good customer service. It's a private gem hidden in NYC.
See photo! My cheese slice!! Wow!! Excellent!! Real NY pizza !! I was there today and I overheard a construction worker say to the pizza people as he left " thanks! It was really good!"
This pizza is actually disgusting. The basil they use is gross and the sauce is so watery that it slips off the pizza. Don't order from here. Even though it's cheap pizza, it's not worth a penny.
I ordered pizza and wings. They were awesome. The meat lover pizza is to die for. Service is great.

This was a nightmare. They called me 30 minutes after I placed the order, saying they ran out of arugula. I asked them to cancel it because that's what I wanted but they said they already made it so they would go get some arugula. Why would they make it if they didn't have all the ingredients? They finally arrived an hour and 15 minutes after I placed the order and everything was cold. The icing on the cake is instead of arugula, they put romaine lettuce on the pizza like I'm an idiot and wouldn't know the difference. Save yourself.
**DO NOT ORDER** worst food ever. I got food poisoned. On top of the fact that I had to wait 90 mins and get cold food. Customer service is a joke too.
Quintessential NY pizza, absolutely cheesy with toasty yet soft scrumptious crust. WHenever I'm in the area this is my pie of choice!
Yummy cheese pizza. Very affordable. The best part of all buffalo wings so juicy and spicy. My kind of wings. My family go there everyday. For a lite bite. Will return
Got delivery. Fettuccini tasted like cheese and nutmeg. Wings were super weird looking. Both tasted badly. Usually give places the benefit of the doubt, but this was unusually weird.
I love ordering from them on nights when we don't want to cook.  Ordered several times and still no disappointment.  Food taste amazing and delivery is pretty fast.

I have no choice but to put one star. I'd prefer to give it no stars. I ordered two slices, a chicken and a veggie slice. Both slices were hard, dry and the chicken slice had a huge hair on it. You're better off getting pizza from the $1 pizzeria up the block. Its cheaper, tastes better and doesn't have hair on it. Do yourself a favor and save your money.

Pretty good pizza. Obviously homemade fresh ingredients. High quality mozzarella, and toppings. $15+ for a pie. Ample for one person. Reasonable size for two. I also liked their quality local made sodas.
The pizza is very good, the Margarete with Basil and mozzarella is a must have. They have quick service. I am glad this was my first NY pie.

I  stumbled across this place while i was in the neighborhood. Me and my friends went to Zum Schneider on the same block for beers , and than decided to have a couple  slices of pizza.After talking to the owner, we found out that its a new place and also the pizza chef is the same  one that  made the reputation of  Vezzo", which is one of my favorite places for pizza in the city. I was impressed with this information, and i ordered an off menu item that he used to make  in Vezzo ,shiitake mushrooms ,he made it for me on the spot. We also ordered the artichoke  and the eggplant. I really love them all , still my favorite it's shiitake, followed by artichoke. The eggplant was a bit heavy for my taste .The crust is thin and flavourful with unique fresh ingredients.      This will become one of my favorite places , and i think it's a great addition to Alphabet City .

Pizza is okay, it's better in lower price category than others around. Don't expect the stringy cheese of ny pizza 50 years ago. I did find a pizzeria in New Jersey that had cheese that stretched for miles and I was totally shocked, I almost forgot that's the way it's supposed to be. But getting back about Yankee pizza, I was surprised to see zeppoles on the menu and I waited til after eating my two slices of pizza before treating myself to zeppoles.  I cannot put words to the disappointment. We may have gotten used to unstringy cheese pizza but these imitation zeppoles are sure to disappoint and keep disappointing. Might as well save your two dollars and get a loaf of Bread and put powdered sugar on it. That's Yankee pizza "zeppoles".  It's what dominos does, they take a Chunk of their pizza dough add icing on it and viola, dessert. It's so disappointing.  Yankee pizza, please get yourself a good zeppoles recipe, make them a little bigger and increase the price by $1 (6 for $3) and I will buy them again, otherwise, if you keep putting powdered sugar on dry balls of bread I am no longer a customer.  Upon closer inspection Yankee pizza is taking their garlic knots bread and adding powdered sugar to it and passing them off as zeppoles. Tsk tsk.
Very good for the price. Pizza was delivered timely with no issues. Will order again.

I must say my 8yr son and myself are
Pizza enthusiast and this place can be added to our top ten pizza places. The wings are moist with zingy BBQ taste, garlic knots are a little on the doughy side but with enough homemade garlic to make it up. Best for last the Pizza is just rite in size not to thick nor thin, sauce is rich in herbs and has a mix of both salty and sweet in which plays with your pallet. The meat lover is my son's favorite yet I gravitate towards the plain and margherita pizza which have just enough ingredients on them. THE PIZZA DOES NOT TASTE LIKE CARDBOARD.
      We have both purchased at the location which I must say the customer service is good, staff are bilingual which the community requires and knowledgeable of the area as there is a bus stop in front and many ask for directions. I like that its a kid friendly place ( there are always kids eating there ) and the establishment offers discounts for schools, kids and faculty.  On several occasions the owner ( seems like fine gentleman ) hands out samples and likes to get personal feedback from its patrons, for me this is being in tune with your customers and great management skills.
     I live in the area and I will continue to buy food from them as long as the food stays the same, delicious and its purpose is to provide a good, clean and children friendly atmosphere.

If you are looking for a place to grab good pizza, some yummy wings and receive welcoming and friendly service this is the place to go! Pizza is yummy and fresh and the wings are flavorful and yummy!! Def try it!!!

Friendly service, great flavor and deal! I got their Special#1 which is buy ANY 3 slices get the 4th for free for $9.00. ($3.00/ea @ the original price.) I'll def. return and hope the great quality & deal will last long!
Warm & friendly service, their pizza taste scrumptious and offer prompt delivery. I recommend this place, you can taste the quality
Well, if you come home at 2 in the morning pretty drunk you'll like this pizza...or if you like putting it in the fridge and eating it cold it'll do...if not you'll probably want to keep looking
This pizza place is underrated. The crust is nice and thin, the sauce and cheese proportion is pretty close to perfect, and it's cheap. I highly recommend it if you're looking for a quick slice.
WOW. Best pizza in the city!!! Nichelle was super sweet and suggested Pepperoni Rolls which were the best thing to ever grace my taste buds. This is the new spot for sure!
I Love this place I know the owners personally and he cares about the service he provides and the food is always fresh !
Really good food! Rice, beans, chicken. Family-owned, friendly service. You can tell they take pride in their business and customer service.
Honestly not that bad big fan of the sandwiches and bagels the soup is a little watery sometimes.The workers seem a little lazy sometimes

This is a poor excuse for a deli.  There is no sandwich menu and when I went to order they didn't have spicy mustard.  They seem to have some food in the back with and a menu.  It seems like a bunch of mexican food but wasn't really interested as I was looking for a sandwich.  This place is  kinda strange if you ask me and their sign is very obnoxious.

yes the cashew chicken is fried (it was gross i didnt eat it when i ordered it)

but today i got the chicken and brocolli - its decent // the brocolli has good flavor // yes its oily

but the wonton soup and eggdrop wonton soup is amazing from here.. to the point that i will def just order a big egg drop wonton soup for dinner in the future! (rlly good w/sirracha too)

I just ordered food from them. The delivery guy did not come upstairs. I had to go down and get the food. I ordered chicken and broccoli. It smells really weird and taste odd to. I got a 10 dollar coupon and it was not worth it. I will stick with Golden Forest. It cost more but the food taste and smells delicious!!

This place is horrible. Seamless somehow had this place at 5 stars with 4.5k ratings. Well I got bamboozled... I'm not even going to go into details. Do not order from here. It's gross, too long for delivery and I'd rather starve or eat a strangers leftovers than eat here again.

I found maggots in my food. I don't know if they wash the vegetables before they use. I ordered other stuff too and they weren't good. I used seamless to order. This place got 5 stars on seamless. I should've believed Yelp. Tips for the people who are trying to order food from here. Better go to a store and get ramen noodle and cook yourself. You won't get maggots.

I ordered food on seamless and the driver called and yelled at me because he didn't know that he was delivering to a hotel even though I mentioned it on the ticket. He yelled at me as if the address was incorrect, made me feel like I entered it in incorrectly but I was correct. Then he yelled at me to come down and get the food. I told him to come up, and he Roy insisting I come down so I told him to cancel the order. After calling seamless customer service I spoke to the restaurant owner and she also was super rude and tried to not give me my money back. Worst service and human beings ever!

HORRIBLE!! Just ordered delivery with my friend from this place. My sesame chicken was fine, but the veggie lo-mein she ordered was absolutely disgusting. Smelled it myself, and we both thought it smelled like it'd been cooked with something that went bad, or even under-cooked with rotten food. We ended up sharing my dish because we had to run to a meeting (which is why we ordered in the first place -- to save time!) and when she called later they would not refund the rancid food even though the dish is completely full!! It only took her half a bite to tell that it was inedible. I would recommend this place ever. TERRIBLE customer service and quite the toss-up when it comes to quality.

No-showed after we ordered them on Grubhub. We sat around famished after midnight and they just closed the shop and stopped picking up the phone. The ONLY THING THEY'RE SUPPOSED TO DO is deliver food, and that's beyond them. AVOID.

I ordered the cashew chicken and General Tso's chicken for delivery last night, and was dismayed by the quality of the food. Additionally, the order of brown rice had a longish black hair sticking out of it when we emptied it onto the plate. The General Tso's chicken was rather sweet, actually, which isn't what I usually expect of this spicy dish. And the cashew chicken dish contained breaded, deep-fried chicken - again, not expected. The veggies in these dishes were nice and crisp, and plentiful, so that was very good to experience. However, I would say that the experience of ordering from here is that the food seems to be very typical Chinese food - oily, sweet, and very saucy. That's terrific if it's what you're looking for, but it's not to my taste preferences.

Fresh Japanese BBQ
Meat was yummy and fresh
But the portion is slightly small
And the service is ok

I don't remember the last time I posted a two star review, but this was definitely one of the worst meals I had in recent memory, not close.

I've been here quite a few times pre-covid, when you still had to take off your shoes to enter, and as far as I remember, I enjoyed the food and the experience.

The main issue is the meat quality. We got the large beef combo and almost every cut was so tough and/or dry that they were basically uneatable. I have no idea what cut of the cow they were using, but I swear it was the worst meat I've ever had at a shabu shabu, hot pot, yakiniku or korean bbq place. I get that this place is relatively 'affordable' by nyc standards, but it's true, Gyu Kaku is way better for the same price.

I'm giving a one more star, because the sides we ordered - bibimbap, and okonomiyaki were eatable, though not good by any means.

We weren't welcome when we entered the restaurant, that's fine, maybe the receptionist had a bad day? We sit there for 20 minutes and no one came over to take our order. We asked the waiter (shown in photo) that we ready to order and got ignored. And I came over to him again since he was the first person I saw around our area and asked once again that we ready to order, surprisingly he relied with "I KNOW!" in a rude and disrespectful altitude!

Food (5/5): We got a bunch of appetizers and some sets while a friend of mine got the barbeque sets. Specifically we ordered the Okonomoyaki, Yakitori, Croquet, Negi toro udon set, tuna udon set, and qagyu beef sushi. All of the dishes were very good! Particularly I enjoyed the Yakitori and Okonomoyaki. The udon noodles were also of good quality with flavorful broth. The only complaint was from my friend who got the BBQ. For the quality and amount, he thought the price was too steep.

Service (4/5): Overall good service with the waitress helping us when requested. Food came out reasonably fast. The only issue was that they didn't check up on us or refilled water that frequently after giving the food unless we waived them down to ask.

Ambiance (5/5): There are two floors to this restaurant. We sat on the second floor. The place feels like an authentic Japanese restaurant with the wooden furniture and setup. Plenty of seating as well as space on the table.

It was my first time eating at Yakiniku West after seeing their weekday specials. On Wednesday they gave short ribs special and on Thursdays, salmon specials.

We ordered 3x salmon toro (4 pieces each other), salmon collar, 2x salmon sashimi (5 pieces each other), and salmon collar for apps. The salmon did not disappoint especially with the Thursday special. We also tried beef tongue sashimi for the first time, it was interesting but it was slightly frozen so it didn't have much taste.

For the main we ordered the mix platter for 2 for $60. The portion was decent for two people to share. We left pretty full and satisfied.

Sometimes chains are better. Gyu Kaku has an All You Can Eat Option, and even the a la carte menu is better than this place's in both quality and taste. I got a "complete" dinner set D which is a 5 oz ribeye with soup OR salad, rice, and cabbage and exactly one broccoli. They should name these sets "completely insane" because who puts raw meat on the same plate as the vegetables? Plus there's no way to cook the cabbage on the grill without burning it. I also got an order of short rib for about 8.50 and a taiyaki for dessert. The taiyaki wasn't super crispy or entirely warm. Maybe it was frozen and they microwaved it. The total for this amount of food was probably around $50, which is outrageous.
My friends got udon sets, which I thought was weird since this place is for yakinuku. The udon sets even come with a bowl of rice which is hilarious. Fried sausage, udon , with a side of rice. They also got a kobe prime beef sushi, but the meat wasn't thin and fatty enough so it ended up being too chewy. They grilled the half seared beef to finish cooking it...what an abomination. Next time, I'd probably just go gyu kaku for a real yakiniku deal, or just get small apps and beers during happy hour.

I was very excited to try the "all you can eat" promo every 29th of the month.
We ordered the Kobe option and unfortunately, I wasn't impressed with the meat (not tender as expected).

Typical cozy Japanese restaurant look & feel when you walk in. This place is at a busy & popular location in Astor Place, behind St. Marks. We walked in without reservation at 6:30pm on a Saturday and we were seated right away. However, after that the place got busy so a reservation is recommended if you come with a  group. We were a group of 3 so we ordered the Meat Lover set for two, which was more than enough for us. Our set was $160 which with tax & tip comes out to be $200, which is pricy in my opinion. You do get a LOT of meat, which makes up for it. The set didn't come with any sides at all, just lettuce to wrap the meat in, which besides me no one else touched/used.  We all agreed that it needed some sides even if it's just soup or rice. Otherwise, delicious meat, efficient & friendly staff, in a convenient location.

This place is disgusting.  I tried the short rib, which tasted more like shoe leather.  I've never seen short rib with no form of fat or as tough as a belt.

Do NOT get bibimbap

The atmosphere is very nice in this location, plenty of space for seating and the prices are good for the amount you get. The meats were very fresh and it was juicy. I got the she so hungry meal for 2. The soy sauce was really good to dip with. ( was too hungry and didn't have a chance to take a picture of the meats :( the takoyaki was also very fresh and crispy yet soft.
Oh my freaking goodness on a cracker everything here is perfect. On Mondays and Tuesdays there's a beef platter combo for $19.99

Food was good and service too. Monday and Tuesday special is very affordable, especially compared to Korean BBQ prices. The assorted vegetables for grill are weird: cabbage, corn, broccoli, mushrooms, and peppers. The corn and broccoli and presteamed. The mushrooms and peppers I get but the cabbage is the weird one  
Will definitely come back

I was busy and have no intention of eating. Upon heading to the train station with my associate, I came upon this restaurant in the East Village. What caught my attention was the big sign that says "$1.50" and big pictures of salmon nigiri. I kept walking but that $1.50 salmon nigiri is in my head. It's not American sushi, it actually looked Japanese from the outside. I kept walking though. Departed with my associate at the train station, made 3 business calls, and came back for this beautiful looking piece of salmon nigiri *drools*

This restaurant serves Japanese BBQ and sushi! I was in a hurry so I can't do the J BBQ today. I ordered almost everything on their Salmon Thursday menu because it is friggen Thursday!

5 pcs of salmon sashimi - $7.50
Mini salmon poke donburi - $7
Salmon nigiri was $1.50/pc but since I already ordered plenty of regular salmon, I got the salmon toro nigiri for $2/pc instead

The fish was very fresh and delicious. The soy sauce was savory. The wasabi was very strong, it made me teared up. That's good! The ginger was fine. I'm okay with the rice. I think next time I won't need any rice.

Next time I want to try the bbq salmon butter in foil for $7.50! It sounds delicious

Walked in around 5ish and was seated immediately. They were having their Wednesday promo for their Kobe beef platter for $20 so that was what we went with. I love how thick the slices of meat are compared to other bbq places. The meat was tender and the marinade was flavorful. 10 oz of meat didn't seem like a lot but it was definitely enough for one person paired with rice. We also got the salmon belly nigiri, the quality of the fish could've been better but no complaints here. I wish they offered a sweet soy sauce like other yakiniku places but the meat was seasoned enough for it to not be a big issue. Overall, really enjoyed our meal here and would definitely come back!

Saw an Instagram video and found out this place offered beef tongue and liver sashimi so came here to try it out. I absolutely love tongue, but this was bland with no texture nor flavor. The liver was gamey but also really bland. I ended up throwing both on the grill, and it was slightly better since it at least had a chewy texture, but still no flavor. I've had my fair share of unseasoned raw beef tongue, and there should be a subtle beefy flavor and slight chew, neither of which this had. The rest of the meat itself was also really mediocre. I never order my meat marinated at JBBQ or KBBQ, and praise for the natural juices of the meat itself, but the meat here had absolutely no flavor or texture.

The worse was our grill did not get hot enough and it took almost 5 mins just to cook the piece of cabbage till it wilted (it usually takes seconds on a normal grill). The fire was so low that the fat on the meat barely melting and was melting so slow that there was no sizzle on the grill at all. I am not joking when I say I was cooking the broccoli and okra for about 20 mins. At that point, most of the Veges got dry but we're not fully cooked (broccoli especially). We asked for the fire to be turned up but was told it was the highest. When your food dries out before the juices can release, the fire is very very sadly low.

Their booths are not really booths but a long table booth that has a hanging window shade as a divider. Because if this, you can still see the bottom half of the person next to you on the other side of the divider and it's winter time now, so with coats, they were basically touching each other. It was also so incredibly loud that I heard the entire conversation from the people on the other side of the divider-- not a good experience. For the price and taste, I wouldn't recommend anyone to come. Came in with expectations that were not met, would rather go to Gyu-Kaku a few blocks down even though that's a chain store
My friends and I have been coming to this yakiniku for years (between closings for renovation) and love the consistent quality and pricing. Meat is great and the Happy Hour pricing definitely helps.

We came here on a Saturday night and were seated promptly. We got the Okonomiyaki appetizer and Kobe for 2 and a side of rice, which we thought together was a good amount of food.

The Okonomiyaki was a bit soft and doughy, but had good flavours. The Kobe was mixed: some cuts were super tender and delicious but others were a bit chewy, no matter how we cooked it.

Overall, 4 stars - a good, solid choice if you're in the area that won't disappoint, but personally not something I'd make a trip to come back to.
Great AYCE! Lots of options and very nice service. Recommend finger ribs and pork jaw

Tried to take a picture but it didn't look so good! We came to try because we wanted Udon West, and it was closed :( When going into the restaurant, the interior was beautiful!

Ambiance: 5/5 - they even pulled the curtains down so that our party of 2 can get a little privacy. Feels like I've been brought to Japan.

Food: 4/5 We ordered the special beef (wagyu and something else but there were 3 cuts of beef). Honestly only one cut was delicious, everything else wasn't so good. Udon was really good!!

Service: 5/5 Super helpful and attentive staff even if they were really busy!

Came here on a Saturday evening with a friend. This was a bit last second decision and was expecting a 30 minute wait due to the area. I was still waiting for my friend to get here when I arrived, but the host was able to get me a table in 5 minutes and was okay with sitting me despite not having the full party.

While waiting for my friend to show up, I order an Asahi Draft ($7). Another 30 minutes pass by and he finally showed up and we got right to ordering. We ordered the Zei for 2 Platter ($70), which consisted of 6 different beefs. We also each got a bowl of White Rice ($3). We thought we would need to order more meat, but after consuming everything, we were both very satisfied.

Service is terrific. Super friendly and attentive staff members. This was my friend's first BBQ experience and he loved every moment of it. The meat was very good quality and we both left satisfied. What more can you ask for?

A disappointment for a joint that looks authentic in the area with a lot of Japanese restaurants.
We ordered the meat lover for four and several of the meat cut were too. The prime short rib, Kobe short rib and pork belly were three of my top choices.

I visited this restaurant specifically for some udon and was pleased to find that the interior decor provided an authentic Japanese atmosphere. During our meal, we noticed many locals dining, which added to the authenticity of the experience. The service was attentive and the overall atmosphere was enjoyable.

However, while the udon was satisfactory, it was unfortunately a bit bland, lacking the depth of flavor we were hoping for. Additionally, the fried chicken dish could have used a touch of salt or sauce to enhance its flavor profile. Overall, the experience was pleasant but with a few improvements to the food, it could have been exceptional.

Came here after looking around for somewhere close for bbq. It's not a bad place. It's okay. But I would come back. The service was not that good since there was only one waitress taking everyone's order and then a guy from the front would come back to check. They gave us the wrong order. Ordered something else. Which was fine we ate it anyways.

The meat was fresh and well marinated and the price wasn't too expensive with Mondays and Tuesdays having 50% off on select items. We came on a Monday so it wasn't too crowded indoors. Perfect for after work quick get togethers. They also have a list of sakes to choose or try from which is a plus.

BUT they charged us for 2 baskets of 5 lettuces for $10 with no warning. Most bbq places offer lettuces for free so this is kinda wild. The waiters are nice but interrupt frequently. Idk at times i felt a tiny bit uncomfortable.

Probably will go back at some point but never ordering lettuces from there again I guess I'll just have rice instead.

This place has renovated since the last time I've been here (10 years ago LOLs). The quality of the grilling meats is still great and they still have their meat specials on Mondays and Tuesdays where the sliced short rib meats are 1/2. I was here with two other people so we ordered one serving of the meat specials and an order of the meat lovers for 2. We also ordered some assorted veggies just to say we had veggies.
The only negative I have about this place is that we felt like they kept rushing us to pay and leave when the restaurant still had empty tables. We wanted to sit and catch up and please know that if we saw that they needed tables were would have left but there were still a few vacant tables so we didn't understand the rush

A great spot for Japanese grill, especially when you come on the weekdays for a special.

We ordered 3 sets of the Kobe beef special that is featured on Wednesdays for $20!!! For the amount of meat, this was definitely value especially in NYC.

A decent sized portion, but people who eat a little bit more might need to order something else to pair with it.

The meat was good and came with two different dipping sauce. There are many other restaurants that serve meat to this quality and even better. But what makes this place unique is that you can cook the meat yourself and to your own rarity. If you're looking for something with this interactivity, come here.

Value: 5/5 (on weekdays)
Ambiance: 4/5
Taste: 3.75/5

5 stars for the service and 3.5-4 for the food. The best meat on our platter were the duck slices. The beef was a bit chewy. I recommend getting the veggie platter as it's nice to mix things up - and flame-grilled veggies are delicious. This was a nice date night experience and not too pricey for what it is. I just wish the quality of the meat and how it's seasoned was a little better.

My friends and I (party of 4 ) stopped by on a Saturday evening without reservation and was seated pretty quickly on the second floor. We were the first party on the second floor and by the time we left more people came.

Barbecues includes meat sets, beef , pork, chicken & duck, seafood and assorted vegetables. We ordered 2 party sets, Meat Lover for 2  (6 kinds of meats) and Kobe for 2 (3 kinds of Kobe beef) . The sets are definitely bigger than most barbecues places. I think the marinated meats were pretty good without the sauces but they did offer two sauces, i think miso and sweet soy sauces. Either sauces are also good.  As for the corn in the sets and assorted vegetables was pretty sad. It was small, and barely any to chew. We got ends of the corn and we were pretty  upset.

We ordered two Bibim-bap and i think it was ok. We thought the portion was small since our server suggested one for each person. But we didn't even finished the second one.  Also love the appetizers we chose:  Takoyaki,  fried chicken and Agedashi tofu.

Other than the things mention above, they also have a lot more appetizers, rice sets, salads, udons, dinner sets and desserts.

We spend over $300 tho...

The menu is constantly changing and the prices keep going up. With three people, we order over $100 worth of food for lunch but left feeling unsatisfied. The waiter also didn't explain which meat was what when it arrived nor did he tell us how long it had to be cooked. This used to be my go to spot for BBQ, but unfortunately I won't be returning anytime soon.
Somewhat overpriced but pretty good. Service was not very amenable. Rice balls were the best. Agedashi tofu was pretty good.

Really beautiful modern space w/spacious seating ideal for groups - we were a party of 6 to celebrate my 16yo's bday w/two of her friends. We ordered two, 6 piece appetizers of pork gyozas for the table and the other adult had 2 lychee martinis that she enjoyed. We all ordered sushi rolls and while we finished them they setup the bbq which was perfectly timed. The teens had never had Japanese bbq and wanted to experience it - but no one was starving so we just got two a la cart chicken & beef orders for them to share - which was perfect. While they we're grilling we ordered miso soup, rice balls and more of the delicious gyoza. We were all pretty satisfied w/the servings as we are all light eaters.

They placed a candle in one of the Taiyaki's we ordered which was perfect & a nice surprise for us all because I'd forgotten I'd mentioned it was her birthday earlier. They don't split checks so figure that out beforehand. The girls were happy & pleased. Perfect experience & portions for teens and children. Four stars bc the food was "just ok" but the service was steller, attentive and easy.
Love their special wed and Thursday salmon special and Japan bqq always get the rice balls set

I love Yakiniku west ! Very nice Japanese staff and very clean table. I go always Monday happy hours are not just only good price , good quality and tasty.
The Selection also, not only beef they have some fish and vegetables so means join your party with vegetarian and pescatarian friends. This place is all welcome amazing great service! いつも美味しく頂いています。ありがとう。長いしてごめんなさい

Always my favorite place! Great place to eat! And drink!!!

Beef liver sashimi is awesome!!!

I want to support local restaurant, but truth is a truth. I was told by one of my friend that Yakiniku West has a good food and great price so Friday night I have a chance to try on. I got to the place early so it wasn't busy and there are bunch of waiter and waitress giving service around.

My table is a table of 2 and this is a food and drink that we order.

- House sake : it is hot sake, I wasn't crazy about but it is ok. 7/10

- Fried Squid : good and popular dish, I also like it especially wasabi soy sauce. 8/10

- scallop and mushroom in Foilbox: I love it, so delicious and one of my favorite. 8/10

- Kobe Finger rib: This is a mistake, I didn't want it but they gave me the wrong on and it is too much fat and sticky. I couldn't finish it, so terrible and they don't take it out from my bill. 0/10 DONT RECOMMENDED! BE WEAR don't order this one.

- Dinner set Short Rib set: it is good and I add an extra $5 for Bibimbop. That is so good. 9/10

- Kobe inside skirt Miso: this one is the one we wanted to order but thet gave us the wrong one at the beginning.

There was no set meal for three so we ordered zei for 4. It was a lot of fresh meat, and we are satisfied. We also ate a salad and some rice balls. Taiyaki could not be missed. We three girls finished the meal proudly

I haven't been here for years but apparently they renovated the place. I missed how it was before where you take off your shoes and sit at a low table. I came here on a Saturday night for a birthday dinner with a group of 4 people. We ordered the gyoza, okonomiyaki, takoyaki, fried scallops, the Kobe platter for 2, and the assorted vegetables. I especially liked the takoyaki and the Kobe platter for 2. There was a lot of meat and the pricing is cheaper than Gyu Kaku Japanese Steakhouse nearby. I brought a cake from Panya (Japanese bakery) nearby. I forgot candles but they were nice enough to provide a candle, cake cutter, plates, and utensils after the meal. The staff were super nice. I would definitely be back! They seem to have daily specials and the deals were posted outside.

Yakiniku is a relatively inexpensive J-BBQ spot that should satisfy your cravings. I do feel a bit cautious going into J-BBQ spots because they tend to serve small portions that eventually amounts to a lot for any decent sized meal.
We were lucky to have taken the M/T deal, and that might have been the reason we left satisfied!

We liked the okonomiyaki. The meats which we cooked ourselves under little supervision were very tasty. The service was very good, as well, with an attentive waitress.
I have the feeling it might get loud over here over the weekends or Friday, but that's just speculation.

Food is good and portions are small.  Overall they are not "cheap," but they're not overpriced either.  Service is another matter.  They "close" at 10:30, but when we sat down a little after 9:00 we were told we had to order then and now as the kitchen was closing (this includes raw meat for the BBQ).  Halfway through our meal (but while we were still eating) they dropped the check since they were "closing" (45 minutes before they "close").  By 10:30 the bill was paid and the table was cleared, but we were told we had to leave since they were "closed."  Never mind that two tables away another group was still eating (and they were already there when we arrived).  I'm teetering on the brink of a "2" but will leave it at "3" (but come to think of it the rice was pretty dry too).

I came here for dinner with some friends. The meat is definitely quality. My friend and I tried the short rib, but my other friends shared a big mixed platter. The sauces were soooo good. I kept trying to dip everything in it, including my okonimoyaki hahaha

Their bibimbap set is a great deal. It's $18 for a bibimbap, soup, salad and vegetables. We also tried an Okonimoyaki. The bibimbap was really good and the okonimoyaki was good too, but felt a little heavy after a while. Overall, was definitely satisfied with this place!

Favorite place ever to eat .. nuff said
Make sure you have clean socks on and are comfortable removing your shoes in order to dine amd you'll be just fine :)

Super good Japanese bbq! Back in the days it used to be traditional where you had to remove your shoes but now they're back and it's more of a sit down place. Definitely recommend getting one of the meat platters so you get a little bit of everything. You grill the meat yourself and the beef tongue here is sooo good. They also have days where they give you specials on their meat! They also have happy hour for drinks as well! Nothing beats some beer with bbq! Good place to hang out with friends. They also have some sushi too which was okayyy but I'm here for the meat meat meat!

Average at best.  Kobe beef for 2 was subpar quality...stringy in some parts.  Rice costs extra.  Servers were rushing to clear the table even though the place was empty.  Expensive...therefore, given the above...poor value.  You can do better in this area.

I have been to various places of bbq ( Korean, Chinese & Japanese) and I hearted for yakiniku and this place is my fav!

Food: their choice meats are huge. From intestine, tongues to pork jaw, Kobe beef, clams... I mean u name it, they have it. And I like how fresh the meat are as well.

They also have non bbq food and their fried scallop and fried squid legs are very delicious as well. I haven't tried their sashimi yet.. probably will give it a try next time.

Services: no complain with the service.. everyone is really nice and constantly check on us if we need anything else.
