Ambience: the place was burned down before and this is under new renovation now. They used to have this Japanese tatami style mat and now all becomes tables and booth now. I do like prior ambience better but the whole place is very clean in general.

The place order happy hour and special during some days and a certain time. And it's extremely affordable when compare to other bbq place. If you are not sure whether you will like this place or not, come during happy hour and check it out yourself. I never am disappointed with this place.. been here so many times already :)

DO NOT RECOMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE. The food is OK, but the service is awful. The moment we signed the check the waiter almost grabbed it from my arms. Then she chased us because we payed less then recommend tip (it was still a good amount for that qualify of service) and demanded more. Read other comments, people were harrased for that and got robed (they changed the amount of tips the customer wrote). Just don't come here - spend your precious time somewhere else, there is plenty of good restaurants nearby. This place is just a bunch of greedy greedy people.

Wish I can leave a good review. But I need to be honest, we all rely on others review. So maybe it was our mistake not ordering anything related to barbecue. Wasn't in a mood. So we ordered lychee martini, Takoyaki, fried chicken, bibimbap, spicy tuna roll and yuzu cheesecake. Sadly, none of them stand out. Let me start with lychee martini, meh! Skip it. Nothing special. We had to return fried chicken and bibimbap. Okay, shouldn't have ordered bibimbap at Japanese restaurant, my bad. Fried chicken had no taste. Honestly, all of their food was quite bland. Takoyaki was not the best but thanks to the sauces we rely on it was good enough to eat. Spicy tuna roll was okay but too much rice which made the dish taste bland.  Yuzu cheesecake, i can live without it. It has a hint of yuzu taste then it's gone. Service was kind and nice yet slow as a turtle. So hard to complain but need to complain. What a confusing review! Ambiance, oh my god. So loud! It is initially just one big room so if one group is loud you are still k listening them screaming laughing or whatever. We did ask out seat to be moved, even then, we couldn't wait to get out. Unfortunately, we won't be returning here.

Went with a friend for a birthday dinner, also my first time trying Japanese my bbq. We were seated upstairs and in big comfortable booth. We got a bunch of meat and not going to lie it was a little expensive but I expected that. I just expected the meat to taste really fresh.

Service: 10/10
Food: 7/10
Price: 7/10

Wow so glad this place reopened! Been coming here since 10 years ago. It just underwent renovations and it's very comfortable. Get the salmon sashimi and short rib/premium short rib combos. They're the must haves. Only shame is they no longer do the shoes off thing!

Pretty quiet when I went which was a nice atmosphere for dinner
The food was of course good

The presentation of this place definitely upgraded... but their food isn't as good as I remembered. And they change the whole ambience that made it unique from other jbbq places. Now it just makes me feel like any other bbq spot. Better off going to Gyu Kaku. I miss the old look and food quality...

Best margaritas
Delicious queso fundido
Cozy and cute
Perfect location
Great service/friendly staff

Legit tex-mex! As a San Antonian living in the city, I've found food, service, and vibes just like home. Eric & Spencer are the best. I highly recommend this establishment for all my fellow San Anto ppl and anyone who stumbles upon this restaurant!

Also peep their commercial with Resy & Amex and stop by to taste what true tex-mex tastes like! Feels good to see SA on the map :)

I recently dined here- a Tex-Mex restaurant that brings an intriguing twist to the traditional flavors I've come to love during my many years in San Antonio. From the moment I entered, the atmosphere was lively and inviting, just as you'd expect from a place honoring the spirit of Tex-Mex cuisine (great little shop inside).

The menu offered an extensive range of dishes. The flavors were amazing, and food was very fresh. Loved that they provide many vegetarian options, which is great and not something I would expect from Tex-Mex food. Staff where really friendly. Definitely will come back again.

Yellow Rose is a fantastic Tex-Mex place and I'm glad I went back to try more of their items.  I tried the barbacoa taco, carne guisada taco, and the "sunburn on Sunday" cocktail.  I will say, I initially got the margarita with mezcal but didn't particularly like it so I swapped it out (which they were very accommodating about) for the cocktail my friend got which was way better.  Out of the tacos, the barbacoa had to be my favorite as the meat was super tender and flavorful.  I hope to go back in the Fall when they make their popular Texas Sheet cake.

A little piece of TX in NYC - Love it! As a native Texan, I'm always looking for good Texas food - especially breakfast tacos. I'm not talking breakfast burrito - if you're from or have frequented Texas (especially South TX) you will understand.

I heard about this place a few months ago and finally stopped by this weekend to satisfy my breakfast taco craving! Super cute inside. Not huge but a decent amount of tables, 10-ish bar seats and a seating area outside. Service was nice. Brunch menu was pretty small but that is okay by me as I came here knowing exactly what I wanted. Lots of fun cocktails available too.

My bf and I each had a carne guisada and potato/egg taco with bacon added. They did not disappoint! My bf said it was the best he's ever had! I wouldn't go that far as it's hard to compare with getting in TX, but I thoroughly enjoyed and will be back!

So, if you're a displaced Texan or just looking for some good breakfast - give them a shot! I can't wait to come back to try lunch/dinner and especially a slice of good ol' fashioned Tx sheet cake (IYKYK)!

Oh yeah, I also had a michelada which was great too! Tasty, spicy, but not over the top. Served with Lone Star!

Being from Houston we are always ready to try other people's versions of Mexican food.  Our daughter found this place and we decided why not.
On arrival we were quickly seated outside, inside was full. It was a beautiful morning. Our server was full of smiles and great suggestions.

We tried a little bit of everything on the breakfast menu. The donuts are delicious, the chocolate was our favorite. We also tried their version of a kolache ( savory)  it's not a true kolache but it was good.
We also had chips and salsa. The salsa was good but $8 for chips and salsa is really pricey.
My husband had a Bloody Mary, he liked it but it wasn't my cup of tea. My daughter and I had mimosas.
My daughter ordered the papa ranchera taco, her fiancé had bacon /egg and a potato/ egg taco. I had the chorizo/ egg and the barbacoa taco. My husband had the special pork chop huevo rancheros. My barbacoa was very fatty and salty. I asked for limes to try and tame the salt. I really think they should serve it with lime wedges.  
Overall I think it's a good breakfast spot with Texas inspired dishes but in no way I would call it " genuine Texas cooking" .

I made a last-minute reservation here last night, and it was great. The vibe of the restaurant is so southern and cute! My friend and I started with margaritas, which were strong and delicious. We shared the smoked avocado dip, which was a unique take on guac, but I loved it!! I ordered one barbacoa taco and one carne guisada taco, and my friend ordered two barbacoa. The barbacoa was definitely my favorite, and the flour tortillas were to die for! My friend is gluten free, and they were able to accommodate with corn tortillas, which was awesome. Such a great, chill spot for dinner! I will have to come back for brunch!

Solid place! Ordered the Tequila Rose toddy as a drink and then broiled oysters, chips and salsa + vegan queso, shrimp tacos, and barbacoa and chicken tacos for food.

The oysters and chips, salsa, and vegan queso were really good. The Tequila Rose toddy too. I wasn't crazy about the tacos. I'd just stick to all small plates next time.

Will still come back!

NYC's version of tex-mex, and it's of course fantastic!

Really impressed with the cocktail list - way more than margaritas and mojitos. I had the Shift Drink and it was light yet punchy with a hint I smoke - went perfectly with the Smoked Avocado Dip, which was undoubtedly my favorite dish with the sesame crunch and umami depth.  Will be back to eat this dip and try more cocktails.  

Also loved the queso and tomatillo salad - looks like a basic caesar but the tomatillo dressing packs a lot of flavor.  Tried both vegetarian tacos - they were simple but still tasty.  Next time I'll probably stick to the "not tacos" section of the menu unless there are new taco additions.  Loved the Texas sheet cake dessert - perfect sweet ending, the toasted pecans on chocolate cake was perfection!

At$5-7 a pop, the breakfast tacos here are certainly not reminiscent of Texan prices. Neither is the size of each taco which is standard and not particularly overflowing with ingredients.

The most positive aspect of the taco is the flour Tortilla which is chewy and flexible. Rather reminiscent of the typical tex mex taco cabana or pappasito's tortillas.

However the insides are incredibly salty yet somehow simultaneously bland. For a small expensive taco, that's saying a lot.

Another fail for Texans in New York unfortunately who are looking for a little taste of home.

Host was quick, turnover is reasonably fast. Both indoor and outdoor seating although outdoor only has 2 tables.

A whole in the wall type place but the atmosphere feels so authentic and probably one of the best places for tacos in nyc
The bean and cheese tacos are unreal, so simple yet tasty.

The cocktails are average but real ingredients
service was fine, drinks were good, food felt like a lacroix in the way it tasted like a hint of tex-mex--not authentic

A really cool restaurant in this area. A bit funky and a step away from your normal 'tex-mex' spot.

I popped in for lunch the other day and tried their lonestar queso and barbacoa taco.

Firstly, the barbacoa taco is a SLAM DUNK. Absolutely bursting with juices and flavor. You can tell they put the time and effort into coaxing the most out of each bite of that meat. You do only get 1 taco, but these tacos are a bit larger and heartier than most so I think it's worth the price!

The queso was good, but not my favorite. It had more of a velveta taste/texture than I was expecting. I'd also be interested to see if they added a bit more spice to it as it fell a bit flat for me. Chips were good and not too greasy though.

I also ordered their house made grape soda which was a nice treat! It was unique and I really enjoyed that touch.

I noticed that they had quite a few fun/funny options and in reviewing their online presence it looks like Yellow Rose might be more that meets the eye. They have all these fun, creative dishes that I'm adding to my list for the next time I pop in.

Service was absolutely awesome. The bartender was also the server and they were killing service. I didn't see anyone's drink go dry. They were also extremely friendly and informative.

Interior is cute and well thought out.

4.4/5

This review could really just be the quintessential "10/10, no notes--perfect meal." Still, if you're coming here for details, i feel as if I should explicate a bit more...

Now you might have to wait for seating--the took our number and gave us a 90 minute estimate, but it was much shorter--only one drink's worth at a local bar.

Sat at bar and started off with a perfectly crafted cocktail, the Cowboy Line Cook, a wonderfully complex blend of smoky mezcal, spicy poblanos and umami tamarind.

While all the food was excellent, you simply shouldn't miss the creamed spinach and Swiss chard quesadilla if available. What a rich and luxe twist on a traditional quesadilla, all nestled in one of their excellent handmade tortillas. Beef and shredded chicken tacos were on point as well.

Finally, we also ordered the Hot Skillet Cornbread. They advised it was made to order and might take some time, but it was not only worth whatever wait there might be, but it effectively functioned as dessert, and allowed the excuse of another drink pairing with the luscious, moist cornbread subtly dusted with honey and spices.

Delicious place. We ordered several tacos to try. I got the chicken, beef, and potato tacos. Each taco was huge and I could have just ordered two for a meal. I ended up packing some home. The chicken and beef were so moist and fall-apart tender. The only thing that would make them even better is if there were more vegetables  in the tacos as the chicken taco only had meat without other filling in it. Otherwise the food was delicious

Came in with my Texan friend and can safely say she approves of this spot. We started with the margaritas. Can't go wrong with this classic, and their house made tajin was delicious. Has more of a savory (cumin) flavor. We ordered a barbacoa, bean and cheese, and carne guisada taco. My favorite hands down was the barbacoa. I would probably order all barbacoa the next time I come back. We also got the buttermilk chicken salad sandwich. It was amazing! The decor inside is super cute, very eclectic but with a homey feel. The service was great as well. I would definitely come back.

As a Texan, Yellow Rose is a true portal back to Texas with its very unique decor including Whataburger table tents and traditional Tex-Mex menu offerings. The menu reminds me of taco joints back in Texas and has everything you want from a great Tex-Mex spot.

We went for brunch on a Sunday morning and luckily had a reservation because this place fills up quickly. The tacos are flavorful and the flour tortillas had a great texture. The Glazed donut may be the best thing we ate and I may go back just for that. Overall a very solid tacos spot that I will be back to at some point.

Absolutely delicious tex-mex with a fun and bustling atmosphere. My friends and I came by for brunch on a Sunday and this place was packed. I highly recommend having a reservation, our wait time without one was 1.5h but we just ended up drinking at a bar across the street until our table was ready.

All the hype and buzz around this place is true, the bean and cheese taco is the best and most simple thing I have ever had. Everything from the beer queso to the tacos to the pastries and sweets was mouthwatering, I highly recommend trying the daily selection of sweet and savory kolaches. I have a huge sweet tooth and so my absolute favorite thing of our meal was the buttermilk glazed donut. It was soft, and moist with the most perfect balance of sweetness.

Overall fantastic spot and I can't wait to return for those tacos and sweets!

Yellow Rose is just so freaking good. Come for brunch or dinner, does not matter, they have something for everyone. I love their tacos personally, especially the barbicoa, carne guisada, and bean and cheese. I love bringing friends here who have never been because it's always a hit and makes me look like I know a hidden gem. Prices are also very reasonable. One of my favorite spots in the whole city for a casual meal.

Yep! Yellow Rose is excellent Tex-Mex.

I had the little gem salad, cornbread, beef taco, sheet cake, and a cocktail. Try anything! Get a starter, maybe try a main, and always get a taco. Save room for dessert if they didn't already run out.

I sat outside on a pretty cold and rainy night, and the heaters were helpful. Nice staff. Indoors looked nice. I've also gotten delivery and takeout, which came well packaged.

Walked in on a Sunday at dinner time and waited 45 minutes for a table without a reservation. The food was so worth it. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. I wasn't expecting it to be so good. The portions were perfect and each dish had a lot of depth. Even the beer queso had so much going on!

My only gripe is that we sat at the bar and the bartender literally spilled about 4 things on us. One of which was the coke he was actively drinking which spilled into my friends drink. He didn't offer to remake the drink. It was super busy but I've never had that experience sitting at a bar.

An awesomely chill Tex-Mex inspired joint-- and also so much more, when you scratch beneath the surface. With chef and pastry chef both excelling in gonzo-superlative-comfort style (see: Superiority Burger, where the pair used to cook), Yellow Rose serves up deliciousness with a wink of ingenuity, seasonality, and experimentation.

The tacos are great (carne guisada, bean, and breakfast versions, especially), way giant if you're used to Mexican street tacos (careful, it's easy to over-order)-- and wow are these flour tortillas artful compared to what we find in most of NYC. Salads come with a nice chef's flair for texture and surprise. Vegan queso is oddly cravable, even for non-vegans. Consistently funky and fun specials are driven by local or small-producer finds. And the different-each-day baked sweets are thoughtful, often with a cool twist. I recently heard they're making "Not Taco Monday" a weekly occasion for even more freeform dishes, too-- sign me up.

For such a casual overall energy, it's actually a solid move to make a reservation before coming. The wood-paneled room offers amusing touches of personality in details like art, knickknacks on shelves, glassware, etc. Almost fools you into thinking it's a decades-old standby (it's not, though we should be so lucky). Staff is on it. Drinks are good. They clearly know what they wanted to create here. And they nailed it.

Come join me on a TexMex journey at a hole-in-the-wall where your bartender wears a Dale Earnhardt shirt and your kitchen puts Shiner in the queso. This joint was dynamite. From the loaded with cheddar bean and cheese taco to the perfectly crunchy Spanish rice arancini with cashew cream, everything was dreamy. Also loved the shredded chicken verde and the handmade flour tortillas are a nice touch. That queso was fire so please add this to your order. It stayed gooey for the entire meal which is a feat in itself. I also had the house margarita with tequila which was the perfect way to wash the meal down. I highly recommend Yellow Rose!

i would live at this restaurant if i could. Anytime someone is in town I take them here. cutest texan atmosphere and lovely vibes overall i never want to leave. Every item on the menu is great -- get adventurous and try something other than the tacos

- patty melt : 9/10 massive chopped chiles, onions loaded great patty and awesome onion rings
- spanish rice arancini: 9/10 SO GOOD. never had arancini before bc it didn't strike my fancy but decided to try it out and now want it every time i'm there + the crema on the bottom is insane - order this if u want guac but don't want to order guac
- smoked avocado dip: 8/10 if ur looking for guac the avocados are in cubes h ur have an awesome sauce/flavor to them i still recommend
- queso:9/10 solid queso

the poblano chicory salad. i would write a love letter to this. i don't even know the exact name bc it isn't on their menu online but i get it every time i go. sometimes the chicory can be a bit bitter but the deep fried cornbread croutons and pecans make me forget my own name. considered making it my lock screen i'm in love with it so much

go here and check their IG too they are always cooking up something special

Came here for dinner, wanted to like this place really badly after hearing such rave reviews. Maybe the breakfast menu is better, but I was pretty underwhelmed. I'll start with the good stuff first: The skillet cornbread was delicious, made to order fyi so definitely put the order in first. Texas sheet cake was also so good, super moist and not too too sweet which I'm always a fan of. However, the entrees were eh. The quesadilla was alright, the queso to dip in was the best part. Got chips and salsa for the table, salsa was fine but pretty a pretty skimpy amount considering you're paying for it/it's not included. The tacos are pretty pricey going for ~$7 each they are pretty big but nothing crazy, just kind of middle of the road. That being said, would love to give Yellow Rose another try for breakfast and try out more of the menu!

My friend took me here for my birthday, and I loved it so much. It's hard to get a table, but the outside seating is heated and cozy during winter months! Our server knew it was my birthday, so I'm not sure if the praline was for the occasion or normally comes with the drink, but the Rose Toddy was aesthetically adorable and an absolutely delicious cocktail!

Now for the tacos (weekend brunch menu):
- Bean & cheese: 5/5
- Chorizo egg: 4/5
- Papa Ranchera: 3/5

The tortillas are homemade, and make the biggest difference in the world; so tasty & rich! And the salsa that comes with the tacos is absolute perfection. I'm already wanting to go back to try the other tacos that I didn't try!

what we ordered:
beef barbacoa $7  
carne guisada $7  
shredded chicken verde $6  
papas ranchera $5  

overall, really great spot for tex mex food. we got the tacos and none of them disappointed. they were all so juicy and flavorful and comparable to the ones i've had in austin! i definitely need to go back on the weekends to try their breakfast menu as well as their other items that they offer.

This is the spot we loved very non-fussy good food tacos all on flour tortillas just the way Texans like them. Their menu isn't large But enough to satisfy your taco cravings. I'm pretty sure we sampled all of the tacos the cheese and beans, the Carne asada taco, the chicken taco, the potatoes and cheese taco, and the Barbacoa tacos.  
     I definitely enjoyed the Barbacoa taco the best.  The meat was super juicy and flavorful came with fresh cilantro. The chicken taco was probably my least favorite because it was wet. I would have preferred if they strained it or even grilled off some of that extra soupy wetness. Otherwise the service was great. We also had chips and salsa. The salsa was good and spicy and checked all of our boxes. It has a very 70s vibe inside with some very unique Decor.

Yellow Rose has great breakfast tacos, no room for debate I feel. I am not an expert on breakfast tacos, but the tacos served at Yellow Rose really do bring their game.

First off, this place is not super large and pretty popular, so there is usually a wait. You can make reservations which helps, but also coming in a small group or solo means a shorter wait time. Everyone I've interacted with has been super friendly, even when dealing with more prickly dinners.

I love to get the migas taco, and recently became a fan of the potato and egg taco, but the barbacoa taco is the one that keeps me coming back--the meat is so tender and juicy! And don't sleep on the donuts--wow. I like to enjoy my meal with the frozen margarita, which really might be the best frozen marg in the city right now. Love the spicy salt that they use.

Come here for a casual, laidback experience!

Was pretty blown away by this place. Came here today for a breakfast tacos brunch and it did not disappoint. Between two people we ordered:
Bean and cheese taco
Chorizo and egg
Migas
Barbacoa
Carne guisada
Hominy sugar donut
Datterini tomato banana pepper cream cheese kolache (special)

The barbacoa was amazing - slow cooked beef cheeks with avocado were so tender and flavorful.

The carne guisada did not disappoint either - tender chunks of beef, was a comforting stew in a tortilla.

The egg ones (migas and the chorizo & egg) were nice too for breakfast but were overshadowed by the barbacoa and carne guisada.

I don't usually like sugar donuts but the one here was fluffy and addictive. As for the kolache it was an interesting savory danish. Mildly spicy creme cheese with fresh tomatoes. I was way too full at this point to really eat more.

The pickled cherry limeade was so pretty and refreshing. Enjoyed the roasted tomato Bloody Mary too, much more seasoned than a typical Bloody Mary.

The only issue I found is that the bathroom hand soap was not working :/ hopefully the workers are using hand soap in the kitchen...

Need more places like this in nyc!

I grew up in Texas all my life, having spent the past 8 years in Austin, TX hill country. Trust me when I say nothing in the big apple comes remotely close to central TX style tex-mex cuisine. I had heard rumblings that this place was THE place to prove me wrong. Came in on a Sunday morning and while I will agree these are the most authentic hill country style breakfast tacos here in Manhattan, the bar is so low that this place is above average at best. Crazily enough, my favorite thing I had was their doughnut - stuff is pure crack.
Do not leave dinner at Yellow Rose without trying their famous sheet cake, which rotates in flavor daily. The chocolate cake with perfectly caramelized pecans was truly out of this world!

Even if you're only going in for the queso and a margarita, do it. My marg was strong and not too sweet (I got mezcal, mmmmm) and the queso was so addictive I could not stop eating it. The service was great and my bean and cheese taco was also delicious, but full disclosure I did put queso on it because I am a disgusting human being who would be able to drink herself out of a vat of queso. So I can't comment on how the taco would have tasted how it was meant to be eaten

The service was very friendly at the bar and the bartenders are super efficient! When I went there was only one bartender so he was also doubling as service bartender, but I never felt neglected. I went at 6pm on a Friday and did not have a problem getting a seat for one, but your mileage may vary.

Definitely go try yellow rose if you want a delicious intro to texican cuisine.

Yellow Rose is a cute, no frills place with delicious food and nice service. I would recommend this spot if you want something easy and something for everyone without being crazy expensive.

We got a reservation for 2:30 and were so hungry and sat in the back. There was cute decor and it was busy without being loud.

We each got a margarita which was really good but I wouldn't say it was the best I've had.

Vegan Queso and Chips: 5/5
OK. I don't like cheese and am dairy free but we got this as an appetizer and I loved it. It really did taste like cheese without being heavy or greasy and there's a lot of it. I appreciated the jalapenos in it too. The chips were also good restaurant style and salty.

Bean and Cheese Taco: 4/5
So this was exactly what you'd expect, but even better. I actually got this without the cheese and added the vegan queso and even the beans were well seasoned and refried-y, smushy goodness. The tortilla was soft but I was expecting the tortillas to be similar to Cafe Rio if you know what I mean (even more flour-y and doughy) just based on the photos.

Barbacoa Taco: 4/5
I'm fussy with tacos coming from LA, but this didn't disappoint. This was probably my favorite. The tender, juicy and flavorful meat paired well with the onion and cilantro (of course). It is a lot of meat too. I wish that it had a little more going on in the meat seasoning but as I said, this place is more fo a tried and true simple vibe than ultra elaborate.  

Guisado Taco: 4/5
This taco was good and I liked it but I like shredded meat more than chunky meat in my tacos so that's why barbacoa taco takes the W (I'm not a carne asada taco girl). Otherwise, this is basically gets the same consensus of all of the tacos: pretty fucking good. The red sauce reminded me of chile colorado which I loved.

Texas Sheet Cake: 100000/5
I didn't get this when I went to the restaurant but my room mate bought some and brought it home and OH MY GOD. I don't love chocolate cake as much as other flavors but damn this was good. The frosting was quality, the cake was moist, and the pecans were a perfect crunchy contrast. I would come back just for this.

Overall, this place is good and I would recommend it for something easy. I would come back even just for the cake and queso!

Definitely stop by if you're down for something simple and know it will satisfy.

I'm always on the lookout for solid tex-mex and had a few recommendations to try this place. The barbacoa taco is outrageous, by far the standout in the meal. I also thought my michelada was the best I've had in NYC. Egg and chorizo taco was alright, good but not special. The beer queso had excellent flavor but was too watery for my taste. Overall a good spot, but too expensive for what it is but this is New York so what can you do?

Really good place for breakfast tacos. My favorite is the chorizo and egg - I could probably eat 2 or 3 of those and not get tired. They have great doughnuts too, which are huge and enough to share between 2 people. Wash down your tacos and doughnut with a margarita or a glass of natural wine (of which they have plenty of choose from), to round out your meal.

I randomly found this place while looking at fun places to eat around Union square. Yellow Rose had surprisingly great reviews.

I got a mezcal margarita, which wasn't anything special for 16 dollars. It was pretty sad that this place didn't have a happy hour.

I got the beef Barbacoa for 7 dollars. It was saltier than I liked and didn't have much of anything for toppings. I also got the refried beans and cheese which was inedible. I took a bite and couldn't finish the rest.

Aside from the drinks and tacos being on the average side, I witnessed a very awkward encounter. The couple next to us had gotten the wrong plate of 3 tacos but they hadn't noticed and had started eating them. The waiter came to let them know that they got the wrong order. The customers weren't mad about it as only one of the 3 tacos was wrong... but the server took the half eaten tacos away. Even though he did give them the right order, i thought it was odd that he just didn't let them also keep the plate of half eaten tacos already....

This is the only place in NYC where you will find me in sweats (matching Alo set obvi. But still sweats) and paying for my own food...I'm high maintenance and worth it. #feminism #4caratsorhedoesntloveyou

Ok...this queso is on another level, and it's vegan which me from 2016 loves when I did that whole vegan/yoga/men with beards thing...it didn't last and I pray to Gwyneth daily that this queso does. I would do absurdly bad things if the world ran out of this stuff to get more. Like what you ask!?! I'd move to some podunk CT town like New Canaan and pretend to be a good wifey wearing puffy dresses and heels to pick the kids up from country day (I do have the legs for those flare dresses), I'd forfeit European and Colorado ski vacations and go to...eww...Vermont (I don't want to think about this), I'd even consider dating (does 1 date count??) a guy who lives in Murray hill and considers Carl Icahn to be interesting...ugh I hope they never run out.

The tacos are delicious. A Texan explained to me the tortillas are the game changer here, and I agree. She also was wearing a green Loro piana cape so I immediately trusted her judgement. Super hero's and people I aspire to be like wear cashmere capes. I didn't get close enough to feel if it was vicuña but her boyfriend had a 5517 Milsub on (google it you gold diggers) so odds were good. Anywho get all of the tacos. Not a single thing is bad here.

Marg check. Honestly this is a top 5 marg in NYC so by the transitive property the world. They care about the turtles and the frozen version is actually somehow better. This place is either the gateway to heaven or the devil owns it and I accidentally traded my soul for this food, honestly I'm fine with either outcome so long as I can keep going. If I traded my soul I would like to not gain any weight from eating here but I can take that up with the devil next time I see him at Tone House

Came here for a quick bite soon aa we landed. Food was incredible and super accommodating for vegetarians. I didn't love the bean and cheese taco.. A bit too beany for me.  The veggie Taco was super flavorful.
Service was friendly

Very casual place. Sat outside on the patio
Decently priced.

Came here on a Saturday evening and they had an extremely long wait! Thankfully we were willing to sit outside and they were able to clear a table for us. The food overall was average. Probably wouldn't come back here, was an overall fine experience

I wanted to visit this place since I am from San Antonio (which is where the owners are from) and serve traditional Tex-mex cuisines. Everything tasted delicious, the tortilla were almost similar to the traditional style. My only complaint would be their refried beans which my sister and I didn't seem to like.

I'd have to recommend the potato and egg or chorizo tacos. It is recommended to make a reservation but they have some seats at the bar. I wouldn't mind checking out the place again to try something else from the menu!

Wait this place was surprisingly so good. I just moved from Cali so I've been on the hunt for good Mexican food - it doesn't live up to Cali Mexican food, but it definitely has it's own twist/take that made it super enjoyable. I had never heard of bean & cheese tacos - and I LOVE a bean & cheese burrito so this was a must get and it did not disappoint. It was ample-y stuffed; I know it was meant to be in a soft tortilla, but a little crisp would have been fun. The star of the show was the queso dip - it was nothing like a bar/casual tex-mex dip, it was "fancier" + higher quality and was absolutely delicious. The arancini balls were also bomb.com - super flavorful and the perfect amount of fried exterior to interior filling... plus whatever green dip/sauce it was in was 10/10. My friends got steak and chicken tacos and loved them too (v high quality meat). The only thing that didn't live up was the corn bread - it's definitely more of a dessert item, but was just too dry. Was fun/better when dipped in the queso, but would otherwise skip out on it next time. Overall, Yellow Rose is like a "nicer" take on casual tex-mex and I just love what they've done with the menu + food. Would highly recco if you live in NYC!

Oh my God! First hole in the wall place I've discovered in NYC that has phenomenal food. The name of the restaurant immediately sparked my interest and yet, I've always  managed to talk myself out of going in.

They have no indoor seating right now, due to Omicron. Yellow Rose has outside seatings with warmers underneath it. I started with the bean & cheese burrito...where has this burrito been all my life. It's exceptional, phenomenal, succulent, whatever, it's just that damn good. The Spanish Rice Arancini was ok, it was eatable, but I wouldn't ever order this again. I wanted to try their frozen apricot whiskey drink, it it was only a seasonal drink and they took it off their menu.

The prices are incredibly cheap. The waitress had a Miley Cyrus vibe and was very attentive. She told me that they serve donuts on weekends which I'm looking forward to. The food here is not only good because they use fresh ingredients and it's homemade, but, also because they make it with care. It's evident with how delicious their food is!

I'm looking forward to trying their margaritas and donuts the next time I'm in.
Had the shredded chicken verde which was pretty bland and the smoked avocado dip was ok. The "Damn Good Margarita" was pretty good and the highlight of the visit since it was poured in a cute cup.

Can't begin to describe how much I enjoy Yellow Rose. From the service to the interior and of course the food everything is BEYOND. If you haven't tried it yet run don't walk but be sure to make a reservation in advance as the wait can get pretty long.

These are some of the best tacos I've ever had. The tortillas are so soft and delicious and while the tacos may seem simple on the menu, they are packed with flavor! Starting with the cornbread is an absolute must and was one of my favorite parts of the meal. Will be returning to this spot again and again and again!!
The rice balls , barbacoa tacos & rum were delicious. Staff are really friendly. Def a must try.

Portions per taco were suprisingly larger than expected. Beer queso was very good but a small portion. Ambiance is quaint and vibrant. Service was a bit spotty, but we were there close to their afternoon closing time.

Yellow Rose is pretty good but expensive unfortunately. I've been here twice, and the Bean and Cheese / Migas are definitely my go-tos. The Queso is also delicious, but $14 is pretty expensive for a smallish portion. I do wish NYC had more Tex-Mex options, but until then, Yellow Rose definitely satisfied that craving! Definitely need to try the cocktails and desserts here next time.

I  am over the moon for CARNE GUISADA
BEEF SIMMERED IN A DRIED CHILE GRAVY, oh boy is this taco incredibly moist and tender with flavor that brightens my day. I order cheese with it and the price is $7.50 or it was and I had or have no complaints spending it. The Margaritas with the Tajine salted rim is also stellar. They make there own Tajine and with they would package it and sell!
The space is not big, you really need to book or you will be waiting to get seated even at the bar.
It' has a Texas funk atmosphere and good vibes.

This was excellent. First visit, we got the bean & cheese taco plus avocado, the carne guisada taco, the chips with queso, green chili wild boar sandwich, and the pink cake. I'm not normally a queso person but this version was great. The carne taco and the sandwich were both outstanding, and I really liked the bean & cheese as well once it was dipped in salsa. We were disappointed that they didn't have their regular sheet cake, but the pink cake was still great.

Went there recently for my birthday so happy that my husband found the spot. If you want some authentic Japanese Wagyu perfectly selected and cook table side for you this is the spot.
I have to say I also felt very special and intended to buy the service there they're friendly and offer help in choosing the menu and the drinks everything and they do it with a smile .
the vibe with the spot was wonderfully low-key but sophisticated. The price tag is expensive but you're paying for an experience that you can't get many other places. So if you want a memorable night out with some really tasty food stop by here

I've been to Korean bbq, but I think this may have been my first Japanese bbq (yakiniku) experience. Our friends made the reservation and I, generally not an eater of red meat, didn't quite realize just how beef-centric the menu would be. Still, per my review, you can still find a lot to appreciate here even if you can't tell your sirloins from your prime ribs.

I keep going back and forth over which I liked more: the Berkshire Pork Sausage or the Jidori Chicken. The sausage was smoky, salty, and just perfect. The chicken was marinated in a sweet, spicy glaze and grilled up so well. My beef-eating friends enjoyed their ribeye and tenderloin cuts.

We also tried various other items on the menu:
-I had the Late Blossom cocktail (sake, lime, lychee, jasmine, Angostura). It was good: fruity, slightly floral, and sweet, but not saccharine.
-To kick off our meal, we did a little shrimp cheers with the Shrimp, Quail Egg, and Shiso appetizer (served together on a skewer). It was delicious and had a soft sweetness to it, almost like honey walnut shrimp.
-The truffle fries were a satisfying appetizer and not too heavy on the truffle oil. No notes.
-You'll definitely want to get a rice or noodle to pair with your grilled items, and the hot stone garlic rice is a great choice. You can let it crisp up by allowing it to sit for a while the bowl it is served in.
-The vegetables (asparagus, mushroom, onion) were a good accompaniment, although I didn't think the mushrooms - which I typically love - were very exciting when grillled. They, along with the rest of the dishes, benefited from the complimentary sauces.
-The cauliflower is a rare dish here that came out pre-cooked, as it was prepared tempura-style. It was well-seasoned, but a little salty for me.

Service was pleasant and generally efficient but occasionally it took too long for an ordered item to arrive.

If you're looking to splurge your wallet on one of the best quality A5 Japanese wagyu in NYC, Yakiniku is the spot! This was highly recommended by a colleague of mine and I'm glad I took his word for it. For a party of 3, we went a little overboard I must say haha but no regrets because the first bite of wagyu will send you straight to heaven and back. The quality was superb and beef literally melts in your mouth like butter. My favorite was definitely the 10-sec beef where the server lightly grills the beef and coats it with egg wash *chefs kiss* TREASURE BOX IS A MUST.

I'm not a wagyu enthusiast or anything because it does get pretty heavy after a while... but no worries just to chase it down with some matcha tiramisu :)

Came here during restaurant week this year with my boyfriend and we ordered the:

- Egg soup
- Option 1 (harami, pork kalbi)
- Option 2 (short rib, jidori chicken)
- Garlic rice
- Dessert (matcha tiramisu)

If you've never been to KBBQ or JBBQ, be prepared as you will be grilling your own meat at your table. One thing to note - strangely, we had to ask for the restaurant week menu when we came here (usually restaurants will give this to you alongside their regular menu).

Other than that, everything was pretty tasty but the standout by far was their garlic rice. My boyfriend and I inhaled this as soon as it came to our table - would absolutely recommend adding this to your order. Portions for the meat are certainly on the lighter side (I think it was about 3 pieces per meat) but considering it was $30 per person, definitely worth it.

Staff was pleasant and quick with our orders. Unsure if I would come here any time soon to try their regular menu considering their prices but would be open to it.

BESTTT MEAT PLACE EVERRR! I came here precovid for Valentine's Day and it was amazing. We also preordered the limited edition hamideru kalbi which was heavenly. It was a prefix course and they started us off with a glass of champagne. They also have these little clear bags where you can place your cellphone in. Customer service was excellent here because they explained all the meats and cooked it for us. Wagyu was melting in my mouth and it was bite after bite of deliciousness. They also have real wasabi and it was a perfect pairing with the Uni. The hamideru kalbi came out on an beautiful tray with some dry ice and presention was A+! The meal was pricy though but so worth for all the meat and the cold soba noodles here were the best! Still thinking about this meal every now and then because of how phenomenal it

We (group of 3) came here to eat some high-quality Wagyu and were not disappointed. The interior design and lighting gives a relaxing dinner atmosphere.

We had the pre-fixed menu ($155 each with beef tongue replaced with Black Wagyu Kalbi), Wagyu Treasure Box ($200), Black Wagyu Kalbi ("seconds", $70), and another steak ($29). The drinks Tokyo Whiskey and mocktail were about $17 each.

The Wagyu tasted delicious and we couldn't help but order seconds without paying much attention to the price (bad for the wallet but good for the soul).

Waiter was also friendly, attentive, and had interesting traveling stories.

Recommend 5/5, hope I can try this again in Japan!

My fave jbbq in Manhattan! Meat is always so tender and juicy

It's my 3rd time here and hasn't missed yet.

It's winter restaurant wk now so be sure to ask for their restaurant wk menu because they are super low key

Really tasty! Got the $130 prefix and loved all the meats and other dishes except for the tenderloin. Also enjoyed the mojito. A little expensive but friendly service and great food. Will definitely be back again!

Upscale Japanese Korean take on BBQ. Yakiniku Futago takes the best of both worlds in the land of BBQ and delivers. There is a delicate touch of fresh ingredients and marination. The food overall is mouth watering paired with good service. At a higher price-point, it is a good level up from your classic Japanese or Korean BBQ restaurants. A big recommendation for those who are craving BBQ and have the wallet for it too!

Taste: 5/5
Ambience: 4/5
Value for Money: 3.5/5
Service: 4/5

To get the most out of the experience, we got the "pre-fixed menu", It had:

1) Assorted Namul
2) Assort Kimchi
3) Assorted Wagyu sushi
4) shrimp skewer
5) side salad
6) prime short rib - amazing but a bit high on marination
7) prime skirt steak - great
8) tenderloin
9) Beef tongue - chewy goodness!
10) Sanchou wrap
11) garlic rice - we upgraded with additional $5 to Bibimbap!
12) gold rush - a lot!
13) matcha rush - like a Bingsu!

The must have on the side: Special Uni Wagyu Ju! This item is a godsend and makes good use of umami flavours!

All in all, a big recommendation!

Even though this was a Japanese steakhouse, felt like Korean bbq with some of the side dishes and garnishes.
They definitely pushed the top tier meats aka the "treasure box"
I can see this place being a good stop for work dinners or tourists
The surprising dish of the night was the Japanese cold ramen- so tasty!! Esp with the vinegar
We also enjoyed the shaved ice dessert

Always great wagyu beef offerings, tender and rich

Hot stone bowl garlic rice savory and hot

Lots of sake to choose from

Specials desserts for the golden chops stick club members.

The most amazing wagyu steak from Japan that I've ever had. It literally melted in my mouth. This restaurant is owned by two Korean brothers who were raised in Japan. So the restaurant is a perfect combination of Korea meets Japan. Their portions of side dishes like kimchi and radish kimchi are not free unlike at Korean establishments. You have to pay for it. Which is why I have this place a 4 star instead of 5. The food alone was great but very very expensive because we ordered wagyu but there are other things there. This place is a hidden gem. From outside I didn't know there was a restaurant in the back. I always thought this was a sake bar. Totally worth trying. Service was excellent. Ambiance is very cause

After trying out Yakiniku Toraji, I have been on the search and craving for my Japanese bbq places in NY. After thorough research, I stumbled upon Yakiniku Futago. What initially drew my eye was their prefix, so I decided to try it out for lunch. Upon walking in, I did like the darker, yet alluring interior; however, I was a bit surprised by the minimal attendees despite it being a Saturday (I think I found out why).

After being seated, I was ready for the $125 prefix, but to my disappointment, they do not serve the prefix despite it being on the menu. They also have a lunch menu on their website which they did not provide (for the record, both menus are glitchy on their website). For me, that was a point off in my head because of the high price tag, I somewhat expect attention to detail. Instead, they highly encouraged their treasure box, but I wasn't ready to pull the trigger because it didn't offer anything else besides the wagyu for $200. As a result, my partner and I decided for A La Carte and ended up getting a lot than I first expected.

Unfortunately I didn't take pictures but here are my thoughts:

Lightly seared Wagyu, Zuni & Shiso: (5/5) and excellent and delicate bite. The wagyu was cooked perfectly and the uni was absolutely delicious. I will note, their uni is probably one of the freshest I've had. Not gassy or fishy, very creamy and a little sweet. I was impressed.

Thick cut tenderloin steak: (4/5) pretty standard tenderloin, a little on the chewy side, but I expected that.

Assorted Namul: standard prepared namul, nothing special to note.

Grilled Oysters and Mushrooms, soy butter: (4.5/5) very well seasoned and aromatic.

Wagyu Sushi Assortment: (5/5) I was caught by surprise. The wagyu they chose was pretty high quality and they didn't "cook" it like you normally would. It was a beautiful texture and it was delicious.

Bone Marrow Spicy Soup: (5/5) this was excellent. Very flavorful from the bone marrow and also very balanced. The heat or the savory flavors were not over powering. I would say this serves 3-4 small bowls.

Hot Stone Garlic Rice: (4/5) I was wondering how garlic rice could cost $18, so I had to try. Honestly, it was good, but not $18 good. The server cooked the rice pretty good. Crispy on the bottom and cooked thoroughly. Definitely complements the meat so I would encourage you get it with the prefix. Crispy garlic rice, can't go wrong.

Japanese Cold Noodles: (3.5/5) a pretty small portion, but a decent way to end the meal.

One last thing, service was excellent. I forgot our Japanese server's name, but he was very attentive, confident in his cooking, was very calm especially with both eyes on him cooking wagyu, pretty knowledgeable around the menu, and very polite. 10/10 I praise the our service.

Overall, Yakiniku Futago has pretty good quality wagyu, but it is on the pricier side. I got more meat for maybe 2/3 of the price at Toraji. Maybe it would have been worth it if we got the prefix (Lesson learned, don't go for lunch unless your goal is the Treasure box). I believe my bill for 2 people came out to $325 before tax and tip. If you're thinking about this place for a special occasion, I would suggest only the prefix because that's a full meal, the treasure box is only the slab of wagyu for $200. Personally, I need vegetables, a soup, some carbs, and maybe a dessert. There is a wow factor, but for 2 people, I'm not sure if it will fill you after peering at an adjacent table.

What an experience! Amazing Japanese bbq, attentive service and everyone was accommodating.

My friend recommended this place since it was my first time in New York. Definitely on the bougie and expensive side but everything was so good. How can you not love uni and wagyu?

We also got the gomashio cabbage and that was so good if you love goma sauce and fiber (unfortunately did not take an image of that dish)

Treasure box A5 wagyu was a fun surprise! Came out of a literal treasure box and each piece of the wagyu was so good -- bonus points to the server who cooked it for us to perfection (medium rare or bust)

Bone marrow spicy soup was good! It was spicy so if you want more of the flavor, maybe go with the non spicy option.

Wagyu Uni Ju is expensive cause of all the Japanese Bafun uni on top of the wagyu and rice.

Shoutout to the bartender for giving us henny shots even though they didn't sell shots  but they did charge for chase.

If it's you haven't gone yet, I recommend trying at least once! They'll also give you a stamp card and if you come 10 times per person, you'll get special perks

We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. The quality of meat was good as usual.  I usually ordered a wagyu box but this time we decided to order meat on the regular menu. The staff was friendly and courteous.  However, the service was not as expected.  I ordered a second drink three times and it only arrived toward the end of the meal. And we were charged for three drinks. The wait staff did apologized and corrected the check.  If it was not for that, this is definitely a five stars restaurant.  

Unexpected surprise:
I am normally not a mojito drinker but I really enjoyed it. The shiso leaves really made the taste extra drink.  

The grilled shrimp was also a surprise for me. I didn't expect it to be so juicy and flavorful. Most grilled shrimp I ate before were tough and overcooked.  I had low expectation when my friend suggested it.

It's definitely my favorite Japanese barbecue in the city. I came here probably like 3 times and the quality of the meat just never let me down.
When my friends and I came here the first time we tried the Treasure Box with A5 Chateaubriand Steak. It's worth a try because of the look and the taste.
I also tried the uni wagyu ju and wagyu toro sushi. The wagyu is so tender and I can easily split it with spoon and it just melted in my mouth (wish there's more uni!)
One of the best meals I've had- highly recommend. The Wagyu was melt in your mouth, first time trying it and glad I did despite the high price point. A meal I'll never forget

Came for restaurant week dinner. They don't bring the restaurant week menu to the table, we had to ask for it, but no big deal.

For restaurant week, they bring a series of small plates to the table (green salad, one piece of sushi, shrimp skewer, two shishito peppers, and a plate for the table with different veggies (pickled carrots/radish, spinach, bean sprouts, spciy kimchi radish) for starters and you just have to select which 3 proteins you want. They offer 3 possible options and you pick between choice 1, 2 or 3 (choice 3 had a surcharge as it had higher end cuts). Choice 1 and 2 each have the same two cuts of beef, the difference is choice 1 has spicy pork whereas choice 2 has chicken. Lastly you pick your rice, white or garlic (+$5) and they bring you dessert. For dessert they bring you corn tea (caffeine free and enjoyable) and tiramisu. The dessert was delicious, but it was not tiramisu. It was a white fluffy cream that tasted like tiramisu with matcha powder on top.

Overall it was a very nice meal, though the restaurant was very busy so service was a bit slow, but nothing egregious. You cook your own meat and for the restaurant week price, the amount of food you get is pretty decent. The two cuts of beef were very good, but the spicy pork was my favorite. I would definitely recommend the garlic rice (tastes like garlic fried rice) and caution that if you order the chicken, it does take awhile to cook. I would definitely recommend coming here for restaurant week.

Scammy place! They trick you with Alcohol price! We asked the sommelier to recommend a sake, he pointed a $98 bottle and I said yes. Then the bill came out they charged us $195 for the bottle which is the price for a very similar bottle but higher end. I wrote to the management and got no reply at all. Extremely irresponsible!
Otherwise, the food is just ok, overpriced in general. The service is slow, subpar compare to other Korean bbq places at this price point.

Went for restaurant week lunch and wow it was delicious! I was very satisfied with the egg drop soup. You could smell and taste the beef broth. All the meats were so perfectly marinated. I did use some of the soy sauces but I would have been ok without them. It was perfect with the rice. The soy sauces were very good too. Everything came out quick and they gave us instructions on how to cook each meat. My most favorite was definitely the wagyu. The fatty tenderness just melts in your mouth mmm. They brought us matcha tiramisu. It wasn't tiramisu but it was still good. It's more like a matcha pudding to me.

Everything here is quite expensive, but the quality of the meat is worth it. Once you order your meats, they tell you how long you should cook each side. We got our phones out and just timed each side that was on the grill. The wagyu was my personal favorite because it was so soft that it melted in my mouth. It was so flavorful and just delicious. The service here was amazing as well, they tend to you and make sure you have a great dining experience.

Service: 5/5

Tip(s):
- Use your phone to time how long to heat the meat

Yoooo, A5 meat and goodies. Can't honestly beat the best. Amazing service, perfectly accommodating everything. Alcohol section is great. Presentation to die for. Honestly if I were to get some good fire meat this place would now be my good too. If you're ready to spend the big $$$ then this place is it. Date, celebration, party you and it and they got it. They perfectly explain the whole meat and literally can't get better cause they know the greatness of an A5 beauty. Flavor is perfectly delicate and cook to your liking. Damn if I say dream piece of meat here. Deadass ordered all the cuts and the waiter didn't know what to say or had to ask us how was the steak because we got all of it, of course it going to be amazing. Appetizers are to die for too so don't skip out on it. Atmosphere is nice and pictures don't do it justice by how the food is. 1477372949/10 going again cause damn food kicking

Yakiniku Futago is an upscale Japanese steakhouse with a bar. Reservations are recommended since it is a small restaurant, table seating with barbecue grills. Recommended for couples and small group gatherings. For a party of 4, $600 was a four course meal with a selection of 4 meats including wagyu.

Recommends: Lychee Beer (Japanese rice lager Asahi beer with syrup), Treasure Box ($195), Special Wagyu ($110)

Meh: Truffle fries (too soft and no truffle flavor), Gold Rush, Matcha Rush (we did not like the shaved ice which was kind of tasteless)

I made reservations for this place a month ahead just in case because I heard it was hard to get a reservation. The night before the dinner, the host called me and said that the menu was going to change for Mother's Day. They said they were going to email me the menu since it's going to be modified and usually I have bad experiences. They didn't not email or text after calling them again and telling me that they were going to send it. Luckily I went on Instagram on their page to find the Mother's Day menu. So that's why I took off a star because of the service received before even having dinner at the restaurant.

Upon arrival, the host then asked if we wanted to see the menu. I told the host about what happened of not receiving the menu beforehand when i spoke to them 3 times.

Although The Mother's Day menu did not disappoint. My favorites are: -A5 wagyu sushi assortment
-kalbi
-A5 wagyu ribeye

My only problem is that my party had sesame allergies, so if you're allergic please tell them beforehand when you reserve because they marinate in sesame and some appetizers has sesame seeds like the wagyu assortment and another one.

They asked if we had any allergies and I told them sesame. Some appetizers they already pre set for the dinner and couldn't make another set without sesame for some appetizers which is a disappointment since we are already paying $145 per person. So one person in my party did not eat some appetizers and felt bad.

We also ordered : -oysters w/ mushroom
-gold rush

Everything was good just the sesame, and the service before dinner was my problem. Other then that i would've rate the food itself 4/5! The wagyu is so good. I would want to go back and try the treasure box but indecisive if i want to go back.

It's pretty pricey for a party of 4 it was over $800 but don't mind if its a great meal with great company.

I recently visited Tokyo and had Japanese BBQ there with the best Wagyu. My dad was not with me during that trip but I was hoping to find a place to visit with him here in NYC with similar quality Wagyu. Yes the prices are pretty high BUT the quality of the meat was insane. When they say melt in your mouth, it's definitely melt in your mouth. This is a place I would definitely visit again but only for a special occasion. Our waitress was so good and patient. She gladly answered any questions we had and took the time to thoroughly explain the differences between the meats on the menu. My dad and I split an order of skirt steak and the Wagyu treasure box and I was stuffed after that. Sometimes it is easy to order more than you think you can actually eat so I would recommend starting with ordering 1-2 items and then order more for the table if needed afterwards. I mean this from the bottom of my heart- please try this place out but beware of the high price. I've eaten at a lot of nice restaurants in my life but I think this was the most expensive restaurant I've eaten at ever. Just to give you an idea the 2 meats, 2 sodas, and 2 orders of white rice was around $300 before tip. If are looking for a nice treat for dinner definitely go check this place out.

Amazing experience. First time having A5 wagyu in nyc and it was worth it. We got treasure box #3 that came with 3 different cuts. My favorite was definite the ribeye, melts in your mouth. Also ordered the shrimp on skewer, garlic fried rice (sooo garlicky and delicious) and extra order of sirloin and vegetables for the bbq. Ended dinner with matcha tiramisu. Everything was delicious and service was excellent
Wagyu sushi's we're amazing. And any wagyu order for grilling was melting in my mouth.

Would give 3.5 stars if it were an option.

Went during restaurant week. The meat is good quality and tender. However, it took a while to get our cocktails. The waiter and waitress even started cleaning the table, taking away the dipping sauce while I still had a piece of meat on my chopsticks.

This is my second time coming here and the food and service never disappoints. It is truly an authentic Japanese BQQ spot.

I highly recommend getting the Garlic Fried Rice, Treasure Box, Tenderloin Steak, 10-sec Wagyu Sirloin and Hamideru Kalbi.

For drinks I suggest  the Dassai 39 and Yuzu Martini. The Dassai was fruity and not too strong. It paired well with the meat.

Our server Jay was the best and grilled our meat perfectly. He also recommended several of our dishes that we loved.

Although the restaurant is quite expensive, it is well worth the treat. I would definitely come back!

delicious wagyu , we try treasure box the meat is beautiful with special sauce, melted in your mouth, the waitress is very professional recommend food all very yummy ! The restaurant design is simple but elegant, very good business full house !
I don't think it's necessarily worth the price but flavours of the meat are great. We did the $60 restaurant week menu and got appetizers, meat, and dessert.

We came from long island to the City just want to have wagu tonight, and the service is trash. He does not want to serve us, he was joking around with next table, and share our treasure box without asking our permission. Food is terrible, I only taste salty than anything, my mouth is salty even 3hours later. Nothing worth anything, uni was not sweet at all, wague only salty and greasy taste, I paid $350 for this 6 piece wague and the whole dinner, not even full. Totally NOT recommended.

I've had this place on my list for a long time but it disappointed me quite a lot when I was finally able to secure a weekend dinner seat and went in. Like other BBQ places, the noise level in this place was also very high. We ordered the treasure box wagyu, which was one of the most expensive dishes on their menu - with very high expectation, the meat was brought out by the server extremely slow and late - we waited at least 25 min to just see this raw piece of meat lying within the "treasure box" coming out. We were starving and finally watched someone help us cook it, cut it, and finally we ate it. The quality of the beef was good but not impressive. Then we waited another 15 min till other stuff (i.e. garlic rice) came out. In totality we spent one hour and half only to eat not-that-many dishes we ordered. Oh yes we paid a huge bill - cuz you all know this place is quite expensive. The only one thing I do like them about is the decor of the restaurant itself. They had very interesting wall decors and ppl's handwriting wishes which was quite fun to read while waiting for our food.

Came here before, but comparing to today, I can feel everything have been worse than before. Not to the point that I hate it, but kind of regret coming. We have two A5 Wagyu Toro Sushi, one came up cooked and the other one is raw.....like? Hello? Also, the meat does not look fresh. Are you giving me something that was a leftover from others?

The service is emmmmmmm, I didn't order the treasure box or any thing that is in red that the servers will grill it for me. But.... It is so hard to get their attention until they giving us the check. Water was not refilled when it's empty, there were multiple servers there but when I want to get their attention for anything that I need with my dinner, they all tried to pretend they didn't see me. Only one tall guy server seem to be happy working there, and the others attitude were like I owe them so much money. Usually with services like this, I'm going tip less than 10% because I'm here to enjoy my food and I'm not here for your attitude. However I still tip above what the suggested amount. My friends was not happy about the service, and I tried to explain that let's separate the food and the service, and enjoy the food. However, the food was so disappointing when we tried it and I regret taking my friends here. I was telling them how amazing this place is and how much I love it. The meat was not good, sooooo different from before.

Excellent service!!! Excellent quality of wagyu meat! Garlic rice was so good! The corn and mushrooms were good! The wagyu sushi trio was amazing! I love the trout caviar on one of them. Really good!
Beautiful ambiance!

Started with the assorted wagyu sushi... all the prices were just sensational... bite sized explosion of savoriness.

Treasure box came out... such an instagramable moment with the meat appear out of the mist of the box. The server will cook it medium rare for you, which I think is perfect, but if you need it cooked a little more, you can always throw it back on the grill yourself.

Last came the uni wagyu ju... the rice, uni, wagyu came together so well, especially with the hint of wasabi.

We ordered all three for two, which was a lot of food (two orders of the wagyu sushi... so we didn't have to share the pieces). If you are coming here for date night, maybe just share one order of the wagyu sushi.

Usually not a fan of cooking my own food but this place is fun. Went for restaurant week, a great deal for two people. The meat was delicious! You do feel a bit rushed as everything comes very quickly.

Came here with my friends for restaurant week lunch at 12PM on 1/29/23. Appetizers have salad, egg soup and kimchi. For main course I chose A5 Wagyu by +25, wagyu tasted delicious. The dessert also tasted yummy. A beautiful lady (Katie K.) cooked Wagyu and other meats for us, she is very nice and we appreciated her great service. Overall, high quality food with excellent service.

Peter Luger has the best aged American steak, but there is no substitude for A5 Wagyu yakiniku style.  We decided to splurge, again.

We settled for 250 gm (8.8 oz) of imported A5 Wagyu sirloin, soup, seaweed appetizer & more meat in the form of Kalbi.

The A5 wagyu was brought out in the mythical  iced  "treasure box", as the fog dissipated like my $165 the marbled beauty was revealed in its full glories.  The waiter fired up the grill & seared the meat on both sides briefly before serving.  We had A5 at least 10 times already so the shock value is no longer there, but it was still wonderful.  They provided dipping sauce (ponzu & some sweet sauce) along with a plate of freshly grated creamy wasabi.  Believe me, no sauces are needed!  

The sirloin was brought out next which was a huge mistake in terms of serving sequence.  It tasted like cheap dry beef compared to A5.  The bone marrow vegetable soup had really good umami, the yakinori seaweed was oily, crunch & tasty.  

$232 for 4 items is not cheap, the A5 is prob twice the price compared to Japan.  But we liked the upscale ambiance, the vibe & the service.  If only they use charcoal instead of electric grill...

The dinner went very nicely. Food was great. But everything was ruin by one very rude reception--we have already gave our credit cards for the check when this grumpy receptionist walked over to tell us in a very rude manner that "the next reservation is waiting". She didn't even apologize after we told her we are waiting for our credit card to come back. She just looked pissed and walked away. Very rude. She completely ruined the nice dinner experience.

We booked this restaurant for my birthday dinner to try out their treasure box with A5 Wagyu. They'll give you 3 different options for treasure box and we picked the one with 3 different cuts. The meat was definitely fresh and tender, presentation was on top for the box. We paired it with the cold noodle, mix with vinegar so it was even more refreshing after every bite. Their staff will be grilling it for you to make sure that your meat is grilled properly. I was just disappointed a bit since we didn't have any birthday dessert as we usually have in the other restaurants, especially when I booked it, I did mention that it's for my birthday. Not a big thing but it made us feel like they don't care that much, compared to other Michelin star restaurant we went to the day before, they gave us the surprise birthday dessert even when it was not the date yet.
Relatively upscale restaurant that serves high quality meat! Service was great and staff were friendly.

Service = Ace
Quality of meats = Ace
Decor = Ace

Our absolute favourite dish was a part of the treasure box - top sirloin!

Personally, I prefer to taste the meats before using any sauces and it was perfectly cooked & seasoned.

Must and will return!

We arrived with our reservation at 9pm and the restaurant was not crowded. The service was extremely horrible and unprofessional. No one came to the table for over 20 minutes, and restaurant close at 10pm. It makes us extremely uncomfortable and rushed. The whole dinning experience was substandard. The food was decent. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone because service was definitely a big part of dining experience.
Very delicious and authentic Japanese-styles barbecue (yaki-niku). The waiter and waitresses were friendly.

So much fun and the food is insanely good. We had an awkwardly long wait despite a reservation and we waited at the bar but the bartender never acknowledged us, so service was iffy but over all would go back for how good the food is

Not bad. Typical selections and can't really say any of the selections are better than other yakiniku spots. Having said that what did lack was the service. It is s...l...o...w...

But I'll go again for some select cuts like thick tongue and pork neck  for those of you know BBQ, the prices for those cuts are pretty decent for NY. The other cuts? Not so much. Those are for tourists and the uninitiated.

Came here to celebrate a birthday and loved it. The slices of meet were really good, especially their A5 sushi. The dessert was lowkey my favorite part of the night - the original gold rush I would have purchased more if I could. The ambience is also nice as there is plenty of seating that is spread out.

Went to this highly rated spot for valentines day and had such a good time.

The indoor area was well decorated but they have limited seating. We ended up dining in their outdoor dining area, which was frezing despite the heaters and hand warmers the restaurant gave us free of charge. I wouldn't recommend dining outside if it's under 40 degrees outside. Poor dude cooking our food didn't even have a jacket and was freezing his butt off (what a champ).

We got a shrimp skewer app and the assorted namul and assorted kimchi to help cut the fat of our Main course. For wagyu, we got the treasure Box of assorted cuts: sirloin, filet, and ribeye. My girlfriend and I were still hungry after that and decided to get an order of the harami steak as well, and it ended up being our favorite. For dessert, we got the matcha tiramisu which is so DIE FOR. It's so creamy and resembles milk pudding from Japan.

Would definitely come here again for a special occasion.

I came here for my anniversary with my bf as a special treat, and we were both blown away how tasty the wagyu was. I've had a lot of wagyu after living in Asia and the flavoring was really delicious/comparable! Overall, I was extremely impressed.

Food: Ordered futago choregi salad, treasure box A5 wagyu sirloin, bone marrow spicy soup, thick cut beef tounge, and assorted vegetables.
The salad was AMAZING, flavor was unique with a light seaweed taste, and it was a great start to a fatty delicious meal. The treasure box sirloin had the most sensual and flavorful taste out of the meal! The bone marrow soup was equally delicious, spicy, and hearty. The beef tounge was good, but I think I'll go back to try the uni wagyu instead since it was all sold out when I arrived.

Drinks: Ordered a yuzu beer, whisky sour, and negroni. Out of all the drinks we ordered I really liked the yuzu beer because I don't know how to appreciate alcohol and enjoy anything sweet without the taste of alcohol.

Ambiance: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Covid clean: 5/5
Overall: 5:5

Loved the female worker assisting me. I came here for a late afternoon snack on Sunday 10/15 and didn't know what to get cause I wanted everything. The staff had blackish grayish hair(it was very pretty) and she described to me what each riceball tasted like patiently. Like I had a million questions which was annoying but she answered each one of them with a smile and very detailed. She even gave me recommendations from what I told her I was craving. I also was looking to get a tea but didn't want caffeine, but didn't know what their herbal teas tasted like and she was also able to  describe each of the teas so that I could understand them clearly. There were a few customers in the store, so I expected a wait time, but her service was quick. The drinks were coming out one after the other. I will be coming back because of the female staff that assisted me. The food was amazing, props to the staff recommending me to get a spicy mayo to bring out the flavors of the riceball.

Came here with some friends on Sunday around noon. The boba shop is small and built for pickup, there's no seating at all. They have 2 kiosks for ordering and when we went there were very few people.

I got the Kawaii Smile (Mango Lychee Passionfruit White Tea) with Yogurt Popping boba. The drink was very good, and I liked the combination of mango and lychee. I should've gotten 50% sugar but it still was very tasty. However, almost all of the boba was pre-popped! There were only ~5 non-popped popping bobas, the rest of the boba was just the flavorless shell part. Maybe I should've gotten a more popular topping but this is the first time I've ever seen this happen.

I've been to a YaYa Tea a while back in Chinatown and it was pretty good. Recently, I've been craving fruity teas & just so happens I was around 23rd street and learned there was a YaYaTea up here too! Such a convenient location near Baruch & many other schools & businesses. I ordered the boyfriend, which is lychee, mango, white tea, with mango jelly. It was so cute with the star shaped jellies & the quotes around the cup. This boyfriend was more tasty than my husband ( ;P haha don't tell him) with the jellies at just the right texture. Will definitely come again!

This is the first time going to this yaya tea location. I had wanted an onigiri for some time. I also got a bubble tea. The cashier lady was very nice and helpful. I ordered several onigiris. I ordered 2 chicken 2 salmon 1 crab meat 1 spam and 1shumai. The bubble tea was also one of their most popular flavors and i can see why.
The onigiris were really good too. Though i got 2 span and 0 shumai instead. This was a little upsetting to find but not a big deal since it was a small issue. Though it was labeled as a shumai onigiri and not a spam onigiri.
Overall all the other ones all tasted delicious and i have to return to one soon.

Always opting for Oolong Milk Tea I must say Yaya  could be up there with the best. Adding tapioca, 75% sugar was the perfect combination and I appreciate the fact there was ice but not too much. Although there were 10+ people in the small storefront you can ether order at the front or at the kiosk and it went by fairly quickly. It was hard not to get a snack with tea but I definitely will next time.
Very poor service, did not confirm the order of the front desk staff, I got the wrong order, very disappointed!

It seems every tea shop has different offerings of drinks and I go to each for one thing only. At YaYa, I can make a drink I call "Mango Dream" which is their white tea with mango, but I add mango bubbles and mango stars (little pieces of mango in star shape). It puts me in mango heaven every time!!

Hot Thai Milk Tea: comforting drink for a cold day.

This is a cute Yaya Tea with the usual tea options and some food options. I've had the rice balls in the past and they're decent, nice for a snack or meal (depending on the size and your appetite).

The interior is really cute. There is no indoor dining, but they still take the time to put up nice seasonal decorations and some inspirational wall art. There's also a few racks with packaged snacks and knick knacks for sale. Overall, a very tidy and adorable shop.

It wasn't busy, so I was able to order immediately. There are also signs hung up reminding you that you can order online, in case you don't want to wait in a line or if you just don't feel like human interaction.

I got a hot Thai milk tea. It came out quickly and the worker was nice to remind me to be careful about the heat. The cup had a floral decoration on it, which I wouldn't mind buying on a reusable cup.

The tea itself is sweet and creamy. There's a little bit of aftertaste, maybe from the dairy being heated? I didn't think it was bad but just unexpected

I ordered ahead via Ritual so the order was ready by the time I arrived.

The onigiri (rice balls) was good. I ordered the Salmon one as well as the spam one. They were both freshly made as it was still nice and warm.

I also ordered bubble teas - jasmine milk tea and taro milk tea. Enjoyed both and the tapioca bubbles tasted nice and fresh too.

Drink trays are only given when you buy 4 drinks. I had only bought 2 drinks which made it pretty hard to juggle with a stroller in tow.
Very bad tea. No flavor. $9 down the drain. Literally threw it away after tasting it.

LOVE the vegan rice balls!!! They are my absolute favorite! Usually you'll experience about 15 minutes wait for your order because the place is usually really busy. The bubble tea is amazing as well. I recommend Okinawa and Taro!

Lots of good unigiri options and taste very authentic. I had the tuna, salmon and the fried chicken. The flavors were pretty good but not the best I've ever had so that's why they got 4 stars. It's a great option to have in the neighborhood and will definitely go back!!

The store is small and cute. It has a bunch of different Asian snacks. I ordered the octopus balls and a shrimp tempura rice ball. The shrimp tempura rice ball was super tasty, but the octopus balls were disappointing. They were too soggy and mushy.

The Boyfriend( mango+lychee) fruit tea was so good. I got mango star & popping lychee as toppings.

The Takoyaki was really good too. The sauce that came with it was good. I love Bonito flakes & Takoyaki in general. Just the right amount of salt, saucy & just pure goodness.

This place can get really busy, but the girls that work there are really fast. Eating area is outside. Pretty spacious. The outside eating area is shared with the bar next door, but hardly any bar patrons sit there. Best riceball spot ever! Definitely recommend getting the sauce on the side.
I just like that place. My favorite boba in the area. I like fried rice balls. The service is great. I would recommend at least to try if you doubt it.
