Discover this spot from buddy who discovered it from his 10 yr old.  Make pretty good  onigiri balls. Tea wasn't overly sugary either. Got the Chrysanthemum tea with honey. Might feel strange on occasion as it's usually full of teen girls.

If you're craving onigiri, this is the spot! I ordered a chicken onigiri, shrimp tempura onigiri, and the Japanese onigiri. I love how each one is wrapped so that the seaweed stays crunchy, and the food was still warm after both transport and sitting out for a while. Each one was around $3 for the small size, which is a lot more food than it looks like for such a good price. The fillings were generous and tasty. The service is quick and the food is great and affordable. Highly recommend!

Came in today because I was craving bubble tea after a long morning of work. Ordered an iced matcha with 25% sweetness and aloe.

Unfortunately I didn't like their matcha :( it was grainy. Will I come back? Yes-- but to try something else other than matcha.

**they put a cute inspiring quote on the bottom of every drink that put a smile on my face :)

I usually go to Chinatown to get these so was happy to see this spot so close to my office. I came around 12pm and it was packed with students who go to the schools nearby. Not a great amount of seating but eating this to-go is easy. Ordered the Japanese rice ball, salmon rice ball and small peach mango tea white tea with lychee jelly.

Japanese rice ball - hands down, still my favorite. Seaweed, crab meat and egg. Delicious and warm!

Salmon rice ball -  I'm really confused by this. I've had it before and it tastes different at this location. Looked more like tuna than salmon. I know the cashier repeated the order to me so it had to be salmon, right? Either way, it was just okay, less filling than the Japanese rice ball.

Peach mango white tea with lychee jelly - just alright. Tasted like pure sugar.

Total for all this was $9 which isn't bad. Food and a drink that is fairly filling.

As someone who worked in food service for 3 years, customer service sucks and my interaction today felt a little discriminatory. My cousin ordered a Lychee Tree and the wrong drink was made. When I told the woman she said Lychee Tree (not Lychee Tea which is what came out) the teenage worker got very defensive saying "Well she (my cousin) confirmed the order". I even offered to pay the price difference for her misunderstanding but again I was met with defensiveness. We come here pretty regularly and my cousin always orders a Lychee Tree. Other yaya employees are usually able to understand my cousins accent and it's disheartening that an employee misunderstanding was accompanied by rude defensiveness.

Smaller than the Chinatown location but still provides the same quality onigiri that the Chinatown location offers. Delicious little meal to go. I would say I've had these plenty in japan and they make them just as well.

Get the spam or the Japanese. I also tried spicy crawfish which was a special version and it was also delightful.

I'm not mentioning the bubble tea or the snack wall but those offerings seem similar despite the half size of this location.

First, we are avid Milk Tea drinkers and can always go for a nice riceball when on the run.

WE HAVE GIVEN THIS SHOP numerous chances..

First time we came in they ran out of Boba in the middle of the afternoon, this seems to be a normal occurrence.

Now, we come in today to order Boba and Spam Rice Ball.. the CUSTOMER SERVICE is a joke.. nobody greets us and ask if we want to place an order.. (this isn't a big deal)..

Then; we order and wait.. and wait.. and wait.. and wait..and wait.. other people come and go but we still wait for our rice ball and milk tea.

We proceed to the counter and the guy who is working says he doesn't know when our rice ball will be ready.. ( how do these people work here, unless it's a family business)

Look at the photos I have included. It's the worst Japanese establishment in the area.. We have been to many!!!!

Long story short.

IF YOU WANT MILK TEA OR QUICK JAPANESE SNACKS ON THE GO..

AVOID THIS ESTABLISHMENT.. tons of options in the area, go spend your money elsewhere..

I hate posting negative reviews but we have been here numerous times and it's a JOKE..

The worst part is, we live around the block so we had high hopes for this establishment.

The 10.00 we spent isn't even worth refunding, I just won't return and hope you guys change the way the shop is operated.

-nick

This small location of this mini-chain of Japanese snacks and drinks is welcome in this neighborhood largely devoid of places to get small Asian bites. I grew up with all the Calbee chips and rice rolls just a stone's throw away from home, so though this location has a tiny menu and just a couple of shelves worth of snacks, I welcomed it with open arms. Their teas and boba drinks I'd rate 3 stars, particularly when you have so many specialty boba shops within a few blocks making superior drinks, but I come here for the onigiri and always leave very happy. Onigiri is the ideal savory snack, filled with fillings like crispy spring roll, spicy tuna, and spam, surrounded by soft sushi rice and nori. One is great for a snack, two enough for a small meal. They even make a large one as big as my entire hand, and I always spring for a spicy mayo on the side, which punches up the flavor of every bite. When the late afternoon hunger strikes, some people reach for tacos, others for a slice. If Yaya tea is around, it's going to be an onigiri for me every time.

Had high hopes for this place but the flavors just didn't cut it for me.

WAIT: Came on a Sunday around 2:30pm and there was only 1 person waiting for food.  We ordered quickly and got our drinks within 2 minutes or so.

ATMOSPHERE: There are 2 long communal tables where people can sit so there are places to chill with larger groups.  There was no one when we were there so I'm not sure how crowded it gets.

FOOD: They have Japanese snacks as well as onigiri and regular drinks.  

OSMANTHUS AND ROSE - one of their popular combos, I added honey and boba to make it sweeter. I liked the amount of teas they had to brew but the rose didn't have any tea and I wanted some green or black tea so I opted for this combo.  It had an OK flavor but overall was too watery.  I wanted more of a rose taste (like boba guys).  Not only that but the boba was too small and not chewy or sweet enough.  They did put little sayings at the end of each drink, which was kinda cool.

Overall, I wasn't impressed and probably wouldn't be back.

Known for their Onigiri. I've never had one before and happened to have found this location so I couldn't resist stopping in to order a few to try. I got the Shrimp Tempura and the Yaya Chicken with Seaweed. There's instructions to get rid of the plastics that was put together with the Onigiri to prevent the seaweed wrapping from getting soggy, pretty clever. I enjoyed both of them, but loved the Shrimp Tempura the best. Will definitely drop by again when I'm craving some!

I would give this 5 stars since I come here quite often and I really enjoy their drinks. However, I am taking away a star because I ordered 7 riceballs on August 23rd. (2 large shrimp tempura, 1large Japanese + 3 small Japanese) and the rice was terribly mushy and wet. It was very disappointing... see photos attached. The mushy rice was a big turn off and I ended up not finishing the riceballs due to the awful texture of the rice and all the toppings got very moist and mushy because of the rice.

Super good! I love their onigiris and fruit tea. Large menu; unless you have a go-to drink that you order every time, I'd even recommend to look up their menu beforehand, as there are many interesting drinks. I ordered First Love fruit tea with lychee jelly, two seaweed onigiris & one chicken onigiri (in-store pick-up, Gramercy location). What I got was the Sunrise fruit tea and two chicken & one seaweed onigiri...even tho my order was a little off, I'm giving 4 stars because it was SO tasty! (and 'cause I might have stuttered my order a little @ the cashier lol so that's on me, anyways.) Fruit tea was super refreshing and onigiris were delicious with a little spice. Would definitely come again.

Yaya's never disappoints. They have great vegan options and their fruit teas are out of this world. It's a delicious snack or meal for a price point that's hard to beat in this area. Thank you yaya's! I've been going to the different yaya's locations since I was in high school (it's been 7 years!)

Perfect spot to hit for a snack or a quick pick me up after class. The lychee teas are so refreshing and the rice balls are super yummy.

They have inside seating if you need a spot to study, and they're open pretty late which is convenient.

They also have those cool Japanese candies!!!

My only issue is that you have to pay for spicy mayo and they barley fill up the container you're paying for. I spent 50 cents for a container that was pretty much equivalent to the 25 cent size. And a friend of mine purchased the smaller size and there was little to none in there. Other than that i plan on coming back soon!

Decent tea, decent boba! Came here looking to explore the different boba options in my neighborhood. Ordered an oolong milk tea with boba, which was decent. The tea tasted authentic and the boba was chewy, but a little on the small side of what I would normally prefer. Service was decent. Overall a nice spot to check out. Not the best boba I've had but by no means the worst!

***Excellent customer service, Quick, Spacious seating***

I really like this tea place. It's decently priced and there's a ton of drink options. I've also tried their onigiri, which is delicious and a must try! There's also two large long tables so you can sit and catch up with friends or get work done.
I adore Yaya, but was so dissapointed when my tea arrived with a crack down the side. Could not drink it properly. Made a mess

They have a ton of Asian snacks and their boba has the perfect texture, so for those two reasons alone Yaya gets five stars in my book!

I thought I had tried every Pocky flavor under the sun but I spotted a coconut variety which I had to snap up and which might be my new favorite! I also went with their recommended tea blend of peach and mango with boba, hot since it was a very chilly day, and though the tea was very sweet (not sure if the sweetness is adjustable), the boba like I mentioned was perfectly chewy.

Finally, I tried the shrimp tempura and the chicken rice balls, both small, and they were delicious and so filing that I couldn't finish both for lunch. They're deceptively hearty, and are pretty generous in the fillings!

Though they mostly have little snack foods on the menu and therefore might not be appropriate for a full-on meal, you can definitely fill up between the beverages, rice balls, hot items, and packaged snacks, and your taste buds will thank you for a nice change of pace!

Love their rice balls / onigiris! Cute little location with a few tables, very casual. They also sell gyozas and squid balls and snacks as well as bubble tea, but I think their rice balls are the best things they sell here!

I tried the Blue Blood with aloe in a glass bottle. Seemed a little acrid at first and wondered if it was the taste of the water or straw. I took another sip and couldn't drink it anymore. I checked the bottle it looks like there's dust or something else on the bottom of the bottle? I've since left the location, so I can't tell what causes the grime/dust.

I tried to email them directly, but their email link on their website is down.

So excited about this newly yaya location. It's close to my school! Hopefully other similar/yummy stores start moving into the area, as well.

Faves:

-Shrimp Tempura Onigiri- crunchy shrimp tempura sandwiched between steamy rice and wrapped in seaweed

Other:

-Chicken Onigiri- was nice; had a "roasted" flavor/taste. I didn't like the marinade.

-Japanese onigiri- very oriental palate cleanser.

-Matcha latte- low grade & grainy texture*
So good and a quick stop to grab food , full filing & great bubble tea ! I highly recommend

Been here a few times when I'm craving bubble tea,  as it's close by my workplace. It's bigger than other bubble tea spots around as you can actually sit and hang out on three bench tables.

Drinks are good and the price is great. I like that your first topping free! A cute surprise is that each drink comes with a small note taped on the bottom that has a positivity phrase.

They have snacks also like dumplings and rice balls which hit the spot.

Completely stumbled upon this gem when I was in the area and it was so authentic, delicious, and affordable!!! I ordered the chicken onigri and the crab onigri. Both quickly prepared, adorably packaged, unbelievably priced, and surprisingly filling. I will so so be back!

Adorable study spot with excellent Taro milk tea and small snacks!

Drink: taro milk tea with less sugar and no ice had a wonderful fresh flavor and was just right in terms of sweetness. Boba nicely al dente and sweet. They have some fun names for their designed bubble tea combos :) also each bubble tea cover has puns + a small square of paper on the bottom with an inspirational quote and/or fun fact. Always appreciate when a store takes the extra effort like this!
Food: they have a bunch of sweets and savory snacks including onigiri. Definitely will try these in the future!
Service: friendly, quick, professional!
Space: modern, chic, so cute. Three long tables with seating comfortably for eight or ten people at each table, plus some standing room.
Price: very reasonable and comparable to other bubble tea shops.

Will definitely be hitting up this cute spot for more bubble tea and to try their snacks!

I come pretty often because it's the closest, but I might not come anymore. I feel like their drinks are more watered down than other locations and my squidball riceball today had about half a squid ball in the first bite and it was basically a plain riceball with pepper flavor in the later bites :') so disappointed

I ordered the Blue Blood from YAYATEA. It was my first time and for the price, it's worth it! Each additional drink topping was $0.50 extra. My large size drink came to $5.40 with tax. It was very refreshing, although the wait was very long. There was only a woman working at the back of the kitchen while another woman at the front making drinks so it's a given it was a bit of a long wait. Overall, positive!

Yaya never disappoints me! Whether its for a work catering event or a quick bite. They are well known for their onigiris and fruit teas. Along with that, they have a variety of japanese snacks. Price is extremely reasonable and everything is made fresh. The fruit teas are extremely refreshing. Would highly recommend
I go here when I crave for origini! So good! Must try! I always get their shrimp tempura and crab meat filling. 2 fills me up and on the side I get their curry fish balls! Costs me ~$10

I'm closer to the Yaya Tea on Chrystie street, but I was soooo stoked when I noticed there was a location further up whilst omw to an appointment. I just had to walk in! The first thing I noticed was how spacious it was compared to the other. Interior beautifully decorated; nice clean feel; friendly staff; sauces on tables. My favorite part was the minimum of $5 for card, because if I want to use my card on Chrystie I have to spend $10+ haha. Blueblood and crabmeat onigiri have always been my fave combo and this place didn't disappoint. Even still going with the tradition of fortunes underneath drinks~ Yay!

I dropped a star only bc the second time I brought a friend, The Hulk taste a bit watery and they forgot the second jelly (mango star) that I paid for.

Will stop by whenever I'm in the area still tho

Can't wait to come to Yaya's again! Tasty rice balls that come in two sizes large and small. I was starving and ended up getting one large crab cake and seaweed and small spam and it was perfect for me. They were tasty and fresh, although had a little too much rice for my taste. Worth it for a quick bite and affordable price. Also if you aren't crazy about kids, skip the lunch hour when a ton of middle school aged kids come by! I didn't mind, but the people having a date seemed to.

The place is a hole in the wall. It looks cute. but after going there for a month, I saw the bad management of this place! IT IS TERRIBLE! The cashier took my order and made a mistake (I don't blame her bc it happens), but she didn't know how to fix my order. There was only one person working and it was really busy and it took me 30 minutes for a boyfriend tea and a spam onigiri.

Just know i spent more money than i should've. the rice ball is good but the drinks are not it!!! I wasted my money coming here for a whole month!!

I ordered a couple onigiri and an oolong milk tea for lunch today. The onigiri was really good! But the boba was extremely disappointing. I didn't taste any oolong tea nor was it milky (despite having whole milk) and whatever sweetener they used cause the drink to taste extremely artificial. The boba was $6, which isn't cheap but tasted like garbage. I would only come for the onigiri from now on.

Bubble Tea: 3 stars
Snacks/food: 4 stars

Bubble tea was kinda meh.. the boba texture a bit mushy and the sweetness was weird. this was for 3 out of 5 of my friends

The onigiri were delicious. I got the yaya chicken.
great price too!

i'll prob stop by if i need a quick snack/meal
maybe i'll give the boba another try
Some of the best sashimi I've had on the east coast. The place is a little warm down and hard to find but absolutely worth it! Enjoy.

This was my first time here. My friend took me here. I was so, not impressed, but didn't say anything. I know this is a very old, popular establishment, BUT, first impression is everything. The interior needs to be revamped. Old, worn, dirty red carpeting, huge decayed, brown, large chairs, n tables:  too large for low ceiling basement restaurant. Very tight and claustrophobic.  Dingy walls. The Frier was broken. We were told this when ordering. We could not order 1/2 the items we wanted. FISH WAS VERY FRESH but presentation n plates were nothing to write home about. Japonica is way better as so light n airy n pretty establishment to patron. I do like to give good reviews but when 2 people spend almost $140 on dinner, the food, presentation, ambience n decor should reflect. I felt as if I was eating in a college dorm room. It was also extremely loud. Sorry Yama

Visually you wouldn't think much of this place - small and not much of an ambiance but what it lacks in decor - it makes up for in food. The waiter was attentive and food was brought out quickly. Everything we tried was wonderful. Even basics like a house salad with ginger sauce. Broiled salmon teriyaki was excellent! Sushimi platter was fresh and good, same with sushi platter for two. And to wrap things up - cannot recommend enough fried green tea ice cream!

I was genuinely excited to try a sushi place nearby and given that it's been around decades we figured they had to be doing something right. Sadly we were quite disappointed. Let's dive in:

Fish Sushi Rolls (2/5): The eel cucumber roll was fine. The eel was bland even with the sauce added and the cucumber was, well, cucumber. The roll however was falling apart. The spicy salmon roll was just salmon in a roll with spicy sauce poured on top - not how I usually see this and was not a fan of this method. The sauce was thin and runny. And - shocker - the roll was falling apart too.

Vegetarian Sushi Rolls (2/5): Sadly, it wasn't just the fish rolls which were poorly rolled -- the vegetarian ones were also genuinely falling apart. The AAC roll was missing the avocado and the asparagus was bland and overcooked. Meanwhile, for the oshinko roll we added some cucumber and it was okay. But again falling apart - all of them ...

Edamame (2/5): This was fine, nothing to write home about. No vinegary dipping sauce like some places provide. No salt on the edamame. Not impressed.

Pork Gyoza Dumplings (3/5): The best dish of the meal and nothing fancy about them. Decent flavor and they were correctly pan fried.

TL;DR: We will be walking the extra 20 blocks (or more likely using delivery) to order from our preferred sushi place - because Yama is certainly not taking that spot.
20 years later it's still good. Super fresh seafood n deliciously prepared with simple ingredients. It's just as good as I recalled!!!

The best sushi in NYC is off of Union Square, down some steps, in a unassuming but welcoming spot. The menu and the spot itself aren't fancy, but the service is prompt and efficient, and the fish is unbelievably fresh and melts in your mouth, and the pricing is reasonable. Yama is out of this world good.
We haven't been here in over 10 years.  The quality of the sushi as good as we remember.

Excellent sushi rolls, attentive waitstaff and relaxed atmosphere with no frills environment.

My favorite rolls are the Special 5 roll which has spicy Mayo and generous amounts of salmon packed inside. The inside out version of Special 5 roll is also delicious. Other favorites are the twin tuna crispy and the shrimp tempura special 8 roll.

A relaxed no-frills atmosphere on the ground floor with cozy quarters (entryway has some steps down). Nice to sit at the sushi bar and has two separate areas for seating - tables are placed close to each other - cozy atmosphere with delicious sushi.
They've been in the game for decades & the Sushi is Great. The place needs some simple interior décor improvements. A simple paint job and replacing the old rug in the back room would do wonders.

It was ok! The fish was ok Not very juicy and fresh. Also the Asian elderly guy with bald hair he is super super super rude! NOT FRIENDLY at all. This is my first time and last time. If he doesn't like his job just quick. I couldn't hear him very well at first. So I was like I'm sorry can you please reply? I didn't hear you. Then he raise up his rude voice and he showed his attitude. I was like what did I do? Why you are showing me your NASTY attitude?!
Jesus, I will tell all my friends and I will NEVER return.

Good luck and BYE

Xoxo

First time trying this place and it was so good! We've always walked by wondering how it was and finally went for dinner tonight. Got there at 7pm and sat outside... there was no one there when we got there but by the time we left there were people waiting to be seated!!
We brought our dog and they kindly gave us a container of water for him.
Our waiter Nishio was so kind and friendly!
You could tell they were very busy and running around as they were busy but made sure to keep checking in on the tables.
We got our apps within 5 minutes after ordering- super quick. We got....
- edamame
- miso soup
- soba salad
- harumaki
- spicy tuna on crispy rice
- mango salmon roll
- California roll
- jalapeño special 1 roll
Total came out to $78 after taxes.
We were very satisfied... 2 thumbs up!
Everything was delicious... all of the fish tasted so fresh. They have such a good menu I can't wait to come back again soon and try more things.

Reasonably priced sushi joint on Irving. We joined for restaurant week - nice variety. The dressing for the salad was pretty thick, and I'd have loved a tiny bit more seasoning to the rice. Otherwise fresh fish, and yummy sake.

Overall, extremely satisfying and filling! We both agree that the chicken teriyaki is better than the beef teriyaki, which is pretty good in itself. Waitress was helpful and attentive, and kept checking in to make sure we were enjoying the food. The prices are reasonable too. Get the plum wine for a little extra on the side!

A long time family favorite, this cozy sushi spot nails it when it comes to fresh, delicious fish. We started with a few appetizers such as the carpaccio, tuna tartar, hotate Mille fille, all delicious. The rolls were yummy, the i like eel roll is wrapped in cucumber and the special roll #2 was good. Don't forget to order the fried green tea ice cream as well to finish!

I used to come here all the time when I was very young with family but would only eat udon at that age haha. This was my first time back since and now I actually eat sushi haha. I was not disappointed at all.

This is a very small restaurant in the basement so be sure to call ahead or be prepared to wait in a line that goes out the door. At first it may appear that the menu is pricey but you will soon understand when your food arrives.

All of the fish is crazy fresh & tender with no fishiness at all. Normally I find sushi places load up on rice and give you very little fish. Yama's is the exact opposite. The sushi is stuffed with more fish than rice which I love. I was very impressed.

Next time I'm craving sushi in the city and want a sit down dinner, I will return here.

This place is special. Very fresh fish and creative rolls.
We usually do a number 1, number 2, spicy tuna hand rolls, special tuna rolls and miso soup. A side of spicy mayo is a must. I go here every time I'm in the neighborhood.  Highly recommend!

One of my favorite sushi spots in Manhattan - and I'd venture to say it's one of my best-kept secrets. The sushi is SO good, they could charge 3x the price but I'm so glad they don't. All of the portions are massive (one piece of nigiri would easily be two at another restaurant). Note that the Union Sq location is a much more low-key hole-in-the-wall type of place while the midtown east location is a bit more upscale - but same menu and incredible food! We usually order some soup, crispy rice with spicy tuna, a kani salad, and split some nigiri. Simple and perfect.

A small place to grab dinner with a friend! Very casual ambience. Because it was dinner/dark outside I didn't mind but there was not much natural light and I wouldn't suggest eating if you are extremely claustrophobic.
The service was fast and accommodating.
The food itself was pretty good- the sushi platters are sufficient size. I also got the udon which was good and filling. This wasn't out of this world good Japanese food but it was good for a casual dinner out and sushi craving.

I have been visiting Yama (both locations) for many years. It has always been my "go to" sushi place in the city. I liked both locations for different reasons. The Yama on 49th street has yet to disappoint me but yesterday this location (17th street) did just that.

So as we always do, we went there yesterday. First, the place had a pungent scent of sewer and garbage. That alone should have been a reason to get up and leave. However, knowing the quality of the food, I decided to stay because I enjoy the rolls and hand rolls there.
Next, the waiter was extremely rude. At first I was a bit indecisive about what I wanted to drink. He seemed very impatient and irritated.

The food- we ordered the spicy tuna crispy rice appetizer and our usual rolls and spicy yellowtail hand rolls. We also got a bunch of different pieces. We ordered the Special no 7 (with scallop), spicy king crab roll, twin tuna crisp, and a spicy tuna roll. If you're one to complain about the amount of rice in a roll, this place is not for you. They add an exceptionally large amount of rice and the pieces of the roll are huge. I just eat as much of the rice as I can and then enjoy the inside. I have nothing negative to say about the quality of food except that it lacked the WOW factor I usually get from it.

They have the best spicy mayo. So that def didn't change. I'll be visiting the 49th street location from now on. It is more clean, welcoming and the ambience is much better.

Yama has been in my mind lately. Tonight I had a chance to revisit my most favorite sushi place from years ago.

When I saw Omakese on the menu, I got very excited. My memories told me that I was always happy with the food there,  so I ordered it.

BUT.... :(

However, my omakase was not what I had in mind. I expected a little extra special sushi than simple sushi pieces (see picture). If I had known, I would have better off order rolls or something else.

Oh well, I probably would NOT return there for omakase.
Yama offers good sushi for the price, big pieces, big rolls, etc.  you would probably enjoy it if you are hungry and on a budget.

It's kind of sad that I left the place feeling unhappy after spending almost $90 Omakase 60 + hot sake 6 + tax + tip. This piece is for 1 person.

Yama is back, and just as good as before the pandemic!  Yelp should stop reporting this place as closed - they're definitely open now.  I've been coming here for over 10 years (when we call, Andy immediately recognizes both my voice and my fiancee's voice since we order takeout so often).  I'll admit - the pandemic and the previous reviewer's pictures scared me.  The special roll #5 has been my favorite as well.  But we decided to order anyway, and it's exactly like how we remember it.  I don't normally write reviews here, but I needed to correct the record about Yama's famous #5.

Delicious sushi that tastes very fresh.  Oversized sushi and rolls.  Great cooked food too, though we usually stick to the sushi.

Been going to this spot for years. It's an underrated gem. All the $ goes towards the fresh fish. If you're looking for fancy decor to upload to Instagram, this isn't it. If you're looking for some of the best tasting sushi in the city, welcome to Yama.
A literal dream! So delicious and so many options on their expansive menu. I really enjoyed this place for takeout and I would definitely go back again. Really has options for everyone!

Oh Yama, I used to come here with my family two decades ago. My parents would swear by this place having some of the best sushi, at a low price tag. Some things don't change, including the interior. I mean yeah, Yama defintiely needs a facelift, but the sushi is excellent...and priced really well.

Make a reservation, this place fills up. I was here at 7pm on a Saturday and it was already packed. My friend and I each ordered a glass of plum wine and it was SO good. Get it, it's $6 and delicious. All the combos come with either a soup or a salad, and I ordered a miso soup along with my sushi and sashimi platter. I typically don't like miso soup, but this one was fantastic, as was the sushi. Fresh, plentiful, great. We also shared the shumai as an appetizer and it was standard.

All this, for $67 total. A bargain in Manhattan.

This japanese restaurant is conveniently located near Union Square were we watched a show We were craving sushi and we were not disappointed. The fish was fresh and flavorful. The atmosphere relaxed. Tables covid safe distanced. The size of the sushi and sashimi pieces was perfect. We ordered a wide variety and I loved the uni and unagi. Takeout seemed extremely busy which is a good sign. Prices are very reasonable.
I forgot my credit card at the restaurant, which they mailed to me as I live far away. First class people . Will definitely return

YUZU HAMACHI.
having all these restaurants drop like flies in the area (thanks alot landlords) makes me nervous that Yama will disappear too... i truly hope not... so with that in mind, i have come to terms that  i must go as often as possible to get my dose of Yuzu hamachi...it's like  tiradito...thinly sliced yellowtail topped w/ tiny microplane daikon, sliced radish, sliced jalapeno or some sort of green chili, drizzled w a yuzu something sauce (that is making me drool as i type this)
Have you not had this? get it...i also spoon the plate and drink the yuzu jus.... SOOO GOOD. the hamachi is a heavenly heavenly bite.

The food is good,  but the staff is rude.
I don't appreciated being rushed to eat at 8:30 on a Thursday evening. They literally gave me a 30 minute last call order when they seated me.
I've ordered throughout COVID to support them, but I will never go there again.

This sushi place has been around for a while. Been coming here since I was young and it's just as good as the first time (granted I was like  8 years old the first time I came here lol). It's extremely small so I would recommend reservations! The sushi rolls are significantly bigger than your normal rolls and they serve everyone's rolls on one large plate. Perfect for ordering a bunch of different rolls and sharing with everyone! A bit pricey, but the sushi always tastes fresh and is wrapped to perfection. I like that the place has a tiny, hole-in-the-wall feel. Always a good time when I come here!

Love coming to Yama on special occasion dinners. That it's sort of under a staircase further adds to its charm.

Their sushi is pretty decent - we ordered a few rolls and the sushi deluxe and were not disappointed. My favorite treat this past dinner was their special sea bass appetizer (pictured) cooked with a yummy miso sauce. Very, very delicious.

A very classic and cute date spot, but also super appropriate for groups of friends and family! Space is a little bit tight (see before note about being under a staircase) but not terribly cramped.
Hole in the wall with best sushi that is consistently fresh and delicious. Special roll #7

Love the tender large pieces of Sushi.   The interior of the restaurant could use a much needed remodel but the outdoor sidewalk shed is one of the best I've seen, and for the great prices I can overlook the interior decor.

We love it here! The tiny basement space will film up quickly and stay full entirely because the food is fresh, tasty and beautiful. We ordered quite a variety with the salmon tartar being my absolute favorite!

Amazing food, mellow atmosphere and incredibly clean and quiet block. Yama has been around forever - still
Love it. Sashimi is cut to perfection, on the bias and sushi rice delicious
My go-to sushi spot in the city. Always fresh, incredibly generous serving sizes, and you just can't beat the value. Will always recommend.
Probably the best quality sushi I've ever had in Lower Manhattan. Venue is a speak-easy like intimate setting right off of the hustle and bustle of Union Square.

This WAS my go-to sushi restaurant for well over a decade. I've spent many special occasions at this location and the one they closed on Carmine Street. But they've begun sneaking in charges for delivery when you check out on Seamless. They claim there is no delivery fee, but there is a 10% "service fee" hidden under "taxes and fees" at checkout. All told, my $22 sushi order was $34 at checkout! Unscrupulous! They also refused to substitute white tuna on a recent platter order (for those who don't know, white tuna isn't really tuna -- it's oilfish!). I would have accepted a less expensive fish or paid the difference, but they wouldn't accommodate me. Too bad they've decided to turn their backs on loyal customers. I'm going to miss that place, but I'm sure I'll find somewhere else that wants a loyal customer in NYC.

Yama is one of my favorite sushi places.  I've been eating here for...well, let's just say a really long time.  Very little has changed in all these years which is one of the reasons I love it.  

There's no fuss with decor or fancy service.  I actually prefer the simple Japanese decor and cozy space.  Feels more authentic than their younger location on 49th St.

The sushi is good quality and tastes fresh.  IMO, better than most sushi places I've been to.  As a sushi lover, I'm a fan of the big, long pieces of nigiri sushi.  Sure, the fish is cut a little thinner in more recent years as costs have risen, but that's the case for anything.  Even so, the prices are reasonable for the quality and portion.

While sushi is what I go for, I also enjoy some of their appetizers. Hamachi kama is one of my favorites...meaty, succulent yellowtail collar with salt.  I could almost just have that and some rice for my meal...almost.

I'm going all out with 5 stars because I've never had a bad experience, the food is always good, and I just like going here.

As much as it pains me to do this  I must leave a negative review. I don't know if they changed suppliers, or are using old fish from before the pandemic starting but something is off.
The special no 5 roll salmon is white (salmon should be red/orange) and Yama sauce which has been a staple sauce is now bitter. Don't believe me? Just compare my pictures of the special number 5 vs. pics from before of the same roll.

Stay away until they get there act together

Went here with my family of four after a co-worker raved about the place. I was underwhelmed (could've been the food, my high expectations or both!) We shared an appetizer of calamari and it was the most chewy calamari I've ever indulged in. Lesson learned: only order calamari at Thai restaurants. We also ordered miso soup which was very rich in flavor.

We each got a variety of hand rolled sushi. I got the only vegan option which was bland in my opinion but understandably so because who gets sushi without raw fish? lol My family who are big sushi eaters were also underwhelmed by their dishes. They described it as "Just okay"

The service was great and attentive and the small interior made for an intimate dining experience.

Highlight of the night: two customers sitting next to us taught my family and I to use chopsticks!
As a Japanese person I am picky about my sushi and absolutely love this spot. This is our neighborhood go to place for sushi. It's tucked away on Irving Street and has a very cozy atmosphere.

Yama is a very discrete and cozy sushi spot near Union Square.  I recent came here midweek for dinner. They nearly full and I'm not surprised! The sushi was excellent and the prices were basically unbeatable. We were shocked when the bill came considering the great quality of the sushi. We also did an order of the gyoza and it was delicious. Highly recommend!

Yama has great sushi. They have specials, appetizers and entrees in the menu or you can order rolls or pieces a la carte. Everything we got was great, I would recommend the mango salmon roll, which turned out to be pretty large and filling!

The prices are fairly reasonable, a dinner for two, including an order of saki was less than $50. The staff was also very nice.

The restaurant is on the lower level so it might be hard to find at first at first glance, however the place was packed!  Yama is kind of small, so I do not recommend going with a large group. I would also recommend making a reservation in advanced, so you do not have to wait.

This is my update from last night.  Yama's is our favorite Japanese place in the Union Square area. We still love the sushi but the furnishings haven't changed in 20 years.  Not sure why but a facelift could help.  It still has a faithful following like us.  Be forewarned, the tight seating is not conducive to private convo so if you're not on a date or don't care, come for the food because everything else is sub-par.
Food was ok and there was a fish smell to the place . Fruit flies flying around . Not going back too many other choices in NYC

You can eat created Japanese sushi and good Sake!
It was really good.
But restaurant was small and I wanted more nice interior for date...1.8.2016

Went for lunch - not the best sushi but for $18 you get a pretty good deluxe set! Not a date spot but more like a become a regular spot if you live near here. Worth going for value! Also their rice menus are like $14 and pretty good!

Totally not expecting to find such a cozy and delicious sushi place around Union Square!

A friend too me here during the week day, we came around 8pm and didn't have to wait at all and we sat at the sushi bar. We ordered Miso Soup, Yellowtail Carpaccio, Sashimi without Shellfish, several special roll and individual pieces of sushi and Chilean Seabass. All the sushi and sashimi were absolutely delicious! They were super fresh and there were so much more fish than rice in the roll and sushi.

The only disappointment was the Chilean Seabass, it was dry and stiff, normally the Miso Glazed Chilean Seabass is very tender and should milt in your mouth, but what we got was not tasty and it was not tender at all. It was the only cooked dish we got, I think I will just stick with sushi and sashimi when I come next time.

The service were friendly and food came pretty fast as well. Nothing else to complain.

I am really happy to have found Yama and will come back here for sure.

I came here with a group of friends before a movie.  We waited about 30-40mins for a table when we were told was a 20 minute wait.  This is not a place that I would wait 30-40mins for.  

We ordered the sushi and sashimi for two to share and additional rolls to share.  Just to let everyone know, they put wasabi between the rice and the sushi because that really caught some of us by surprise.  For those that don't put wasabi on their sushi, this will not be to their liking. I normally put a small amount but it was a little too much.  I like to put my own wasabi to my own taste.  

However, the sushi fish is fresh and the salmon melts in your mouth.  So they deserve a 3 star because they use good ingredients and the portions are huge.  However, the service and wait time was where they lost points for me.

Let's start off with the fact that Yama Sushi has received a C Restaurant Grade. Did you know that? Maybe you didn't because they deliberately keep the door open with the Rating facing so that it is not visible. I can't believe that get away with this!

The sushi is decent but the combination of receiving a C grade (there is no D) combined with the fact they hide it so customers cannot see it, has made it impossible for me to eat there anymore!

Why go through all the trouble of hiding the rating and not fixing whatever problem there is that caused it?

Avoid at all costs, at least that's what I do.

Sorry to share but I just felt I had to.

nytimes.com/2017/05/17/n…

#yamasushi #yama17

I started to come to Yama while my husband and I lived in the neighborhood 25 years ago.  It used to be super popular and the line would form around 4:30 pm before first seating at 5 pm.  Back in the days, we would come 1-2 a month and could always count on a delicious Japanese meal.  We moved away and came back and just took a friend there to re-live the joy of my favorite place.  It didn't disappoint.  My friend is a vegetarian and her eggplant appetizer was really flavorful and so was her kabocha sushi roll.  My assortments of sushi and rolls were just as fresh and delicious and the pieces of fish on my sushi were just as big as before.

The food was good - had the classic tonkotsu ramen with pork chasu and the gyudon. Overall the food was good but the service is extremely slow.

Maybe I'll give them another try in the future.

This Korean place known for neng myun is just ok.

We had the kimchee dumplings which were solid but not as good as Mandoo Bar. The pan chan was a joke. They served so few pan chan and it was disappointing. The noodles (neng myun) were very good but the portion size wasn't as big as I would have liked. The service was poor as usual (most Korean places have poor service in my book). The bibimpap was average.

I won't come back here.

Ive eaten here for years. The food is great most times. Their Mexican menu is on point and fresh
favorite go-to take out.

To me, Yeung's Number 1 Chinese Restaurant earns 1 star right off the bat, because it's a family run establishment. The younger son, when not playing video games, helps his mother answer the phone and take orders. The older son, when not sitting quietly on one of the large containers of "Umami Flavor," is helping his father cook in the kitchen. Sometimes the boys argue for no reason. I find this all rather endearing.

However, to me, no additional stars are earned or warranted, because neither the American-Chinese food nor the American-Chinese Tex-Mex food are very good. The beef is greasy and tough. The chicken is salty and dry. The tortillas are dense and chewy. The rice is flavorless. It's all just boring upon boring upon boring. And it's not exactly like this food is healthy for you. If you absolutely have to take in a lot of calories and fat immediately, you might be better off going somewhere else.

Cheap, edible food.  The steamed vegetable dumplings are suprisingly tasty for how unnaturally green they are.  But if you go pick up your food yourself, you see just how dirty the place is.  That is, fairly dirty.

The food is your standard neighborhood Chinese, the service however, is among the worst I have ever experienced. The owner is extremely rude and has no customer service skills whatsoever, during an order which was over 2 hours late I had called to cancel, and she basically was trying to to force me to still take the order hung up the phone on me. I called back and she just hung again. After that experience, I decided I wold no longer order from them and figured I would not have to deal with them ever again. Unfortunately I was wrong.

One of their delivery people, came to my building and kept ringing my buzzer, knowing I did not order anything nor was I expecting anyone, I  ignored as I was in the middle of a serious project. Somehow he gets into the building and then starts banging (not knocking, banging loudly) on my door. I ask him who he is he yells delivery! I told him I didn't order anything and was that him that kept ringing the buzzer, he says and tells him I should have let him in. I tell him why wouldI Iet you in, If I didn't order anything??  I ask him if he has a phone, he says yes, then I ask him why he didn't he just call the person he's delivering to if no one answered the buzzer, at that point they could have told him that he has the wrong apartment,  he replies he can't do that all the time. What kind of a response is that??

He then gets the correct apartment and of course starts to talk about me. At this point I go to my neighbor who ordered the food and ask where the delivery person is from. He informs me that it's No 1 Chinese. I should have known.

When the person running the business is rude  and has 0 customer service skills, how would the staff have any common sense or customer service skills either?? This business has ensured that they have lost a customer for life.

So I used to order from this place frequently, but recently decided to stop ordering takeout entirely.

The food is good around 3.5 stars but to deliver I have to give it half a star to even a zero. I live about 7 blocks away and for the past 2 years they have an average delivery time of 45-60 minutes!

Last time I ordered they i waited for an hour called and they claimed they sent it out long ago another 20 minutes have elapsed called again and they claim the same. I cancelled my order. 10 minutes later the delivery guy rang my door and called me. I gave him what I would tip him and informed him I cancelled and he apologized explaining that they forgot to even put in my order and they were trying to stall for time!

After this they called my phone constantly trying to insist on me taking the food when I already not only ordered somewhere else but got my food within 20 minutes.

I would NEVER advise to get take out. If you want the food best bet is to go there personally and pick it up. 90 minute wait time is completely and utterly unacceptable.

Best Chinese/Mexican takeout in all of Inwood!  They deliver promptly and if you order over $10 of food they add 2 sodas to the order for free.  Love their sweet & sour chicken and green vegetable dumplings.

I'm sad to say I have to give this place a bad review. When speaking to the owner about an issue with an order, she was more interested in talking over me and hanging up on me than listening to the issue.

The issue was that I wanted to cancel
an order because it was taking way too long.  The owner refused to do it & basically tried to force the order on me. During the course of the calls she also hung up on me 5 times.

I'm very disappointed with the poor service.

I Love this Restaurant Very much. It is right up the Block from where i live. I Usually order from the Mexican Side of the Menu. The Mexican Food is very Tasty. I have been Eating at this Place for 14 yrs and never had a Problem. They moved a few doors down from where they used to be. The new place is so much nicer then the old.. Not really a place to sit and eat but food is good.

Three different dishes ordered from the Mexican side of the menu were perfectly adequate.  The one dish we ordered from the Chinese portion of the menu was not: the orange flavored beef was about 70% breading and sauce.  The sauce was in fact tasty, but the dish had so little meat that I'm afraid I'm off this place for good; too many better options for both of these cuisines in the neighborhood.  But if you're as excited as the OP is about a couple of free Sprites, this could be your kind of place. Delivery time was standard.
this food was disgusting. I threw it away, couldn't even eat it.
I can only comment on the fajitas, which were basically terrible.  No complaints on service time, price was OK (not cheap, not expensive) but the food was just not good.
Not the best Chinese. But the fresh made tortillas at this place are amazing.
My absolute favourite Chinese place. I've tried many others and always come back to this one. The lady is always nice enough to give me fortune cookies without me having to ask :)

Finest Chinese in the hood. Bless yourself with their presence. Their brusque, business-like, humans-hunger-first presence. Excellent food. Great prices. And a cool and relaxed delivery man.

Top shelp for 10 years. I've been in the neighborhood for 20. A great improvement in clean, tasty, well made Chinese cooking by a Chinese family in the Heights.

The lunch specials aren't so special because you don't get more than the entree in the price as you do at other neighborhood Chinese restaurants. If you want soup you have to add $3.50 to the bill. Food is tasty and well prepared. Service is good.

It's gone downhill since last i ate here. I literally had to spit out the steam meat dumplings because it tasted doughy and a little rotten. The BBQ ribs were OK but the lunch special serving of Sweet and Sour chicken was tiny. I wont be coming back here anymore sadly.

I ordered from Yang Garden for the first time tonight, based on a couple of recommendations in a local online discussion board about neighborhood Chinese takeout.

I'm left wondering what the folks who recommended the food were raving about. Have they ever had OTHER Chinese food? This food was passable at best. I will say that the woman who took my order over the phone was very nice. The guy who delivered our food, also very nice. (I'm sorry, I accidentally kept your pen. But I did give you a big tip.)

According to my wife, the Szechuan Beef was pretty good, but the Chicken in Hot Garlic Sauce was bland. Like another reviewer mentioned, she said the chicken looked weird and had an odd texture. Like it was reconstituted. My Spicy Bean Curd w. Hot Garlic Sauce was cooked well (nice texture), but where was the spice and the "hot garlic"? Cold Sesame Noodles--better than some but only after I added sriracha and soy sauce. Probably wouldn't order again.

The complementary steamed veggie dumplings (thank you) were also bland and very doughy. I actually put them in a pan with a little oil to crisp up the bottom and add some texture. The String Beans with Spicy Sauce was the one thing that was perfectly cooked and seasoned.

The price was decent--a bit cheaper than some other local spots but I can't say that Yang Garden will be in our "take out folder" for future orders.  But if you just need to put food in your body, this will do.

We stayed at an Air BNB right around the corner to this Washington Heights hole in the wall type Chinese restaurant. I decided to visit it and was pleasantly surprised. I got their lunch order of pork lo mein and it was really really good.  I'm glad I chose it and I would definitely eat there again.
Get takeout from here every once in a while and its always fast but never that good. Its Chinese takeout tho and for its price its decent. Can't ask for more from a chinese place.

Really poor.  Had not ordered from them in quite a while....the egg foo young and lo menu were both tasteless.  No seasoning at all.  Total waste of money.  I don't remember it being bad before....something must have changed.
Great neighborhood Chinese.  Delivery and take out is always good.  Super fast delivery, arrives HOT, and fresh made and tastes it.

Quick. Cheap. Quality is highly questionable. If desperate, maybe? Chicken looks weird always. Beef is somewhat suspect too. Shrimp is ok, but again I always wonder if it's fresh. During rush hour they tend to make mistakes, and it can be annoying. The best thing they have going for them is speed. They can have food in your place in no time (during non-rush hour times).

I've always been hesitant to each cheap chinese food in NYC, but these guys do it right. Clean, tons of options with large servings and fresh, quality ingedients; many only $5.00

A few of tasty suggestions:
1. House Special Mei Fun
2.  Fried Pork Dumplings
3. Sweet and Sour Chicken (all white meat!)

An added bonus is the family that runs Yang Garden are very nice people.

They've been continually accommodating of all the different special requests I've tried, despite any language barrier.  But, with multiple trips now safely under my belt since my initial review, I'm going to downgrade a star due to lack of consistency.  Still, better than everything else around!
Perfect neighborhood Chinese. Love the veggie dumplings, egg rolls, chicken with broccoli, and moo shoo. Always very fresh and quick.

This restaurant has been in the neighborhood a long time, and the family who own it are wonderful people! I love the Singapore Mei Fun, Vegetable Lo Mein, and Scallion Pancake. Overall, an excellent Chinese restaurant!
My Favorite go to spot for Chinese food! The food quality and fast service is excellent here. The owner is always friendly and remembers their customers.

It is as good as it gets in Washington Heights.   You just have to know what to order.  Some items are really decent: fried shrimp dumplings, spring rolls, the fried chicken, yang chow fried rice.  

Delivery is lightning fast and courteous.  You can ask for free bottles of water instead of soda.  

I tried all the Chinese restaurants in this neighborhood.  I would say each has its strengths and *many* weaknesses.  Just order the right items.  See my reviews of the other places.

Warning:  I am not impressed with the seafood entrees or the soups or the tofu dishes.  The necessary turn over of inventory is not happening there.  

The chicken is decent, however.  For a sinful treat, try th

After months of ordering from the same place, we decided to try a different Chinese place. We did a thorough Yelp search of nearby Chinese establishments, particularly interested in what other Yelpers had to say about fried dumplings. We thought we found the spot with Yang Garden, and except for the egg rolls the food was pretty terrible. We ordered

1. fried pork dumplings -- horrid! They were suuuuuper doughy and the pork was extremely unpleasant texture and taste-wise
2. beef with mixed vegetables -- barely edible. The beef itself was slimy and chewy.
3. sesame chicken -- wouldn't recommend. It was fine, but not great.

Overall, extremely disappointing culinary experience. I have a very cheap friend who does NOT waste food, and he found himself unwilling to eat the dumplings or the beef.

I would recommend going to Fu Sing on 176th -- the shrimp egg rolls, chicken and broccoli, and shrimp with mixed vegetables are delicious.

I order from this place a few times a month. They are very quick with delivery and i am always really pleased with my Chinese food!

I love boneless ribs combo platter and this place is top 3 I have every had :) yum

Unquestionably the staff is nice and you get a lot of food for your money.  However, our first order will likely also be our last.  

The sesame noodles had a very gooey consistency but amazingly almost no flavor.  

The spicy garlic eggplant was decent in flavor, but a bit monotonous - not broken up with a single vegetable or texture point so the whole dish is rather soft and gooey.  

Lastly and worst was the sesame bean curd - the tofu was very spongy and just completely swimming in a sesame sauce so sweet that it tasted like eating a jelly donut.  In the large order there were just 3 small pieces of broccoli hiding in the bottom.  

It's edible if you're in a pinch, but from our limited experience I would say that you could do a lot better for cheap Chinese food.
Probably best chinese takeout in the area and a block from me :)

if you're careful in ordering, the food is fine and a bargain.  The house special Mai Fun is my favorite.  the "home made iced tea" excellent, the dumplings fine, the vegetable soup fine.  if you're a regular, the food will always be fresh.  Find your favorite foods and stick to them.the owners couldn't be nicer.

My last three chicken and broccoli orders haven't been as tasty as usual. The sauce was bland and I could taste the fish oil which is a turn-off for me. It also appears the white rice sides are smaller. So I haven't ordered in a while, just thought you should know.
Got delivery from there a couple of times. Then the last couple of times I call, I'm told 13 blocks is too far to deliver. Lame service.
This is by far the best Chinese food take away place I've had. SOOO good and tasty and fresh. If you're new to the neighborhood, you must try!

I thought the food that I ordered, that was thai chicken wings, and green curry were average. My lychee martini was five stars and the best one I've had ever.
I thought the service was pretty good. I was told that since they charged a sur charged fee, if you use credit/debit, I decided to use cash instead to avoid the fee.

The thing that impressed me the most about this restaurant is how beautiful it is. The decorations, from the lighting, and what looks like someone plant a tree in the middle of it. They had a beautiful bench in an area all decorated and dressed up for social media attention. It was really nice inside. They also had outdoor dining, but this particular day was a bit breezy.

The food was just ok. I was expecting more flavor from my green curry. My Thai wings were just crispy chicken, served with sweet chili sauce. Nothing phenomenal.
I will give a thumbs up, the prices are pretty good, my drink was amazing, and they have a really good happy hour deal. Not to mention, my overall experience was not bad, but just ok. HAPPY YELPING!

Ok Guys! I ordered an early take-out dinner  here. I got the Thai noodles w/ vegetarian duck.

This was very tasty  would definitely order this again. I also go the fried dumplings it was different than I expected but ok not really for me.  

Ohhh, I really enjoyed the cold tea at the bar they add some kind of milk to it. It's very very good & for only $4 u can't beat it.

It's in a clear beverage canister.

The place is clean, & clean air. No smelly, smoky restaurant smell like some places.

The prices r fair to be be in NYC.

Transportation: Take A train to last stop W. 207th St / Bway or #1 Train to 207th St & walk up (3) blocks to Bway. It's in Inwood so it's safe enough.

Staff is friendly! It's a beautiful restaurant u can sit in & eat if u like. Large enough to bring a group of ppl indoor & outdoor dining. Enjoy!

I definitely, recommend this spot.
Tasty reliable...just right...makes you smile every time...perfect environment...anytime daytime, evening everyday...*****

I saw the negative reviews and have to say my experience was very different ..as a matter of fact it was so good i called the restaurant to tell them....will definitely order from them again.  also the delivery  was good time-wise and delivered when they said they would..it was yummy for sure

Only been here once, and didn't love it, but I've heard good reviews word of mouth so I'll have to go back and try again.

I ordered a pad thai to go, and it was not a busy night (maybe 2 or 3 tables), they said the wait was around 20 minutes - which is fine - and I asked if it was okay for me to sit outside while I was waiting. I also specifically asked if I should come back in 20 minutes, or if the host would tell me when the order was done. Host said they would tell me when it was ready to pick up.

40 minutes later I go inside to check because it was talking longer than expected, and host was just browsing their phone and says "oh here's your order" and so it had been sitting there I guess for 20 mins.

Once I got home, despite being super hungry, I wasn't impressed with the Pad Thai - it seemed super bland.

A friend told me that they love ordering the drunken noodles, so I guess I'll eventually give this place another shot - but it's not on the top of my list to return.

Mushy, tasteless ribs and inedible pad thai that was overcooked and way too sweet. Ordered delivery -Never
again.

I went to Inwood area to have my bike serviced, so met a friend who lives in the neighborhood. So we decided on Thai food (one of my fav for its distinct spiciness)
We went there for a lunch. Ordered a Tom Yum soup, wished it was spicier. On asking they said I can add the red chilly paste they provide you, that does not do it. But it was tolerable.
Pad Kra Pow and Pad nam prik were our main courses. The dishes were scrumptious and big portion, actually 2 people can eat them. Came with white rice. I had pad nam made spicy but again that Thai kick was not there.
Overall a good place, they do alot of pick n drops so it seems its a popular takeaway spot.
The ride back to Bronx on Fordham road couldnt be more delightful after their food!!!

I ordered from here off grubhub.
Food is hot, fresh, and delicious!

I got pad se ew with beef and panang curry w jazmine rice. So good, thank you!

There is something about the food here that makes it not so yummy at times. I usually get the pad Thai delivered and wish they would just add some more sauce. Too many noodles and not enough coating makes for a dry dish. It hasn't always tasted like this so giving them a 2.5/3. Also, I was on a drunken noodle kick recently and ordered the dish at different Thai restaurants in the neighborhood, including Yummy Thai. Sadly, Yummy Thai's version was the one I liked least. Their pineapple rice is solid, lunch specials are nicely priced and portions generous.
I love the drunken noodles with vegan duck. The vegan duck is plentiful and good protein. It's so delicious. Pad Thai is ok too.

Terrible food. It looked decent when I walked by and it had good reviews. If you expect real food this is not the place; the farmed overcooked salmon came with  a sugary glaze with precooked peas and carrots, even the rice wasn't any good either. I'm giving it two stars because the ambience is nice for sitting with a book or computer for an extended time without bothering anybody (4:30 pm), the music is at a comfortable level, it's relatively quiet inside and the temperature is just right. Good service.
I haven't had this in awhile, they delivered this time. They gave plenty of veggies. I'm glad I gave them another try.

I have ordered from Yummy Thai for years and this was the absolute worst! I ordered a lunch special that was supposed to be delivered by 12:15pm. I went to see if it had arrived at 12:25 and it had not. So I called and was told the delivery driver had just left he will be there shortly. My location is only down the street. I waited patiently for another 20 minutes and called again. Once again I was told he would be there shortly. The delivery was at the corner. I met the delivery person outside and wondered if by now my food was cold. Well, in fact it was. My spring roll was sitting in the sauce of the entree and was soggy, my sticky rice was so sticky that I could not pry it apart with 2 forks. Everything else was cold. Terrible!!!!!!!!!!!
It took an hour to receive an order that was only down the street. Never again.

The rating is for the food, which we have some favorite dishes, but it's hit or miss these days!
Now, for something more important and telling, which is the service and customer services, which is a negative ...

We had a dish,  and the sticky rice was hard. we ate it, but after a few minutes, my wife felt a stomach ache, and a bit nauseous. She ended up vomiting in the bathroom.

Now, we go there somewhat often, and they have seen us before. After she came out the bathroom, we told the two waiters, managers who ever they are named Alfredo and Alonzo.

They dismissed us, and her and just talked about how the sticky rice gets hard (very unclear), and not offering any comments or concern on how she felt.

They totally dismissed her, and offered no comforting or caring words, just a dismissal because they probably felt we weren't going to pay or something.

We will never go there again, especially with staff that are more concerned with the dollar than with customer satisfaction.

Be wary of this people, as an establishment needs to have concern for it's customers, and especially those that have been there before.

Fortunately, she's better, and that's not due to staff concern, because there wasn't any.

Decent Thai food. Good service. It can be hit or miss with the food. My go to orders are the red curry and the drunken noodle. I feel like quality and spice level varies depending on who is working that day. Spring rolls are good but tiny. Tom Yum soup is also really good. It's a cute place to eat at with indoor and outdoor dining. Service is good and I've never been rushed.

This place consistently serves up fragrant, complex dishes and offers plenty of vegetarian options. The drunken noodles, curries and stir fries are all delicious. We usually get takeout, but I have been pleased to see, when I pick up my food, that the host is consistently asking indoor diners for proof of vaccination. Can't wait to dine here in person - I'm just waiting for the numbers to come down a bit.
Underwhelming....everything. Took 40 minutes to get food. Pad Thai was ok. Service was slooooow. Also prices are high for basic Thai food.

Patio dining is great on a nice day and nice happy hour specials before 7pm. Blue Hawaiian had a chemical aftertaste but the pina colada was good and all the food was above average. I'm rooting for this place and I will come back, but service really, really needs improvement. It shouldn't take 20 minutes to get a drink on a quiet weekday.

I've been eating from this spot for years and I've never had a bad experience. The food is always yummy and the drinks are awesome as well. Service is always friendly and the wait is never too long.  Highly recommend.

Lunch time for a party of one in Inwood, Manhattan.  This Thai cafe is conveniently located nearby the A train at 207th Street (last stop in Northern Manhattan).  Lunch special of large shrimp Pad Thai with salad $9.50 was average.  It was very greasy and the portion was small for a platter.  The salad peanut dressing was very bland and insufficient. Oddly, the salad was planted on the same plate as most standard Thai restaurants have serve the salad separately- a individual salad bowl and the Pad Thai in its own noodle bowl.  Straight forward service without any malarkey.  Certainly not authentic Thai cuisine as the food is too sweet.  I overheard the staff (bar tender server, bus boy and female waitress) all speaking Spanish and far remote resembling anything Asian.

This cafe has a bamboo decor with a large photo of a large Buddha with a background of a Buddhist temple, perhaps Wat Sena Sanaram, Ayutthaya?  Tables are align set and filled with Western utensils rather than the traditional Asian utensils and no chopsticks in plain sight.  Chopsticks are available by request only.  Service is average.  Air conditioned environment which was a nice cool down from the blazing humidity and summer's heat.  Tap water is served in mason jars.  While sitting at the bar I noticed a large glass jug of sangria which was enticing but no bits of fresh fruit was embedded.  Takeout menu is available for grabs.

This is the most disgusting food I've ever tasted in my life!
Shame to keep such a restaurant, not knowing the elementary Thai cuisine!

I love this place! Hands down a great vibe all around. Before covid it was great, during covid it's been great, hopefully for many years to come it continues to be great! Everyone inside Yummy Thai thanks for always making my food, drinks and welcome always great!

One of the worst Thai food I've ever had. I ordered the chicken wings ( 6 in order)were all partial burnt and had only a little flavor. the shrimp rolls (3 included in order) were also partially burnt and had oily. The pad Thai didn't have vegetables, limited flavor, and the vegetarian duck was overdone. I'm paused bc I just spent $37 on such bad food. I want my money back. This is not the first disappointing order I had delivered since COVID started but this pissed me off so much that I had to write this bad review bc I'm pissed. People work hard to spend their money at restaurants that should not be lazy and do better.

Got some food delivered a few days ago and it was ok. The drunken noodles were solid, but the basil chicken was boring. The mango sticky rice was ok. I would definitely order the noodles again, and try something else.

Solid food - not memorable, but will be just fine if you're in the mood for Thai and are in the area. They also have affordable, kitschy cocktails which are perfect for a summer's day. A good amount of outdoor seating and not super crowded. Clean bathrooms too!
Lousy food. Bad service. Fried stuff was incredibly greasy. Waited forever for service, and it wasn't even busy. Go somewhere else.

I've been getting takeout from here constantly throughout the Covid pandemic.

Solid Thai food when craving noodles and Thai.

Some of my favorites are the pineapple fried rice (I always add shrimp), coconut shrimp, pad thai, and their Thai iced tea.

On occasions I also order the lychee Thai iced tea and add vodka to it (thank me later).

There is also outside dining and last night when I went to pick up my dinner (order) server said they are preparing for indoor dining next week.  

Thank you for the workers and cooks for feeding me through out the pandemic.

The service is hit or miss depending on who your get.  There was nothing bad about it, but some are better than others.  The food comes out fresh and piping hot which is nice.  The flavors however, are more sweet than spicy or complex.  It lacks the nuance and depth of traditional Thai cuisine.  The Thai iced tea was excellent.  Having said that, I'm willing to try it again to see if other dishes are better.  The decor is very nice, and clean, with an almost Disney like Thai inspiration.   All in, it might be an Americanized version of Thai food, and a fair one at that.  I'll be interested to see if it gets better as I'm willing to try it again.

The delivered food is equally good as the table service food. The drunken noodles are always good. I tried their coconut soup for the first time, no diss appointment. The delivery was 10 minutes ahead of schedule. Full stars from me.

I work a few doors down and I can say this place is steadily declining. Lunch special drunken noodles with shrimp had literally 3 large size shrimp in it. Not even jumbo like the Chinese stores (who also give you 4). And I paid an extra 1.50 instead of if I just got chicken like I normally do- which come with a lot of meat. Then whatever seasonings they used on the noodles were clearly not cooked long enough because they tasted almost gritty (that mouthfeel of raw curry). And my spring roll was greasy. Don't think I'll be returning here for some time.

Deeply mediocre Thai food. Won't go again. Basil fried rice was too heavy and dense, too salty. Kalamari was "eh". Thai fried rice with shrimp had little shrimp with all the shells still on, and super pain to get off. Beef satay was ok, but seemed like it had been pre-cooked then heated up. Whole order was ready super fast, which makes one wonder about the extent to which they individually cook your order. Maybe other dishes are better? But prices are not super cheap, so I felt obligated to post a review, since to my mind you don't get what you pay for here.

This bowl of iceberg lettuce with a few shrimp tossed in was $14. Do you see how sad this dish looks? Tastes just as sad.

2 stars instead of just 1 because the food was delivered immediately (I mean duh, it probably took 32 seconds to toss shrimp onto some lettuce), and I didn't die from food poisoning. so, thanks.

Giving it three stars because I felt that the service lacked. Very straight forward service, no checking in really.

However, the food is flavorful and fresh. Also the prices are very reasonable. We paid around $45 for an appetizer, 2 drinks and our entrees which to me is very good, especially in Manhattan.

The ambiance is great too, feels very tropical and trendy.

I'd come back whenever we crave Thai.

Good food - good service.

We had for appetizers:
Chicken wings - great.
Chicken Dumplings - good.
Edamame - Good

Entrees:
Shrimp Pad tai - over cooked shrimp. Need more flavor
Chicken fried rice - chicken needed cooked better. Had large piece of tomatoes??
spoiled food! out of patience!!! the rama's peanut sauce so done. lost a customer. im eyepopping at the 5 star reviews.

Way better Thai anywhere else- don't waste your time. Noodles were overcooked. But good price for a lunch special and service was very speedy for a weekday lunch. However, I would definitely try all the other Thai places in ny before going back.

Authentic Thai food , great taste and lunch menu price reasonable..
I will most definitely be back..
I think the food is fine but I was not thrilled to hear Christian music on the sound system. This is a Thai restaurant. It is not a place to proselytize.

Let me say this place is a DECENT spot to come into. I came in here the other day and it was basically empty; from the seats to the tables.
We were immediately greeted by a waitresses who sat us a the first table underneath the golden tree and gave us or menus.

The food took a while to come out, even though they were empty. Even after ordering an appetizer. There was a lag between entree arrivals which was a little weird. It wasn't much interaction between our server and us (like checking in, if everything's okay, only when the food was being dropped off).

My company enjoyed their chicken curry puffs, loved the flakiness of the pastry and the sauce that accompanied it; you also get three BIG puffs. I had gotten the drunken noodle and while it was a bit greasy, it was filling. The other plate was pineapple fried rice with beef, which they enjoyed as well.

Overall it's okay. Not the best Thai food NY has to offer but the most cost effective, especially if you catch them for their lunch special.

Walked into the place 45 minutes ago places an order for 2 items... still nothing... Had to ask the hostess at the front how much longer before the order was ready, at this point it seemed like an I reasonable amount of time for a half empty restaurant to take. It did look like a good amount of delivery orders were coming in as bags kept coming out of the kitchen and being placed all around. ANYWAY, my order had actually been sitting on a table right behind us with two other bags. The hostess saw this, once she bothered to look and took all three bags to the back said to me "let me get your order" brought the same three bags back out and gave me mine, it was obvious that this was an attempt to cover up the error as the bag was cold and when I asked if my order had been sitting there the entire time she just said thanks have a good night. Total disregard for the customer and the screw up. Instead of owning it she tried to cover it up and deceive us... horrible service and practice.  Thank you next, there are many other Thai places folks... We deserve better, we are paying for a service and do not deserve to be lied to. Check on your order when you order to take out here unless you want cold food too. SMDH

Update, got home ready to reheat my food and I see that they also packed the food horribly... sauces were place under the satay chicken and completely spilled in the bag, we are now left with dry chicken.. what a huge disappointment that I had to pay for!
This place is amazing!  My food was delicious and the service was excellent, So comfortable.

As the only Thai restaurant in Inwood* (read footnote below, though, for caveats), Yummy Thai has a market cornered. The food is OK, but it's definitely dependent on salt gimmicks. My "traditional" Thai chicken was pretty horrible. The noodle dishes are reliable, if not stellar.

Why 2 stars? The logistics are off, as many others have said. It takes forever to get your order taken, to get your order -- entrees brought out separately for two people rather than the same time, too! -- to get your check, to get your water refilled, you name it. With so many new places opening up, why bother settling?

* If you're too lazy to get up to the Bronx or down a little to Wash Heights, then yeah, this is the "only" place around. If you're like me and willing to do the 15-minute subway ride somewhere else, then you'll help generate the necessary economic pressure to get Yummy Thai into more acceptable shape.

Delivery order: Thai salad was mostly iceberg lettuce. Tamarind Duck special was greasy, rubbery and had very little taste. I have a hunch it was deep fried in old oil, even though it is supposed to be roasted. It's too bad, because I used to eat there for lunch and it was good. Also have had some reasonably good tasting delivery orders from them over the years, but not lately.

UPDATE: The next day I cut off the breading (it was definitely deep fried) and the fat and put the sliced duck on top of a green salad. It was actually delicious, so I have added a second star.

So sad waste of a half of $100 shrimp was burnt food taste like it was from day before I would never order from this place again I feel disrespected I threw the food away it's not about the the money sending burnt food an old vegetables not only was it disrespectful to me it was disrespectful to the Thai culture The cook should be fired please beware when ordering takeout check out these gross pictures

Wow I mean the quality has really gone down hill.  I ordered with my coworkers some take out. It was five of us and none of us liked our food.  They must have a new cook.  Also the person who took my order sounded like a child and had no idea what she was doing.  Very unprofessional. Food bad. Service okay. Professionalism poor.

Let me start with my disclaimer than I am a huge Asian food snob, I am Chinese and used to live in the part of Los Angeles that was known for yummy Asian food from all the Asian countries. Unfortunately, the Asian food in the Washington Heights area has disappointed me time after time but I always have hope and continue on my search. I also used to be a fat girl who has turned skinny and speak in terms of calories that are worth or not worth consuming.

I ordered delivery from Yummy Thai to feed one of my late night cravings for something salty. I ordered the spring rolls, the steamed vegetables, pad thai and the papaya salad. I used the YELP eat24 app and was able to google a $2 off coupon. Always google for a coupon when ordering delivery on this app!

The food was delivered before the guaranteed time and the portions were decent sized.
