Somehow New York and Los Angeles classify their egg/spring rolls differently because in LA spring rolls are NOT fried but in New York they are! It was to my disappointment that my spring rolls were fried instead of rolls with soft rice paper. If you speak the LA lango, these are EGG ROLLS!

The steamed vegetables were just as described. No flavoring added nor wanted.

The papaya salad came in a generous portion yet was not as flavorful as others I have experienced. The "dressing" should have been more generous to soak up the flavors. I usually LOVE papaya salad and eat it till i'm practically licking the dish. This one was meh.

The pad thai was something else! I expect medium thick saucy noodles whenever I think of pad thai. Yummy thai's pad thai consisted of thin noodles similar to vermicelli that were dry rather than pad thai saucy. It lacked flavor and was definitely not worth the calories. I threw away the $11 pad thai because calories are precious and should be consumed eating something yummy. Byeeee carbs!

It's really nothing to write home about and the food is sub-par. My husband and I ordered Pad Thai and Green Curry. Both dishes lacked flavor. While the prices aren't bad, the location is great, and the service was good, the food won't be bringing us back.

This place needs wayyyyy more stars!! I was skeptical because of the rather low rating but yummy Thai blew me out of the water!

I will admit, this is probably not very authentic Thai food... Doesn't mean it's not delicious! We had the seafood kra-prow and the emperor duck and they were both equally delicious.

I love the ambiance of this place! Beautiful decor, including a fake tree in the center wrapped in lights. Had a good drink selection although I didn't try any.

I can't wait to come back to Yummy Thai and try more dishes!

Cute outdoor seating but I don't think the cooks are Thai. We should have known when the menu didn't use any Thai names for the soups or entrees. The Thai iced tea was good but I couldn't finish any of what we got: tom kha and Tom yum soups, papaya salad, and chili basil stir fry. The staff were friendly and service was good.
The best !! Great efficient service!! Always order via Grubhub. Delicious food, best noodles in Inwood NY

Butch very helpful
Carrot cake is always there
Ritz with chocolate

There but for the grace of god go I

Best store ever they have every single thing you need from beers to Canday to snacks to all type of sandwiches, Panini wraps, solids on all kind of top sandwiches and tacos and they open to 2 am  in the morning

My egg & cheese with bacon on a roll was so nicely done I ate half & the other half I ate it at home, that was the best egg,cheese bacon sandwich I've had in years & I grew up in the heights all my life. This is an awesome place to buy whatever you want.
Good food, don't listen to all the shit this ppl talking about this guys are clean, fast and best of all- OPEN 24/7

Close deli that just opened up...clean, the guy making the sandwiches was nice, delivery was relatively quick, good food. I'll definitely order from here again. Wish they sold beer though...maybe they eventually will.

I come here often. First, the staff there informed me that they have a fully halal menu, which is a huge plus.

Main reason for 5 stars: staff is friendly and will make you whatever you want. They had a good selection of snacks and drinks as well. They work pretty quickly and are fairly priced.

Items I've tried:

Cheeseburger: very solid, juicy.

Chicken parm on a hero: decent, if you want the cutlet as a whole piece instead of cut up, let them know in advance.

Lamb and chicken over rice: arguably the best I've had in NYC, especially with their white sauce. Great portions as well.

Buffalo wings: very solid option

Curly fries: very solid

Steak burrito: super fresh and very filling

Pastrami egg and cheese: decent, a little too salty
I bought this chocolate cheesecake for my wife. She noticed all the mild when I brought it home.

The new place poped up in neighborhood. They are delivery bakery and grocery also. Delivery is on time. Food was ok. Western omellette was fine. Italian panini was a bit salty but ok. Onion ring was nothing special. Don't be respect that much for this price but fair enough.

I know I can brew my own coffee at home, but I still choose to come here every morning (and afternoon) instead because I LOVE this place. All their staff are soooo friendly and courteous, and it's a clean and welcoming environment! Their hot food is delicious and I've tried tons of things off the menu, from French toast and egg sandwiches to the custom salads, paninis, and halal options. Nothing has ever disappointed me! They offer hot soup in the winter which is always delicious and scalding hot. Yum.
Also, they're dog friendly and let me bring my boy in on our walks, which is INCREDIBLY helpful when out running errands :)
The turkey bacon on my sandwich was very dark and chewy. The bread was hard to bite through at times. Not sure if I'm returning.

Nasty service from the grill man always getting mad at someone when you point out his mistake also they look out for people with money so that could charge you more money for food that the next man would pay less for and the foods old they'll still use to make a buck
I made the mistake of coming here today and found out that no one wears masks! So disappointing! I used to like the selection and the cleanliness here, but I won't be coming back.
This is our go to takeout place! Delivery is the fastest I've ever experienced! The food is always great and we love their beet juice!!!!
If you want good quality food come here my boy is steph curry with the pot a never miss I recommend the chicken parm

After walking across Highbridge we came over here to get some food. Couldn't eat in because we had our pooch with us.

Food was excellent! We had pernil with beans and rice, a half a chicken, more beans and rice, and some maduros. Very good. Service at the counter was a bit crazy and we had to wait for the maduros. Good spot for fresh, cheap Dominican food. I'd visit again.
This is a pretty low key, but nice place. They can serve a reasonably good lunch portion for not that much, hot and good food.

the food is always fresh and the prices are fair.  they have lunch and dinner portions. the staff is pleasant.  i have tried almost everything on the menu and haven't been disappointed. But my favorite is the Bistec y cebolla con arroz blanco.

BEWARE: These folks will rip you off lovely if you don't speak Spanish.

The space is small and not well utilized. 3, four tops awkwardly take up more than half of the front entryway.  This place gets packed so you're constantly moving over to let people in and out of the store.

There is a hot food display with a vast display of offerings. Think - pernil, stewed chicken, rotisserie, yuca, stewed beef..the regular suspects

Ordering up front is a bit difficult as the line shifts constantly due to the store's set up. There were some unsavory men up front so I ended up moving towards the back and discovered the takeout counter which also doubles as a the sole register.

I ordered:  

1/2 rotisserie chicken (white meat) $4.50

Small Chicharrone de pollo sin hueso w/tostones - $9.50

Small pernil with yellow rice and peas - $11.50

Chinola juice - $2.50

Total with tax was $32.50

Food is good but as I waited for my order the (chicharrones took forever) I perished their menu. The woman who took my order upped the pricing by $0.50 - $1 for each order, including the drink

Again, the food is good but the hassle of getting it is not worth it. Nothing over the top great here. Between being jipped and having to grip your purse while you wait..

I'll pass.

If you black walk on by this  joint, they DONT KNOW THEY BLACK, RACIST, they Make you wait ON PURPOSE LIKE YOUR MONEY AINT GREEN!  And old females look really ugly!!! Lml beside that get the spaghetti with bacalao.

Great local Spanish restaurant. So far most of the good I've ordered from here have always been delicious! Flavorful, seasoned just right.... the meats, the rice, the beans..... everything is delicious. But it's more of take home restaurant, it is not big enough to accommodate several tables. It only has 2 or 3 tables. But hey pick up your great food and enjoy it at home.

Just finished eating lunch here, I went with Roasted Chicken and Fried chicken with White rice and beans. Everything was delicious! Super fresh and the Roasted chicken was one of the best I've tried. Def coming back to try there other items

The Best of the Best! If you're searching for authenticity in Hispanic/Latino cuisines this is the place to go! I don't think you'll find a place any better that isn't providing a fast food ambiance. Yoly's provide the diner feel with the right music playing to give you the ultimate dining experience.
Raised their prices significantly and added tax. Aside from that, the women ignore you when you walk in and start taking other ppls orders. I guess you have to be Spanish for them to care.
Amazing Dominican food, I highly recommend. Best rice and beans in the Bronx!! Can't beat the prices.

Food is great, prices are reasonably, and I live walking distance which is why I give it four stars. However, I don't go often unless I'm with my boyfriend who is Dominican and speak Spanish due to the fact they overlook people who don't speak Spanish. I am Afro-Latina but, my Spanish sucks.

At first glance, Yoly is an assuming place that doesn't really strike the eye - just another Dominican spot in the bronx, tucked away in an enclave that is only really frequented by folks who work and live in the area.

I walked in, contemplated some of the dishes behind the counter, asked senora what she'd recommend - the pork, which stays off my fork - so I went with the chicken which was in some kind of sauce with green bell peppers (I ordered in spanish and wasn't able to catch what kind of sauce it was), along with rice and beans. After grabbing a glass of water, I took a seat at one of the three tables.

The food absolutely hit the spot. Had been working all day, and this happened to be my first substantive meal, so maybe that partially explains my reaction. But wow - the meal was wholesome, the chicken was tender and the sauce was fantastic - met the rigorous flavor demands of someone raised on the savory punch of south asian cuisine. Not to mention the fact that everything came out to $5.

Also, for being a small, local joint, Yoly has a great vibe. Bachata plays softly in the background, interspersed with shrieks from kids cooling off with a fire hydrant and friendly exchanges between regulars and the staff. I had planned on only stopping by to take a short break from work, but ended up lingering over my meal, inhaling the flavor of the food and the setting. For cheap Dominican food, this is as good as it gets
Great food, fair prices, the authentic taste takes me back home to the Island of Dominican Republic.

The food here is really amazing and also affordable. Every time we get hungry or come from church, we scooch over here and get a small plate. But dont let the word small fool you, its actually very filling and could potentially feed 2 people. Craving some stew chicken rn actually

I always order from home, usually when I call they already have my address connected to my phone, in that way I save time telling them my address. Today I got white rice, red beans, and stew chicken. It was delivered at a timely manner.

Went there for the first time around 5pm, they were out of yuca, and yellow rice. I had the beef stew and the salted fish. It wasn't all that, there's plenty of Spanish food in the Bronx this place is pretty average in comparison.

This place is really lodged in a corner. I had passed by it many times, but never took the time to look until a friend told me to meet her there. As I've stated before, I am Dominican but do not eat Dominican food often. But I could not help myself here. The great smell roamed the restaurant in circles, approached me and continued to tap dance inside my nose until I ordered!! lol. I asked the server what was her favorite dish and she told me... Chicken w/ a side of Berenjena (Egg Plant) sauced in the Beans and White Rice. I had to have it! It was sooooo goood, it reminded me of my aunts in Los Mameyes in DR cooking it up! Delicious!

My next visit I had the same but added avocado... I add avocado to almost everything. The food is really good here and I might have to eat Dominican food more often, especially here. Miguelina's up the block (University Ave.) is good too but I feel their going to kill me with the excess oil. Not the case here. Just right!

Little Spot but With a Big Kick... I Highly Recommend
Love this restaurant they have the best chicken and picnic around great eating. They've been here for years, and the prices are very good.

The food for the most part is very good. What I don't appreciate is that if you aren't a male and aren't Dominican the women who work there tend to overlook you. I don't look Hispanic but I speak it so when I go in they try to take care of someone who looks and speaks Spanish before me. I resent that. It shouldn't matter whether I speak their language as long as I have money to pay.

Traveled waaaaayyyy uptown to help the dedicated teachers and staff of P.S. 204 repaint their school cafeteria and generally clean up the place.  When it was time for lunch they all recommended this place and after seeing the other choices (typical chinese food and a string of fast food chains), there was really no competition.  But we never imagined it would be so delicious!
We walked into this packed, tiny, deli-esque place and felt as if we had traveled to the Dominican Republic - the woman in line behind us had to translate our order to the person behind the counter.  They have tons of extremely delicious and authentic, if unidentifiable to the untrained eye, foods on the hot line, but they also have a regular menu which no one seems to pay any attention to anyway.  We sort of made up our order by getting two cuban-type sandwiches, a side of plantains, and a delicious something that we never could figure out - something like yucca, fennel, cream, garlic, and lots of other stuff.
Everyone was unbelievably friendly, the food came out extremely fast, there was tons of it, and our meals plus two cans of soda cost a total of $10 plus a $3 tip.  
My first trip to the Bronx: entirely worth it, even if I hadn't been fulfilling a compulsive need to volunteer.
A small Dominican restaurant (hole in the wall), good for when your looking for a alternative from the usual fast-food places that dominate this neighborhood. Good bang for your buck.

I work just one block away from El Yoli I'm Dominican myself so I know when food is good or not the food is on point well seasoned cooked to perfection as soon as you step in this small restaurant you can smell and savor everything. You leave this restaurant completely satisfy and the price is very very good for $6-$7 you can have what they call a "lonche" aka lunch which is good for one person and extremely fulfilling. The only downfall is how small this place is and how crowded it can get by lunch time there's only 3 tables and my first time going here I had to share my table with a cab driver who was extremely fresh! I rather order or take out instead of staying in.

One of the best Dominican food i have ever had. I'm Dominican and i am very picky when it comes to my Dominican food. This place looks like a hole in a wall but the food is on point. I used to live in this neighborhood and i still travel all the way to this restaurant when im craving some good Dominican food. Not only is this restaurant's food good but its also pretty cheap.

This was the spot for my uncles who were cab drivers a few years back their food is on point well seasoned the small capacity has become a concern because now you sit in a table with strangers and you have that odd feeling .the atmosphere is ok bit noise level is through the roof is a cab driver gossip place
I live near this spot so I am used to the lazy staff, but if if you really want a great rotisserie chicken then this place is a must. It's hood but it's good.
The food is good but not great and the people tend to be a little rude. Their smoothies though are excellent like you taste the flavors perfectly and it's just to die for.

They are rude. Disrespectful and can't get an order right for there lives and in top of that they make the choice for you of what you want. Especially the old man. He's a sexes. Wouldn't buy anything from this store again.
Came in on a nice rainy Saturday. Quick service and yummy light broth roasted duck soup. Atmosphere was very modern and chill. Would pay another visit back here

Went here thinking it was Tipsy Shanghai, and although it wasn't the restaurant I was expecting, it was still delicious. The waiters were attentive, and at 5:45 there were only a few tables there. By the time we left, they were pretty busy (especially for a Wednesday night!).

It's an cute spot with lots of booth seating and regular chairs. The aesthetic is very clean. We got a few different types of dumplings and the food other tables got looked delicious. I really liked that the soup dumplings were served with ginger. It made the otherwise very savory dumplings delish!

They didn't rush you out and they take your order digitally, so getting the check is a breeze.

Stumbled into this newly opened restaurant a few weeks ago and have already returned twice! This place won't be a secret for long, so I definitely recommend you visit soon for their fabulous dumplings, pea pod stems with garlic, shredded pork and a variety of noodle dishes. The folks running the place are lovely and helpful negotiating the menu. We love it!
A legendary spot that fully lives up to the reputation! Tamales were absolutely amazing and the prices were great. We got one of each and were not disappointed. By the 145th 1 stop NE corner
Lovely woman, amazing tamales. A few different options including chicken, beef and vegetarian. Really enjoyed the queso + jalapeño.

GOD BLESS Yolanda & her tamales!
When I first moved to this area, I saw her on the map. So I went out looking for a restaurant named Yolanda's Tamales.
Never found it bc Yolanda's Tamales is a tiny stand outside the 137th subway. This little stand is on the map though! That's when you know they're good.

I was worried after reading an earlier report that Yolanda was no longer actively selling, but I texted her and she confirmed she is there every day except Wednesdays.  Such good tamales - I bought 20 so I can have a good supply in the freezer.

I don't like to be the bearer of bad news but when I walked down Broadway this Friday afternoon between 136th and 138th Streets, Yolanda's was nowhere to be found. When I called the number listed on here for them there was no answer.  It's rather hard to be optimistic at this point
I order thru the web page, I got the best tamales I had in NYC, great service and not expensive at all!! Support small businesses
So, so good. Got one cheese and one frijole. Surprisingly spicy, so delicious. Found a new addiction.

After reading all of these reviews, I just had to find you and have you vetted by my personal Oaxacan. The outcome: The only thing that would make this any more authentic is fresh ground corn from Mexico.

"Yolanda," you are legit.

She is by 137th, but also by 145th in the afternoons (thanks, JJ). My personal favorites are the puerco, pollo, and Oaxacaqueño (whenever they are around).  The flavors and spices are amazing. My office is actually forming a pool so that we can clean her out and leave some in our office freezer for a rainy day.

Amazing. Authentic. She's the nicest person too.

I get a tamale or two whenever I see her around. They're always warm and always $1.00.

Yolanda's tamales are the best. Real authentic flavors.  I love them and she's so nice :-)

I've never had a complaint nor issue with my purchase.  Sometimes she does have a line but it's definitely worth the wait.

So good!!! Got my dad hooked too so i have to get him a big bag every time he visits from jersey.  He loves the ones that are Nice and spicy, but i always get the mild ones cause i can't handle the spice

I rarely post reviews, but for Yolanda, I'll make an exception. I've lived in the neighborhood for a few years now, and without fail, ANY time I see Yolanda out and I have cash on me, I will buy a few tamales. They're delicious, super reasonably priced even after the recent increase to $1.50 each, and she's so nice.

I usually see her on the NE corner of 145th & Broadway, but I think she's also by the 137th stop sometimes. Definitely pick some up if you see her out there! I recommend the cheese or spicy pork.

Yolanda is a doll. I asked her to cater a party at my office and she did it perfectly. I love to grab a tamale and get on the 1 train.
The only reason for the 4 stars is because my mom and family make tamales all the time and I know how good they can truly be. She's making them for the public, but for the average Joe, not Jose, they are great.

Let's talk about Yolanda and her tamales.

The idea:
I know next to nothing about tamales. I understand what they are, but have never tasted them. I saw the reviews for Yolanda's Tamale Stand, and was interested. $1.50 for a tamale sounds great!

The ordering experience:
I ordered a spicy chicken tamale, which Yolanda recommended (She said "Spicy better"). Then she quickly added "Dos?" And I was like "Ehhhh why not?" As she puts the tamales in the tin foil she adds "Tres?" And I laughed at how hard she was up selling. Good for her.

The tamales themselves:
My first impression was disappointment there wasn't more meat. The spice level wasn't that spicy, but I overall enjoyed it. The more I ate, the less I enjoyed the tamale. I should have just ordered one. The chicken seemed more like canned chicken than fresh. Kind of rubbery and a mix of white and dark meat, but the corn and spicy sauce was good!

Overall:
Re-reading my review, I seem harsh, but the product was good. Maybe just recommend either not getting the chicken, or maybe that's just what tamales taste like! Definitely worth checking out.

Holy shit.
I'm sorry for my crassness, but the expletive was only way to convey my true feelings. I honestly didn't even like my previous experiences with things labeled as tamales, but based on these yelp reviews (and the $1.50 price tag - come on!!) I decided to give it a try. Again, holy shit. Soooo delicious! I couldn't eat it fast enough, and again up to this point I had never even liked tamales. I am now a believer!

Treat yourself - try Yolanda. If you live anywhere on the west side it would honestly even be worth a subway ride uptown (or down). It's. That. Good.
Best  tamales ever, they are always so fresh and tasty. Also the atole is great. She is very nice and attentive I will buy whenever i'm on my way to school and cash in my pocket.

I love visiting Yolanda when I get off the 137th st 1 subway!! Her tamales are as good as they get, they're hot & fresh & SO affordable. And Yolanda is the cutest, nicest lady. She'll brighten your day.

Her name is not Yolanda but who cares. These Tamales are the most authentic Mexican specialty in New York, I dare to say even in the United States. The only way to compare her artwork is to go to Mexico and eat some Tamales. But if you don't want to go to Mexico, then Mexico has come to you in the  form of Yolanda.
We just had Yolanda's tamales for the first time and they were awesome. We're from Texas and these were as good as any we've ever had. $1.50 per.

If you're up in West Harlem, be sure to stop by Yolanda's Tamales. These tamales are the best in New York hands down! At only $1 a piece, you can't find a more delicious and affordable deal in town. If you call ahead Yolanda's Tamales will also deliver. Perfect for a brunch party. Yolanda is back in her original location at 3380 Broadway on the North East corner of 137th Street and Broadway just outside of the uptown 1 Train subway stop.

Lives up to the hype! I've been meaning to check out Yolanda's tamales for a week now because of all the great Yelp reviews, but even though I ride the 1 train every day at 145th I only spotted her just yesterday right outside the station with her distinctive blue cooler. I finally bought 2 spicy tamales today for dinner, and I am not disappointed. Now, I nowhere near consider myself a tamale expert, but these are definitely some very delicious bites of tender chicken, soft dough, and fragrant seasoning. My expectations were not low after reading all these glowing reviews, and Yolanda met them. For $1.50 each this is truly a great value of a meal. I actually didn't eat the tamales until 4 hours after I bought them, and they were still warm and fresh! At this point I feel as though it looks like I've been paid to write this review, but my taste buds are honest and my wallet is guilt-free. For such a cheap price, even if you don't love the taste as much as I do, what have you got to lose by trying one for yourself?

She's moved to 145th and Broadway on the N.E. corner.

Still $1. Still so good. So friendly. Best tamales I've had.

Nothing else to say!
The tamales were really good and truly authentic. Plus it's a great deal at $1.50 each. Talk about good fast food!

We felt like secret agents trying to find Yolanda! Turns out she was the super nice smiling lady subtly on the corner with a giant cooler. As we cautiously approached her, she beckoned us closer and opened the cooler....revealing a giant bag full of tamales! So cheap and yummy! Definitely need more than one per person to be full. All delicious but the spicy chicken is the BEST! Best bang for your buck.

Pros:
- Cheap! $1.00
- She stands with her cart on the corner of Broadway and 137th near the entrance to the 1 train at the City College 137th stop

Cons:
- None.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

My Experience:

You're rushing to the train in the morning to work or school? Didn't have time to eat breakfast before you left the house?  No time to stand in line at a bodega to have a quick meal made? Not to worry. Yolanda is here! She stands in the corner with her cart on Broadway between 137th & 138th with Tamales already made warm and ready for you to eat for only $1.00 ... you can't complain about that! It's easy, convenient, good and cheap. It's worth the 5 star for the $1 you pay.

Hungry? Broke? Craving something hot & full of flavor?

Yolanda's $1 Tamales to the rescue!

Cheap, delicious, filling & served with a smile- these tamales are perfect for a quick snack, a filling meal (after all, one is never enough) or a party.

I didnt know that a tamale could change my life.  Find this woman and buy a tamale, or three, from her right now.  Spicy chicken is what was recommended to me, and I can't disagree.  I can't wait to try her other types.  Corner of 145th and Broadway.  Enjoy!

The best tomales I've ever eaten. Also, the only tamales I've ever eaten. So they are also the worst tamales I've ever eaten. But, I really liked them, so I emphasize the best part more than the worst part
Bomb TAMALES!!!! Coming from a small little cooler cart, these will blow you away. Real authentic food.

I've been going to her for almost a decade. She used to be by city college 1 train (137st). Now, she's by the 145 1 train. Only 1.50$ each and amazingly delicious. Plus, she is a sweetheart and always smiling. :)

We used to live right down the street from her, and her tamales were our almost daily staple. Then we had to move to Astoria, and we really missed her and her tamales all these years, even in food-rich Astoria. Nothing compares, and the frozen tamales from Trader Joes are utterly poor substitutes. Her tamales were always a hit at parties too. We are looking to move back to Harlem, and found that she has 5 stars, and I had to pitch in. It's true. We will be getting her tamales again when we move back.
I'm Mexican. I grew up eating tamales. These are the real deal. Amazing. Like crack. Yolanda is my woman.
SIX STARS!!!! Yolanda is a gift from God and her tamales are the best I've ever tasted.   I'm now buying from her at least once each week, if not more.

Best tamales I have found in the states. I have spent months in Mexico and these are the real deal. I tad spicy for people with bland palates but I love them. Her cart and her are hard to spot since they are so small, but find her and you will be rewarded. Forget McDonalds, this is the original homemade fast food.

Great tamales and friendly service. I grab them morning and night as I get on and off the subway.  Being a native Texan living in the Northeast, good Mexican food has been hard to find.  Yolanda's hits the spot!
I stop to get these delicious tamales often.  They are sold right when I exit the Subway going home, so easy to get one and go. Always spot on!

I just love her tamales, they're very delicious, and they have saved the day many times when I come home hungry and without intentions of cooking. I also love the fact that she's right by the subway station.
AMAZING! I love this lady. I order 45 tamales for my last new years party and they were a total hit! I order from her again and again
Great food.  Of course don't let the shopping cart and cooler throw you.  Every friend and family I got these for gave it 100%.  Buy 10, eat 2-3, freeze the rest for later.

My brother, Greg, brought tamales from Yolanda's Tamales to my birthday party a few years ago and I do have to say they are some of the best tamales I've ever had. Growing up in Southern California, we use to get tamales for Christmas and I think these might be better. Yolanda's tamales are made with good corn meal dough and are nice and spicy. I think I am going to have to take a trip up to West Harlem before this Christmas holiday.

Does anyone know where Yolanda has moved with her Tamales. I walk everyday to Broadway and 137th near the entrance to the 1 train to look for her and she is no where in site. Please let me know where she has moved to.

Yolanda made 60 tamales for my party with just one day notice. I was a little nervous to just order and pick up without any kind of receipt or guarantee, but everything worked seamlessly--and the tamales were amazing. Will definitely order again.

Cash only. Very friendly service. Food was good, price was decent.

As a heads up there's no seating.

Food is a great price for large portions and it's all made to order! The staff is very friendly and attentive. I got the orange chicken combo which was $9.25 including tax and it came with an egg roll and fried rice. It was still steaming when I got back to my apartment! I live nearby and will definitely be back

Food is good and the price is right.
They deliver quickly and they are always pleasant and friendly.

Not bad at all. The kids had fried shrimp and fries. I had  shrimp fried rice with no egg. My wife had garlic chicken. Based on the reviews here, this place was my second or third choice. I am only a block away from this place. The family and I started walking towards our first choice Chinese Restaurant, Splendid China. We then met with a dead end at West 155th St. New here, on vacation. We came back to our block and went inside Yong Sheng. The lobby is very small. There is no eat-in. The lady who took our order was very nice and made sure she understood what we needed by repeating and writing it. The foods were prepared in a timely manner. They were placed in a bag with extra plates and utensil. The kids eat with no issues. This was good for a guy who have not eaten Chinese food in a very long period of time, 8 years to be exact.

So this will def. be my new go-to for Chinese Food take out. It's not one of those point-and-scoop spots, there is some preparation done after you order which means it just tastes fresher.

They deliver or you can pick up and the prices are very reasonable. We got the sesame chicken combo with noodles, and dumplings. All were good.

Oh and PS they had an 'A' rating on their door....so that helps.

quick friendly and tasty ! Will order from them Again soon keep saying it again and again good food not sure how much I gotta type before my review will be accepted by help. But my review of them will not be so good

decent hood chinese food.   Although the rice was tasteless...and they still serve in styrofoam.  tacky...but im ure they dont care because the neighborhood will always support them.  2 stars because they are convenient and the food is filling
Got the General Tso chicken combo, wonton soup, and broccoli with garlic sauce. All DELICIOUS! Generous servings that'll feed 2-3 people.
Solid neighborhood Chinese food, including some good options beyond the "fast food" classics. Friendly service, good prices, good portion sizes. Cash only.

Yong Sheng isn't bad, at least as far as the food goes. Its right across the street so it tends to be more of a convenience thing, than anything else. They do not deliver, so ordering (unless by phone) and picking up is frantic mess.
   You walk into a space thats like 8 by 6, and its always packed with loud, rude people (typically youngins). They're all yelling and making jokes at the Asians expense. Don't get me wrong, Im all for a good, tasteful, racial joke. But these people aren't even funny, just ill-mannered, rude, and crass. I feel sorry for the employees, because you can see that they are pissed, and that if they didn't need the business, they'd karate chop their asses out of the store. Oh well, what're you gonna do?
   The good thing is, that the lady who normally works the phone and window recognizes me (probably helps that Im one of the few white patrons), so as soon as I walk in she hands me my food and Im out.
Their wings are hearty and good. Chix szechuan is good (I do extra veggies). Dont do the fried fish, too fishy.
If you are in the area, Jin Hui might be a better option.

Really fast delivery. Regardless of who delivers I live in a 5th floor walk up and they are always so friendly when I open my door. And very grateful. I can't say the same about the lady who answers the phone. There's two of them - ones very patient, courteous and attentive. The other one is rude, dismissive and impatient. I hate giving her my order because immediately hangs up the phone without all proper information being relayed. Food is 6/10.
it was ok , i mean the only things were that the rice tasted like nothing needed salt & the chicken was just bones . The delievery guy was pretty nice though.

This place is my savior. it is my oasis in a sea of crap food in upper harlem. The fried dumplings are awesome and the noodle dishes are great, though i have to ask for no msg here so i dont get a headache.

Cash only. avoid general tsos chicken, not crispy enough.

Sorry to disagree.

But I am not a fan of Yang's (present company excluded), nor of Yang Fans. If there's one thing this area has a plethora of, it's chinese food. Try another.

Ich.  This place has been here for about 3 weeks.  My roommate got a shake from here and I got a "free sample" before I knew about her experience.  Of my free sample, that tasted off, I took only one bite.  But it was enough to upset my stomach for 3 days.  My roommate's shake did far worse damage and left her quite ill for almost a week.  

Also, they had health inspector issues (I checked).

Stay away!!!!

Cheap and yummy find! You can pick which ones you want, and the size of the box (how many pieces). Nice if you want a snack or meal. I recommend the spicy salmon, the fish tasted fresh. It also came with a lollipop :)

Super cute cafe and atmosphere as well. Casual walk up lunch spot and the wait was less than 10mins.

Pretty good and affordable!! I think this is the perfect size for a light lunch or snack to get you through the day. The toppings had great flavor and weren't too overpowering. The  quality of the salmon wasn't the best, but I didn't expect too much for the price. This set of 3 was $10, and I opted for the torched salmon, crabmeat, and spicy tuna. My favorite was the crabmeat- there was a nice peppery flavor to it.

The storefront is cute too! Lots of wooden accents, and it was clean and comfy to sit down for a little break during the day. Service was nice and quick. Their drinks look really unique and tasty as well, I'd love to try next time.

I came here for lunch and thought the food was pretty good. They have a lot of various toppings that you can choose from, and the restaurant itself is quite large with a lot of seating. The portion sizes make it a good lunch option, definitely in competition with Rice Kitchen nearby. I believe I got the crab, the pork, the seared salmon, and the bulgogi, all of which were pretty good. The one thing I will note about it was that it tended towards the saltier side, in comparison with other similar tofu bites nearby.

The people working the shop are really nice!

Decent place for a quick lunch but the taste is a bit underwhelming. The salmon tasted relatively fresh and I thought the rice was well seasoned as well - there was also a good proportion of rice to the toppings. I did feel like the torched salmon and regular salmon ones were a bit bland, while the spicy mayo salmon had more flavor from the spicy mayo. I liked the spicy chicken cheese one as well, although I felt like the flavor actually overpowered the taste of the rice and yubu. Overall though it was pretty tasty and the service was friendly!

Very disappointing and overpriced for a piece of yubu with cheap ingredients. The rice are not well cooked, very sticky and not distinct, I don't like them.

~ Beef Bulgogi ~
The beef Bulgogi is mildly sweet and quite flavourful, not chewy at all. It's the best out of the 4.

~ Scorched Salmon ~
Can't really go wrong with this. The scorching give the salmon a really nice smokiness flavour. The salmon itself is like any average salmon, I wouldn't call it particularly good or bad.

~ Fish Roe Mayo ~
I felt like being scammed. The fish roe Mayo.... barely have any fish roe, there are only a teeny tiny bit of them sitting on a giant pool of mayo. You can't get any fish roe taste, all you get is mayo. Fish roe are pretty cheap (they are not salmon roe!!) so they should add a lot more for it to match the price!

~ Spicy Tuna Mayo ~
Another scam. Spicy tuna, I would have expected it to be diced/minced raw tuna mixed together with spicy Mayo sauce. But no!! This is actually canned tuna and it is hella salty!!!

Will I be back? No
Only the beef and salmon tasted good (my guess is pork, mushroom, chicken will taste okay too), but they are not worth the price given the cheap ingredients. And I'm absolutely disappointed by the other 2 yubu. Pretty sure the crabmeat is the fake crabmeat, and avocado will just be avocado, go to supermarket and buy yourself an avocado instead.

As a massive fan of their first location, I was positively ecstatic to see Yubu open up a second location-- this one is much larger and has better seating options. They specialize in yubuchobap, a Korean version of inari sushi which takes a seasoned fried bean curd pouch that gets stuffed with sushi rice and topped with whatever you may please. The tofu pockets are deceptively filling as a lunchbox of 3/4 ($10/$13 respectively) is more than enough to satiate a peckish appetite.

Some of my favorite toppings include the classic beef bulgogi (runs a little salty but is very sweet), the torched salmon (love the texture the torched bits provide), and the spicy salmon (not particularly spicy). All lunch box sets come with a little sweet treat as a bonus too!

Yubu was such a gem to find on Yelp before my NYC trip! This visit was probably what I was looking to most while in the city. There aren't very many places in the Bay Area, let alone California, that offers inari the way that Yubu does. I was especially drawn to the aesthetics of the presentation since it made the food look so delicious!

We ordered a set of I four, which was surprisingly at a lower price point than what I had anticipated.
+ Spicy Tuna (5/5): My favorite of the four! The tuna had a great texture, mixed with mayo and added furikake on top made for a nice presentation.
+ Bulgogi (4/5): Definitely better than the salmon, the marinade on the meat was really light compared to what I usually expect out of bulgogi.
+ Salmon (torched) (3.5/5): A light drizzle of spicy mayo would have made this inari taste a little better. The salmon was at an awkward temperature, which made the inari itself taste a little off but either way the inari was still delicious.
+ Salmon (4/5): The freshness of the salmon didn't quite shine through, but like the torched it was a little dry so I'd suggest the spicy mayo version!

Overall, it's perfect for a light snack if you're out shopping in the Soho area! Service was great, there's a lot of tables inside of the restaurant, and they also offer a lot of drinks like lattes and coffee. Be aware that they don't have a public restroom though!

I'm a snacker...and this was definitely an awesome snack!

Cute shop in soho serving up little tofu skin pockets filled with rice and a variety of toppings.  Tried a few different kinds including the spicy tuna Mayo, torched salmon, and beef bulgogi. All 3 were pretty tasty and we got a couple pieces of candy as well which was fun!

The strawberry matcha drink was sooooo good and as we were struggling to mix it with our straw we happened to make awkward eye contact with the cashier/server and she offered to stir up our drink with a spoon...so hooray for attentive staff offering up awesome service!

Super cute spot and concept with some solid tasting eats! We tried the mushroom, salmon, torched salmon, and myungran mayo yubus, as well as the plum bubbly drink.

The drink was not too sweet, just how I like it. The yubus were flavorful and the tofu skin perfectly seasoned. My favorites were the salmon ones. The mayo one I probably wouldn't get again; as I felt like the mayo taste kind of overwhelmed everything else.

A tad expensive for the amount of food but overall still quite solid.

I've been meaning to try this place for SO LONG and wow it does not disappoint! I tried the salmon and mushroom bolgogi tofu pockets and they were amazing, hit the spot completely. Service is super quick and friendly and there are so many options whether you're vegan, vegetarian, pescatarian, or a meat eater they have it all! AND they have a great selection of drinks. The inside is cute and nice to sit in and they also have a good takeout option with very nice packaging. Great for solo casual dining or eating with a friend! I'll be back soon!

Love this place!!! The bulgogi is amazing and so tender and flavorful. The tofu pocket is slightly sweet and goes really well with the sticky rice and toppings. I also love the crab and the spicy Mayo salmon is good as well. It's super affordable and the staff are sweet and always give you a lollipop with your order.

This is such a cute store in Soho. It seems new and everything was really clean when I visited. Their menu mainly consists of these tofu pockets and they're delicious!

They contain rice and a topping, all contained with this tofu skin pocket. I got the torched salmon, spicy mayo salmon and the fish roe one. The fish roe one was my favorite as it has so much flavor. I loved the texture because the roe pops in your mouth. I wasn't too hungry, so these 3 were perfect for a quick lunch. However, if you're hungry, I would definitely try to get more.

They give you lollipops when you check out, which is such a cute surprise! I would come back if I'm craving something sushi-adjacent!

I took a bite of each to see which one I like the best. My favorite ones are crabmeat and torched salmon. If you like spicy , you should try their spicy pork and spicy salmon. They have a nice kick to it.

Their iced dalgona matcha latte is sooooo good.

I would deff come back again.

Nice, modern snack spot in SoHo.

I stopped by YUBU in the middle of my shopping and really enjoyed the nice cafe vibes inside. It definitely reminded me of a low-key snack spot you would find in a college town.

There are plenty of variety on the menu, and I got the spicy tuna mayo and Beef Bulgolgi which lay on top a bed of rice wrapped in tofu skin. I think I definitely preferred the Beef Bulgolgi!

The service was fast and the workers were friendly. This is a great spot for a quick bite or to hang out for awhile. Definitely a younger crowd!

Great service. Cute, clean space.

Food comes out quick. Adorable little bites! You won't get full off of 1 or 2. Staff is kind.

I liked the ones we got aside from the fish roe (it's just all mayo on top) but really good otherwise!

Glad I got to try. They even give you yummy candies with your meal!

Thanks to social media, we knew that we had to give this place a try!

These are little rice pockets with sushi toppings.

WARNING - THESE ARE REALLY ADDICTING. 2 IS NOT ENOUGH. haha

We tried the spicy tuna (fyi, it's not tuna sashimi, it's more so tuna in a can), torched salmon (salmon sashimi - raw), and spicy chicken with cheese.

All three was so good! Honestly, I can probably eat like 5 of these...

Cute little restaurant with a lot of drink selections. From coffee to espresso shots, to Asian drinks.

I highly recommend this place!

This YUBU has nice indoor sitting area comparing to the one in the East Village. The tofu skin rice wraps never let me down. I love the fact they have so many topping options, including for vegetarians.
It is self-serve style. Everything is clean and organized. It's also a nice if you just stay for a cup of drink. I got Grapefruit Ade and it amazed me after my first sip. It's like fruit flavor light soda. So refreshing. Definitely will get the wraps again if I pass by the area.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! I literally had to come here twice before I left New York because it was so good. I love the tofu pockets with salmon. I cannot find a place like this anywhere else. I also loved the matcha drink I ordered but I didn't take a picture of it. I really love the vibes of the place and the music they play. 10000/10 recommend if you love salmon like I do.

I was pleasantly surprised to pass by a YUBU on my day out in SoHo. This is a location part of a chain with 1-2 other locations within Manhattan. I wasn't looking for anything too heavy as my partner and I were really just looking for a snack.

I will say the food here is fantastic. The concept is that there is a topping inside a tofu wrap bottom with some rice. It's the perfect amount of food if you're looking for a light snack to enjoy and you can order more if you're feeling hungrier. The winners for me were the beef bulgogi and the spicy chicken. Both were delicious and were very flavorful. I will say this is a 2-3 bite meal but I think the prices are fair.

You absolutely MUST try the iced dalgona matcha latte. The matcha latte was perfect amount of sweetness and the dalgona at the top really added the extra crunch. I really enjoyed this meal and the staff was incredibly friendly. Service was great too with the food coming out within 5 minutes. There is also seating if you wanted to sit and eat your meal. The interior is super clean and very aesthetically pleasant with wooden touches throughout.

I would definitely recommend if you are in the area!

Food: 5/5
Ambience: 5/5
Service: 5/5

Tasty Drink + Bland Food

I ordered the Spicy Salmon Yubu and Strawberry Ade. As the title states, the yubu was bland and there was barely any mayo. It just tasted like plain salmon with salty rice. However the Strawberry Ade was really good. I expected the drink to be tasteless, but they added a lot of strawberry syrup and some mashed in strawberries too. The store included a complimentary lollipop with every order!

The cashier was really friendly and professional.

The Strawberry Ade exceeded my expectations. I would come here next time only for the drink.

I'm officially hooked on Yubu!

It was so hard to choose from their selection, but I ended up going with the pork jaeyook, mushroom bulgogi, and spicy tuna toppings. I LOVED the spicy pork and the mushroom- but they were all so flavorful and delicious.

I can't wait to come back and try the rest of their toppings.

Don't underestimate the size of these pieces. I came in hungry, ordered 6 pieces, and was content after eating like 3.... My favorites were the crabmeat, salmon and beef bulgogi. I love how the tofu skin adds a hint sweetness to every piece. I also tried the Maesil Ade which is a sweet and tangy sparking plum drink. Everything was very delicious! There was plentiful seating and the establishment was clean.

Tip: Check in on Yelp for 10% off your order.

I heard about this place from my friends and saw it on social media so I came here with my family for lunch! We ordered a single piece of uu you in each flavor they had. I was pretty full after eating 3 whole pieces. I would say that they're definitely filling and delicious! I'm sure they make it after you order so it was fresh too. The workers there are very efficient and friendly as well. The inside has ample seating and is very modern and clean. I would defjidlwy come back here and I recommend this location!

Great option for lunch if you're looking for something quick and filling. While Yubu appears to mainly be a takeout place, there is still ample seating if you want to sit down for lunch. Lunch combos come in 3 or 4 tofu bites, and there are plenty of options to pick from. I would recommend the mushroom bulgogi and the torched salmon; there is a generous amount of toppings and portion sizes are larger than I expected! Service was fast and the owner is really friendly, would strongly recommend visiting!

I've always loved inari and it is a great idea to top them with different fillings such as crabmeat, bulgogi, chicken, mushrooms, etc.  I tried the bulgogi, crabmeat and spicy mushrooms.  The bulgogi is excellent.  The spicy mushroom is kind of spicy but needs more salt or flavor.  The crabmeat is full of mayo and very creamy.  I would have preferred a spicier mayo.  A welcome addition to the area.

This place is def worth the hype! They specialize in tofu pockets stuffed with rice and your choice of protein.

I got the pork, beef and spicy chicken with cheese and they even gave a free mini chuppa chup lollipop.

The owner/employees were super nice and explained their concept very patiently. Will definitely be back.

I had the salmon mayo and torched salmon yubus and they were delicious!! I would recommend both of them. They were flavorful and were a perfect snack. The service was good too so I would definitely come here again. The yubus remind me of inari or tofu skin rice.

This place serves the best little yubu snacks! They are quick and efficient as well. We have mostly tried different combinations throughout their menu and ahabe enjoyed every bite. I enjoyed the spicy chicken and bulgogi the most!

These tofu pockets were absolutely delicious and the perfect workday lunch! It's reasonably priced for what you get- I got 4 for $15 and was very satisfied. On a day when I'm not that hungry I could even just get 3.

The tofu skin had a nice sweetness to it and torched salmon was my fav, but I also really enjoyed the raw salmon and the pork. The mushroom was a good veggie option but I preferred the others.

-@nyconthetable

YUBU finally has an indoor location!! This location is extremely aesthetic and gives very comforting vibes. The food is amazing as always and they even added new items like coffee and desserts. I especially loved their new  addition: torched salmon. Now that there's an indoor location, I'll definitely be coming more often!

So glad Yubu opened up a location in Soho! The ambiance is very chill- filled with friendly vibes and k-pop. The cashier was nice and even gave me a lollipop with my meal- so cute! I got the salmon, crab, bulgogi, and tuna. My least favorite was the tuna. I was expecting fresh tuna but it was canned tuna salad. However, the other tofu skin wraps were spot on! Hope to come back and try other inaris.

My recent visit to Yubu Soho left me with mixed feelings. While I had high hopes for an enjoyable dining experience, the reality fell short of my expectations. I ordered the salmon, mushroom, tuna mayo, and beef dishes, hoping for a delightful mix of flavors. Unfortunately, what I encountered was an overwhelming saltiness that dominated every bite.

The dishes were undoubtedly bursting with flavor, but the excessive use of salt took away from the natural taste of the ingredients. Each bite left me longing for some relief from the intense sodium content. It's disappointing when the strong flavor becomes the sole focus, overshadowing the potential of the dish.

Moreover, the portion sizes were unexpectedly small, especially considering the price. I expected a reasonable amount of food for the cost, but sadly, I left the restaurant feeling unsatisfied. The disparity between the portion size and the price tag was hard to overlook.

Regrettably, I cannot see myself returning to Yubu Soho in the future. The combination of overpowering saltiness, small portions, and the high prices left me with a sour taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively. I believe there are other dining options that offer a more balanced and enjoyable experience.

This is a cute indoor location with a couple of seats and tables. Although this location was a bit of a walk, the food was delicious and filling, three of them made me full. The server was friendly. Forgot to check in to get 10% off. Will come back next time!
Amazing, amazing place to visit in NYC, very affordable price and good tastes. I would go again if I am visiting NYC again.

I was first introduced to YUBU when their first store opened around the NYU area. The food is amazing even at the new location. I'm so glad to to see them, expand to Soho to further introduce YUBU and Korean food to more people.

By far my favorite is the pork and the beef yubu. The tofu skin is always perfect and delicious. The sauce that they add on top is so good it makes the rice and meat, so flavorful and addicting. It's the type of food that once you eaten once the next time you come visit, the food will be gone before you take a picture!

Popped in for a quick bite to go. Got the torched salmon (kinda wish it had a bit of mayo and then was seared) but it was nice. The fish tasted fresh although some pieces could have been better. I also think it looked a bit smaller than the other yelp photos but might be because I only ordered one instead of a full meal. The cashier was super nice and friendly. Offered me wet wipes since I was just taking it on the go after I declined utensils so she knows what's up. Might need to come back for a beef one.

This place is great for a quick bite. The restaurant was very clean and gives a modern and cute vibe. The workers were very nice and made sure the food was displayed nicely. I was looking forward to eating the salmon but it was a bit bland for me and my boyfriend. If some soy sauce was added it would be better. The cooked meat ones are good and I recommend those.
Wonderful presentation, fresh ingredients, i highly recommend the Spicy tuna and the crab! You won't regret those!

I've been to the other location and this one is just as good! I love that this location is bigger and has a dine in option. I got my favorites which are the crab meat and salmon. The worker was nice enough to put some spicy mayo on top of the salmon which I really appreciated because it enhanced the flavor! I always felt the salmon needed some sort of sauce so this was perfect. I highly recommend this location and will definitely be back soon!

Food and service was overall really good for a quick in and out meal. Fair price for the amount/what you're getting. The place was clean and bright with big mirrors too. Ordered the spicy pork, chicken and cheese, and torched salmon which were all good, however the spicy tuna was disappointing as it was obviously canned tuna just mixed with spicy mayo and tasted like it was straight out of the can.

Had a quick lunch at the SoHo location with my wife. Nothing really like it around and its great! Bulgogi was delicious and probably the best. Really enjoyed the spicy chicken and mushroom variation as well. The salmon was a drop fishy tasing for me and the Roe was pretty good. Avocado was also pretty good but needed more than just daikon imho. The drinks were incredible. We had the melon and citrus flavored ades and would go back just for those. This is a cafe type of place with tables and no servers. The cashier/mgr is friendly. The inside was a bit hot on a summer day and there are NO bathrooms available to customers. Great music playing and a big ol mirror to check yourself out in before you leave.

I popped in because I wanted to try this place as a lift snack and it was better than I had expected! Everything was flavorful and fresh. The wrap was slightly sweet and paired well with the rice and toppings inside.

This SOHO location is a bit of the way to get to, but the food quality is just as good as the St. Marks location. And they have indoor seats! They may look tiny, but they are filling. I am usually full after three pieces.
Absolutely delicious rice filled tofu pockets!! Loved the salmon, torched salmon, and beef bulgogi pockets  the tea and latte selections are also fantastic. Highly recommend this cozy cafe of a spot.
Cute and yummy stuffed tofu pockets. Purchased as a quick snack for my family before seeing a show. They were delicious, and the only regret was not getting more!
Clean and spacious. The hot grapefruit tea was amazing. Food was meh. No restroom. I would go back for the grapefruit tea.
Good but i was expecting crispy hot rice and it was cold and not crispy which was disappointing. Bulgogi, pork, and mushroom were our favorites. Id get again but now i expect something different
I would choose the crab meat, spicy tuna, and salmon again. So good. Love the tofu skins.

An elevated version of one of my favorite Korean comfort foods growing up: yubu chobap. My bf and I got the bulgogi, spicy tuna, tuna mayo, spicy pork, and spicy chicken flavors. Tuna mayo... IYKYK. I also got the Yuja-ade which wasn't too sweet and very refreshing for a humid summer day. Would not recommend it if you don't like citrus. I'd suggest going with people so you can get a taste for all the flavors. The establishment itself is pretty small with no indoor seating or customer bathrooms but there was cute outdoor seating. Service was quick and friendly.

Actually mind blown by how good the food is here. Picked this place on a whim because it looked interesting and I'm so glad I did! Got beef bulgogi, pork jaeyook, spicy mushroom, salmon, and salmon torched.

Let me just say I rarely write reviews but when I ate the torched salmon, I felt my soul ascending. Also have no idea what the sparkly drink the barista recommended was but wow that went so well with our meal. 11/10 probably one of the best places I've eaten at in NYC so far.

They really only serve smoothies and a few pastelitos. I've tried asking for pancakes or fajitas even quesadillas and the individual there always say they aren't able to make it or don't serve it.

It's one of the few healthy options in this neighborhood and it's hard to like it when their options are so slim. 50% of the time they don't have all the fruits you'd want in your smoothie. You find yourself cutting down your list or picking something else.

My suggestion is. Change yourself to a smoothie bar and focus on that or actually start cooking the items you list on your menu.

My 3 stars are because i really do want to like this place. The smoothies aren't bad when you get one it's just so limited on everything.

I've been ordering from here for at least 10 years. The food is fresh and delicious. The delivery is very fast. I usually order the chicken with broccoli, chicken wings with beef fried rice and pork dumplings. I have no complaints. Could you find better? Probably. Will you be disappointed? IDK. More than likely not. But they are ok in my book.
My go-to neighborhood Chinese spot. Delivery is fast. Cash only!!! They are pretty fast when you go in person too. The food now comes in the plastic containers not styrofoam

This is specifically a review for a lunch special takeout done in person (not over the phone deliveries). They were not super friendly (almost seemed annoyed I was ordering food despite no one else at the restaurant), but this was not a big issue for me. I sat and waited for the food which took somewhere between 25 and 30 minutes to make. Not sure if this is normal time but they seemed busy with delivery orders and it made me think that the food is probably made fresh, so it makes sense to take longer.

Their lunch special price is good ($6.45) and the menu states that it comes with "egg drop, wonton coup, hot and sour soup or chicken rice soup, white rice or fried rice or pork rice." When taking the order, they did not ask what rice or soup to pick but I asked for fried rice, forgetting to specify the soup. After it was ready, I realized there was no soup so asked about it and they said they don't have soup today. Not sure if they forgot about it or blatantly omitted it since I did not ask about it. I find it odd that none of the soups were available. I was offered a soda instead but I personally don't drink soda. At least they tried to make up for it.

I ordered general tso's chicken with fried rice. It was decent but nothing special. It came with two pieces of broccoli plus soy sauce and duck sauce packets. The fried rice tasted very oily. However, the amount of food was definitely more than enough for one person. I only ate half in one sitting and had to save the other half for later.

There aren't many Chinese food places around here so it's hard to compare and for the price, it's hard to beat ($6.45 for a filling lunch) but overall it's just decent in taste. If I come back I'll try the regular rice or pork rice and hope they have soup.

This spot is thieves I placed a order and they never told me it was to small to order something else they charged me 2dollars extra and I could of got a soda or something else they are thieves and they customer service is horrible there mean don't waste your time here the one down the block is better and food is great
Terrific taste, fresh, good prices, NYC Health Dept A rating! Friendly on the phone. Fast. So glad this place is in my neighborhood.
They're fast, clean, delivery is quick.  Food is amazing.  They're on it!!!  They also take card payment over the phone.  Try it!!

Well....this is one of the best takeout Chines I've ever ordered from....and aside from somoe Upper East Side (NYC) place I've ordered from...at twice ...or three times the price...with fre chopsticks and free sliced ornge...the BEST take-out chinese I've ever had....and I've ordered from them on/off...either as GUAN HIN ir YEUNG HIN for 30 years....at the same location at W. 238th Street and Bailey avenue...in the Bronx.  Friends of mine...in the pricier Riverdale also have ordered..or more egularlay exclaim that they can't get this quaility at sit-down restaurants in Riverdale anymore. (suffere)  Their soups are lower in salt....their combination playyers and all dishes with friend rice are not loaded with grease...and evn their beef is chewable. (rare)   I'd only advise against ordering hir pork ribs, which, per usual, are not too meaty.  I most often order over the phone...and their delivery guy, who's worked with them for at least 15 years has as much personality as the boil on my ass...yet, even in his limited rapport, delivers such quality take-out, that I easily forgive...and can only help that his additions of the English words THANK YOU to his vocabulary, when I regularly give him a $3+ dollar tip might qujalify me at the pearly gates as an English teacher/translator.  Their vegetables are rarely overcooked...love their General Tso's combination...steanmed dumplings....huinan beef.  My extended family, and many neighbors LOVE Guan Hin/Yeung Hing....and pitch a fit whenever we end up ordering from any other local take-out.  Delivery is always prompt and accurate.

I have been to this place a couple of time, its the closest korean food in my area, Great food, small place good for grab and go!
Attentant is quick, attentive.

Without a doubt one of the best boba spots in the neighborhood. You can't go wrong with any of their drinks and everything is done well, but my personal go-to's are the fresh grape tea (SO refreshing and addicting) and the classic milk tea.

Came here after work for a quick meal on a weekday. Quick and easy, this place is pretty solid. The space has ample seating for groups of 4.

Gyu Don - Juicy beef over rice is always great. The flavor soaks right into the rice. I wish there was more variety of flavor in this dish (maybe an optional sauce or something), but it was still good and hit the spot.  

Value: 4/5
Quality: 4/5
Quantity: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5

DELICIOUS RAMEN AND BUBBLE TEA TODAY-MY FIRST VISIT, WITH MANY MORE VISITS HERE IN THE FUTURE, FOR SURE!

PRONOUNCED:  YOI, as in just put a Y-sound in front of OY!! Spelled YOI.  

Directly across from the AMC Kips Bay Movie theatre ON Second Ave, near 33rd Street--I just enjoyed a generous-sized CHICKEN RAMEN, and a Black sugar Milk Tea.   TOTALLY GREAT MEAL!!!  See my photos, please.  Very nice staff.  

The chicken broth was delicious along with sliced white meat chicken, and the seasoned egg was PERFECTION!!!  Martha Stewart would be proud ...for those who have her very first Entertaining book, with an easy tea egg recipe; altho the yummy egg in my CHICKEN RAMEN, was marinated in soy sauce, it really gave just the PERFECT added hint of seasoning, truly, the egg was perfection, with a creamy yolk. See my photos.

My CHICKEN RAMEN ($17) also had plenty of wonderful ramen noodles, fresh corn, scallions, seaweed/Nori, bamboo shoots, and more. I enjoyed all of it. Even pouring the last bit of broth into my wonderful ladle-like large black spoon.  This was all delicious.

My Black Sugar Milk Tea was great ($7), and it is in a nice, tall and slender, reusable, covered cup, enabling me to shake the tea several times. I can even use this when I'm home to mix a breakfast drink.  Win-win!!  

I shall keep YOI Ramen & Tea in mind whenever I'm going to the Kips Bay AMC movie theatre right across the street, or for any medical visits at NYU LANGONE Medical Center on First Ave/33rd Street.  

The UNISEX bathroom was clean and spacious. It just needs a few hooks in the back of the door for a tote bag/purse and jacket or coat.  I'm told they plan to put hooks there.  YOI has been open about 6 months.  

There are 2 tables to seat 4, and 2 tables to seat 2, PLUS About 9 additional stool-seating against the wall.  

Yes, you should enjoy some RAMEN AND TEA HERE, along with some appetizers, too.

Next time, I look forward to trying the appetizer chicken karaage (fried chicken) and some dumplings or edamame.
Oh!!--I even see DESSERT on the menu--Mochi Ice Cream 2 PCs) in green tea, vanilla, strawberry) $7.  

I will definitely be back!!!

Short review: Falsely advertised fresh taro and overpriced drinks.

This is a new bubble tea spot (with ramen) across the street from another bubble tea spot Surreal (with ice cream) and they have some similarities. Both of them serve big portions of tea for high prices. The teas range from $6 (!) for a small unflavored to $9 for a mango durian concoction with all the large teas being 7 or 8 dollars. In short, not cheap.

The picture outside show many fresh fruit teas including fresh taro which is one of my favorites. The outside photo is a milky white taro drink as in actual taro. I ordered the "fresh" taro which automatically comes with white bobo (or boba) but you can substitute for another type of boba or another topping which was $8 + tax. As per usual, I got no ice and less sugar. The drink came out pretty quickly and was unfortunately purple which means they use the hideous purple powder which means I paid a buck extra on top of overpriced tea for powder. The drink was as expected overly sweet even with less sweetness (I can't imagine how sweet it would be if I ordered regular) and I couldn't taste the tea. The white boba had a pleasant chew but all of it was on the bottom so likely it was all stuck together. All around a not so good beverage.

I usually wouldn't complain but this dumb tea was more expensive than the fresh fruit teas for no reason outside of false advertising. Another person mentioned that they were asked about using fresh taro instead and if this is the actual case, I heard nothing of the sort and I would have much preferred being asked over getting this junk. It almost feels like I am getting ripped off even more if I had to ask for fresh taro secretly. If you have fresh taro, don't use powder or at least charge different prices for taro milk tea and fresh taro milk. Low 2.

Fresh made tea with real fruit. They are a bit more expensive than other bubble tea places. I went there during lunch time and was surprised to see the place empty given they also do Ramen.

I ordered my drink with no sugar the way I usually do with other places because the fruit syrup is usually plenty sweet as is the boba. The woman behind the counter warned me that the drink may not be sweet, but I went ahead anyway. I should have listened to her as it was not sweet. That's my fault, not theirs.

Stopped by here on a Saturday evening because I was craving something sweet and fresh. Shop was empty around 5:30 pm, I'm assuming it's probably because it's not very popular. My brother and I got the grapefruit tea and my boyfriend got the Thai milk tea. Both tasted fine, nothing fancy or special. Pricing was obviously expensive as is the case with most hip boba places. Also we personally all thought that the container of the tea was probably half the cost of the drink, it was so much extra unnecessary plastic. Almost felt bad discarding the container after we were finished. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here unless nothing else was opened.

Tried YOI for the ramen today, and was quite satisfied!

The place is set up like a quick service restaurant, and the food took about 5 minutes to come out after ordering. I had the classic tonkatsu ramen, which hit all the right notes of umami flavor and texture. Will definitely be returning, especially to try the bubble teas, as they looked great from the other customers!

We stopped here for a quick lunch before catching a movie at the amc across the street. Tonkatsu ramen was good, but i wasn't a big fan of the soy. We also tried a fruit tea which was good. Only downside is the prices felt a little high, especially the tea.

This is my 2nd time here. Both times I ordered  drinks. First time the Thai ice tea was weak... Watered down I guess. The second time I had the mango tea slush. The flavor was weak too.  I'm guess less ingredients more ice.

I think I know what my next time will be like if I choose to return.

They do give generous amount of toppings when you order them.

Finally good ramen in Kips bay!  I ordered the spicy ramen to go and the karaage chicken and it was everything I needed.  
The way the ramen is packed to go is brilliant with the soup being separated from the noodle and filling so when you get home everything fits together perfectly!
Definitely must visit!
Food and specialty drinks are the best here. You can't go wrong with any Ramen dish. Two thumbs up

Kips Bay is in dire need of more bubble tea options, so I was excited to see this place open! Perfect place to stop by before or after the movie theater. They specialize in fruit drinks. I tried the passion fruit green tea on my first visit and enjoyed it. Unfortunately, they do not have any nondairy milk options for their milk teas. They also do not have any vegetarian ramen options.

Went in on a freezing Christmas Eve with my bestie and happy we found it. I got the Yoi spicy miso ramen and it hit the spot. It had a slight after taste but because of the spicy it didn't turn me from my meal

Pretty good bubble tea but a little overpriced. I got the grapefruit one which was like a grapefruit juice with a lot of pulp and it wasn't super sweet, all of which were to my liking. The fresh grape one my boyfriend got was a little confusing with cheese foam, tea, jelly pieces and also grape inside. These drinks looks pretty but I think they aren't reaching their full potential as a tea shop. Good if you're craving tea in the area though!

Sadly have to deduct one star because I ordered the same drink and they didn't include the cheese foam it's supposed to come with (pictured in previous review). I was pretty disappointed because it's quite an expensive drink and I didn't realize it was missing until I got home.

Ordered ramen for takeout today. The place opens noon on Sundays. Service was very quick.  The classic tonkotsu was an excellent deal for $16 plus tax including whole egg, menma, kirkurage and Scallions. There were 3 pieces of pork chasu. The only negative was the tonkotsu broth although milky in color was not very flavorful.

Really yummy ramen. I got the pork miso and milk bubble tea. It was fairly priced and used good serving ware. Not the most sit down friendly; there's only a few tables with not so comfy chairs. But service was quick and the twinkly lights and cacti around were nice touches.

To be honest, I expected a lot but slightly was satisfied with what I ate. Ramen was pretty good but the broth left a bad taste in my mouth since I'm not too fond of pork broth. Pretty good toppings though, tender chasu, great veggies, and the soy sauce egg was amazing. Loved the salted edamame. Great place, just didn't like the porky broth but amazing find :)

I live nearby and it's really nice that there's a new bubble tea and ramen place so close! Usually I walk to Koreatown for it.

I got the fresh grape tea, which comes with cheese foam and white pearls (if I remember correctly), and also has real grape pieces in it. It was really good! Will definitely be trying out more of their menu.

Consistent tonkotsu ramen with porky broth and large pieces of chashu. All the toppings are included in the ramen as well, so you don't need to add much. The delivery and takeout packaging quality is also top notch.
Good boba pearls, tea itself is just ok. Shoyu ramen has no flavor, very watery. Lots of toppings but they are meh.

Well what can I say: the ramen delivered on the price point but didn't wow me

I will def come here again and try out the donburi

Also I didn't order the boba but wow $7 boba??? This is my first real world experience with inflation

Tried them out for the first time today. They must have opened within the past couple of days. It was empty inside, but I hope that changes because I really enjoyed my lunch.

I had tonkotsu ramen and it was excellent. The pork was really tender and the broth was rich and flavorful. The eggs were cooked perfectly. Everything was just right. I look forward to trying the rest of the menu.

I always pick up from this place. Above average ramen and rice bowl place, decent amount of items but a relatively small menu. A few rice rice bowls, a few different types of ramen and appetizers. I always order pick up from here and they are always very fast and package everything well. Never any spills. Both noodles have great texture. I prefer the curly yellow noodles. If you are in the neighborhood it is definitely worth the trip.

If you want fresh taro bubble tea or other fresh teas then this is ithe place to get it. I ordered the taro bubble tea and was asked if I wanted fresh or powder and the counter person even gave me a sample to try. Needles to say it was delicious and I was sold. I also ordered the passion fruit green tea which was delicious with some sugar added otherwise it would be too tart. The prices are a tad higher than other places and I think it is worth for certain beverages.
Ordered the Classic Tonkotsu Ramen and the Curry Chicken Katsu Don for pickup. Both dishes were amazing! I would definitely order from here again.

Order take out. Unsure if sometimes it just doesn't taste as good when it's delivered. I was fairly underwhelmed. The broth is ok. It's not amazing but it's not bad. It's a little bland. The portion was HUGE but it is mostly just noodles with mediocre broth. Maybe add a bunch of toppings? My egg was under seasoned and very hard boiled which was disappointing. The meat was also decent. Overall it was just okay though and definitely overrated.
Excited for this tea shop in the neighborhood. The Golden pineapple tea is delicious made with fresh pineapple! I'll be back to try other items on menu!
Amazing bubble tea, decent ramen. Very close to NYU so it'll be my go-to place to quench my boba thirst.

Fast, comprehensive service with plenty of affordable, Greek food options, including salads, pastries, and lamb gyros on my other items. The Gyro itself is actually tasty and not too dry, spiced well and accompanied by an abundance of additional toppings. The desserts are homemade and the salads are full of ingredients that make it totally worth your while.

The cashier can be a bit disorganized with delivery and takeout orders (they're very busy!) so make sure you double check your bag of food. There's plenty of seating indoors, but it gets busy fast, so be sure to keep your eyes out.

Overall a good experience and a place worth checking out, especially if you're required to remain close to the Cornell Hospital. There are other Greek food places in the local area so there is fierce competition.
.

Food 4/5 - It's not Astoria, but if you're looking for a reasonably priced, filling, and relatively nutritious meal in this neighborhood it hits the spot. The option of lemon potatoes as a side really drew me in.

Pricing 4.5/5 - Only $15 for a huge plate of lamb-beef gyro with lemon potatoes and a Greek salad, which is enough that I took home leftovers.

Service 5/5 - The guys behind the counter weren't Greek (Albanian) but they were really nice, kindly giving me a cup for water and several to-go box options.  

Ambiance  4/5 - lots of tables and the long layout means you can take your time to eat.

Yes again to take out or sit down fast food style Greek cafe.  Gyro and salad please.  They don't sell the sandwich combo but will make your gyro salad sandwich style rolled in pita if asked. They offered.

Ok so tip the guys as they are super nice and super accommodating.... flavor and freshness are good.

I was pleasantly surprised by the food here. The restaurant reminds me of my go to Greek spot in Brooklyn. Only difference is the lamb gyro slices are thinner which I don't mind. I had the lamb gyro platter that came with 4 pieces of pita, fries and salad. The fries were addicting and the portions were large for the price point. There is plenty of seating inside to enjoy your meal so be sure to stop by.

Ordered for delivery from Yia's tonight. I ordered the hummus and grilled shrimp. Delivery arrived on time. Hummus cold, shrimp hot. The shrimp leaked in the bag. Luckily I'm at work lol. The shrimp were cooked perfectly. They were a little too buttery. I removed the excess. I didn't realize they would arrive so wet. I'd order something else to try next time.
