The hummus was delicious!! It was perfectly made and flavor was excellent. Great texture. So fresh! I'd definitely order it again. The pita bread it arrived with was soft, warm, and tasted fresh. It was delicious.
Prices are on point. Will be reordering soon! :)

Good Greek dinner spot.

Got delivery of:
-Veggie Souvlaki Wrap $11.95
-Tiropita $7.25
-Spanakopita $7.25
-Lemon Potatoes $5.95
-Lamb/Beef Gyro $11.95

The Lemon Potatoes were out of this world.  The tiropita and spanakopita were healthy portions and quite good.

The souvlaki wrap and gyro's were just okay.  I've had better for both. Not overly stuffed like other places.  I'd still come back to get other Greek specialties if I don't want to venture over to Astoria.
This place never fails. Service is always spot on the food is always fresh hot flavorful I cannot say anything negative about this place.

Great rates for delicious cuisine. Don't allow this place's outside dictate when to quit. It's great meal. It is prepared fresh upon request. They are usually cordial and quick. The salad, gyros, and sandwich are all cooked to perfection. Try this place the next time you're in the mood for Greek food.

Nice open space. One of my favs when in the city for Greek Food!

The plates are decent portions and very tasty. The Lemon potato's are my fav but sometimes it's very lemony.

The Pita Bread and Gyro meat are on point. Always looking forward to grabbing food there!
This place is pretty amazing for some quick casual Greek dining food. Everything was tasty, large portions, very nice staff, and clean dining area. Would 100% go back!

Had Chicken Souvlaki which came with pita delivered. Food came fresh and warm. Not at all coma inducing, which was a plus, and very healthy, yet delicious! Only complaint was it needed more sauce. I would come back to try their other specialty meals!

Loved the salad I received from this restaurant. Was looking for somewhere new to eat and decided to try out this spot. I ordered a salad with gyro meat on top. They weren't stingy with the meat at all! The salad was very tasty.. it had olives, feta cheese, cucumbers and just the right amount of fresh dill on top. It came with a really tasty dressing. Overall the food was very fresh and the people working the counter were super friendly. I'll definitely be back here. Give them a try.
I'm ashamed to admit how often I order here; consistently, the food is always good. The chicken souvlaki platter with lemon potatoes is always a solid choice.

Rating is based purely on take out. My husband and I were at the hospital impatiently waiting on the arrival of our baby girl. Our nurses told us we should eat quickly because once I was admitted to Labor and Delivery, I wouldn't be able to eat. I had the chicken platter, and it was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend if you're in the area and craving Greek.
Ordered here for delivery. I opted for the chicken platter with lemon potatoes, a side of falafel, and a soda. Food came quickly. Food is tasty, and has good portions. Will order from here again.
I had the chicken gyro platter with lemon potatoes. The pita is under the chicken. It was satisfying for a good lunch meal. No complaints.
It's a hole in the wall but delicious. I always look forward to coming here because it's authentic and never ever disappoints.

I absolutely love Yiayia's, it is my go to fo Greek food especially the catering.
I have ordered from them for several dinner parties and they could not be more gracious and courteous, the food is delicious-I have had it all-the Chicken Souvlaki, Gyros-all of them, Pastichio, Moussaka, most of the Salads-the Beet Salad is my favorite, Stuffed Peppers, Stuffed Grape Leaves, Greek French Fries, the Pita is always warm, and for my last order they gave me a huge bowl of Tzatziki. The portions are so generous. The owner even threw in some Rice Pudding. Their dining space is clean and great for a casual, quick, good quality food and fantastic service for a reasonable price, you get lots of value at Yiayia's. I can not say enough good things about the owner, such a nice man. Going to Yiayia's is a great way to Support Small Business. Yiasou and Euxaristo!!!

Ordered delivery. Ordere chicken soup and two platters: one chicken, and one lamb/ pork gyro. I chose lemon potato sides for both options.

Everything was fine. Chicken was a bit dry, lemon potatoes were great. Wish there was more! Soup was okay-- wouldn't order it again.

The bag it came in was completely wet on the bottom. Not sure why. The soup wasn't leaky. Maybe something for the salad poured out? Glad I realized before it stained and greased up my floor too much!

Picked up the Vegetarian Platter $16.50 to go. I waited about 5 min. They have a lot of to go orders going out but they were very efficient. The restaurant is very cute, bright and clean. I was very please with the platter which included Spanakopita, lemon potatoes and Greek salad. It was all so delicious. I had enough leftovers for lunch the next day.

Delivery Review:

Chicken gyro plate - chicken is tender and flavorful

Pita - soft, buttery, yum

Salad - crunchy, bright, refreshing

Lemon potatoes - soft, silky, a+

Falafel - dry and very bland; avoid

Hummus - just okay, had much better

Overall 3/5.

Greek food! This was first time trying Greek food and I fell in love. I did not know Greek food was so bomb! I tried the dolmadakias and got the cold dip trio (but subbed it for vegan dips- there are a decent amount of vegan options!)

For the dips we had hummus, eggplant dip, and the garlic potato dip, each topped with a yummy olive. and they were all a good. It comes with warm pita bread too.. so yum. My favorite was the garlic potato dip -- highly recommend. Seriously It's garlicky, creamy, and so good. If you're a garlic girl, you have to try it. The hummus was good as well. It had a strong tahini flavor to it and the eggplant dip was smooth and light with almost a subtle wine flavor to it.

The dolmadakias (rice wrapped grape leaves bites cooked in a tomato sauce) came 6 to an order and were servers warm. so so good. The leaves were soft with a slight bite to it and had a nice earthy -almost tea like- flavor.

My sister ordered the lamb chops which she raved over. She's not typically a lamb girl but she loved these so much she came back the next day to have them again. Tender, soft and flavorful. She ordered it with a side of steamed veggies that were a bit on the blander side but amazing AMAZINGLY good paired with the garlic potato dip topped on a warm slice of pita.

This place is a bit on the pricier side (lamb chops were about 27$ for 4 ~smaller sized~ pieces and about 8.50 for a dip -- 14$ for the trio though!) but I'd say it's worth it because everything was so good and surprisingly pretty filling! I'll definitely be coming back to try the other goodies and also to eat the garlic potato dip again~

Oh! And if you like spicy, I've heard that the spicy feta dip is amazing and nicely spicy.

Overall this place was very good! I loved everything I tried and would rate this overall a 4.75/5! Excited to try the others. Was eyeing the beet dish when I went, so will be ordering that next time yum!

Two words: LEMON POTATOES
These stood out for me because they were so comforting and obviously homemade...
Savory and rich

I placed an order online and saw some reviews regarding the salmon pita sandwich and decided
I wanted to cancel the order. I think I called 5 mins after it was placed and they said it was made already. I got it anyway but as another yelp review stated it was covered in feta cheese which is not stated on the menu. They also stated that they vomited from the food here twice. You couldn't find
the salmon in the sandwich it was sloppy with too much cheese. I paid $15 for fries. Will pass on this place. The fact that it was ready in 5 mins is not a good sign. I don't want to wait long for food but that's just too fast.

Meh, lunch leaves a lot to be desired. Chicken souvlaki was the greasiest I've ever seen, and for some reason they put the pita underneath the chicken, so it soaked up all the grease and became complete mush.
Tzatziki sauce was flavorless, in fact nothing really had much flavor with the exception of the potatoes, which I did actually find good.
Overpriced and subpar, would not recommend, would not go back.

Been here twice and both times I regret it so much that I had to write a review. The food is just not good quality and leaves you sick. Got the salmon sandwich and it was legit just the bottom of the salmon skin in a wrap. Wild to charge $15 for fishy and oily scraps in a sandwich. The staff is really nice though and I really wish I could have liked this place more.

Also this means that I've vomited from their food on two separate occasions months apart.
Pork gyro is to die for. Everything tastes fantastic. One of the best gyros I've ever had, would go here a lot if I lived here.

Small kitchen/cafe style restaurant with excellent and fresh dishes. We were a table of friends and ordered the dips and grilled octopus to start. Entrees ordered where shrimp and salmon with lemon potatoes and lamb kabob with an order of Greek salad. Plates were plentiful, flavorful and will definitely return. Head there before 7:30 and you will definitely get a table - after that it's touch and go as I suspect it's a local treasured secret.

I have only eaten delivery so I can't speak to what the in restaurant experience is like. For delivery, the gyro platters are good. I usually get the lamb/beef with lemon potatoes. I don't like that they put the pita under the meat. The pita ends up greasy. The lemon potatoes are usually good, but last time I ordered they were pretty dry. Their salads are awful. The dressing is really inconsistent and either too oily or too much vinegar. The worst menu item I've tried is the baklava. It is a wet soggy mess. It isn't crispy and flaky like it should be. It also isn't sweet. There is some kind of syrup drenching it, but it has no flavor. It's really disgusting.

Stopped in for a quick bite on a Saturday night. The menu was not too overwhelming, but still provided plenty of options. I decided to get the chicken gyro and feta fries.

The gyro was phenomenal and you definitely get a sizable portion for the price. However, the feta fries are just their fries with a slight sprinkling of feta. It is worth mentioning that the fries were also pretty soft/soggy and had no salt or seasoning. I would definitely not recommend getting those here.

Service was a bit slow, but the gyro was super fresh. The restaurant was clean and had a cute aesthetic.
When ordering through door dash, you can't make alterations to the food, which is a bummer. The baklava was very tasty and the vegetarian platter was good.

Ordered lemon chicken and the chicken was terrible- rubbery and poor quality.  I don't know what kind they are buying but it had the worst texture and dry .  I do not recommend ordering that.  I wish I could have returned it but I had already waited awhile for it to be ready and by the time I got home , I didn't feel like going all the way back.

I loooved Yia Yia's lemon potatoes. It was my first time having tried them and wow were they flavorful.  I ordered the falafel plate with lemon potatoes and hummus; the salad was fresh and the falafels were crispy. The hummus was unfortunately quite bland, though very creamy, so I didn't eat as much as I usually do with the pita bread at other restaurants. I would add a little extra oomf to the flavor of the falafel's, but they had an excellent consistency and crunch. The lady who took my order was very sweet and the service itself was fairly quick.
One of the best experiences,with great food ,i liked  the chicken gyro plate with lemon potato s, the spanakopita and galaktoboureko
Great portion size and the food is really good. I ordered the Greek salad with grilled chicken and it was delicious.

Food is decent but delivery always takes forever, and the staff has a horrible, unapologetic attitude about it. They've also sent me an incorrect order on multiple occasions, which I ended up just eating because I was so hungry by the time the food arrived.

This is a really good Greek place in the Upper East Side that is close to New York Presbyterian and MSK. I originally thought this is was a sit down place, but it's more of a take out place. Not quite fast food, but closer to that than a sit down place with a waiter.

I was in the mood for some traditional Greek dishes, and got a pastitsio and avgolemono. Boy! I was pleasantly surprised!! Both were really good. I got a large portion of pastitsio that came with a side (got lemon oven baked potatoes) and a Greek village salad (lettuce, tomato, cucumber and feta). There was so much I could not finish. I didn't even have room for the soup (it was too hot to start with that).

There was seating outside due to Covid rules on dining.

This is definitely a place I would go back to again!

Terrific grab-on-the-go Greek food with gyros and kabob platters that are freshly cooked and worth the extra buck when compared to street carts. One of the only places I've found where the chicken gyro isn't dry (much better than the lamb). $9 a dish. 4.25/5 starts as a lunch spot.

Stopped in over lunch time during the week and even with a moderate crowd there was hardly a wait. The food was really good too- I got the Spanokopita as a starter which was flaky and warm and yum, and a chicken sandwich which was also great. I brought it home to eat and it traveled well- not greasy or anything. A little pricey for me since the sandwich doesn't come with a side, although many things are like that these days, but was really good and I'd certainly return to try another menu item next.

Been ordering delivery from Yia Yia's on a regular basis.  The food is very good. They are great at following instructions to modify dishes.  Delicious almost always within 30 minutes.  Good and convenient.
Ordered food - quality had been okay in the past. Called 3 times to figure out status and told food was on the way. Food never arrived asked them to cancel the seamless order... they never did.
Love the delicious greek delicacies that really have that homemade taste ...almost like my Yiayia (grandmother) used to make in the Hellas . This place is a hidden gem !!

Massive delays and rude hostess. We have ordered from this place several times and 80% of the time they are late. Yesterday we placed an order at around 1130am and the food did not arrive until 130pm. When we called the "hostess" she plainly replied that they were busy. No apologies of any kind. We will not order from this restaurant again.

If you're looking for a casual dining place to have great Greek food at amazing price, this is the place. The staff couldn't be nicer and it is a bright modern clean place with a lot of seats and a good location. I would definitely recommend this place and come back.

Stay away.
Rude and unfriendly staff.
Incapable of meeting estimated delivery timelines.

Second visit, this time for dinner to go.  We shared a Greek salad - ample portion for the two of us, with 5 or 6 cubes of feta, red onion, and a few kalamata olives.  Light dressing, good salad.  We again shared a spanakopita, one of my favorite foods.  

For mains, we ordered one chicken souvlaki plate and one vegetable souvlaki plate.  Each came with 2 skewers of either 6 nice chicken cubes or 6 hefty pieces of vegetable: 2 big chunks of eggplant, 2 big chunks of zucchini, and 2 big chunks of tomato.  Of course, we shared the skewers.  You get a lovely side of Greek salad with the souvlaki plate, so we have salad for tomorrow night!  Plenty of pita wedges, bot with the large Greek salad we had shared, and then soaking up the juices from our skewers.  The side we both chose was lemon potatoes, and I must say they were really lemony and delicious!  A small cup of tzatziki rounded out the souvlaki plate and it's a great tzatziki.

Glad this was our dinner choice this evening!

I've ordered from Yia Yia's several times since moving to the UES. Everything has always been delicious. I usually order the lamb gyro sandwich or platter, avgolemono soup, greek lemon potatoes always instead of french fries and the quality and flavors are consistently great. I have walked in once and there is plenty of indoor seating. Their customer service is excellent and they are pretty quick with preparation. I saw lots of takeout bags lined up for delivery companies. The Greek Salad was wonderful and ingredients were fresh. I will continue to support this local Greek Spot!

I ordered the food online and when I went into the restaurant it was sitting on the counter ready for me to pick up. I had paid extra for 8oz of tzatziki sauce plus the 2oz one that was with one of the meals. I only saw 2 in the bag she told me 2 were in the plate and gave me one more which equaled what I ordered. I ordered the vegetarian platter it comes with spinach pie, a side salad and lemon potatoes plus a side. The side I chose was feta fries. I was missing the lemon potatoes, didn't know right away because I didn't eat there. Spinach pie was soggy and not tasteful at all. The side salad was good and a good amount of feta on the fries and salad. My coworker got the chicken kabob platter with rice. She said the rice and salad were good. But the chicken wasn't that great. This is my second time ordering from them, I probably wouldn't give them a third chance. Also one of the boxes was super oily when I took it out of the bag.
The portion sizes are huge for the price- and food is amazing. Would definitely recommend the Souvlaki plates

This might become my spot for lunch during work!
Interior: good amount of space and tables. They've got this cool design of colored window panels hanging on the walls.
Service: decent time. I ordered a Santori Salmon and it took like 10mins. Could be faster so I could enjoy more of my lunch break but not terrible. If you have a table, one of the employees will come out to bring it to you which is great. Gives it a take out/dine in vibe.
Food: delicious! My salmon sandwich was great. It's hard to find pescatarian meals for lunch so this'll have to be my go to. The fries were amazing and so was the salad (both included with it). The salad had this delicious seasoning/dressing - I wish it was on the sandwich bc I had to take bites of both for it to be spectacular lol.

If you work in the area, I recommend calling in your order for lunch 10mins before arrival. Great food.
Delicious breakfast sandwiches, excellent fresh salads, good coffee. Most important, super friendly, welcoming staff. Now a daily customer!

I was in the area, checking out my new digs and was famished. I love a good smoothie so I searched Yelp for a good spot in the area. This place was close enough for a short walk. They're basically a really clean deli where you can get bowls, smoothies, juices, sandwiches and snacks.

Their menu is pretty basic but I love my classic PB & Banana smoothie which is just about available everywhere. They have an interesting take one my usual and it's called the PB & S. It's peanut butter, bananas and spinach! I wasn't sure how this was going to pan out. They use an almond milk base and I added vegan protein, chia seeds and granola. It came out green, which is to be expected, but it tasted soooo good! I'm definitely adding spinach to my usual, whether I make it at home or order from a bar. Smoothies are a great way to incorporate healthy whole foods into your diet when you don't have the time to either cook or sit down to a meal.

I wish they had more options for customization but I'll deal because they're not a full on juice/smoothie bar. The man that took my oder was unsure of the ingredients they even had and I was adding items that I read off their own menu. Luckily someone was near and corrected him so I was able to get all of the additions that I wanted.

Considering I'll be working in the area from time to time, I'll definitely be back.

I usually frequent this place almost weekly. Today their coffee was contaminated with dishwashing liquid. I wasn't going to bring it back but I figured maybe I could save someone else from drinking contaminated coffee. She hands me another cup which the dishwashing liquid smell is even stronger because it was hotter. I told her that this is also contaminated and she should pour out all the coffee and re-rinse but she declined. I took a sealed coffee and was made to pay the difference. Glad that they're cleaning everything but I shouldn't have to taste it.

The service was very bad.  I went to buy a Caesar salad on a Saturday , the employee was very rude. When he started making my salad I saw him putting very little romaine. I asked is that all you're going to put? He said yes we measure it. I usually buy the salad close to my building but unfortunately they don't make salads on weekends. The salad they give me is always full.
Now please see by yourself the photo of my Caesar salad!   A joke! No comment to add the photo speaks for itself!!
Don't go there! Any other Deli would give you a full box!  Shame on them!!!
Worth a quick stop if u need a bite to eat! Eggplant panini is definitely a good sandwich and warm and tasty. Recommend!

Omg. This place is unbeleivably yuck. They don't wash their hands to handle food. The store casH clerk is the same person who makes the juices and he touched the garbage can then grabbed my fruit to blend it as a pressed juice. I swear I was in shock They need to come supervise this guy. Literally . Had to tell him.  Absolutely not will i buy that juice. Please make a other 1 again and I'm watching you!!! Its FIDGUSTING. PPL ARE OUT HETE GETTING SICK FROM FOOD HANDLERS LIKE THESE PPL
The most clutch late night deli on the upper east side. Conveniently located near 3 major hospitals, this 24/7 deli delivers well, and at all hours. A staple for night owls of the UES.

Juicy, flavorful, cheesy sandwich. The Vera Cruz Panini was a pre made sandwich that they heated up, cut in half, and packaged it right up. I took it to Central Park and it was still nicely warm, with insane cheesy melt that made the sandwich juicy. It has a nice slight spice of flavor, and overall a very balanced sando.

York Grill & Juice Bar is another place on a side street that sometimes gets overlooked. We don't pay as much attention to businesses that are not on the main Avenues. I'm going to keep my eyes open more after this.

York Grill is another cute, clean breakfast or lunch spot. I was there early and there was already a customer before me. The two employees were ready to serve although not as peppy as I am in the early morning. It was stick to business type service. I'm sure they had more food preparation for their day.

Prices are all over the place depending on what you order. Most items run around $8.00. Muffins and some pastries are very reasonably priced. They're open 24 hours unless that's changed. I'd be a regular if I didn't live so far away. I'm recommending you have a big appetite before you go. I vote for the Paninis as they are good with fresh ingredients.
Whenever you need a quick bite during anytime of the day. Combination of a deli and convenience store. Prices are reasonable and they also offer hospital discount.

This place is surprisingly great. The food was so good. I got a tuna melt panini and burger deluxe for my husband. The panini was so good! The bread was crunchy and the tuna tomatoes and lettuce was so tasty. The burger was great and the French fries are so yummy. The prices are fair and the discount was a nice addition to an already great experience.
Friendly peeps with incredible menu.  Very clean facility and excellent juice bar.  Also very quick service.  I'll be back!

My friend recommended their Vera cruz panini, which honestly was not my first choice on their menu but seeing how popular it is I decided to give it a try. It was so good! The ingredients are simple and seem like something you can easily make at home but after more than a year of eating boring homemade sandwiches for lunch at work, I've come to the conclusion that it takes expertise in making a tasty sandwich. The vera cruz comes with chicken, peppers, onions, cheese, avocado, and chipotle mayo and it's a magical combination. The sandwich also comes with a pickle, a bag of chips, and a can of soda. Not bad for ~$10. Will definitely be back to try their other paninis and smoothies.

This is my go-to delivery place if I'm staying at the hospital across the street. They are open 24/7 which is so great. I always order a smoothie or acai bowl, and love their piña colada smoothie. Taking just one star off because sometimes they don't have all the ingredients for the acai bowl, but I haven't run into issues with other things from their menu.

I think this is one of the best delis near the area with the greatest bang for your bucks and guess what?! It's opened 24/7!!

Their wraps, quesadillas, and açaí bowls are absolutely delicious and I love that some of their wraps come with chips and soda/water. Definitely delicious and pricing is reasonable as well.
Great place , different varieties of foods and good customer service , I would definitely want to go back and try the other varieties

Staff at register are rude,and they always find a way to over charge you ..I was charged 9dallors and 15 cent for a bagel with bacon and cheese and a small bag of chips...NOT THE FIRST SECOND OR THIRD TIME
Quick, tasty, fresh. Definitely a great place to go if you are looking for healthier options. Really yummy

Love their Choco-nana smoothie (Pro-tip: add cinnamon) and haven't had a sandwich I haven't liked. Also major points for being open 24/7, being a night shift nurse it's always so hard to find places that are open overnight and this place always hits the spot. So happy we have it close to the hospital! :)

Food is OK but the customer service has gone from bad to worse.  I went there last night for a burger on my break (which was obvious as I was in a hospital uniform) and had to stand there waiting to pay for and get my food while the guy was making smoothies, his back to the customers...I'm watching my food get cold and my break time tick away.  I was there over 20 minutes just waiting and, when the guy behind at the cashier started serving a guy who ORDERED AFTER ME and began making him yet another smoothie, I had enough of this BS and just left to grab a quick bite elsewhere.  Luckily, I was so totally ignored that I hadn't paid for the food.  I'm sure that he still hasn't noticed and it's still sitting there behind the counter.  Dude, here's a hint:  When the food is ready, you call that person next and stop making time-consuming smoothies.  On a brighter note, the man who made my burger was super-nice.  Oh, and the tip cup (to reward a long wait and horrible service) is a nice touch.
Some of the best smoothies in the area! The choco banana one is our favorite. Expensive but worth it

Got the Vera Cruz panini that comes with free chips and drink ($9.65) and the peanut butter bliss acai ($9.58). The panini is pre-made so they just had to heat it up. Super filling, fresh and tasty. Acai was also great. The base is also pre-made so it took less than a minute to get my acai.

Ordered pick up couple days ago. My order was ready when I came to pick up, staffs were nice. Phili Cheese steak was good , juicy not dry. Greek salad kind of small for $8.95 but vegetable was fresh. Overalls is ok for deli places nothings special.
Really great place. Open 24/6. Great food and very friendly staff. i get sandwich, smoothie or wings.

This is a gem of a place. It is a mix of a convenience store (you will find any snack your heart desires) and a lunch place with fresh, healthy options. The staff is extremely friendly and efficient. You can get a lunch - power bowl, sandwich, panini, salad - made right in front you for cheaper than most other  places around. Lunch options are fresh and have good portion sizes and tend to last 2 meals for me. I particularly enjoy the Lemon Grilled Chicken Sandwich.

I ordered two paninis they were fresh and delicious .
This place really takes care of their food!
I will definitely order here again

York Grill and Juice Bar is a gem surrounded by all the hospitals on the UPPER East Side and open 24 hours. It is one of the cleanest delis in Manhattan that I have seen.  The prices are amazing for the quality of the food. The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  The food is delicious and I love their smoothies are tasty.  My favorite smoothies are the Chocolate Nana and the Almond lover. The salads are always fresh and their sandwiches and paninis are always great.

I love the juice and smoothies and York Grill! This is a great local find that has reasonable prices for really quality fresh juice and smoothies. I haven't tried their food yet but friends have highly recommended their wraps and sandwhiches also.

Hands-down the best grill/juice bar/deli in the neighborhood. The quality is unmatched, which is all the more impressive when you consider the variety of the menu. It's no surprise that they've been so successful in such a short period of time. The owner, Amine, is almost always there ensuring the operation runs smoothly and deliciously, and is a great friend to everyone who walks through the door. Since it's opened, we go there multiple times a week and sometimes multiple times in a day.

While the menu is strong through and through, my personal favorites are:
Hash Brown Burrito, Greek Omelette, Vera Cruz panini, Chicken Pesto Panini, Eggplant Parm panini, Tuna Twist wrap and the Cajun Chicken Quesadilla.

Last, very important note: the bagels are NOT generic deli bagels. They are full, proper, NY bagels.

So glad to have this business in the neighborhood . Reasonably priced but absolutely delicious food. The variety that they offer combined with the fresh smoothies- win win. Not to mention the owner is really kind
New deli near the hospitals. Solid food. I typically get a sub, soup and and/or salad. Open late, which has come in handy.
I keep ordering and they keep bringing me delicious food! I'm liking this arrangement so far!
really disappointed. i found a hair in my green juice, they should be more careful in what they serve to people.

Best deli ever. Freshest, high quality ingredients, great pricing, friendly and kind staff. Have tried a smoothie and a couple of sandwiches and all were packed with ingredients. Great assortment of food, snacks and beverages as well. Highly recommend.

Couldn't decide what I wanted to order for a quick lunch and discovered this spot on DoorDash. Everything I've ordered thus far has been amazing, exactly what I was looking for. From the paninis to the juices and even the sides, everything has been tasty and reliable. Highly recommend!
Just moved on this block and found this gem! Food is fresh and tastes great, they also have a wide variety of drinks and snacks. Friendly staff and 10% discount for hospital workers!

I love this place! I order from it all the time.  Their sandwiches and wraps are amazing, you even get a free soda and bag of chips with your purchase! Smoothies are awesome as well.  Reasonably priced too and fast delivery! So happy this place opened up so close to us!

We savored the Drunkside Down Sicilian Pizza pie with mushrooms and black olives, and it truly delighted our taste buds. It's among the finest pizzerias on the Upper East Side.

The sauce offered a burst of flavors, while the crispy, hearty dough left us thoroughly satisfied.

I wholeheartedly endorse this spot for anyone seeking a delectable slice in the area. The staff was welcoming, and there's ample indoor seating available.

Now this gentleman sends me nasty emails calling me a "Karen"

Sir I suggest you stop being nasty to people. Seriously

For a local pizza spot, this place is the best! Staff are friendly and the service is quick.

They have all the classic slices and some really nice creative additions. I just had an arugula salad grandma slice. Random, but exactly what I wanted. How did they know?  Also, you can't go wrong with the pepperoni or the crazy grandma.

I inhaled my pizza before I could even take a proper picture. It was delicious! Highly recommend the arugula grandma slice and all white pizza! The salad on top of the arugula grandma was delicious! Loving their crust too. Small cozy local place with a few tables. And super nice staff members! Can't wait to come back to try all their other pizzas.

Came by on a whim bc of Yelp... and have been back several times since.

Not the cheapest slice of pizza, but well worth the price. Have had the Nonna slices, vodka and plain cheese. Flavor of sauce and cheese is tasty, and that crust is satisfyingly crispy. Gentlemen behind the counters are gruff-nice-but-no-BS in a way that as a New Yorker I appreciate. Has a steady business but not crazy crowded. Typical neighborhood pizza parlor interior, nothing fancy, but clean and uncrowded.

If this was downtown near where I live, I'd pit it against Joe's and Prince St Pizza any day, and would win most days for me just for the lack of crowding.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! All their pizzas are fantastic, and I never have to wait especially long especially for a whole pie. Genuinely such a good underrated neighborhood pizza spot in UES.

I'm thrilled to have York Ave Pizza as my neighborhood slice joint. I found their version of the Prince Street slice more enjoyable than the original.
I got a mushroom and jalapeño slice on my last trip there. The very sweet worker behind the counter drolly said, "That's a good choice!" He sounded a little conspiratorial but I was along for the ride at this point.

The slice took a little longer to heat than usual. When I opened the to-go box, the slice was studded with freshly cut jalapeño that had clearly been added right as the pizza came out of the oven. It was...magical and dope, haha. This should be adopted everywhere!

People act like they're real critics of crust and sauce elsewhere for pizza reviews. I can tell you that the crust and sauce are great on the grandma and traditional slices here. You won't be disappointed.

The price of slices is on par or lower than other similar spots in Manhattan. I can't wait to try their coffee as well. Honestly, this is what you move to NY for, arteries aside. I'm proud to call York Avenue Pizza my neighborhood spot and can't wait to show it off to family and friends who visit.

I was working in this area, in a bit of a hurry, and needed something quick to eat. This spot was close and convenient, so I gave it a try. The pizza was very, very good. Particularly the dirty pepperoni slice was exceptional. My only complaint is that I felt the pizza was way overpriced. Two slices of standard sized pizza cost me nearly $15. And I noticed how expensive a lot of the other items were. But otherwise, the taste was right on the money.

I just tried this place after reading the positive reviews! We ordered the grandma and it was perfect. The sauce was true pizza sauce, sweet, oregano, etc. (not this spicy crap all the pizzerias in the city are now using.)
They used fresh mozzarella. The crust was perfect, albeit a little thinner than I'm used to for a grandma, but I loved it. Non vedo l'ora di assaggiare tutto il resto!
FYI You can order free deliver through the Slice app.  Not on seamless. Delivery arrived 30min after I ordered. Nice and hot!

The owner Billy, the pizza and surprisingly the coffee are fantastic.

Had my first Greek frappe and will have more.

Awesome pizza! Newish spot that opened 5 months ago. Too many pizza joints in NYC to count, many are just mediocre. Always great to stumble upon a place that's special. Excellent cheese slice -- sauce on the sweeter side which I love and dough cooked to a perfect combo of soft but crisp. Sexy slice was also top notch. Will definitely return
Extremely solid pizza and the owner is super nice. The desserts looked awesome but I'm saving that for next time. Extra points for the Grateful Dead reference.

Real NYC pizza made by a true New Yorker. Pizza is excellent and made with high quality ingredients. Upside Down is fantastic. As close as you can get to L&B without the hike to Brooklyn. Easily one of the top Pizza places on UES.

Simply one of the best additions to our neighborhood and the pizza is next level delicious. I love how I can tell that the ingredients are so much more artisanal and curated than most of the cheap slice joints dotting the upper east side; the pies coming out of the oven at York Ave Pizza are unique and delicious, inclusive of different crust options as well. You'll also be delighted to find delicious Greek-style coffee and bakery items, among other grab & go options too.
But I'm adding a picture of my absolute favorite, the York Ave salad - its the best grab & go meal and priced perfectly, making it my ultimate lunch when I am WFH. The salads here are so delicious! Try them and a slice of pizza and you'll have the best of both worlds.

I stopped by here today for a slice of pizza. I completely regret it. I took it to go and perhaps they decided to provide me with an old slice because it was horrible and made my afternoon unpleasant. So lesson learned - check the slices before you order, especially to go.  Maybe I'll give it another try but first I'll check other spots in this area.

Pizza and Buffalo wings were delicious! I'm picky about my wings, as a lot of places make them sludgy/fatty. These were crispy and flavorful, perfection! Only in NYC for a few more days but will probably go back for more!

Nice pizza joint where we were staying. We got the margarita, the pizza sauce was fresh, had good seasoning. The slices were large, and had good speckle on bottom and a nice crust. Good local neighborhood spot

I made a trip to York Avenue Pizza to sample their food. The space is small but neat, and they have a nice bathroom. I ordered a Detroit slice and an Upside down slice. The Upside down slice was very tasty, but the Detroit slice did not work for me. Two slices and a bottle of Evian water cost $13.83. Value $11.00. Thank U next!

The Pizza is okay,nothing special about it,What is special is the RUDE TOXIC Woman at the Cash register.. Talk about just plain nasty,I don't need to deal with that nonsense!!!! I'll pass on this place...I appreciate the owner reaching out class act!!!!  To be fair the food is good there,I guess I will just block her out

I tried all the pizza around this area and this is the best tasting one. The pizza is Crispy the marinara sauce is fire the pepperoni isn't that cheap stuff them other ppl use. Great selection of slices they also got sweets rest variety of sodas and hipster beers. Service is always great  and the ambience gives that old school uptown pizzeria vibe. Definitely will be coming back

Ordered a tomato sausage pie and added mushrooms for delivery. Delivery was fast but nowhere in pizza description did it say garlic was on the pie. They use pre minced garlic. Did not even finish one slice of an 18 in pie. Did not taste good at all. Not a fan.
Great pizza, nice people. We went there many times while we were living in the city. Would definitely recommend!

I wasn't expecting to love this place so much! The Drunken Grandma pizza is incredible, I would eat it every day if I could. The mozzarella sticks and garlic knots are also great. Everything was well packaged and warm on delivery. Definitely will be ordering again!
Excellent pizza and great atmosphere ! Welcoming and friendly . Pizza is fresh and delicious

I gave them two chances.
Time #1--I ordered and the app called me and said that nothing I ordered was available. NOTHING. Including slices of, you know-pizza.
Time #2-The restaurant called this time to say that things weren't available. But not everything, at least. So they brought what they did have, and it was cold when it arrived.
Problem is--I can see this place from my living room window. So why is it cold?!

The pizza was good...reheated. I wanted to love and support this local place. But they got two chances. I'll be at Delizia.

Delicious pizza! Very glad we tried this newer establishment. The York Ave Twister has vodka sauce, pesto, and fresh mozz. Crust was crispy, light, and cooked perfectly. All the toppings were fresh and delicious. Pepperoni slice had the perfect amount of cheese and crispy hot pepperoni cups. Went back to try a 3rd slice (buffalo chicken) which was also amazing. The gorgonzola sauce isn't overpowering at all. Essentially, all the flavors and textures are well balanced and delicious. Would come back (and likely order a whole pie).

Great pizza and more restaurant.  Went there Friday and got a pepperoni sausage pizza. That was the best pizza I have had in 10 years in UES. Crust was perfect and damn good .  Toppings awesome. Went back Monday night for the meatball and spaghetti, house salad, and my wife had the Chicken Parmigiano w spaghetti.  What a treat. Great food and awesome owner! Can't wait to go there and try another delicious meal!​
One of the best slices in UES in my opinion. Upside down, detroit, and sicilian are all good
Friendly folks working the oven and front-end.  Great Tiropita and pizza by the slice.  Plan to try the  breakfast sandwiches in the morning.
Best pizza in the city. Service is incredible, and the owner is one of the kindest people ever.

Recently opened local pizzeria with a pizzaiolo who got his start kneading the dough at the Ray Bari Pizza in Midtown. When the opportunity was presented to him to open his own business after doing deliveries during the pandemic, he jumped at the chance to introduce his skill with Original Italian pies, but also not afraid to venture out with unique toppings, like pesto, Buffalo chicken and his take on a slice inspired by Prince Street pizza. He also sources desserts from a popular Queens Italian bakery as well as some Greek treats since they are both from Astoria. A plain slice is only $3, which is a bargain considered this isn't your run of the mill 99 cent place (which isn't even $1 anymore). Real local pizzeria serving the locals. Support small business!

Amazing pizza sauce And good
Sad that some of the special cheese appetizers sell out so fast
I live for their garlic knots

Weird, bad vibes from the staff. First time I was in a couple weeks ago, chef and woman at register got into an altercation and another worker nastily replied to a woman for asking the hours of the location. Second time I went in, the person behind the counter asked me what I wanted and offered a few options. I said, "I want a plain cheese slice if you have one". He proceeds to tell me (very annoyed) that he just offered me cheese slices (which were not plain cheese). I say, "it's ok - I'm good" because there's literally 1 million pizza places around and I don't need mine with a side of attitude. He finally pulls out cheese slices from under the counter as I'm walking out the door and continues to be rude. Pizza is actually pretty good, but it's a bummer that their staff seems not to know how to treat customers. It's pizza - CHILL.

a new pizza shop on the upper east side that serves kick ass pizza , salads,  pasta dishes , garlic knots. fries , greek spinach pies, entrees, desserts , etc.  stopped by on a friday afternoon for a few cheese slices but something smells good at the table next to me and discreetly i ask the counter guy whats those folks having and he told me its a york hero which is chicken cutlet with panko breadcrumbs and melted mozzarella , ok pizza next time , its hero time now. it was yummy but burning hot as i couldnt wait ..next time i must try a few slices as i heard that owner has been in the pizza game a long time.  p.s. damn i should have grabbed some zeppoles for my evening snack.

This is such a great addition to the neighborhood. I've been going since they opened and we go at least once per week now. The pizza is delicious- not too heavy but not too light, good cheese coverage, savory sauce. The York Ave salad might be my favorite salad in New York. Everything is made from scratch and the owner/pizzaiolo is truly passionate about his food and his customers. York Ave Pizza is a rare gem!
11/10 one of the best gluten free pizzas I've ever had! I added pepperoni to the york ave twist and it was amazing!!
This place has the best eggplant parm! Good salads, slices, desserts and coffee. Closed Sundays.

Couldn't be more excited to have this spot in the neighborhood! The pizza is absolutely delicious. I love that they open in the morning for coffee service too. I can see I will now be spending all of my money on Greek Frappes. The staff & owner (who is very present on site) are also really lovely. One of the best slices I've had UES in quite a while.
I love pizza and I love coffee.  This place has both and they're both great.  Highly recommend.  Get the twister (pesto, vodka and fresh mozz), it's awesome.
New place in the neighborhood and a welcome addition! Good selection of slices, great extras like cappuccinos and spanakopita. Very friendly service, looking forward to their liquor license!

Billy and his team at York Avenue Pizza keep crushing it! You've got to try the crazy grandma slice or, better yet, the whole pie. Amazing quality; out of this world personal service; excellent prices; and that NY Pizza that feels like home.

Good halal food, I prefer the gyro , messy but delicious. I tried the rice and it was a little bland for me. Great service, the man is very polite and accommodating. They accept card! The hot sauce is spicy too

Solid local halal. Has what seems to be an Indian flair.  Fave is halal guys, but this local halal is a solid choice.  Combo over rice is a good option. Red sauce isn't too spicy, layer that stuff on.

P.s. this is a review for a food cart. Does anybody really read this?

$5

It isn't the best in the city, but $5 is a win. That will get you a hot, delicious, combo box.

My experience here was more smooth compared to the one on 71st and york, this cart also had fish and falafel but after reading yelp review which stated that the falafel was probably really old I decided to stick with fish just to be safe .. the fish was okay but the rice was a little bland and the salad was very dry. Prices were as listed and staff was efficient I am on the fence as to whether or not I would order from here again because the cart on 71 gave me two prices of fish whereas here I only received one piece. Big boss still has the best flavor in my opinion but they don't have vegan or pescatarian options.

3.5 stars. solid, typical halal street meat.
$5 for over rice dishes is tough to beat.

If you want typical halal come here.
If you want a sweeter cinnamon rice, go to big boss cart a block away.

Price is good at $5. The bag was heavy so portion is generous. It's average halal, nothing great, nothing bad. I would've given 4 stars if there were more rice. There was a thick layer of chicken and just a thin layer of
rice. I would've preferred less chicken if I could get more ricw
Lamb kebab so good! I liked it a lot and it hit the spot. Street meat, with white sauce and hot sauce. Sloppy but tasty.
This is my go to halal cart. Get chicken and lamb mix with rice! The spicy rice is good!

If you're in the neighborhood, some of the best meal options around are being dished out at the halal carts on York Ave. - across the street from the hospital. I make the long trek from Hunter College and it's well worth it.

This particular halal cart is my backup if "Big Boss Halal" on the corner of E. 69th St. and York has left for the day or has an insanely long line. Nevertheless, hands down, if you have a choice - go to Big Boss. Both the service and the food are much, much better, and both carts have the same prices.

At this point I've tried the rice dishes and the gyros. I can recommend their gyro but the rice dish left me disappointed. The rice and meat were both okay but the fries and falafel were pretty bad. Vegetarian options aren't so great either. I tried a falafel sandwich and wouldn't order it again. They're $4 just like the meat gyros but aren't as big (no veggies - not sure why [?]), and the falafel tasted like it was made a loooooooong time ago.

Street food is street food and I'm sure someone could question the freshness factor at most of these halal carts. However, if you're not looking to spend a lot of money on lunch and want something that's sorta healthy, this is the spot.

This is the BEST Halal food cart in all of NYC by a very wide margin. Their chicken is so well seasoned that I go out of my way to go here when I am in the mood for a chicken and lamb on pita sandwich! And I consider myself lazy when it comes to stuff like this, so that tells you just how good they are!

5 bucks for chicken+lamb over rice? (Well, and dollar for water) So far, so good. Comes with a handful of French fries and 2 falafel balls as well? Another thumbs up. There's a couple pieces of broccoli somewhere in there too. The chicken and lamb are both good, but it's hard to even analyze the quality of these things beyond it having good texture and having agreeable spices on it.
Chicken comes with onions? Unfortunately I hate onions in my combos. It's nasty out-of-place filler for me. The guy selling the food asked me if I wanted a water or soda three times before handing me my meal, which came off as a bit more pushy than concerned for my thirst. Gonna be giving this badboy a 4 out of 5, for those onions. Can't stand em.  (Some of the carts around here, like the one outside hunter college, deserve 3 out of 5 even without onions, so consider this 4 a pretty good rating for what it is. Like a 4.5.)
Halal guys who? This is the best halal food in the city hands down. Large plate of food for a good price. The owner is a gentleman and the food is cooked fresh.
Good fresh lamb gyro, not too fatty and the hot sauce is spicy! Enjoyed it very much. Service was friendly as well.

Pretty good lamb over rice for $5 although it's a bit salty. I prefer this cart over the one on 70th street. They ask you whether you want yellow rice or spicy rice (at least that's what I thought he said).

They also have other types of food that most halal carts do not offer such as shawarma, falafel, fish, and chicken wings. The menu lists kofta but it's no longer being offered; I not sure if they still have fish or chicken wings despite it being on the menu as well.

On separate occasions, I had the chicken shawarma and the beef shawarma. The chicken shawarma is $7 and delicious. They packed the container full and smothered it with white sauce. Yum! Although unfortunately it leaked onto my coat. There is enough for two meals. The beef shawarma is $8 and was  bland compared to the chicken. The meat was also a bit tough.

Stopped in during lunch and got the mixed over spicy rice .   The chicken and lamb are both flavorful and the spicy wasn't overly spicy .   During the weekdays you get a free drink with your purchase.  Can't beat that for 6 bucks .

Came here today after reading yelp review that they had falafel and fish fish over rice. I decided To go with fish over rice and it was okay. The hot sauce is really spicy and the white sauce lacked in flavor as did the rice but I am glad they have this option for those who aren't a big fan of meat I deducted two stars because the flavor wasn't there as opposed to big boss( I am comparing the flavor of the rice since big boss doesn't have fish or falafel) the portions aren't as big as big boss and I am upset that they have false advertisement. Fish over rice is listed as $5 on two or three of the signs the have on the outside of the cart  right in front of your face but when you order they ask out for $6. I don't mind paying six but at least list the price as is. I would be back if I'm craving halal because big boss doesn't have a vegan or pescatarian option I just hope they update their prices on their signs so it isn't false advertisement

I'm a big fan of halal food and have tried many different locations in the city. I have to say this one is the best! Even though it is not as famous as the halal guy or others, their flavor is much better! And they are much generous than other locations. So lucky that we have such wonderful halal food in the neighborhood!

Buddy takes care of me everytime with the lamb over rice, extra hot sauce extra white sauce and a Dr Pepper. This is my shit, I like to find a bench and enjoy my meal. True NYC fulfilling meal on the go

Yefsi accommodated our large party dinner and gave us the back/backyard covered area. We got a pre-fixe menu which were limited options from the main menu. However the dishes for apps included calamari, octopus, Greek salad and a mezze platter. All were delicious! For entrees, I opted for the salmon and green beans. But I know many others opted for the steak dish, which was a gigantic portion!

Overall great food and company, will always return to Yefsi!

I'm not familiar with the UES, so I went on Pulsd to see if I could snag a last-minute reservation for brunch with a friend. After looking at the menu, online we decided to go to Yefsi. From the minute we sat down to when we left, I felt so at home. Our waitress and a man that I believe was the owner or manger were so hospitable. Our Pulsd included bottomless mimosas, and our waitress was very on top of refilling our glasses. We started off w the bread and dip such was delicious. My friend and I both opted for brunch sandwiches, she got the lamb and I got halloumi which were both served with fries and salad. Delicious.
Note that if you're paying with a Pulsd, they don't add any extra fees, so be a good person and tip in cash or order a coffee or something so you can leave a tip!

Yefsi,
Located in the Upper East Side
Looking for Authentic Greek Food, This Place Has An Upscale Vibe and A Variety Of Full Course And Shared Dishes! We enjoyed The Delicious Authentic Greek Wine. This Place Has Such A Beautiful Ambiance, The Attraction Of Historical Greek Figures, Statues And Wall Art Kept Us In Awe

What We Ate
Feta Sto Fourno
Octapodi  
Mousaka
Thalassini Makaronada

What we Drank  
Authentic Greek White Wine

I fell in love with the Mousaka, so delicious and tasty! Loved how creamy and flavorful it was! Wow!

Don't forget to Check Out The Garden In a the Back Of the Restaurant If you're looking For A More Private Inclosed Garden Space  
The servers make you feel like family super sweet and very informative of the menu

My friend and I had a lovely dinner here. The space inside was warm and intimate, with an inviting vibe.

We were served rustic bread with what seemed to be homemade hummus. The bread was nice and soft.

For my meal, I selected the Lamb Shank, which was served with Lazanki noodles in a tomato cinnamon sauce. The Lamb Shank was quite impressive in size in a bed of tasty looking noodles with shredded cheese on top, along with fresh rosemary in the center. The Lamb Shank was oh so tender, well seasoned with incredible depth of flavor. The pasta was cooked perfectly and I even enjoyed the sauce (usually not a fan of tomato based sauces). I liked that it had a strong cinnamon taste.

My friend and I shared the Small Dessert Platter, which was such a great deal... For $15, we got to sample all 4 desserts. There were Karidopita (Greek walnut sponge cake with honey syrup), Baklava, Galatoboureko (Vanilla custard in phyllo pastry), and finally, Greek yogurt. My favorite was the Karidopita, which was absolutely delicious sticky sweet honey essence cake. The Baklava was crunchy, light, filled with crushed walnuts and glazed with syrupy honey. The Galatoboureko had a wonderful soft, creamy, custardy center and layers of outer dough. Last, the Greek Yogurt came with walnuts, Quince preserves, and more honey. This was a delightful combination. The smooth, milky yogurt paired well with the fruity, almost cherry-like preserves and the honey gave it an added level of yumminess.

Service was solid. Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. I might return at some point for the Baby Lamb Chops or Mousaka.

I came here on a weeknight with my girlfriend and quickly fell in love with the place.

The vibes of this restaurant are pretty laid back; everyone eating at the restaurant was dressed very informally. But don't let that fool you. The food is worthy of a date night.

We got the lamb chops with lemon potatoes, spinach rice, calamari, and...tbh I can't remember if what we had was the branzino or the other white fish they had on the menu, but it was delicious.

The lamb chops were so good I almost wished we had just gotten two plates of that instead of sharing it! Having a bite of the lamb chops with a bite of the lemon potatoes was heavenly. I didn't expect the lemon potatoes to be left whole, but I promise the potatoes are perfectly tender and easy to slice through.

There was plenty of large pieces of calamari and they were well battered/fried. I enjoyed the yogurt sauce it came with as well.

Will definitely be coming back!

We dropped by on a thur winter night for dinner for 4. A longtime mainstay of the neighborhood and was generally packed (~80%).  Positives: large menu (dominated by seafood) with extensive appetizer choices.  Food was OK but nothing memorable especially given the high prices (which is the biggest negative).  The steak was dry.  Same with the fish. The half chicken was too saucy. The beef Patties were actually delicious but small serving size.  Service was OK (not super attentive but also not overbearing).  For beer drinkers, they only have 1 beer offering (Greek bottle) but an extensive wine menu.  Ambiance needs some refreshing - Old and dark

Dropped by for a quick bite on Sunday - ordered a smoked salmon omelette, a horiatiki salad, and pikilia spread platter to share. In terms of service, they were efficient and the food came out quickly. After we got seated, free house hummus and bread was served. As for what we ordered, different spreads in the pikili were good and had their own charm. The salad was standard and nothing special. The smoked salmon omelette was good and the side of greek fries (served with all egg and salad brunch dishes) helped fill the plate (and my stomach).

Wonderful place and wonderful service. I went to Yefsi with a group of 10, and we were able to have our own private patio area with reservation in advance. The place itself is nestled in the quieter UES, but the inside was so popular and packed with people. The atmosphere was lively, but it still felt intimate with each table having its own candlelit space to itself. Lights and Christmas decorations are also currently in full swing!

The food was amazing. For the prices, you definitely get a lot of food and feel full afterwards. I ordered the Arni Youvetsi. The lamb came right off the bone, and the sauces were perfect combination. I tried other dishes such as the Soutzoukakia--really flavorful and filling. The service was also great--the chef and owner himself checked in on our table and asked how we all were. Waiters were so attentive too and checked in on us periodically.

Overall, Yefsi is a great and warm place to have an intimate dinner or a larger table of friends. The place is busy, so I would make reservations in advance. The lights and candlelit atmosphere sets a more romantic, intimate setting. I definitely recommend the Arni Youvetsi if you like lamb. Otherwise, all things are so flavorful whichever you choose. Highly recommend if you're in UES and want a Greek meal.
The good lived up to its reputation and service was great. octopus and fried shrimp/cod on the regular menu and grilled whiting on its special menu were the stand out dishes.

Yefsi continues to be my favorite for outstanding Greek food Upper East Side, over the past year using Seamless delivery service.

My favorite Greek dishes, Moussaka (which I enjoyed the first time here at Yefsi) and the traditional Greek Salad, have been staples since I started coming here years ago, and never disappoint.

I have not been here in person over the past year but have spoken to friends who have enjoyed outside dining here recently with family and a date with her hubby.

Delivery is prompt (using Seamless).

Delicious fresh Greek food and warm friendly staff. Christos is the chef
I loved the Organic Chicken in complex well seasoned tomato based sauce with potatoes and Shrimp Santorini. The seafood linguini is also amazing!

The restaurant is cozy, and outdoor patio charming. Will definitely be back soon.

Great authentic Greek spot on the UES! They have outdoor seating in the front on the sidewalk along with a cute patio in the back. Make sure to make a reservation as their outdoor seating is limited. The food was a little pricey but definitely worth the quality as it was delicious and unique! We had the grilled octopi for an app; soooo fresh and light! The lamb kebob was seasoned to perfection and the moussaka was also great but a little oily. Most entrees were between $20-$30. The service was good; our waitress gave honest suggestions about the food.

Overall, loved this little gem! Would definitely recommend.

Wonderful meal here the other night. The arni youvetsi (lamb shank over pasta in cinnamon-spiced tomato sauce) was incredible -- so tender and delicious, beautifully seasoned. My companion had the steak, which was cooked perfectly to order, tender, juicy and beefy, and a great deal for restaurant week (as part of a $45 3-course prix fixe). Will absolutely come back !

A few things.

1. Crab is definitely not included, you get a different cut down menu with Pulsd.
2. You are not allowed to grab different kind of drinks for the bottomless. You choose one and stick to it.
3. The bottomless drinks get less and less strong. By my 3rd glass, there was barely any alcohol in it. The head waiter was extremely inconsiderate, he asked me multiple times if I was "sure" I wanted another drink. Not the greatest thing to ask someone who was completely sober after 4 drinks.
5. I left a 20% tip based off of a full Pulsd value, but the head waiter was extremely snarky after he saw the $15 tip.
6. The food was amazing, make sure you get the lamb sandwich, absolutely heavenly. Only reason this got 2 stars.

Overall, I really wouldn't recommend coming with Pulsd, they treat you like second class citizens. But the food is good enough to come without. Be warned.
Yefsi means taste in Greek and here we got a lot of yefsi. The restaurant is very clean. Everything looks like rolling smoothly. The food was amazing, outstanding!!!

We had 8:15 pm dinner reservations and were seated promptly at a nice corner table for 2 in the back garden area.  Service was good, we each had a glass of white Greek wine, and shared the fava puree dip with delicious bread.  I had the grilled vegetable dish which I loved.  My friend had one of the specials, bulgar cones stuffed with beef.  He didn't particularly enjoy them because he was unaware that they would be fried, but it was his own fault because he hadn't asked how they would be prepared.  We shared a side of the lima beans and they were wonderful.  
We will be back.

Came here for brunch and there were only 4 tables occupied. The inside feels classy and the service was very attentive. Ordered the Greek Eggs Benedict and substituted for Greek sausage! Although not noted on the menu, it came with fries, which were soggy. My friend also got steak and frites but it was not good either. They also had a bottomless drink menu. Maybe their dinner is good?!

A friend recommended this place. She said it's an authentic Greek restaurant. What a disappointment Service was terrible. Our orders came at a random pace. We ordered the fish with no capers, they put capers. Ordered 3 salads only got two the third one arrived at the end of our meal.
Won't be coming back here!@

Old people joint trying to be old people cool but can't seem to pull it off. With all the high end pricing, it's not like management doesn't have the money to hire one more staff so people don't wait 25 mins to order at 7pm (not prime time). Food is ok but they need to focus on the guests and not the churning of tables
Eh.  Nothing about this place was great. Food was poor, service medio, and place was ok. What it mostly was was over priced and over rated.

Takeaway: impeccable service. I never had to wait more than a few seconds to get someone's attention, and this time going it was a solo dining experience. I sat in the more secluded back garden area, which would have been a quiet delight if not for the entertainment  I received overhearing UES family squabbles. Hah. I got the lamb, but all of the food looked and smelled fresh so it was hard to choose. I ordered the lamb Kebab chefs choice/medium rare and it came out beautifully, just as it should. Even the rice had tons of flavor, and the whole meal was so filling I really couldn't do dessert. (Though i did end up getting fro-yo a few blocks away). The ambiance is a bit more formal than I anticipated,  probably wouldn't want to return in sneakers but meh. More than likely will be returning to try the seafood!

3.5 at best... could see this being better with some improvements

Having just visited Greece this summer, I was itching for some reminders of the relaxing life on the islands and the inviting familial feel of the restaurants in Athens. Yefsi was our hope to rekindle those memories...

Two of us opted for the Pulsd deal and another for the regular a la carte. Drink options were standard - mimosa, bellinis, etc. and the menu was an odd combination of authentic Greek and regular tavern food.

Food:
- Cheese omelette - good portion but lacking flavor. Bit heavy on the oil
- Burger - well cooked (asked for medium rare), but lacking flavor
- Lamb sandwich - lamb was over cooked and lacking flavor. Perhaps should have opted for chicken instead
- All dishes came with fries - very flavorful but again, heavy on the oil

Drinks - unlimited was good (didn't feel like too much) but was also not a good value. Felt like more juice / club soda

Somewhat disappointing but perhaps we caught it on a bad day. Given the other options in the city, we probably won't be back.

Beat Greek spot on UES.  We had the zucchini croquettes and grilled octopus to start. The croquettes were fried perfectly and the octopus had a good glamor and texture. For main courses, we had the baby lamb chops and the linguini with braised veal. The lamb chops were good and the lemon potatoes that came with it were great. Braised veal and linguini were also good as well (not as saucy as Italian food).

For dessert we had the baklava. Definitely the best baklava I've had in the city. The portion was generous and it was very flaky.

Drinks were pretty good too. The Greek Negroni was made well and fairly priced.

Overall, a good Greek spot. A little on the pricey end (I think the lamb chop could have cost a little less or they could have added 1 extra chop to justify the $42 price), but not too outrageous. Definitely will return.

A solid place for bottomless brunch! They give you a separate brunch menu if you get the pulsd deal. Looks like the regular menu, but they don't have the crab cake sandwich. Also they have bellinis, which the pulsd deal doesn't mention. The lamb sandwich I got was tasty, a little on the small side. The overall meal, though, with the fries and salad, was yummy and filling.
We went on a Sunday and service is a little all over the place, but they did seem very short staffed for the amount of people there. Also they have a weird rule about only one type of drink per person, so if you try switching a Bloody Mary to mimosa, you might be met with hesitancy. While service was slow at first, they picked up in the second half, and we definitely got our money's worth for the amount of rounds we got for the table.

Somewhat upscale greek spot with solid food.

I got their Yefsi chips and a seafood pasta dish. The chips were fantastic, but the pasta dish was just "ehh". It strangely combined spaghetti sauce and feta cheese.

The dinner did come with solid complimentary bread however.

The service was decent

7.5

The food is not as good as it used to be, and for the price I expected better. The filo on the Spanakopita was mushy and the filling was a bit insipid. The grilled squid was the best thing we had. The rest of the food was fine, but not better than that. The restaurant itself is pleasant enough.

We decided  we needed a special and healthy very special Greek dinner. The cocktails were certainly special. My wife's drink included fig infused vodka and a sprig of fresh mint. She loved it.

Our Greek salad was filled with lots of fresh vegetables and the best feta I've ever tasted. Our perfect shrimp was baked with orzo and a fine light tomato sauce. We ordered a special of calamari... a total winner.

This was a very good choice for dinner.

Well this happens to be my spot. Not only my spot just because I love the people that work there but because the food is just absolutely amazing. I love the black Seabass with the tomato sauce it's comfort food like I've never known. There a Greek salad with feta cheese is so fresh melts in your mouth absolutely delightful. The ceviche melts in my mouth there's spreads are absolutely wonderful and the pita is always baked so fresh crispiness from the oven. I can't say enough good things about this place or the people that run it.
Good food. Horrendous service. Prob a good spot to order from but yikes...1 hour for hummus?

I really enjoyed our meal here. We got the following:
-zucchini and eggplant chips: this was great and I definitely recommend. I did like the zucchini better than the eggplant. The breading was light and crispy, which was perfect and the yogurt dipping sauce was great.
-Greek salad: we loved this. The tomatoes were so fresh and the feta was great. The dressing also had great flavor. We ordered another salad after we finished the first because it was so good.
-spanakopita: we didn't like this dish. The filling didn't have much flavor. I wish there was more feta mixed in with the spinach.
-Branzino: very fresh and a good portion. We also loved the lemon potatoes that came with it.
I would recommend going here if you want good Greek food.

This place has an amazing brunch deal, one of the best in the city. Endless Mimosas or Bloody Mary's with purchase of 1 entree. I got the Chicken Sandwich that came with fries. I ate every single one of those fries, not to put down the sandwich it was great, the frjes just had me addicted. Drinks were on point too, give this place a try you will enjoy something about it.

Notice that the negative reviews are for brunch? Anyway, dinner was fantastic. They have a very extensive menu. The servers are very attentive and the food was amazing, very authentic. Highly recommend.
Best Greek food in the UES. Split a bunch of appetizers & entrees, everything was seasoned & cooked perfectly. Highly recommend the yefsi chips & staying for dessert for a slice of the rich baklava.

Hands down my new favorite spot on the upper east side. The service is excellent, welcoming and warm. Theyre quite busy no matter what day it is. I came here for a few snacks but ended up eating 3 entrees! Loved the octopus and salad, couldnt remember the exact names on the menu.

Definitely coming back soon, i have to keep trying everything on the menu! Highly recommended.

Great salmon - cooked to my liking perfectly and served on top of a slightly bring rice pilaf with capers.

Cute and cozy establishment with excellent food - can get busy so recommend making reservations ahead of time.

Pretty good, but short, selection of domestic and imported Greek wines

We went with friends to Yefsi on a Saturday night for a 7:30 reservation. The place was packed, but no matter, our table was waiting for us at 7:20 when we arrived. First, noise level, a triffle bit above average but still good enough to have a conversation without straining.

Next, the service..On target and well attending without unnecessary interruptions.

Lastly, the food. scrumptious. Wife and I had the lamb kebob with rice accompanied with a tossed greens salad lightly drizzled with a red wine vinaigrette dressing. Thumbs up! Our friends had a salmon cooked to her  liking with a salad and he had the traditional Greek chicken soup and a half a chicken dish. The icing on the cake so to speak was the Garides Saganaki, Sauté Shrimp with Tomato Sauce Topped with Melted Feta Cheese. Yummy!!!!!

Definately, a must go but go with reservation...

Wow, this place is great. Sadly, I don't have any pictures to share so you'll have to take my word for how delicious every single dish was. You know how when you order 10 items from a menu to share with a group and there are usually a few things that are just okay? Not here. Everything we tried was incredible. Oh, and so was the service and the martinis.

I would highly recommend dining here with a small group and trying as many dishes possible. Some of the appetizers and entrees we ordered (and you should to) are the Calamari, Yefsi Chips, Kolokithokeftedes, Pikilia, Feta Sto Fourno, Horiatiki (life changing feta), Soutzoukakia, Arni Souvlaki, and lastly, Kotopoulo Souvlaki.

Is Yefsi a little pricey? Yeah, sure. But is it worth every penny? Absolutely. Come here and you won't leave disappointed.
We sat in a cute little courtyard in the back, still air conditioned which was nice for this 85 degree day. Highlights were the Marouli salad and Plaki. Quick and prompt service. Great local find.

The food was a complete letdown and the service horrendous. The interior is actually pretty decent, but it doesn't matter if your food and service are crappy. I personally would love good Greek nearby so hoping they fix things, may give them another try way down the road.

So we stopped by after a birthday party in the area to get dinner--ordered one app (octopus) a two dinner entrees (meatballs and chicken Slovakia). Our total was $84! I'm sorry, our portions were so small, the octopus needed lemon and it was totallly overpriced. The chicken Slovakia was dry. We stopped in because the pictures looked really scrumptious and we wanted to sit down for dinner--but honestly I've had better Greek food in hole-in-the-wall restaurants and other higher end restaurants in the city within the same price range; we will stick to those.

Our server was nice and gave pens to the kiddos to draw on the paper tablecloth. The service weals pretty quick. Would not come back though.

I don't usually write reviews, but this was one of the best dining experiences I've ever had in my life. Our server was extremely attentive and detail oriented. He made sure the courses were served at exactly the right time. Every single bite of food was absolutely scrumptious: the salad, the grilled whole Tzippoura fish with a side of lemon potatoes.. They brought out a sample of desserts for my mother's birthday, which included walnut cake, filo dough filled with custard, baklava and Greek yogurt - all to die for. Even the cappuccino was noteworthy. If I lived in NYC, I would be a regular customer for sure!

As usual, the food was good but as we were handed our menus, the server told us that because they are very busy, the owner said we only have an hour and half at the table.  First of all, how about saying it nicely or even better, ask if that's ok OR stating that when you make the reservation.  If you are limiting times at tables, then it's 'seatings' not reservations.  I will never step foot in there again.  Plenty of restaurants on the UES where they don't time you and you ca relax and enjoy.

My husband and I were looking forward to eating here this evening. We showed up on a night they were not busy to sit outside with my 9 pound service dog. Upon being seated, we were informed that we would be unable to stay because they do not allow dogs due to their insurance policy. The manager demanded to see registration- which is illegal and violates the ADA. After begrudgingly showing him the documentation, he still refused to serve us and came up with a story about getting in trouble with the health department which has nothing to do with the "insurance policy" excuse he previously brought up. It was incredibly rude and I felt embarrassed to be put in this situation- I have never had this problem at any NYC restaurant before. It's too bad because we live in the neighborhood and would have easily become patrons of this restaurant.

Food looked mediocre anyway.

Pretty effing great, pardon my Greek. Yefsi? More like, yes please.

But seriously, surpassed my and my family's expectations. And they're a tough critic when it comes to Cypriot, Greek, Mediterranean food.

It is pricey, upwards of $20 on some mezedes. But the portions are actually fairly sizable, minus the octopus. That always helps.

We had a bottle of the Assyrtiko from Santorini that was delicious.

The octopus was solid, but a very small serving. I really enjoyed the red peppers, capers, and red wine vinaigrette. The calamari was a hefty portion, not over-fried, and served with a refreshing yogurt sauce.

Saganaki: fried cheese, can't go wrong. The Horiatiki salad was fresh. The Kolokithokeftedes (aka fried zucchini) was pretty disappointing, though. Step up your game, zucchini.

The kebab wasn't too good. Spicy, sort of in a good way. But it tasted more like a koftedes than anything. Then again, I don't know why we got kebab at a fish restaurant. My family never listens to me.

But the fish were great! The Lavraki was juicy. And the Arni Youvetsi (lamb shank), not a fish obviously, was flavorful and tender. Great tomato sauce.

Great establishment over on York!

Thank for our wonderful dinner last night.
Staff was very patient with us, since this was our first time here.  
Food so yummy. Lamb chops and ribeye cooked to proper temperature.
We were amazed at how light the battering on the calamari and Yesfi Chips were, light yet crispy = perfect.

Be sure we will be back!
Fairly good Greek spot.  Only tried the lamb sandwich at brunch which was ok, the meat was a bit dry.  Enjoyed the ample yogurt and pita though.

I had the lemon chicken soup. Don't ask me to spell it but it was amazing. My main entree was the salmon and let me tell you it was cooked to perfection a little char but still delicate and delicious. Great spot.

The man who greeted us was so rude and condescending that we decided to go to a different restaurant! My friend and I showed up at 4:50 and asked for a table for two. He looked us up and down and asked if he could help us and then proceeded to tell us that they were all booked up for the night. Mind you, they open right at 5 and there wasn't a single soul there. I also called about 30 min later while we were waiting for our food at a much nicer restaurant down the street to check if they were actually booked and of course they were not! So he lied to our faces after judging the way we looked and turned us away. I guess this restaurant doesn't want $$. Learn to treat your guests with some respect!

Had a reservation indoors tonight at Yefsi, and we were shocked how careless the staff is about Covid. The manager put up his mask to welcome us and then put it down as soon as he could and each time he could. We were seated at a table where we could see the kitchen.
