I definitely recommend stopping by Yara for dinner if you're in the area! Food, drinks, and service are all excellent and I'm really impressed with how vegetarian friendly they are.

My experience here was an absolute joy! I called earlier in the day to inquire if the restaurant was wheelchair accessible, so they had the metal ramp waiting for me when we arrived. Unfortunately, it was too steep for my heavy power wheelchair to get up to the dining room area, even though the owner and his staff tried mightily to assist me and my boyfriend. I was thinking we'd have to leave, but the owner insisted we stay and was quick to find a way to accommodate us. He set up a table in the waiting area (located right by the front window and not at all in the way or awkward) and the whole staff made sure we were well take care of. (My hope, of course, is that they'll get a longer, sturdier ramp so this isn't an issue for other customers!)

As the absolute cherry on top of this excellent service, the food was incredible. We started with some mezze. I especially cannot say enough good things about the vegan kibbe, though I also loved the labneh. For dinner, my boyfriend and I shared shawarma chicken and kibbe b saynieh. Everything was delicious.

With a heavy heart, I have to update my 5 stars review. While the menu still the same yet there's something lacking. The first time we went, the food was so fresh! We chat with the owner too!
We came back and had our family drove from long island to dine for my birthday in July. Disappointed, we bragged so much about this place! I remember how tasty was the fillet mignon but they came out rare, so embarrassed with our family!
We went again last night. We always order the same thing, so we know that same fresh food when the first time we tried was not there anymore. It's so sad. It's going down so fast!

The food is always top quality!  My twin sister and I have a special love for their apple pie and pecan pie. We love their sandwiches, soup and feta squares. Service is always good and the atmosphere is friendly.

Yura at Coleman's is absolutely wonderful. All my favorite pastries, slices of cake, pie, cookies, and breakfast food.

The number allowed inside is limited. Now that I know the drill I can get in and out faster next time. The man behind the counter is very nice. The girl that rang me up was smiling and we chatted a little, she was friendly. I purchased the Chocolate Chip Loaf for $3.75. With tax included that price made it easier to cover with my available cash.

I'm recommending you go when you're in this neighborhood. It's close to the esplanade where you can sit to eat with riverside views. I'm coming back. Enjoy my photos!

Is this place pricey? Yes it is.

Are the pastries here delicious? Yes they are.

Nice little nook of a spot for coffees, pantries, deli and breakfast sandwiches. Freshly made and pre-packaged goods.

Try their homemade blueberry crumb coffee cake. It's good!

The orange juice is fresh pressed and delicious and only $3 so a great bargain! Other items can either be kinda pricey or decently priced. Quality of everything is outstanding though. They obviously benefit from being the only corner store/cafe on all of East End.
The food is good, but it's an absolute ripoff, even for NYC. They take full advantage of being the only place on East End Avenue. If you want cheaper, go to Moduwa on York and 84th.

Great for breakfast and lunch
Only 2 person allowed in at the time
But the wait is well worth
The manager very caring, he will remember what your whole family
Likes.A treasure for this neighborhood

The food is expensive but good. My problem is they don't support the neighborhood by keeping better hours especially weekends.  They charge a lot and take from us but don't give back to the neighborhood by being open proper hours and contribute to the area

Quintessential local shop. The owner and everyone who works there is so friendly. So much attention to detail is paid to everything from how neatly the shelves are stocked to how perfectly the sandwiches are made and wrapped. Reviews saying it's expensive confuse me--compared to a bodega? Maybe, but the quality is incomparable. Ingredients are fresh and care is put into every order. Also has some outdoor seating, a full coffee/espresso menu, daily specials and is the perfect spot to grab a snack for a walk in Carl Schurz. Truly a neighborhood gem!!

I would like to think that my star rating is only for quality of food and that is all.

#1-Wait Time: My wife asked me to get her food while she was 3 months pregnant. While what I ordered does not take long to make, I nearly missed my child's birth 6 months later- all over a bagel.

#2- Price: For $5 you will receive 10 oz of mediocre soup at room temperature. While I was waiting 13 minutes for them to scoop my soup, my taste buds began to crave grilled. But upon looking at the prices, @$11 for half a pound, I would have rather bought a whole chicken, roasted it and ate it over the course  of 2 days- all the while waiting for them to microwave an "11 dollar slab of chicken breast"

#3- Clientele- Very up scale, snobby people. Wish they would give me money rather than spend $9 for 1/2 of kale salad.

That is all I have to say. Not for me, extremely overpriced- but at-least someone is taking advantage of the 1% in the neighborhood.

We were staying at my family's across the street, so I had to run over when we felt like breakfast sandwiches & were too lazy to cook. Ended up going back almost every morning. The bagel sandwiches were great, the eggs were perfectly done, and even the roll they use was good - often the rolls on breakfast sandwiches are tasteless or fall apart (or some use a kaiser), but these were like brioche!

Anyway, the prices seemed reasonable for the UES. And the staff were all really friendly & brought your stuff to the front if you didn't want to wait in the crowded counter area.

I think this place is great. The guy who works behind the counter is super friendly and remembers your orders. Their food is great and I'm pretty sure it's homemade. It can get a little pricey when things are weighed, but I find the prices to be totally fine.
I'm so glad I found this place! I go there as often as possible.

Love this place! I come here almost every weekend for their amazingly delicious breakfast sandwiches, pastries, and strong coffee. Everything is fresh and tasty, and the staff are extremely pleasant. I only wish they were open later on the weekends!
This place is highly expensive and they charged me over $11 for a sandwich with avocado. Spanish guy is rude and disgusting. Don't come here !

Good food. However, extremely over priced and expensive. When ordering something from behind the counter, it takes a while to make. Small portions for large prices. Do not like their coffee, and they are limited to what kinds of coffee they make.

Pro: Very nice food, handy local neighborhood storeroom have.

Cons: food orders are criminally slow and when it is ready, they just leave it at the counter expecting u to come get it or know when it's done. You have paid and sitting waiting yet your food has been getting cold for the past 5 mins.

Should take your name and call like other delis in Manhattan.

I had known that Coleman's had been closed for a while, so when my wife told me that they had reopened, I was interested. When she told me that it renamed "Yura at Coleman's", I was GONE.
Yes, the Yura from Yura on Madison, has an outpost on East End Avenue, and the Colemans have left.
The legendary roast beef sandwich with frizzled onions is there. Less one, which is currently in my BELLY. There's a coffee and espresso counter, some salads and prepared foods, pre-made sandwiches, and deli meat. I feel like the drink case could use work, but that's probably because I need like 500 drink options, when most people need like, five.
In the end, it looks like a nice deli, now I have somewhere to go for foodstuffs when I sojourn to Carl Schurz Park.

The only thing better than the food at this adorable little place is the staff. It's as though everyone who works here always wakes up on the right side of the bed. Really nice people, really good food. Lots of interesting options. Every time I've been here I've tried something new and always really enjoyed it.

The samples are a nice bonus too.

I've lived around the corner from this place for a while and always walked by as walking my dogs.  Today I stopped in and it was just a great clean, basic  deli. 100x cleaner than your corner bodega.  I got their version of a hero and it was the best sandwich I've had in quite a long time.

Service was friendly, the price was...Nyc....and I will be returning often I can't believe I never came sooner!

Nasty service at cash register today, a case of different strokes for different folks the woman was surly when I asked a question and started helping the customer behind be without giving me my receipt. I had to request it 3 times, she then ripped it off the machine and shoved at me without a word of thanks. Tyra needs to be careful as to who they put at cash registers. I'm not going to go back to this place again.
Great neighborhood spot on East End. Five stars for the breakfast sandwiches. Fresh, quality ingredients and friendly services - highly recommended!
Delicious ham egg and cheese breakfast wrap off the specials menu today.  Always high quality perfectly made food!  They never disappoint.  The best spot in the area of you're a sandwich lover.

Extremely over priced food. I ordered the fresh roasted turkey, they gave me smoked turkey. Asked for oil and vinegar, there was none to be found. The sandwich was very small and light and cost $10.54. Unbelievable. I would never return.

Best little breakfast/deli place.  Seriously the best egg and cheese sandwiches around, with delicious baked goods, and above average coffee.  Great sandwiches generally. Downside - not the cheapest, and portions generally not the largest. But makes up for it in quality and has nice neighborhood feel.  I get breakfast here every weekend.

A great deli with spectacular service. The food is all fresh, the baked goods are addictive, and the staff is friendly and helpful. It's the epitome of a warm neighborhood establishment, and a pleasure to visit every time.
good as it gets.  food is great -staff as well...best cappuccino In neighborhood

So amazed to find a Yakiniku FOOD CART in the city!!

NYC truly has everything. I'm a big fan of Japanese BBQ and was surprised to find these guys while walking around Williamsburg. I've gotten their Kalbi and Spicy Pork BBQ boxes. Both were mouthwatering and great prices for the quality of meat - the taste is really on par with Yakiniku restaurants and you can definitely tell the difference from other cheaper food trucks. They also use eco-friendly plates, which is a huge plus in my book. I actually went back the other day but found out later that they moved over to Midtown via IG @yakinikukitchen.

P.S. they also have stamp cards, so your 13th meal is half off!
Loved everything I got! Great food for a great price. generous portions and most importantly killer meat! My new favorite food truck! They also accept credit cards yay!

The aroma coming from the Yakiniku Cart drew me in, and the flavor of the Spicy Pork Chop did not disappoint. Neither did the Shredded Cabbage served with a unique dressing or the Edamame. I had white rice and did not see a brown rice alternative, but also, I did not ask for one. Their only speedbump is that the serving was a bit smaller than most of the food trucks and carts in the surrounding area and that in itself could hurt business.

First time visiting this place, i gotta say, their food was pretty good. I'm definitely going to come back again when I'm around the area. When I was there I got their Kaibi options, next time when i come back, i'll go for their Spicy Pork BBQ.

Think all kebab stands are the same? This is the place where the proprietors are mindlessly shouting "yes guys!" at you as you come out the walkway from Rockefeller Center. The meat manages to be incredibly tough yet still underdone. $6 for a few chunks of gristle, no thanks. Walk down to the Halal Guys at 53rd and 6th and get 4x the quality, 2x the portion size and pay less too.

This is located inside Urban Hawker. It's a little pricy with 2 yubu's for $10. I got the Cumin Chicken and Salmon Yubu's. They were the perfect snack. The food tasted fresh and filled with sauce. The tofu skin and rice were slightly sweet and were a great combo with the savory proteins.

3.5 stars

Came to check out Urban Hawker last month and decided to try this place out since I love inari.

We got the set of 4, which was $15 and came with miso soup and a small salad. We got the salmon, spicy salmon, bulgogi, and spicy kani. They were all good, pretty standard! I'd probably stick with salmon/ spicy salmon next time. The miso soup though was really bad... super salty.

Feel bad putting this down because the Yubu was actually quite good, I just don't think the price point is very fair.

Got the 2 set for ~$8 but went for both vegetarian. For only guac and mushroom, could you guys lower the price point a bit? I understand this price for the fish options but for two small Yubus vegetarian this felt unfair

Great lunch at Urban Hawker. I chose to get 4 different kinds of Yubu - rice wrapped in tofu skin with 4 different types of protein: spicy kani (initiation crab meat), spicy salmon, bulgogi, and chicken. Delicious and juicy.

Located in the Urban Hawker food court, spacious lunch/dining space with so much Asian food variety. Yubu is tofu skin filled with sushi rice and topped with protein of your choice. Toppings that are available are salmon, spicy salmon, mushroom, cumin chicken, beef bulgogi, and tamago. The sushi rice can be better, I'm used to chewy sticky sushi rice. Since it's my first yubu, it was alright. If you buy 4 yubu, you get free miso soup. This place also has poke bowls. The lychee and peach sparkling water are really good. It's worth trying.

Bought a bowl today 1/6/23, food is great but cashier lady was having a bad day? Very rude.
Never going back because of her.

This is for the Urban Hawkers location. 2.8 stars rounded up. Inari was okay, but I'm still not sure I'd come back for it just yet... Usually Inari rice has a little more flavor but the rice here was really bland, like it was just white rice. Ordered the salmon, spicy salmon, bulgogi, mushroom and spicy Kani. Again, everything was okay. Nothing special.
very cute but too salty. nice presentation and friendly staff! the miso soup was awful.

Recently the urban hawker opened up across the street from my place of work.  It is a food center which features food vendors offering Singaporean fare.  Yum yubu was the first vendor I sampled and I was very glad I did.  I had never had udon noodles before so I decided to try their spicy chicken udon noodle dish.  It was delicious.  All the ingredients were fresh( corn, scallion, chicken etc) and the spicy broth was out of this world.  I enjoyed it so much I went back and tried their beef bulgogi udon noodles.  It was also wonderful with the bulgogi being both sweet and savory.  On a cold rainy day a 15 dollar dish of hot noodles is just what the doctor ordered especially at that price.  I believe their main offering is yubu which is tofu stuffed with the same meat and vegetables offered in their udon.  Haven't tried this yet but based on my udon experience count me in.  Highly recommend!

I've been buying muffins and pastry at Yassine Place for years. We have a ritual of friendly banter. I get there late and my favorite muffin is sold out. He always says the same thing, that I need to get there by 7am!

He's got a really popular Breakfast Business with long lines in the morning. There's two employees ready to assist you inside the small cart. Now that the sun is coming up earlier, and the weather getting warmer, I may surprise Yassine by getting there early!

I stop here for an occasional cup of good/solid Americano coffee in the mornings when I don't have coffee at home but my dog needs to GO right now! I just stick my head in with my dog outside on a leash and they give me coffee. I haven't done this in a while though.

But this review is also for their delivery. I hosted a party recently and since its been a while due to COVID, forgot to organize ice. I ordered online via Yelp and they were stellar.  They called to let me know that they didn't have as many bags as I asked for and delivered everything on time and well packaged.  Great friendly customer service in person or delivery.

York Deli
AKA York Deli and Convenience Store is very close to my apartment. I passed by it many times and decided to go inside recently after it was recommended to me.

The employee behind the deli counter is very nice and ready to take your order. It's a very convenient store if you live nearby. There's a little of everything. As for the store area, the main thing I noticed was the variety of Ben and Jerry's Ice Cream. No one has that good of a selection.

I'm going to return one day because everyone raves about the sandwiches. Like I said the man behind the counter is super nice. This visit was all about a falafel. Yum! If you live nearby and want a grab and go lunch this place has a lot to offer. I'll be back!

Nice spot to grab some coffee and snacks to take over to the park and sit by the water.

Clean and well stocked with plenty of items, food, snacks, drinks.

Friendly staff too.

Last night Amit Patel made me a chicken Parmigiana sandwich,.... I've never in my life had such a good sandwich! I'm truly impressed because I thought I made the best sandwich in the world?! Well, I won't be making any sandwiches anymore, because Amit will be making them !

I really like this place, and the people who work there are lovely.
Great sandwiches, and delivery is very quick!
Great store - has tons of things you might need in a pinch. Clean space and staff is nice.

This place has the feel of a bodega, but its located in the Upper East Side. The guys there are really cool. Good selection of beer, right next door to a liquor store, and the deli makes good sandwiches. They have a lottery machine. They have a little bit of everything in this place.
I can say The best chicken parmesan sandwich I ever had in New York thank you so much guys ..you are the best

The food was amazing !
I would recommend it !
And when ever I'm in the mood for sushi I order here !

Have ordered from them twice before and enjoyed the food. Last time my container of about three regular sushi rolls had a hair in it. Called them to complain and ask for a new order and they asked me which exact roll had a hair in it so they could make me just one piece of the roll. Are you kidding me?! The entire box is contaminated with YOUR chef's greasy hair. When I pushed back, they told me they'd make me a new order. When I arrived, they only made me one handroll. I will not be returning. Poor service and unclean. There are way too many options in new york, especially UES. Akami sushi is right across the street from them and cleaner.

Wanted to support a local business so I stopped in for some sushi. Sushi is my favorite food and this is like two blocks from my apartment, so it was finally time for me to try it.
I paid $29 for rock shrimp and a spicy girl roll. Unfortunately neither were even decent and I ended up throwing out the food after a few bites.
The sushi was not balanced, the rice was bland, and the fish wasn't as fresh as I'd like. The texture of the tuna just wasn't right.
The rock shrimp was breaded in a tasteless batter, not seasoned whatsoever. It also wasn't crispy at all. The sauce provided with it looks like plum sauce but tastes like a watered down sweet vinegar.. I really hate to be this negative!
I really wanted to like this place but they have ways to go, and I just don't want others to spend their hard-earned money on not-cheap food that isn't good.
Perfectly adequate for what it is - a tiny, hole in the wall sushi restaurant. The fish was fresh, and the owners were very kind and appreciative for my business. I would definitely eat here again
Food was amazing. Very convenient location. Very fast pickup for takeout and staff worse masks. Would recommend this

I would really like to give it no stars. They delivered the wrong order and refused to give me a credit. They wanted me to come back to the store and  return the food to them even though it would take me 45 minutes. Horrible customer service. Never order there again

I decided to order from them on lunch break once. Since I was craved for Tempura. Their lunch box is just  $10 but onset it come with salad , maki and shumai. I order Veggie Tempura, that has a lot of tempura in it. It is good place for spend money on for lunch time. Good Food reasonables prices.

Yummy Japanese Grill & Sushi Bar is an excellent, and I highly recommend it. Honestly great value for the price. I will have to admit, Teriyaki Lunch Bento was really outstanding. I think that I might have a new favorite dish now. Incredibly courteous, attentive and experienced. Yet I definitely recommend Yummy Japanese Grill & Sushi Bar.

This is hands-down the best sushi we've had delivered in our neighborhood. Everything was fresh, quality, and expertly made. The order was on time, and they even threw in some Japanese candy is for dessert! Will 100% order again; this is definitely our new go-to sushi place.

Super quick and reliable sushi.
I ordered dinner one night and my food was ready in three minutes. This is my go-to local sushi
All the rolls are tasty but the shrimp tempura is definitely my favorite. Also the delivery arrived sooner than expected.

Yummy lives up to its name! This is currently my go-to sushi place in UES - I usually get the 2 or 3 roll lunch special special with some combination of Alaska, spicy yellowtail, yellowtail scallion, and tuna avocado. The rolls have always tasted fresh, and even the miso soup is flavorful here (plus they include a good amount of seaweed/tofu). The only minor "complaints" would be that the avocado they use is sometimes flavorless/watery, and they are not as generous with filling their hand rolls as other places. Otherwise, the staff is friendly, the setup for picking up is mindful of COVID safety, and my inner child loves the fruity gum they include in their take out orders. Happy to have this place nearby!

Super surprised as I only had awful sushi in New York up until now. Absolutely great. The photos say it all too. Everything was fresh and just so tasty. Finished my plate in like...5 minutes. Enjoyed every bite of it.

The seaweed salad was heavier than the sushi I had, very good nonetheless.

You should absolutely go!

Have been ordering from them for years and never had a bad experience. I mostly get raw fish and rolls, but miso soup is also good as well as gyoza.
Their delivery service is just the best -- consistently skyrocket fast and all their guys are very nice. I live over 20 blocks from them and get my food within 40min max in a busy night hours.
I also like how they throw a free soda or/and some Japanese chewing gum to my orders from time to time. It makes me feel a valuable customer:)

Average sushi joint. The sushi is decent, nothing special - usual selection of fish and rolls. Was glad to see an "A" rating.. they were a "B" for a long time. I come in for lunch specials. Lunch menu has a good variety from rolls, to sushi/sashimi, to ramen, to bento boxes.

This was a seamless order on March 29th; Japanese is usually my go to food in a hurry. I ordered Maki 3 Roll lunch special and it comes with Miso soup. The rolls were fresh the soup was very nice Nd the price point was very good.

Two words for this place - Shit Show.  I have been getting takeout here for the last three years.  The downward spiral began around a year ago.  I don't know what happened, new owners etc.  But this place just flat out sucks.  You'd do better with supermarket sushi and pay less.  And, this drives me crazy; there is never any rice on the Maki Rolls!  The Nori shows right through and there are just a few specks on the roll itself.  (See my picture of the sad rolls)  This is not just one roll, usually it's the whole lot.  There are better Sushi takeouts in the area that cost less.  Head to one of those.
Tasty food! Nice & well-mannered delivery person. Quick food delivery time. Will definitely order again

I've been a loyal customer for 3 years and never have sent food back or had any issues.  Yesterday I ordered dinner for delivery.  Halfway through my meal i bit into a piece of sushi that had a ROCK in it (attached photo). From the ground rock.  I called and they picked up my order so they could see said rock and refund me.  They called me back and said that they saw the rock.  However, they said not only do they "not have rocks at their restaurant " but because I ate half my food they wouldn't refund me.  Totally insane!!!   Clearly I didn't eat the piece with the rock first!!  Zero apologies from the woman who called and they said to call seamless for my refund and hung up on me while I was asking for the manager.  FYI seamless said yummy could have refunded me themselves so obviously they were giving me the run around. Did you guys not grasp the severity of the situation?  I could have cracked a tooth and to top it off I got super sick after my meal so clearly something was either dropped on the ground or not cleaned properly. Never in my life have I been treated like this by a food establishment especially one I order from weekly and always tip generously on my delivery.  Shame on you yummy sushi.

Awesome place! Always fresh fish. Lunch special three 3!!!! Rolls for 1050. Their tempura is very on point, panko panko and more pankooo. This is the best youll find at this price point. Go higher if you crave atmosphere.

I love yummy sushi for 2 reasons.  I only have had the sashmi not I mean the sashmi is super fresh and inexpensive. The staff is pleasant too.

Second reason, they allow me to swap out fish. So I don't like the red tuna so ask for extra salmon.

The service is good but normally when I go, there's none there which I like.  So I sit at the bar. But I swear its the best kept secret.

Small closet sized sushi place close to where I live. Nothing amazing here. Just standard sushi and decent rolls at affordable prices. I have never eaten inside here but normally will drop by for take out. Rolls are usually fresh but nothing that will scream the word "creative" in your head. Sushi is decent but can be on the bland side. Salad with ginger dressing is usually crispy and satisfying, along with the soups.

Not a bad place if living close and need a quick drive-by sushi take home meal.

This review was based on seamless delivery. Ordered the salmon avocado and eel avocado rolls. Both solid but unspectacular. Relatively cheap for New York sushi (~$5 each).

Probably will not order again, but if you're looking for cheap rolls, not a bad option.

In the words of Kanye- I'm so appalled. The customer service at this place is miserable. And the food is regretfully terrible. Every time I that I ate a piece of my roll I was thinking about all the other things I could have been eating had I only had the common sense to not order from a place with "yummy" in its name.

I live in the neighborhood and this is my go-to sushi place for lunch and dinner takeouts for the past 4 years. The fish is always fresh, high quality and nicely portioned. Really great value for the price you pay. I always order the simple stuff, yellowtail roll, salmon roll, white tuna roll, sashimi combo. They are always delivered fast and delicious. I'm grateful to the restaurant owners for keeping the business open during the COVID-19 shutdown. I'm just so happy that I still get to eat delicious sushi during this time.

This place gave me horrific food poisoning. I should've know things were going to be bad when the food arrived and was so poorly made. The rice was falling a part and the cuts of fish were too large. I fell sick shortly afterwards and it has not been pleasant. Do not order from here unless you want to be sick for the next few days.

Today I had take-out from yummy, a Teriyaki lunch bento box (check out the photo) : 9$ and 20% off with seamless. I'll never get over how much food you get at lunch for such a cheap price. Foods good, average maybe a little above average. Salad and sushi were fresh, miso could have used more seaweed for my liking and the chicken was cooked well without over doing the teriyaki sauce. You really can't beat this deal. I'll have to stop in and sit down for a meal and keep you updated!

I live around the corner, passed this place numerous times and finally gave it a try. Sadly this will be my first and last experience here. I didn't think you could really mess up a spicy tuna roll but it was inedible! Tasted like some premade terrible mixture that some cleaning supplies found it's way in. I am one of those people that will usually eat anything and if I'm hungry would just suck it up and eat it, but I had to toss it. House salad dressing was the best part of the meal. The lettuce was so white i think it had negative nutrients if that's even possible. AVOID THIS PLACE
The sushi was so warm when It got to the house smh . & the lady who answered the phone was super rude

Everything i ate was edible only reason for one star that the food was really lousy except the sushi. But then sushi was in the same box as the rice and cooked the sushi a little bit. Still was good half cooked. Rice was good. The curry chicken was soup!!!

Delicious sushi very fresh. Great price. My daughter and I love it  
Small place but very clean and comfortable.
Definitely always can back there.

THE BEST STIR FRIED UDON I HAVE EVER TRIED!!! Hands down, yummy serves my favorite meal in the world; vegetable stir fried udon with kimchi. It's like heaven in your mouth. The flavors, the color, the cilantro with the hint of spiciness from the kimchi is truly a piece of art. The owner is kind, makes conversation and knows her returning customers very well. This is definitely a go to every time I'm in the area. Keep up the great work. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS DISH! You will NOT regret it!
RUDE AND HUNG UP ON ME. Kept talking to me like I don't know what I'm ordering- I eat sushi multiple times per week. Will never call again. This place doesn't deserve my business.

Just ordered from here for the first time. it came with free pineapple! The soy sauce was in a perfect little container so you don't have to rip open the packet and put it in the top of the container, which can be messy. Tuna tataki is ok, though I've had better and the miso soup was a little thin. The sushi was well-filled, but a bit lacking in rice and composure of the roll. Overall, though a little bare in quantity, Yummy Japanese certainly serves quality ingredients with a friendly spin.

I haven't tried too many things on their menu..But the few rolls I have tried during their lunch special which by the way is available on weekends too are pretty solid.Its a small family run joint and they have been in this location since ages.They have few tables but I can tell they do a lot of take outs and deliveries.Their salad is average, I usually end up getting their miso soup which is quite flavorful.

They have huge selection/combinations for lunch specials.I typically get 2 or three rolls of Spicy Tuna with Avocado or Spicy Salmon with Avocado..2 Rolls with Miso Soup is for 7.50 and 3 rolls with Soup is for 9.50.

If you happen to be around in Yorkville and are looking for clean, inexpensive and yummy sushi, stop by at Yummy Sushi and support this small family run business.

Good food for the price and a clean little shop. I had the regular sashimi entree. All of the fish was very nice, as was the rice. The miso was a bit bland and the salad too. Probably better for take out but not a bad place to eat in if you're staying in a nearby hotel.
I work in the area and have ordered from here for years. I always order the pink lady special roll and it's delicious. Very nice and friendly , clean as well. No complaints at all!

Good place for delivery if you want something quick and cheap. Lunch specials are good deals and Delivery.com offers promo codes for this restaurant as well. My lunch order came in under 20 minutes! Sushi was mediocre but was fine for the value. Will probably order delivery from here again!

My go-to sushi place for ordering in for the past 4 years. Sushi can be a bit oily sometimes but other than that, always timely, good quality fish, I love their basic rolls like salmon avocado, and generally very reliable. Nothing too fancy, but also doesn't claim to be.

Great place to get your sushi.the owner very nice.she is always welcome you and.treat you right.i start coming here since 2008 and was dissapointed .
I highly recomend them.

This review is strictly based on two orders via seamless and delivery.com where discount was offered.

Delivery was within reasonable hour.

The reason that they didn't get 4 star was because their sushi was served in room temperature and assembled loosely. The fish and rice were all in room temperature. Otherwise I was happy with the freshness and the taste of the following orders: shrimp asparagus roll (great texture!), tiger roll (not bad at all), fantastic roll, yellow river roll (a ok not impressed), and rainbow roll.

Def no no: grilled miso eggplant and baby octopus. Both of them gave me serious case of GI problems. Grilled miso eggplant was disgustingly buttery and sweet that I had to throw it away. baby octopus looks like mini Cthulhu drown in red dye, plasticky, chewy and sweet. yuck.

I am not a huge fan of this place because it just isn't great stuff. It was very boring and made me feel like i was having slimmy stuff with my rice. I
The person helping is was not very helpful when it comes to suggesting rolls and never even asked whether we needed drinks.
Why can't these sushi places get original and get some real ingredients in their rolls? It was like every other average sushi place i've been to in the past.
I would've given them 3 stars but they don't seem to care about the environment with every to go order they prepare.
I don't think I'm gonna try this place again.
*sigh

I am hardly in the Upper East Side but have come here a few occassions. Never did eat in though, got food to go.  It was just ok Japanese, nothing too fancy.  I got pieces of Sweet Shrimp, Tuna Avocado Roll and Nabe Yaki Udon soup.  I am really picky when it comes to Nabe Yaki Udon though. I can't remember where I have had it the best or if i can remember it was some place up in Riverdale that is probably closed as of now.  There are plenty other sushi places you can check out in the city.

Fast and good. Two things I need in my food and food service. The other is nice staff serving me, and this crew is great.
My favorite on the menu are the dinner bento boxes. Yummy.
The Gyu-Don is tasteless and not the typical, delicious mix of sliced beef with vegetables. Would not order again. Miso soup and salad are okay...

Ordered ramen and ate in. The service was rude and rather than taking my order, the teenager who was working there just stood there until I asked for a menu. Keep in mind that I was already seated at a table before actually getting some service. Ordered my food and they took a half hour to prepare--which I understand, ramen can take a while but I was the only customer inside. The food itself wasn't even ramen. It was faux ramen noodles thrown into a pot of various vegetable that aren't usually associated with traditional ramen. Listen, if you are a Japanese restaurant, live up to it. After the food was done, the same teenager basically threw me the check and after I paid, picked it up without so much as a 'thank you.' I would've given them an extra star for having those Japanese bubble gums in place of the usual mints but the food and service were too poor that even packs of bubble gum couldn't save it. Do yourself a favor and go to the sushi place across the street, it's a LOT better and they'll actually treat you like a human.

I ordered sushi from this place last night and haven't felt more satisfied by a delivered sushi experience...the lady who took my order over the phone was sooo nice AND funny (she laughed at me and my friends jokes)...they even gave us cute little packets of gum with our order :)....

The soy sauce was tightly wrapped (a first), the aged tofu is LEGIT (I am a japanese foody) and incredible and the scallop special roll is amazing...the delivery guy was pretty funny too....

DEFffff ordering from here again

know its name sounds shady "yummy" sushi? cmon. but this place is actually really good and gives big portions for the price! their lunch specials are a steal. I got the shrimp tempura bento box once for $10 and it came with dumplings rice shrimp miso soup sushi salad etc.

tonight I got the salmon teriyaki entree delivered. came with miso soup and salad. 3 large chunks of salmon perfectly roasted and with very tasty not too overpowering teriyaki sauce on top, on top of a bed of sautéed veggies. mmmm! surprised by the large portions and popping flavor.

fast delivery too!
Yummy. I really enjoyed my time and food here. The sushi was fresh and delicious. The staff were super friendly. It's Small and cozy place. Will visit again.

Stopped by the place because the boyfriend wanted to give it a try and it was nearby. I've had better sushi, truth be told. It's a tiny hole in the wall spot, and I assume they get little traffic since they're in a quiet part of Yorkville. The lack of customers worried me a little, and the negative reviews below scare me. We had no issues with the quality of the food- i think- but the flavor and freshness could be better.

Would You Walk 5.5 miles round trip to eat at a hole in the wall bagel Cafe?

Wife and I walked 2.7 miles from our timeshare on 7th and 56th to Yorkville Bagel & Cafe on 2nd and 94th.  Fellow Yelper Marianne W had arrived early to grab a table.   We had missed her last time in Manhattan in October due to severe allergies to pollen in the air.    

Marianne rushed over here and got here early, to hold two tables together.  All unnecessary as the place was empty when we sat down at 9:10am on a Wednesday.

My wife nodded her approval between bites on the Italian omelette with sausage, tomatoes, onions and mozzarella cheese.  Marianne looked incredulous at my wife eating a freshly made bagel toasted but with no Jam no butter on it.

Now I wasn't walking 2.7 miles to an ordinary bagel cafe.  This place had a full scale buffet with loads of hot foods, at $12 a lb.  Paid $18 for my buffet, which included a credit card service charge.

Marianne looked on with envy as I wolfed down  all those foods she couldn't eat: ribs covered with tomato based bbq sauce, fried egg rolls, and fried butterfly shrimp, all delicious.  She would have tried the ribs if she could leave the bones in the buffet trays.  

She regularly eats the meatballs and basa, which I found a bit bland.    Almost missed the basa, as looked like enchiladas from a distance.

First time here, but Marianne W has been here several hundred times.  Don't know of anyone else who has posted 1237 pictures in Yelp of a hole in the wall.

Over priced!
Chicken Salad is drenched in mayonnaise
$.50 for onion and .50 for lettuce

Don't go for food! Just get flowers.

Yorkville Bagel and Cafe is one of my favorite places to eat in my neighborhood. The bagels are great with a little crunchy outside and moist delicious inside. They don't skimp on the cream cheese and they have lots of flavors. My favorite is the Pumpernickel Bagel.
I love to eat the buffet food too. It's gotten pricey over the years but it's so delicious.
Today I asked the owner James if I could put two tables together because I had friends coming. He's very nice and didn't mind. Sorry I forgot to put them back before I left!
I'm still giving them Five Stars even though I have a issue with one cashier. I don't think she likes me. I try my best not to deal with her.
I'm recommending. I always bring my Yelp friends here. Today Robert and Janeen and in the past Bruce, Anna, Nik, Ellen and CJ. Plus Charlie my friend from college days. I'm definitely a fan!

Happy New Year, Everyone!

Yorkville Bagel & Cafe is within walking distance from the 96th Street (Second Avenue) subway station. My commute from Queens to Upper East Side was about 1.5 hours. Today, I finally met Marianne W. for brunch at one of her favorite spots. I was honored to be in her legendary presence.

My friend Marianne W. informed me about the back registers adding a surcharge to cash payments. My friend was complaining to the cashier. She didn't bother fixing my friend's receipt.

I ordered a toasted egg bagel with cream cheese. I paid for my bagel at the register by the front entrance to avoid a surcharge. My egg bagel was yummy.

Note: There was one restroom toward the back of the buffet!

I will stick with my favorite bagel spots near me.

There are many bagel shops in the area but this is where I come for my bacon egg and cheese on an everything bagel. After trying many a different deli this place has become my favorite. The service is quick. The bagels are big and fluffy, and the bacon/egg/cheese is on point!! My partner generally gets a rice pudding as well and it's a nice touch that you can't get at other places. It's my place to go for my fast weekend breakfasts and I'm not changing anytime soon :)

My favorite bagel place! The staff is super friendly!
They also sell flowers, which are fresh and lovely!

I tried one bite and immediately wanted to buy a dozen to take home. I'm visiting from out of state but have had bagels from a few nyc shops. The bagel is well salted and has a beautiful rise to it. Delicious  I will definitely return here when back in town!

I met up with New York's Greatest Yelper, Marianne W. www yelp com/user_details?userid=Kf5PVQUdDvQYf-MXoeWqZA this afternoon and we had a lovely time just sitting and talking and no one bothered us at our corner table.

Big menu with lots of sandwiches and goodies, it took me a minute to settle on the chicken parm after I spotted some nice looking chicken cutlets in the deli counter. The have a few coolers with a wide variety of drinks, sodas, juices and more.

My sandwich didn't take too long to be prepared and I unwrapped and dug in. A nice sized hero bread well stuffed with chicken and tomato sauce and melted cheese. I ate the whole thing. Delicious!

Yorkville has lots on offer for sandwiches and salads. It all looked great.

[Review 15588 overall - 228 in New York - 1092 of 2021.]
Got an everything bagel with tofu scallion spread.  I had never tried the tofu spread before.  Delicious! This will be my new bagel spot!

Decent bagels, but more of a place of convenience. You can find far better in Yorkville if you're wiling to walk. I come here when I need a carb fix right by my place, and in that instance, the bagels can get the job done. But they are overall bready and not great quality, and as a few reviews mention, far overpriced.

Unrelated to the food, I saw their cute bouquets outside--$25. For a simple daisy/greens bouquet, that is absurd.

I ordered a sandwich and was charged 11.49 including tax which is absurd. Used my credit card to pay and seems like I was charged an extra fee. In addition, I looked at their menu online and the sandwich I ordered was advertised as 4.25. Really disappointing.

Good place to grab a quick bite or grab and go lunch.
Good variety of offer and it is very clean.
I have ordered today tuna melt and it was delicious!
4 stars because I haven't tried their lunch "buffet " yet

Stopped in for quick breakfast.  The young lady taking orders was training, resulting in a slow process. Tried a wheat bagel with sundried tomatoe cream cheese.  The bagel was fresh and toasted.  They gave plenty of cream cheese, too much for my liking,  but can't complain. My daughter tried their greek omelet on a bagel. The sandwich was flavorful.  It had salami mixed in the egg, and she substituted avocado for the tomato.  They did give us the wrong order to start with, but immediately corrected. They also sell flowers, an odd, but beautiful combination of businesses.  We ate outside with admiring the lovely flowers.
I was looking for a really good New York bagel. I almost didn't go in because this place just had too much going on. The bagel was just OK. The people were nice. Atmosphere not so great.

This is so close to my house and I've been disappointed a few times going in there but I tried yet again. Today I ordered an egg and cheese breakfast platter but I got an egg and cheese sandwich on toasted dry bread with no mayonnaise or butter or anything. So now I'm at home re-toasting the bread and reconstructing the sandwich. You guys really have to get it together you miss every single time.
This is one of the best bagels ever. The host was super nice, and it taste AMAZING. It's super cheap and it's so much better then other places
Oh man!!! I've been going to the wrong bagel spots on the UES, THIS IS THE BEST ONE!!!! Yummy and delicious and HUGE

A decent bagel shop. I have gotten a bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel which is made as you would expect it to be. I've also gotten the lox spread on an everything bagel where they're pretty generous with the spread.

They charge a credit card transaction fee so bring cash!

I'm so glad this bagel shop opened in the neighborhood. The bagels are awesome, and they have so many varieties of bagels and cream cheese. My favorite is their everything bagel with scallion cream cheese. The staff are friendly, and the prices are reasonable.

Also, they have a flower stand up front with many different varieties of beautiful flowers. The yellow roses are particularly nice.
I hadn't been here in a while. Came for a BEC. Cute place but pricey. And the staff don't wear masks  I am never coming back.

Brand new bagel shop and cafe right across the new 96th street Q train stop. It's grand opening was June 19!

Much needed since the MTA and it's decade long 2nd Avenue subway construction mess ruined and closed many businesses here, including the Bagel Express shop that many of us used to be patrons of in this neighborhood.

Had the light tuna salad on an everything bagel. Big portion and really tasty. Only  $5.50 - not too bad. Bagel was good so there is hope here that other options will be good.

Kind of confusing the way you order at one location then have to go over and pay at another spot where registers are. As a new biz they need to work out some kinks here. They also need to put prices on everything clearly. Otherwise, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I can see coming here many times each week for a bagel, hot lunch item, or cold drink.

Oh, and there is also a full buffet/salad bar area offering hot and cold items.

For the last few weeks they have enlisted a flower stand in front of it while they were getting the place ready of which I have just picked up a bouquet for my gal. Looks to be a nice addition to this neighborhood.

While staying in NYC this has become my favorite bagel place. The Yorkville Bagel & Cafe is a 2 minute walk from the Marmara Hotel, It's across the street.
I was in the mood for a true NY Bagel so I decided to give this place a try. I'm so glad I did. The bagels here are very fresh, not doughy and a little crispy on the outside. ( For me it's a perfect NY Bagel from what I last remember.) Yorkville Bagel has a nice selection of bagels . They're made fresh daily.
I decided on the EVERYTHING BAGEL lightly toasted with Scallion and Bacon Cream Cheese.
OMG! I died and went to heaven. This bagel was so
good I savored every single bite. ( They say it's the NY water that helps make a great bagel , I know it's the water!) My second day I ordered an EVERYTHING BAGEL lightly toasted with Lox and Bacon Cream Cheese. This too was very good. In Jersey we don't have as many spreads to choose from. Yorkville Bagel and Cafe offers over 15 varieties of cream cheese spreads, plus all kinds of Chicken Salad, Egg Salad, White Fish, etc.
My third day I went back to the EVERYTHING BAGEL lightly toasted with Scallion and Bacon Cream. My fourth day I had Lox and Bacon spread and I took home a dozen bagels so my daughter could enjoy them too.
Yorkville Bagel and Cafe also has a Juice and Smoothie Bar. They make breakfast and Deli Sandwiches, and every day they have a nice Buffet. They have a large assortment of Bottled Water, Soda, and Healthy Drinks like Kombucha and Green Tea. They sell beer by the can or 6 pack. You can order Coffee, or Hot Teas, Muffins and Cakes. A large variety of Potato Chips , and Healthy Snacks. Heck,  you can even buy Plants like Orchids and Mini Cactus and outside in front are Fresh Cut Flowers. It's basically a store for one stop shopping.
Inside there is some seating for eating.
I definitely recommend giving Yorkville Bagel & Cafe a try...

Bagels here are perfect! I've gotten the lox with cream cheese on an everything bagel twice, and there's no question I would come back again. Bagels are soft and warm on the inside, crispy on the outside, perfectly flavored. Very generous portion of salmon and not an overwhelming amount of cream cheese--it is a perfect harmonious balance :)

Yorkville is slightly less expensive than places like Best Bagel and Ess-a Bagel, and in my opinion, more delicious. There's never a huge crowd, so you get your bagel quickly.

Went in to grab a bagel, ordered egg everything with plain cream cheese. My sister ordered a salt bagel with plain cream cheese and we both said no to them being toasted. Unfortunately they toasted hers, only reason why they weren't five stars. We didn't have the time to go back to ask them to fix it either, and it wasn't too big a deal. Total was $6. Good bagel and good price in my opinion!

The prices are reasonable and the bagels are yummy and fresh. The place is clean and sells other items such as drinks, lunch, etc. Service was speedy.

They do charge a 3% service fee on all credit card payments so bring cash. I think credit card service fees are illegal in NY...oh well.

The only bagel spot in the neighborhood so I appreciate this place being clean, good and affordable.

I'm on a rotation at Metropolitan Hospital and my friend suggested that we grab a quick brunch here while on a shift. She always gets the toasted everything bagel with scallion & lox cream cheese ($5.54), and I didn't see any lox so I got the same thing with a fresh orange juice ($5). As we sat down, I realized that it was possible to get lox, but I ended up being perfectly happy with my bagel. The bagel was definitely much above average, but not on par with Brooklyn Bagel's. The cream cheese, however, was really excellent; it was thick and generously stuffed with lox pieces to the point that I felt like I was getting a really fantastic deal. It was like a low-key lox bagel, which was exactly what I was in the mood for. It's also a lot for an entire bagel, so it felt like an indulgence by the end of my meal.

I wouldn't recommend going out of your way for this, but if you're in the area, this is a great breakfast place.

Ow. My jaw hurts after eating this bagel. Now, full disclosure: I fall into the bagels need the perfect fluffy-to-doughy ratio camp, but this was overwhelmingly doughy on the boarder of jerky-consistency. Let's dive in ...

Everything bagel (1/5): More like a somewhat bagel. First and foremost, where the heck is the seasoning? This "everything" bagel was so light on seasoning I could have been convinced it was a plain. I chewed so hard eating this bagel my jaw got a full workout.

Lox Spread Cream Cheese (3/5): I was expecting -- based on what others said -- to have a schmear that is overflowing with lox. That was far from the case. There was lox in here but of fairly normal proportions. Nothing special.

Vegetable Cream Cheese (4/5): Did a nice job incorporating multiple veggies and was creamy and spreadable. A little salty.

TL;DR: Our friends just moved around the corner from this bagel place. They should keep walking and find a better NY bagel staple.
I had an everything bagel that did not taste fresh and the bagel was not even cut in half, it was sliced on one side and there was hardly any cream cheese. I do not recommend this bagel joint.

Best bagel spot in the area, Yorkville is more than just a good bagel shop actually. They got to go food counter with all the salads and hot food by the pound. I like coming here to get my breakfast and lunch ready, lots of choices. They got a fresh juice counter too, although i never order juice here yet but maybe ill try one day when im feeling healthy. The food at the counter is very fresh, taste good and the price is cheap for lunch. I like the asian noodle and chicken wings they got here on the counter, pack it and go. They got soup too on the side agaisnt the wall.

Easy walk from train station, the front has a flower shop with fresh flowers. Very convenient when you need a last minute browny point for the lady at home.

Staff are friendly and take your orders fast. Its a big spot so plenty of people working the orders, even though there was a line to order your bagel it moves pretty quick. I will keep coming back here.

Great spot to grab a quick breakfast! I'm a huge fan of their omelettes. This is one of those spots where it's totally worth it to upgrade to the platter. For an extra buck you get a huge portion of home fries and buttery toast. That's my kinda deal.

My only critique is I wish they had a better ordering system, but it seems to work for them. It's great to have a reliable bagel spot so close to home!

Great local bagel place.

I've been there like 3 or 4 times, as it's close from where I live.

So far I'm very happy about it: decent prices; no mistakes in any of my orders; good, fresh bagels.

I usually go to H&H for bagels but saw that Yorkville had a sundried tomato cream cheese option. I should have stuck with H&H. These bagels were super dry and hard to get down. They weren't soft at all and weren't that yummy and chewy like bagels are supposed to be. The cheese cheese tasted super processed and not fresh. It was like the flavoring was added without using any of the actual sun dried tomato or jalapeño.
Food here is fresh with a wide variety of bagels and cream cheeses. Love their lox spread with Everything bagel. Would highly recommend in Yorkville area.

Pastrami sandwich is $6.95 unless you get hero bread which is an extra dollar. Oh, and lettuce is 50 cents. Tomatoes as well. For a $6.95 sandwich I ended up paying $9.20.

I'll sell you a car, if you need seats that'll be extra. If you need wheel and tires those are gonna be extra too.

I like transparency and honest business. 50 cents and a dollar isn't a big deal but to suck every single penny out of your customer for lettuce? Mercy!
Clean with great service. Lunch sandwich was huge and fabulous! Morning bagels were warm and delicious.

This has become our official bagel spot. First couple of times I ordered a lox bagel - you have to assemble it so not sure how I feel about it if I'm on the go but it was good. Wish there were more capers.
Switched up my order to egg & bacon/sausage & it's always reliable and does the job. They're pretty quick but call in if you have a lot to order.

I discovered Yorkville Bagel one morning when I was in town visiting my boyfriend. I love that there is never a line and I can walk right in an order. I always go for an egg and cheese on a toasted sesame bagel, so good! I also love their iced coffee. Prices are great and the staff is very friendly and welcoming.

Only con is I once had their "canadian ham" on my breakfast sandwich and it 1. was more $$ and 2. did not taste right. I ended up taking it off my  sandwich.

Stick to a simple bfast order and you'll be satisfied!

Best bagel in town. I love their smoked salmon and cream cheese bagel. My favorite breakfast! I come here at lesser 4-5 times a week and the price is the best in town. I love that they actually give great amount of salmon compared to other places. I also love their fruit juice bar. Thank you yorkville bagel for making my breakfast healthy and filling

On a cool morning the day before Thanksgiving, I hiked from The Mark Hotel to Yorkville Bagels, on 94th and 2nd Avenue. It was well worth the trip. Yorkville is a bagel cafe for the locals. I ordered the Nova Special on a toasted pumpernickel bagel, served with scallion cream cheese, a generous amount of nova lox, sliced tomato, red onions, and capers. This was simply put a life-changing bagel.  Highly recommended!
Had to be remind the staff that my order wasn't started after several people behind me got there food

These guys do a good job following clear instruction (for example, a sandwich on scooped, well-toasted bagel comes out just as requested), and they're pretty prompt when not slammed. Covid accommodations include no seating and suggested social distancing. Sandwiches on bagels is their game. Really great bagels. When slammed, be patient.  They'll call your name.
This is my absolute go-to for bagels and breakfast sandwiches. The bagels are the best in the neighborhood. The scallion bacon cream cheese is always a comfort for me after a long night shift

I cannot believe this place charge me 9.20 for a grilled chicken sandwich!

It feels like a scam when I wasn't explained clearly that everything that's supposed to come with a standard sandwich-- tomato, lettuce, cheese, and a forced pickle--are ALL extra charges (I was told it is 7). On top of that, there's an extra charge when I paid with debit card. I wasn't aware of or told by them either.

The sandwich is decent, but the way this place is not upfront with pricing isn't cool. The sandwich guy's attitude isn't cool either. When I saw the price and challenged the charges, he said "I told you everything else is extra" and yet he did not.

I am surprised people in this neighborhood actually tolerate this kind of behaviors in a business. When I saw them having stellar reviews on Yelp I am really surprised.

I won't come back to this place because they are not honest. Certainly not the type of neighborhood place I, or you, want.

New favorite bagel spot in the city. But double check your order cause they do make mistakes. Like forgot the bacon on the bacon egg and cheese :-) But they happily fixed it. Yum!

BUT I'm allergic to flowers so I can't eat in as they have a big flower stand. Wish they'd rethink that.  Thanks!
7.50 for bec after 11am. it was below avg won't be going back. however, the staff was nice.
ordered a salmon bagel and they served me the bagel with bad salmon. I started to not feeling well after i ate the bagel. Customers please be careful.
Turkey sausage, egg, and cheese on a sesame bagel! Every part of this sandwich was awesome- and it's huge I could only conquer half! Iced coffee was good too.

Stopped in this morning for a toasted sesame bagel with avocado spread and it was phenomenal. The bagel was so fluffy.  It's so clean inside and the decor is on point. I also really like that they have Boar's head cold cuts because I personally think that's the best kind no matter the price. There was a little bit of a wait but it was well worth it. I have a friend that lives near the area so she's the one who told me about Yorkville. If you're in the upper east side, definitely check them out!!!

This place just opened across from my subway station which in theory would be great, but the service has gotten progressively worse each time I've been. They've been back and forth on whether there's a credit card minimum so I never know if I have to bring cash.

Today there was a long line with a cashier who couldn't remember an order for more than a second. As a result, they gave me a bagel with strawberry cream cheese (I ordered garlic/herb cream cheese) which is not remotely what I wanted and completely inedible.

I hope they get better because the coffee is pretty good and when the food is what you order it's good too, but the service should not get worse every day at a new place.

I've come here several times as they are close to my office. The bagels are OK and the iced coffee isn't bad either. Every time I've come here I have paid with my debit card and it's been no issue. Yesterday I show up and there is a strip of paper indicating an $8 minimum. When I asked the staff about this they simply said "This was put in place last Thursday."

Dear Yorkville Bagels, your bagels are $3 and your coffee is $4 it's quite hard to reach $8 at breakfast unless you buy all types of unnecessary snack
items and other things you never really needed. I'd come back if I so happen to have cash but otherwise not worth it with Starbucks next door.
